Bottle. Pours pale yellow. Slight grassy aroma with malt. Fairly sweet taste. I suppose its refreshing on a hot summers day.

Clear sickly straw color. Sweet corn-like aroma, no hops at all in the nose. Has a musty skunky smell that has become Corona’s most identifying feature. Clear why nobody ever drinks this out a glass. One of the worst smelling beers on the market. Watery body, bit of acidity, bit of an off taste. Some spicy hops, right on the threshold of recognition. Dry with just a hint of malt character. Light hop finish. Not as bad as I remembered it, but still not good. I’ve never understood how this beer is so popular.

Bottle, 330ml. Pours clear light yellow. Scent of canned corn and some citrus. Medium carbonation, llight body. Flavors of canned cor, ome hops, very mild, lacks in flavor. Gentle sweetness with notable bitternes in good balanced. Tasteless, but not offensive at all.
Yellow color, big white foam. Water. Really I do get why ppl love it. Easy to drink and refreshing. But not beer.
Great Beer. Perfect for watch sports, and for a sunday in the house, for bbq and for family reunion. soft flavor and good taste

This is an amazing beer, it ticks all the boxes, aroma, appearance, taste, palate and overall style points. It helps me not spew and isn’t hoppy like the rest of them. We need more beers like this in the world to make it a better place, not only for mankind, but also for human kind. Dinosaurs are a thing. Over and out.
-Spew
Cienizna. Puste, bez wyrazu, bez smaku. Aromat słaby, wygląd też. Zimne z cytryną jeszcze jakoś przejdzie. Omijać!

Bottle (with a lime). Straw color. Not particularly aromatic other than some mild skunkiness. Rice and grass flavors; most flavor comes from the lime. Very refreshing in the appropriate environment (e.g., Key West, the beach, anywhere warm, anywhere cold when you're wishing you were warm). 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Garrafa 33 cl, cerveja leve com cor amarela, sabor suave e aroma a milho. Bebida bem fresca é bastante agradável
Acho uma excelente opção para uma tarde no boteco ou para aquelas duas q curto tomar na quinta de noite! Leve e saborosa, cumpre. Proposta do estilo
My Favorite Beer ...but i like Corn a lot :) ....and it just tast good very cold

0.33 l bottle at Boogaloo club, Zagreb. Bottle with a slice of lemon stuck to it. Clear pale golden, small white head disappeared almost instantly. Sparkling. Aroma of corn flakes, urine and wet paper. Lemon was in it, not sure if that’s good or bad. Sweet perfumed corn flavor. Finish is like I’m drinking urine. Watery, terrible.
Pale yellow with a white head that disappeared quickly. Thin with a corn and a sweet vegetable taste. Has an off flavor. blah
355ml bottle. Pours yellow without head. Aroma of starch and some floral hops. Watery. I guess its ok for a warm and sunny day.

I am biased. This was the first beer I fell in love with when I started drinking. So so drinkable and refreshing. Light. Always a good go to swimming pool or yard work beer. My palate had changed and I enjoy a beer with more flavor and body these days. This beer does not deserve some of the poor ratings it gets. My 2 cents!

Bottle out of a ice trough at Billy’s because why wouldn’t you choose this in this scenario. Commonshawn and samadouche present. Yellow and straw in color with minor head and a bobbing lime in it because that?s how it comes. Kind of skunky and grainy aroma. Taste is symbolic of sitting on a beach but that’s because they have effective marketing. There’s a bitterness present with a healthy malt offset. Almost calls out for the fruit aspect which isn’t welcomed. It serves a purpose and that purpose is to keep a buzz going. Not a tasty beer.

What can I say? It’s all in the image, the marketing. Actually, while boating on a warm day, with a lime, in a glass...pretty refreshing and it makes you be barefoot and heavy on the Buffett songs...Ole
can/bottle. Poured clear gold with no head. Light grainy aroma, sometimes a bit skunky. Light body, average carbonation. Flavour is generic and grainy, light malt with a slightly peppery.

Piwo barwy złotej, klarowne z białą pianą, która szybko zanika. Aromat zdominowany przez mokry karton, prócz tego w tle trochę słodu. Nieprzyjemny. Smak pusty, słodowy. Piwo wodniste, goryczka na miernym poziomie. Nie polecam,
Drinkable light session lager, but without any aroma or sensational taste. To drink and forget.

Bottle 
Palme yellow clear
Aroma of hops, can and vegetables 
Taste honey, bitter light feel.
Easy clean flavours.

Pours yellow gold color with foam head that dissolves almost immediately. Aroma is typical of cheap beer. Taste is bland and slightly sour. Not that great of a beer. I try and avoid this beer unless the Mexican party I’m at only has this beer in the ice coolers which is the case 99% of the time.

Aroma:wet malt,corn,carton.
Appearance:straw color,almost no head.
Taste:sweet,flavour of malt,carton,esters,sweet malty finish and aftertaste.
Palate:watery,light body,medium to high carbonation.
Overall:I suggest you to drink water with addition of sugar instead of this crap(the same flavour profile,no alcohol at all).
32-ounce bottle served in a pint glass. Labeled as Corona Familiar. Unappetizing aroma, but flavor is not quite as bad as I was expecting. Not all that good.

Zupełnie zapomniałem, że takie piwo w ogóle istnieje... Pamiętam, że lata temu podawano je w pubach z połówką plasterka cytryny wciśniętej w szyjkę butelki :) Trzeba było więc sprawdzić, czy trunek nadaje się do picia... Cytrynkę sobie podarowałem i przelałem do szkła bez innych dodatków. Kolor słomkowy, idealnie klarowne. Piana biała, niewielka, szybko opadła. Aromat słodu i innych, nieco mniej przyjemnych nut. W smaku, niestety, jest fatalnie. Na pierwszy plan wysuwa się stara szmata. Jest też słód,. ale o goryczce możemy zapomnieć. Wodniste i niesmaczne - w każdej temperaturze... I do tego ta przejrzysta butelka...
Boa para dias quentes como outras mexicanas. Fraca e com coloração bem clara, mas agradável.
Drank with Kaspar while hanging out at my place 12-5-16. Not that bad actually. Watery but sweetness is nice.

355 ml butelka. Jasny, blady złoty kolor. Piana jest słaba, szybko znika, trochę zostaje na brzegu szklanki. Słaby zapach tequili. Słaby smak tequili i cytryny. Bardzo wodniste. Później podczas picia nieco lepszy smak. Gorycz słaba, nie pozostaje w ustach. Może być dobre w upalne dni, ale ogólnie złe piwo, nawet w kontekście tego rodzaju piwa.

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass. Aroma- Has a watery grain smell. Appearance-. A straw color with a small white head. Taste- Has a corn and grass flavor that is OK, not great by any means Palate- A light bodied beer with moderate carbonation. Overall- A South of the Border BMC. It is good with food and if you are going to drink a ton in one sitting.
Earlier Rating: 5/3/2015 Total Score: 3.1
Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Has a watery grain smell.
Appearance-. A straw color with a small white head.
Taste- Has a corn and grass flavor that is OK, not great by any means
Palate- A light bodied beer with moderate carbonation.
Overall- A South of the Border BMC. It is good with food and if you are going to drink a ton in one sitting.
Guess I’ve never rated this. Can in Mexico on the boat returning to our resort in Riviera Maya. Color, no clue. Nose, who cares. After a hot day in paradise, actually wasn’t horrible.

Bottle. Very pale golden. Nose is light malty, sweet corn and grain. Taste is very light, slightly sweet. As a beer its not great, not much taste but with a lime wedge in a warm day or with mexican/texmex dishes it is nice and I do buy it for those occasions. Therefore, it has a place in this planet unlike many other high volume lagers.
Refreshing, drinkable light pale lager. Refreshing floral aroma with a pale, clear appearance. White foam.

This one doesn’t taste of enough to be really good or bad. I just had it with a spicy burrito so I suppose for want of a better option it hits the mark. Pale lager, bit watery but crisp and refreshing enough in it’s place.
Very smooth, distinctive taste and overall perfection. Perfect for a hot day.

Butelka 355 ml; z tequilą. Ciekawe rozwiązanie na upalne, letnie dni,. Silnie wysycone dwutlenkiem węgla, warto dziabać z cytryną aby dodać kwaskowości. Piwo w przezroczystej butelce - narażone na negatywne skutki naświetlania.
Piwo bardzo jasne. Piana słaba, szybko znika, Zapach słabiutki, troszkę nieprzyjemny. Smaku brak.

Bottle from Asda; clear yellow pour with a bubbly white head, aroma has a hint of grass and a sweet corn edge, taste has some sweet malts, very clean and refreshing, highly carbonated, this review was sans lime.

0,355 l Flasche. Aroma: Wenig Geruch, dezent grasig, leicht malzig süß. Erscheinung: Hellgelbes Bier, flacher, weißer Schaum, der schnell verschwindet. Geschmack: Leicht süßlich, minimal säuerlich, kaum bitter. Nachgeschmack: Wässrig, viel Kohlensäure, leicht säuerlich. Gesamt: An einem besonders heißen Tag als besonders kaltes Bier wohl gerade noch genießbar.
the aroma is malty and herbal, with shades of grain and some flowers... the taste is malty with notes of grain, grasses and, a little bit, apple... light dry and bitter aftertaste...

Appearance: clear golden, Head: rather a small foam which disappears quickly. Body: light and mild flavor. This beer served with a lemon slice, as for me without the lemon slice it doesn’t taste that great. Lemons overpowers the beer but in total giving a nice refreshing combination. Nice for summer time.

I guess this is the alias for the Corona Familiar. Pours a clear straw yellow color with a small white head that dissipates quickly. The aroma is grainy, sweet Malts, and straw. The flavor is grainy hops, some malt sweetness, white bread. Not as bad as the ratings would suggest.

21cl bottle - "Coronita" - from Selver, Tallinn. Pours clear pale golden with a small, white head. Grainy aroma with cooked vegetables and hints of grass and honey. Kind of sweet and not much flavour at all, but not too unpleasant either when served ice cold. Some bitterness is noticeable. Only good thing about this is that it’s in the small bottle - 21cl is more than enough!
clear golden liquid with white head. aroma of hay, caramel. taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour. light body, thin feel, average carbonation, bitter finish
Fresh and with no complications. Something to drink when you are thirsty and looking for a relaxing time while you are on the garden.

Very faint aroma of corn. The mouth-feel? Almost non-existent. "Sparkling water" is the first thing that comes to mind. There’s just nothing. I can’t even taste the alcohol. Short, weak finish with some very very slight bitterness (mostly just carbonation), and some corn. One of the worst beers I’ve ever tasted. This is sparkling water with a faint beer-flavor. Absolute garbage, I wanted to pour it down the drain...

Looks like the cheapest possible fluid. Bright golden and clear. Aroma: citrussy hops and foremost corn, what was surprising for me since I never had a beer with corn. Taste slight bitterness. Microscopic sweetness brought by the corn. Quite drinkable and interesting (corn) but not revolutionary. Overall decent.

Very watery and light. Even a bit of lemon overpowers the 'richness' of flavour here.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
dreadful lager with almost no flavour other than standard lager. very watery. It’s the distinct lack of flavour that prompts ppl to put a slice of lime in the neck of the bottle

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Pale yellow/gold colour with a small white head. Aroma of corn and light hop. Medium sweetness, slightly rough bitterness. Light body, thin texture, average+ carbonation. Not especially good.
Refreshing. Good for a summer afternoon. Very light body, mild flavor with some malts and hops and a hint of funkiness. Not too sweet. Not bad for a macro but also not interesting at all.

12 oz bottle pours a clear light golden color with small disappearing white head and practically no lacing. Aroma is faint, but has some nondeScript grains. Taste is slightly sweet with a only a touch of bitterness in the finish. Body is light and watery, with noticeable carbonation. This one needs a wedge of lime or something to add some flavor. By itself, it tries to be an inoffensive least common denominator beer. There’s nothing horrible about this one, but nothing memorable either. It’s still February, and I already wish it were a hot day in August so that I could enjoy this more after mowing the lawn.
20-Feb-2016.0,33l Flasche. Goldgelb, klar, weisser Schaum. Aroma getreidig, Mais sticht hervor. Antrunk indifferent/eigenartig.muss nicht nochmal sein.

Yellow, small head. Very weak, skunky aroma, a bit of malt and corn. Almost no taste, just a fizzy water with no bitterness and sweet, malty aftertaste. Better than i thought it would be, will be ok on a hot day.
Cerveja normal, não se distância de qualquer outra cerveja barata. Apenas para refrescar

Bottle. Doesn't taste of anything other than the lime wedge you have to put in. No offensive flavours like some, just no flavours. Goes well with a chilli laden taco

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz bottle served in Perfect Pilsner glass. Moderately chilled. No lime. Fizzy. Thin white head dissapears very quickly. Beer is piss yellow in color. Very clear. Light malt aromas. Very lightly sweet and the slightest bitterness near finish. Overall light and fairly smooth. Not a lot of flavor. Not what I think of when I think Lager. Overall an ok party beer but not my favorite lighter beer. Over priced for what it is.

Drank it straight from the bottle. Color is yellow, palate is relatively light bodied with an average carbonation for this style of beer. Lightly malty, very little hops, and faintly sweet. Finish is very short, with a fleeting sweetness. Adding lime is a popular and pleasing tactic with this beer, with the sour bitter tanginess seeming to bring out something in the brew. Refreshing. Not many points in any conventional sense, but not unpleasant, and goes well with a wide variety of foods. Easy to knock back a bunch of these without them leaving much impression on the drinker, good or bad.

Aroma: cereal, delicate hoppy notes
Appearance: pale, clear, minimal head
Taste: malty in general
Palate: light body, thin texture, a fizzy one but i drink fizier, low but detectable bitterness 
Overall: one of the best widely available lager, very drinkable, not jaw dropping, but just good lager
Bottle, Japan and a few other places. Always add lime for extra citrus flavor. Strong carbonation, great for summer snack/light drinking.
Boa cerveja feita em escala. Bom custo beneficio. Recomendo para quem vai beber em quantidade. Cerveja bem leve

Clear straw color. Barely no head, lasting 30 seconds. Average legs and activity.

Faint sweet aromas and flavors of corn, syrup, citrus, slightly skunky and metallic.

Light body with prickly carbonation. Short and weak smoky finish.

Overall : Faint flavors but good freshness. The sugar is good and does not feel artificial like most macro brands.

Bottle. Has a clear straw color with an off-white head. Aroma of sweet corn, wet hay and some cooked vegetables and citrus. The flavor is slightly sour with lime, candy and sweet malt. Not far from soda. Has a light and watery mouth feel and light bitterness. A very light and sweet beer. Not bad a taste, only very easy drinking and almost like soda.

It’s 2Pac day!! Clear pale yellow color.. I don’t know about head since I never poured it in a glass :P Malty aroma, corn. Sweet taste. Light thin to oily body with soft carbonation. It can be consumed only at the beach on a hot day.
Crear pale yellow color with thiny white head. Aroma of citrus, herbs and grass. Too carbonated.
Drank at around 10 Celsius deg. from bottle. Just dyed water with unpleasant DMS and diacetyl. If u wonder whether to drink or not: don’t.
Bottle, Cafe Del Mar, Ft Lauderdale, FL. Served with a slice of lime at the neck. Nothing peculiar, refreshing at a hot day close to the beach.
A nice refreshing beer, even though it lacks true complexity or bitterness.

Straight from the bottle to wine glass very cold beer 
Appearance: Light pale yellow, minimal head, a lot of lacing 
Aroma: scent smell of malt, nothing else 
Taste: not really great Mouth feel: very carbonated 
Overall: good beer for the hot weather

Awful. A nightmare. No character. Lemonade with a twist of alcohol. .
Beer for kids.
Bland, easy, drinkable. Not the best, but certainly not the worst. Fresh taste no bitterness and a null aftertaste.

So I tend not to rage macro swill except in cases of extreme boredom and here I am waiting for my wife to get ready for dinner at my in laws. No lime available and not really a tropical setting Albany in December so the lack of ambiance hurts this as I’ve probay enjoyed more poolside in the past. Anyways watery yellow looking. Light spice, citrus grains and piss. Water palate. Off aftertaste.

Instead of the usual review, I will simply say this is the worst beverage I have had the displeasure of tasting. If you carbonated the rain water dripping off the backside of a festering dead skunk, it might beat this pathetic excuse for a beer in a taste test.
33cl @ bottle. Dio che schifo questa roba. Dopo anni di artigianali è difficile tornare indietro. L’aroma è forse la cosa migliore, aspetto orribile, gusto orribile (acqua + limone). Insignificante.
Den dårligste øl jeg indtil dato har smagt. den er nærmest gennemsigtig lys gul med en hurtig forsvundet hvid skumkrone. smager ikke af noget.

Industrialized beer but very easy drinkability. Light color and taste. Better when served really cold.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl (clear) bottle. Pale yellow to straw colour, thin white head despite my aggressive pour. Not much carbonation. Not much aroma. Sharp bitter mouthfeel, must be wonderful on hot summer days. Tastes a bit citrusy, nice bittering hops, but hardly anything else. Drinkability is huge as a thirst quencher, but as I mentioned above, this is a perfect follower to BBQ food through the summer. (But a bit expensive...)

For sure one of my favourite more expensive beers. It’s a very good tasting beer overall. One you tend to drink faster then others because it is very smooth. I kind of wish it was 5% instead of 4.6%. It does contain a little less then a normal bottle of beer meaning a bottle of Corona is 330ml where as most beers are 341ml. Still a very good beer.. if you don’t mind paying a little extra from time to time.

The marketing of modelo group is enormous. I was several times in Mexico and even in the local villages, where you don’t find any gringos, the people drink this beverage. The colour is yellow and clear not really malty and the hop is not existent. It is a typical beer for hot weather or at the beach and not too bad with a piece of green lemon. Another comment said that in the others countries is too expensive and it is the true for what you get.

水   
ライムいれる戦術はすごくよくはまってる
33cl bottle @Gwada bowling. Drunk on bottle. Clear and light, medium sweet, low bitterness, watery, soft carbonation.
Bottle from Milagro’s in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is light corn. Taste is slightly bitter seltzer water. Pretty bland.

The Corona Extra (4.5%)
Nickname: The perfect all-round average.
Taste: Light-bitter.

I am not surprised this is the nr.1 selling beer in mexico and that it ranks highly in many other warm countries. 
For me, this is the perfect all-round thirst stopping beer (especially when it is warm and you need something to cool you down). 
It has a completely "average" taste, it smells ok and it looks great in it’s tall, skinny, good-looking glass bottle.

I rate this bottle based on my philosophy that this is the perfect all-round, ok, thirst stopping beer that gives you a pleasurable feeling both in your mouth and does not "fill you up" as much as many other beers would. It’s not a super special beer, but it gives you more pleasure than pain by a long shot. I’ts also a pleasant experience both drinking from the bottle, and a glass :)

The only problem with this all-round average perfection, is that it costs way too much in some countries (like Norway).

The supermarkets target lager to go with your Mexican dinner. Promoted with images of the beer with a piece of lime in it. So you know the lime is there to give the water, eh, lager it’s typical taste. Backlog from 2014/06/04.

Robe blonde et limpide, quasiment pas de mousse.
Arômes de céréales. En bouche... Difficile à trouver. Légères notes de céréales, mais j’ai surtout l’impression de boire une limonade. Aucun corps, aucune longueur en bouche.
Bref, je ne dirais pas que cette bière a mauvais goût puisqu’elle n’en a pas. 
À goûter 1 fois dans sa vie pour ne plus jamais y revenir.
Kolor słomkowy, piana słaba i szybko znika. Wodniste, lekkie nuty słodowe w smaku i aromacie.
Debole, slavata, acquosa, scipita... ma tutto sommato non disgustosa. E’ più una bibita al malto che una birra, ma se ci sono 40 °C all’ombra può avere un’utilità...
Promocja była... Słomkowe, klarowne, piana sycząca nietrwała. Puste, lekko cierpkie i wodniste, nuta mokrego kartonu. Średnie plus nasycenie, odczucie dużuch bąbli CO2.

Yellow color with little foam. The smell is light malty and not very convincing. The taste is well carbonated and boring. The aftertaste is not special as well. However, if you put some lime in the beer and drink it quite cold, it is refreshing and pleasant. On the other hand, other beers will do the same thing without being so expensive.

Rated on 5/6/08-not a good beer, smell, and taste are far below average. lime makes it slightly tolerable though. I like going to the border but drinking down there has gotten expensive especially when you pay $2 per bottle for this stuff.
(1) Never again. That is saying too much. Drink it again, of course, but for a party - it is a fine light beer, but nothing too spectacular.

Any beer where you add lime or lemon to give it flavour says it all. Weak in all areas and looks too much like the end product an hour after you drank it. 
Try it without the citrus added to it and it just isn’t worth drinking.
330ml bottle. Aroma cereal maybe some citrus. Taste lightly sweet and lightly bitter. Pleasant enough. I’m weighing this up against the Sol I drank last night. I think the Corona just edges it.

29/IX/15 - 33cl bottle @ Polé Polé (Gent) - BB: VII/2016 (2015-1437) Thanks to my work for paying! :p


Clear pale piss yellow coloured beverage, no head, as this is the famous "bottle in hand"-segment. Aroma: well, not much, except for that bloody lime wedge in the neck. Hurray! MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: lemon juice, little bitter, bit grassy. Aftertaste: slightly bitter, not much. At least it’s better than that horrible French imitation Desperados.
Blade wodniste o niskiej pianie i praktycznie braku smaku. Picie tego z cytryna ma chyba zapewnic smak bo w samym piwie go brak . Metaliczny posmak. Bida
Met de typische citroen dat je erbij krijgt. Een goede en aparte smaak, zeer lekker.

12oz Flasche. Hellgelbe Farbe, kaum Schaum. Wird auch zumeist mit Limette aus der Flasche getrunken. Leichtes Hopfen und Citrus Aroma. Geschmack auch leicht und süffig. Eiskalt zu mexikanischem Essen lecker.
Helles gelb, kaum Schaum, leicht citrus in der Nase auch im Geschmack, leichte Säure wenig herb
Tastes best when someone else is drinking it. Let the celiacs have it. Would rather chew sand. Belongs in only one orifice.

This beer is served under a few different names in different countries and comes in different sizes.

It scores big on making the bottle look nice, but other than that, it’s a cheap pilsner type beer. Pours a light golden yellow with a small head and some lacing. Smells gently of bread and barley. Has a bready, corny and malty taste that finishes with a nice slight burn. Best enjoyed with lime, lemon slices or juice, and even some type of nuts.

Overall it’s not bad, but not great. I am unaware if there’s a ’lime’ flavored corona out there, but this drink is best enjoyed on a hot summer day with lemon, lime, beer salts or even nuts of some kind.

Bottle @ family/grandmother. Appearance: pours pale yellow with ok soapy white head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, maize and straw. palette thin malty aroma, average carbonation, thin body, light sweetness, balanced by a light bitterness, medium duration and a watery texture. Overall: standard pale lager
With lime is just perfect! One of the few types of beer that you drink it with pleasure from the bottle. Taste pleasant, refreshing, ideally goes ice with lime in the neck of the bottle
330ml bottle. Aroma of dusty corn. Taste lacking with little bitterness or flavour. Worth serving very chilled with a slice of lime to give it something! Watery and fizzy.

35.5 cl bottle from Roto dinamic, served in a snifter. Pale yellow clear, no head. Aroma is skunky, meaty, very faint hoppy. Am afraid to taste it at this point. Thin body, low carbonation. Taste is thankfully blend i.e. not as offensive as aroma would suggest. Low on sweetness, low on bitterness. Watery.
Not the worst beer but still pretty disappointing. Looks like piss in a glass but a little lime doesn’t hurt.

From a 12 oz bottle into a stem glass. Pours gold yellow with small head and lace. Aroma of light malts, grains, very slight wet blanket. Medium carbonation and mouthfeel. Flavors of light malts, grains, slight sweetener, minerals and starch. Overall light, slightly sweet, relatively easy drinking.
I tried this under slight pressure from some gals who also gave me a shot from the bottle with lime and salt added. This added a slight tint of lime citrus, but of course hid the aroma.
Golden with white head. Corn, floral and light caramel. Dry, crisp and floral finish. Overall: meh.

Bottle. Pours a golden yellow colour. Minimal white head. Mild aroma nothing notable here, a little grainy perhaps. Taste pretty much what you’d expect from your average lager. Slightly sweet slightly citrussy. Also had a bottle with a slice of lime as is tradition, doesn’t necessarily improve the flavour but obviously gives it more of a citrussy flavour. Not bad, drinkable, works nicely as a refreshing summer beverage but it’s nothing special.

(Old rating, used to drink this a lot from 2006-2010 -ish, rarely drink now but it still tastes the same)
Bottle. Clear straw colour. Thin white head. Aroma of syrup and corn. Watery palate. A light lager with a touch of body/hops on the finish. It is for me a summer beer.

Bottle.
Вот этот лагер я люблю. Ненавязчивый, приятный вкус, очень освежает.
Bardzo specyficzne piwo, nadające się na ugaszenie pragnienia, to wszystko. Mocno gazowane i wodniste. Procentowa woda, łatwo się pije.
Boa cerveja para tomar com limão. Prazerosa mas não tão gostosa assim. Boa de beber debaixo de sol forte!
Not really my kind of beer. This was a tasteless beer, using lots of corn to make. Tasted rather cereal, chicken feed and I think that why a slice of lime is essential.

Pale orange/gold with a quickly-diminishing white head on top and vigorous carbonation. Aroma is cheap beer and eggs, like the worst breakfast ever. It tastes decent at first, but gets really bad as it warms. Flavor starts out slightly herbal hops with a little honey, but degenerates into a sulfurous mess that not even lime fan fix. Watery mouthfeel that leaves a little stickiness. Pretty bad stuff.
Une bière facile, raffraîchissante, pas complexe, ni longue mais désaltérante. De loin supérieure à bien des lagers d’autres macro-brasseries

Very light beer, but really really good,, taste like lemonade,, its drinkable but its very different from other beers,, there is no foam when youre pouring it, you can litteraly slice a lime in it and drink it at the beach, also very expensive for this quality

Pite pod marką Coronita cerveza z Hiszpanii.. Klarowne, barwa słomkowa - trochę nijaka. Piana się wzburzyła, ale szybciutko znikęła. Słaby, słodowy aromat, a poza tym dominuje diacetyl. Lekkie. W smaku słodowe, dosyć słodkie. To czego się można było spodziewać, czyli niewiele. Większych wad w smaku nie wyczuwam. Wysycenie średnie, goryczka niska.
Horse piss. It is not eventos refreshing. Very bad. No head. Taste bad. Yellow straw almost line water.

Bottle. I have had countless of these before, finally got around to rating. If you don't think of it as a beer, it's not a bad drink to go with spicy Mexican food.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This is by no means a good beer. Put a slice of lime in it and drink it on a beach; that can be nice though (power of marketing? Probably). Dump a shot of hot sauce in it and chug, and it can be a fun drinking game - last one to finish buys a round of real beer. Still not a good beer though.
Bottle. Pours golden/straw with small white head. Aroma is skunky and weak. Taste is similar and watered down.

Bottle at Chicos Cantina, Copenhagen. Light golden beer in the bottle, no glass. Lime in the bottleneck, beer tastes therefore mainly of lime. A litte malt sweetness, otherwise little aroma or taste. Quite high carbonation.

How: </b Bottled  Appearance  Light yellow color with almost no head  Aroma:  Hops, and some citrus notes.  Taste:  is the same as aroma, light to medium sweet.  Palate:  Light body, slick texture, flat carbonation.
Botella. BBD: 26/07/18. Color amarillo transparente, aromas metálicos sabores rancios. Mala cerveza.
Origin: Bottle. Vessel: Bottle. Supplier: Gift (Romsey). Weak yellow colour. Citrus nose. Light and watery taste with hint of lemon. Mild carbonation. Easy to drink but ultimately lacking much merit.

A lager that does not foam much during pouring. What you do not get in the foam, you will be blessed in carbonation. It bubbles lively as a soda and spreads its fragrance of citrus and light malt. Taste is very little malty and slightly hoppy. Aftertaste is there almost nothing of. Usually you drink Corona with a slice of lime, but I will first try to drink the first half without, and above description was the result. Eventually I’ll put a slice of lime in, and it lifts the overall impression tremendously. From being a thin-legged and watered experience, it is after all a more fresh and thirst-quenching beer that could do well as banquet beverage. I understand that it may be popular among younger drinkers, as it has previously been the subject of a trend statement among young people. In my world I find no great enthusiasm.

Amarelo vivo, espuma branca de boa formação, pouquíssima duração. Aroma levemente maltado, metalizado, facilmente se dispersa no ar. Paladar de leve amargor, aguada. Mais uma daquelas para se beber estupidamente gelada, a fim de não sentir os defeitos.

Cancun, Baby, dieses Bier schreit CANCUN. Jaaa, was es aber nicht schreit ist "Trink mich, ich bin außergewöhnlich, eloquent und charismatisch". Aber davon geh ich auch erstmal nicht aus. Schon beim Öffnen der Flasche riecht man deutlich süßliche Maische. Optisch zumindest leichte Perlen, kein Schaum. Geschmacklich ein Hauch von Malz, dann nichts. Echt, da kommt nix mehr nach. Vergleichbar mit meiner Bierdurststrecke in Südostasien. Und da sind wir wieder in Cancun, CANCUN, Baby...
Skunk in the bottle. Thats everything about Corona. I dont know what i can say about this liquid so i writting 70 letters because i must.
I dont know what beverege I would classify this as, but it’s not beer. It does the job on putting out your thirst but that’s about it.

from bottle looks pale yellow but will give it a 3 because I can’t pour it aroma malty taste soft watery little malt honestly not much flavor at all but it does have a nice mouthfeel due to the softness

Flasche (355 ml) aus einem Edeka-Markt in Berlin. - Intensiv gelb, blank; sehr kurzlebiger Schaum. - Eigentümlicher Geruch nach Dosengemüse, schwach muffig herb aber ohne Hopfen, mit Anklängen an Gummi und Schwefel. - Antrunk sehr dünn und ganz schwach malzig mit schwacher, muffiger Süße, etwa wie alt gewordenes Weißbrot. Ganz im Hintergrund ein wenig undefinierbare Herbe. Durchschnittlich rezent, extrem wäßrig, ohne Substanz. Im Abgang schwache, etwas muffige Herbe. - Saft- und kraftlose Plörre mit unschönen Fehlaromen. Kaum bierähnlich.
Yellow color, pretty skunky, some light alcohol flavor with slight malts. Not bad, not great.

Pours clear, fizzy yellow-gold with small white head that vanishes in a moment.
Nose is malt, sweet corn, a hint of lime. Taste follows with light malt sweetness against light hop bitterness. An uncomplicated beer to drink cold on a hot day, with a wedge of lime.
Also an indifferent beer, one small step up from its US counterparts in the mass market or hop-forward brutalists.
330 mml bottle tasted on the 09/07/2015. More tequila please!!!! More tequila! Next one please!

This is my third favourite beer. #1 is Canterbury Dark Mild, #2 is Rickards Red, and #3 is Corona. Must admit that I prefer it with a lime. I choose this one if I want a light tasting beer and usually order it if out at a restaurant or bar. At home it is Canterbury and at pub is Rickards (unless they have Canterbury).

Pours pizzy yellow with low disappearing white head
Aromas of water, citrus, corn, hints of beer
Taste has corn syrup, hints of citrus, hints of malt syrup. Lively carbonation, low bitterness, medium sweet

15-03-2020; bottle; at home (bought at Plus supermarket, The Netherlands).
In all this corona virus madness its best just to sit back and enjoy a...corona beer. 
Drank the beer form the bottle. The looks of the beer are allright. Golden yellow beer, crystal clear and almost no foam. It is not that special, pretty straight forward. 
The aroma of the beer is allright. There are some simple malt aromas, quite bready. There is also some adjunct I think. Some hop aromas are there, giving a touch of zest and also some herbs. Not strong though. It is a very simple beer, but it is nice for on a hot day. But, form a real aromatic treat, this is not the beer. 
The taste of the beer is simple too. Sweet malts and adjunct, bitter hops. Thats it. All a bit mild. 
The palate is simple. Light body, thin texture and medium carbonation. The finish is short and has some simple malt notes in it. All in all, this is a very simple beer. But the whole vibe around it, makes it nice for on a summer day somehow. Especially with that blasphemous lime slice in it.

It us what it is. Anytime u need to squeeze lime in to a beer to make it taste better. That's not a good starting point

As Coronita Extra (207ml, 4.6%). Pours a clear light golden with a medium citrus-induced white head. Nose is of lime, light grains and surprisingly light on skunk for a clear bottle. Taste is light corn, lime and generic lager notes. Body is light and carbonation high. Watery. Quite refreshing on that hot day I must say. Overall a fair mindless summer drink, better with lime.

Bottle 0,33.
Light yellow, no head. Aroma is missing. Taste: plain lager, a little sour, slightly bitter finish. Light body. Refreshing if served cold, adding lime did not change much for me. Overall: not bad for macro lager, suits for hot summer days or sauna. Poor in comparison with micro brews.
Foul corn syrup nonsense. Adding the lime is a waste of lime, mass produced lager is the death of beer.
Clear very pale yellow, more or less no head. Vague corn starch aroma. Sweetish and very bland with clean, hard mouthfeel. Lots of mineral water, some oily corn. Tinny finish. Mostly harmless.
The piece of lemon or lime is the only thing that can make this corn juice bearable. Acidic aroma, plain taste, pale watered golden. For binge drinking.

(330ml bottle, Beijing) 
(original review June 2015, re-visit April 2019)
Nose: wet cardboard, oatmeal, hint of lager/pilsner nose, raisins. (definitely has light euro pils notes in the nose, pale malt and green)
Appearance: light/medium yellow, clear, decent carbonation, moderate head with some variability in bubble size, dissipates pretty quickly. 
Taste: Touch of malt/toffee, a bit more hoppiness than most other mass produced lagers. Metallic. (grain, including slightly sweet corn, hint of smoke/wood)
Palate: light body, kinda watery, does have some hoppy bitterness that lingers a bit, dry. (yes, light but not ultra light, some creamy smoothness but also some palate cleansing frizzy astringency)

Overall: better than I expected. A refreshing light lager with a touch of body/hops on the finish. Might be a bit similar to Miller High Life. (some sweetness yet some body and pilsner essence too. almost doesn't seem like a mexican beer. I upped the Aroma score one notch, so overall went from 2.2 to 2.3. might even deserve a 2.4)
Beer, very good, I not Drank with Lemon yet, but I like many this Beer, very places search this Beer
Pale yellow, almost no head. Aroma of corn and hay. Taste light soar, maybe rice, corn, very light watery body, no aftertaste, yet refreshing.

Spread throughout the world, but typical low standard of well spread beers. Not great at any level but the price. Still, Mexican well spread beer is better than EU or American beers of that type. No top, urine colour, sttrong carbonation to kill bad aftertaste etc. Corn is dominant.
Drank on behalf of Chester Copperpot. Initial aroma of light citrus and skunk. Pale yellow appearance with bone white head. Sugary water, lemon and bland corn flavor. Ordinary at best.

A bottle of Corona Familiar that was gifted to me by my coworker Luis. I have decided to make the most of this opportunity and play the "gotta rate them all" card. Pours a clear pale yellow color with a quick fading head. Nearly absent corn like aroma. I’m only going to say positive things about this. On a 90° day, when you are parched, this is a tasty, very refreshing beer out of a frozen mug. Typical Mexican lager other than that. I’m not going to call this garbage, because it isnt. Could be much worse for sure. Thirst quenching. Clearly the main ingredient is water, and water can be quite refreshing at times. Though sometimes water doesn’t cut it, and you aay, get me a beer. I don’t know. When opportunity knocks, I’ll continue to order to order this beer over the fierce competition of Mexican lagers.

(Bottle, Schiphol Airport, Amsterdam, 1 March 2015) Pale golden colour with brief, white head. Malty, slightly fruity nose with bread, cereal, boiled cauliflower and corn. Single 330 ml clear bottle from the Last Chancers Ice Chest at Park Lane Liquor Store, served in a Big Rock footed lager glass. Numero tres in my little round-up of light lagers. This Mexican number is popular with one of my brothers-in-law, with the de rigeur lime slice. As for de rigueur, the unmistakable calling card of Pepé le Pew and/or Fifi LaFume hits the ol’ ’factories as the cap is pried off. Pours a very carbonated, golden straw hue with a cap of off-white that rapidly, loudly crackles into oblivion and leaves hardly a trace. Aroma: skunk and cereals. Flavor: light sweet cereals and malt, with traces of astringency and bitterness dancing in and out. Thin, with a mild bitter aftertaste. And, always present, even in my belches, is the lingering cologne of Mephitis mephitis. Why people enjoy this perpetually lightstruck Bizarro World beer from our amigos and amigas down South just escapes me. I feel polluted now.
"Great as a softdrink - not so great as beer" - yes, and there’s way better softdrinks. But actually drinkable. Just nothing there.
Skunky, watery, uninteresting, flavorless, uninspiring, which makes it a good choice amongst bro beer drinkers. Are you a guy that screams WOOOOOOOOOOOOO on spring break? You will love this.

One of my friends calls this Mexican Piss. He’s right, it’s terrible.... Aroma is malty, somewhat skunky....It pours with a decent head, but it goes away pretty quickly. Thanifully it has some decent carbonation, and that helps a little... Overall, I’ve heard it said hundreds of times, when you go to Mexico, "Don’t drink the water!" So why would you drink this?

Coronita

Su verdadero nombre es Corona Extra (La Cerveza más Fina) pero en España se llama Coronita. 
Coronita es la cerveza mexicana de mayor venta en el mundo, y actualmente está representada en casi todos los países. Su botella es estilizada, transparente y de cuello largo, que tantas imitaciones ha suscitado. 

Elaborada en México, tiene un color amarillo dorado pálido, es muy ligera, de aroma poco intenso pero franco, que recuerda ligeramente al cereal, con un paladar fresco. Es de sabor suave, ligera, refrescante y baja en calorías.
Pours uber clear yellow with minimal head. Water, light grain, light hops... hopefully some lime to give it flavor. Some skunk in the trunk. Thats about all there is to it.
Bottle at home. Pours pale piss yellow, not much going on, grassy yeasty, quite pish.
Nothing special about Corona that distinguishes it from other lagers. Not worth the money and won’t be buying again.

Mexico’s best known and most exported standard pale lager. Often drunk directly from the iconic bottle with a slice of lime in the neck. I pour it into a lager glass without lime. Very thin, loose, off-white, quickly dissolving head leaving a rim around the edge of the glass. Colour very, very pale yellow with a faint greenish hue, cristal clear with low sparkling (which explains the lack of head). Very weak aroma - I’m beginning to see why the slice of lime is used - with primarily sweetish corn, some vague Pilsener malts, some iron and a faint hint of lightstruck hops - yet too faint to even be bothered by it. Taste of faint sweetish corn again, little bit metallic but otherwise very bland and watery, utterly neutral with a weak grassy hop presence in the finish, very late and brief and not nearly enough to create even a form of real bitterness. Almost like any bland standard pale lager diluted with medium-sparkling mineral water... One of the most tasteless beers I ever had, so tasteless it doesn’t even offend me. Just a waste of time.

Had this on numerous occasions at pubs in the US, UK, and Bulgaria. It is a nice, light, summer drink, although it might be difficult to find something really exciting about it. DATE REVIEWED: July 5, 2014... GLASSWARE: Blanche de Chambly pokal (though tough to choose one, considering this is mostly a bottle-to-mouth beer... OCCASION: the comedown after two solid days of eating, drinking and celebrating...APPEARANCE: blur-inducing golden yellow body with minimal bubbles forming; quickly disintegrating white head forms a pencil-thin circle; zero lacing... AROMA: some metallic pings, but mostly a blank slate to sift other scents between; faint bubblegum and biscuit ... PALATE: where this one wins at least in its functionality--as enjoyed the past two days, a clean, clean palate-cleansing body that thinly holds to a beer-like guise--mostly water; when held on its own merit sans setting, a liquid pure and simple... TASTE: is it corn chip? just corn? bitter malt ping of a Vienna lager minus all that complexity--a syrupy ending leaves a little aftertaste, but a bit beefy if chewed...who knew the lack of a lime could be so detrimental to the overall experience?... OVERALLL: after oscillating between this and Starr Hill’s wheat, I found my Fourth of July well enjoyed mostly due to the family, food and fireworks...the beer itself served to quench thirst and balance out the grill carbs, and little else...I do believe this review would have been more complimentary if the lime were present, as I even had difficulty selecting a proper drinking vessel...

For shits and giggles, let’s do this.
Let’s not speak of the numerous amount of times I’ve had this out of the bottle and a fair amount of times I’ve had this with the lime in it, but let’s sit down and talk about this beer.
I’ve had this in a pint glass and pilsener glasses several times and there was barely any difference. 
The appearance was a super clear yellow color with a vast array of different sized carbonated bubbles rising to fill a rapidly dieing bubbly white head. There was barely any lacing and what there was just slid into the body. 
The smell was basically just some sweetened cooked corn. 
The taste was the same and it was watery all around. 
The palate sat very light and allowed a great deal of sessionability about it. 
Overall, it’s a pale lager that’s extremely light. Honestly, this one doesn’t do much for me but there isn’t really anything disgusting about it either.

Poured from 12 oz bottle into pint glass.

Appearance: pours a thin white head that disappears almost immediately with no lacing. Clear pale straw color with some streaming carbonation.

Aroma: slight bit of skunk at first, then white bread, corn, and grassy hops.

Mouthfeel: light and watery with a mostly dry finish.

Flavor: corn sweetness, grassy hops, and some white bread, echoing the aroma.

Overall: not offensive. My biggest gripe with this beer is that it costs much more than it is worth. Plenty of other options that taste just as good for half the price.

Review: Bottle of Corona Extra lager, 4.6%ABV

One of the beers to drink when it’s summer, Corona is a light beer that has a great refreshing taste, especially in the hot sun. The flavours are not overwhelming making the beer go down smooth and easily. It’s a beer that everyone can drink and very suitable for a party. No bloated feeling after drinking a few Corona’s.

The appearance has a clear pale straw yellow body. After pouring a small white head appears that dissipates very quickly. Not much lacing.

It has a mild, clean, subtle lager aroma, that smells of light, sweet cornbread

Corona’s very light in taste, mild, clean with no bitterness and has a rather thin tasting watery feel. It’s flavour is minimal, but on a hot day it quenches the thirst.

It pours a very pale shade of yellow with a thin white head that quickly fades out. The aroma has light grain, corn and husk notes. The flavor without the lime is well, plain old American pale macro lager. There is a mildly sweet, light grain flavor with corn adjunct and bland mildly grassy hops that offer some bitterness for balance. Its palate is light and crisp with a light body and refreshing carbonation. For the most part this is really just a trendy drink so for best results serve ice cold in the bottle with the lime and enjoy on a hot summer day.
Clear gold pour. smells like skunk barley. Tastes slight wheat grass hops. Watery palate. needs limes-bad.
Drank at the Pocono 400. Piss warm and skunked to all hell. I can’t believe people kept drinking this stuff. Straw yellow color in a clear bottle. Pretty much undrinkable without lime.

Mit Limette serviert schmeckt es am Besten. Ein geschmacklich leichtes Bier, das auch schon ohne Limette zitronisch schmeckt. Fazit:Gutes Kultbier.

Surprisingly harmless, less disgusting than European macro lagers but still helplessly tasteless.

355 ML bottle
4.5% ABV

Clear straw yellow color, very visible short lived carbonation. Bright white head that quickly falls to a ringed collar. Some spotty lacing.

I poured a 24oz can into a shaker glass. There was no clear freshness date. It cost $2.89 ($0.12 per ounce).



Appearance: Transparent pale gold hue with massive carbonation constantly visible. Pours to a small, bright white, soapy which manages to leave a surprising amount of lacing on the glass.



Smell: A general non-clean aroma, but nothing repulsive. Milled corn grits are noticeable.



Taste: Drinking Corona straight from the bottle with a lime wedge in the neck doesn’t give the drinker the true taste of the beer. All you really taste is beer-flavored lime juice. For the sake of this review I decided to try it from a can and pour it into a glass like every other beer. The result was surprisingly not terrible. The palette was more bland and boring than it was off-putting. 



Upon my first swig, I was surprised to find a little bit of sweetness. Corona Extra doesn’t have the sharp tang sensation of corn like a lot of American macro adjunct lagers. It does have a bit of a yellow lollipop flavor, which I believe is an indication of oxidation. There is some corn syrup flavor as well, which might account for the sweet factor. It finishes rather weak with a watery sensation. 



Drinkability: This might have been one of the most visibly effervescent beers I’ve ever seen, so I was surprised the mouthfeel to Corona Extra was rather tepid. It did go down smoothly, though, and there was little aftertaste to speak of. At only 4.6% ABV it’s a borderline light beer, which would also explain its mild palette.
Aroma is mostly corn. Yellow pour. Flavor is also mostly sweet corn. Thin body. Lots of co2. Not bad actually. Just nothing spectacular. Nice pleasant aftertaste and a little throat-tingle.

Pours golden straw color with perfect clarity. Only a thin head of loose bubbles that fell pretty fast and left a very thin ring. No lace. Nose is clean. There is a brief hit of mild skunk that fades to reveal sweet grain and a bit of corn sweetness. No fruity esters at all. Taste is light and lively with carbonation. It bites the tongue a bit with bubbles and the grain is husky and lightly sweet. There are no off flavors. The body is thin and watery. The beer is crisp and refreshing. Thirst quenching. It finishes dry with a small touch of hop bitter and the faintest hint of spice in the very last moment of the swallow and it’s dry. 



This is not at all unpleasant. It is not sour, it is not offensive, The corn sweetness is not syrupy and the lager character is light. It’s called a light lager. it’s easy to drink and because it does not have any complex flavors it would compliment a variety of food, from Chinese, to Mexican to Italian or just a pastrami sandwich. You don’t have to think about this beer it drinks as easily as water with a sessionable abv. There is a mild odor of sulfur that develops as it warms.

A clear golden beer without a stable foam, it has a big content of carbonic gas. The aroma is quite simple being more evidence some malt flavors. The taste is simple watery, with a good balance of hops at the end, but with a light body. A good beer for a sunny day.

Pours a light golden color with a smallish white head that quickly dissipates. Aromas of light sweet fruity and grainy malt with hints of floral hops to counter. The taste is sweet with honey and fruit. Light bready grainy flavor with a sharp spicy hop flavor with a low to moderate level of hop bitterness. Light to medium light body with a moderate to high level of carbonation and a slick sharp crisp mouthfeel. Nice grainy bready aroma, this actually tastes pretty decent without a lime stuffed into it.

Bottle. Salty, inexpressive aroma. Taste is weak (very watery), though nicely balanced between bitter and sweet. Interesting, but good aftertaste, but it might become off-puting. Good for quenching thirst, but therwise totally overpriced and watered down pale lager. It is drinkable, but I’d rather choose many other beers over Corona (even for quenching thirst).
Corona is a bland beer. There is no distinctive flavor, aroma, or characteristic. That said, it is refreshing and pairs with most any bar food. Everyone knows by now that clear bottles are not ideal.

F’n Corona! Every cookout I go to I’m handed a Corona...with a lime of course. I’d rather squirt the lime in my eye than tip back this watery swill. But alas, don’t want to piss off the host. Bottle 33cl. from a local supermarket, @home in a lager glass. Clear light yellow golden colour, very small white head. Aroma cereals, corn, hint of citrus, leaves. Bottle at my grandparents. Pour is pale clear yellow with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Big husky, slightly grassy, light corn, straw, grainy aroma. Taste is grain, cereal, slightly hoppy, corn and husk. Light body with high carbonation. Not a bad pale lager and pretty easy to drink.

Had it out of a bottle. This beer is meant to have out of a bottle and not poured. For some reason it tastes better straight from the bottle ( and yes with lime ). Great lager on a hot summer day, nothing fancy about this macro, but one of the better ones. Pours a clear yellow hue, lager hop taste, watery in a good way.
Nice fresh beer for the summertimes, although I prefer white beer, a Corona once in a while is a blast! Citrus jumpes out when tasting the beer.

355ml clear bottle from Systembolaget, labeled 4,5 % ABV, pours clear light yellow with a small white head. Aroma of malt and corn, with a hint of citrus. Taste is also malt, corn and citrus. Overall a somewhat underrated beer in my opinion, with a pair of lime slices the beer works well with together spicy food or as a thirst quencher.

Bottle at dallys rooftop...lime added...nice crisp light beer to drink on a hit day..

Back when I was a novice beer drinker, I really enjoyed this ubiquitous Mexican corn lager, and I must still acknowledge that with it's cleaner-than-water finish on the palate it's one of the most sessionable summer beers around, which coupled with the light non-filling body and simple refreshing sweet grain and corn taste, cements this as the epitome of summer vacation beer. That being said, I was always perplexed by the exorbitant premium price for this brew, which at the end of the day is just a cheaply processed corn syrup beverage with a dose of propylene glycol for good measure. On top of that, I always found that half the time the beer was lightstruck from the clear glass bottles, which made buying a fresh six pack a game of chance (on that note, if you decide to drink this beer, I recommend you look for the brown glass Corona Familiar bottles which better preserve the beer). I for one will be sparing my liver and my wallet by sticking to Pacifico or craft Mexican style lagers which are far superior quality at a better price.

Bottling beer in a clear bottle is a death sin, but the guys at Corona have done a helluva marketingh job promoting this beer as "high-class".

Watery, and good refreshment, but this is indeed a poor beer.

Ideal for the game with broomsticks and a frisbee.  Palate is pretty unoffensive as well, if absent.  Overall, add a lime and don’t think about it, at all.  Or anything, at all.  Btw, with a lime, it’s probably like a 2.3.

32 oz brown bottle of Corona Familiar, and I’m drinking it out of the bottle. Seems like there is some debate as to whether or not this is the same as the regular Corona Extra in the clear bottles... I don’t have one handy to taste them side by side, but upon sampling I’ll wager they’re identical. Pours bright clear yellow with thin fizzy head. Aroma is only a faint hint of corn. Taste is thin, corny malt with an effervescent body and a vague hint of a hoppy bite on the finish. By most reasonable standards, this is a cheap, crummy beer even among light lagers and Mexican ones at that. Yet... on a hot day, with a slice of lime floating in it, this is undeniably refreshing. Fizzy soda pop like body that makes the addition of a lime almost mandatory.
A very common beer that I find myself drinking from time to time just out of convenience.  I dont think a description is neccessary.
330ml bottle. Swill, idon´t know how this can be even considered beer. The light glass bottle shows clearly what you can expect for this one...
this one is overated beer of mexico. nothing special about taste just corn and corn... i think i has very good comercial becouse it wont worth its price
Pours clear yellow. Nothing special in this beer. Aroma and flavour are common and bad. Expensive for such a bad beer.

The malts taste a bit like hay and corn. It's palate and color is weak and thin. The hops are not dominate 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I think it's fair to say that "beer" is an absolute failure. Can't really discribe flavour

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cerveja leve, refrescante. Acredito que ela supera as expectativas criadas a partir das típicas cervejas de garrafa transparente, umas das melhores.
The finish of Corona is what kills it.   The skunky finish makes me think that they need to "put it back in the horse"......

Bottle. Pours clear golden with no head. Aroma is corn, grain, malt and citrus. Taste is light sweet and light bitter - actually bordering tasteless. Body is light, texture is watery, carbonation medium. Finish is short with corn.
Tastes far too rotten (skunky). Not sure how you can drink more than a couple of these without feeling sick. Too expensive, but still far better than the likes of Bud Light and Coors.
I know is a Very light Beer but I like it for that. Fresh Comercial Beer. You can Drink it without feeling full....

It’s amazing how corona has a light beer for this already light beer. The smell is of corn and not much else, the appearance  is extremely pale. Taste is just horrible, skunked hops, and corn mix for an offensive aftertaste. Where’s the malt, can’t find it. extremely thin bodied.  Not sure how this beer became so popular, perhaps it’s commercials and the myth that a beer for a beach has to fill a criteria of being light,  and pale or maybe because most Americans haven’t tried anything different or won’t. Terrible beer, maybe even worthy of a drain pour.
Very corny smell with slight bitterness and sour citrus. Refreshing taste but honestly I will rather drink lime juice than this beer.
This smells and tastes like urine, though the lime wedge makes it slightly less unpleasant.
330 ml bottle, backlog. Aroma of corn starch and cardboard with a touch of stale citrus. Tastes watery and not much else. ’Orrible,

From a bottle in Puerto Aventuras Mexico. Pours a clear gold with a white head. Feint malt aroma. Highly carbonated mouthfeel. Crisp but very flavorable. Just OK if served with a lime in the tropics. There are better mainline Mexican beers.
The only beer I feel it necessary to add a lime to.  One of my favorites when I just want to enjoy the lime taste.

Another beer that I had so many times but never took the chance to review. So what if it’s snowing outside, I grabbed a bottle from the supermarket and I even poured it into a lager glass. The classic clean glass bottle of 355 ml, who everyones love to hate, ABV 4.5 on my bottle.
Very pale, piss yellow colour, with one finger of white froathy head, very low retention and of course no lacing on the glass. Great activity in the glass though.
Lots of adjuncts on the nose, with the corn being quite obvious, but at least it doesn’t have the "wet cornflakes" smell. Probably is covered by the light citrus notes. 
The corn is much more obvious on the taste. Nothing else to mention here.
Very thin, almost watery on the body, saved by its high carbonation. 
Overall, what can I say that is not already written? Only good for the beach.
Ljusgul i färgen, litet vitt skum. Doftar väldigt lite av söt malt, majs, majs, lite citrus. Smakar vattnigt med inslag av majs, lite citrus. Ge mig mera lime!!

Clear yellow lager, virtually no aroma, taste is light, watery with a little bitterness, highly carbonated, body is light with thin texture. Very easy to drink. Overall, not bad for Mexican lagers.  Needs counterparts like limes or tomato juice. Best served cold on a hot day with counterparts like lime, salty/sour foods. I like to make Micheladas (red beer) with these.
The best part about this beer is the fact that we have to add lemon to drink it. And that says it all. But I think that it is a good beer to be on the beach on a sunny day. Like a soda!

99¢ in a clearance shopping cart. Why the hell not. If this was mint flavored, I could have mistaken it for light mouthwash. Light corn and cardboard with a touch of stale citrus in the back. This isn’t as bad as I didn’t expect it not to be this time. Again.
Update of old Tick from 2013. The fact that nobody, anywhere, even asks if you want to jam a wedge of citrus into this speaks for itself.

Very present bitter aroma. It doesn’t look like beer. Bright yellow with no foam at all. It also has a bitter taste, that will move into a bitter aftertaste. Just a normal lager.

Erg aanwezig bitter aroma. Ziet er niet echt uit als bier. Heldergele kleur zonder schuimkraag. Heeft ook een bittere smaak, die ook overgaat in de bittere nasmaak. Gewoon een normaal pils.
Il a un nez très subtile florale. Il y a un goût très légèrement surcé. Carbonation moyenne. Si c’est froid c’est pas très bonne, mais quand il se rechauffe il devient horrible.
330ml bottle. Light yellow body. Pretty much like Sol. Alcohol flavored water, good for quenching your thirst but nothing more.
The kind of beer you use for "micheladas",  in my opinion the best micheladas are made using corona.
De las mejores cervezas mexicanas, siempre es mejor la coronita y así... Pero muy buena.

Pours very pale yellow with a thin white head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is skunky grass.  Flavor is wet straw and grass...skunky.  mouthfeel is light and the finish is sweet malts and skunky notes.
Urine yellow, tastes like skunked beer, yuk. A lime really does save this beer but honestly, its good for getting drunk on a warm day and nothing else.
Well, this has a skunky, corny, citric smell, a watery texture, very light bitterness and almost no substance. But it’s drinkable alright, very refreshing.

Had to taste this beer with such a bad reputation at JFK in NYC on my way back to Sweden. Golden clear beer with a small lacy white head. Hoppy and fruity aroma. Fruity and citrus flavour. Not as bad as I thought, refreshing summerbeer when you do boring things in your garden a hot summerday.

Jaune très pâle, presque blanchâtre. Parfaitement limpide avec une mousse mince et une effervescence soutenue. Au pif : céréales, eau minérale et jus de pommes. En bouche : un peu sucré. Dans la catégorie des bières qui se boivent comme de l’eau, la Corona va toujours garder sa place comme un rafraîchissement d’urgence.

Bottle at the Green Man, Kuala Lumpur.  Clear yellow in colour with medium carbonation. Always served with a slice of lime which tends to dominate the flavour and drunk from a bottle. It’s not a quality beer, but it quenches the thirst and with the lime it has a pleasant taste. It will still be around long after I’m gone thats for sure!
No foam, no bubbles. no real hop, smells of corn. tastes slightly bitter, wathery, sticky. Nothing is real in this beer.

Heresy. The Pope should excommunicate all those responsible for this outrage. An affront to all that is decent. My wife likes this beer! Now I am questioning my own desirability if this is the quality of her discernment.

The most famous mexican beer in Europe.
Light yellow colour without head. Hoppy aroma and citrus flavour, but very watery.
But, with a piece of lemon or lime, in a hot summer day, is good, refreshing.
Without lemon, rubbish.

Bière pâle, malodorante (mouffette et sueur), et extrêmement limpide. Goût de maïs et d’eau gazéifiée. Peut-être acceptable lors des grandes chaleurs, elle ne résiste cependant pas une seconde à une analyse quelque peu approfondie. Fade, peu invitante et très ordinaire.
I like the bottle and the taste of the lime. Just wish I didn’t have to install it myself. Weak and ineffectual.
Nice beer for the walk 4 sure hommies.........................................
Bottle.  Only worth drinking when the temperature tops 90.  With a lime, goes down like water.  Without, goes down like dishwater.
Ska man betygsätta den som öl eller törstsläckare? Förstnämnda så är det verkligen ingen höjdare. Sistnämnda, ja är det 35grader och solen skiner, ja tack!
Typical Mexican beer for summertime drinking with a lime at a party. I won’t turn one down but better Miexican beers out there.

Crystal clear golden colour with a small white head. Aroma is grain and a slight skunkiness. Taste is creamed corn, sweet grain. Slightly sweet on the palate with a light body and a lack of complexity. It is not totally undrinkable but there’s definitely nothing of interest here.
Soft beer, not so flavored , a little light and body. Clear yellow color. Is an all ocassion beer, a symbo, of mexico with the lemmon slice.

From notes - Corona Familiar 32oz bottle.  Pours clear piss yellow.  Nose is corn and straw with hay and staleness.  Flavor is sweet malt, more corn, and grains... Light body, drinkable, but not enjoyable.
Light, skunky and flat.  Probably doesn’t benefit from the clear bottle, but I doubt that is the only culprit.  Passable on a hot day near a body of water. Garnish with as much lime as possible.
This beer  is best freezing cold in an icy 12 oz bottle straight out of a cooler on a hot day near water. Serve with lime if available.

330mL Bottle. Stylish beer, especially when drunk out of the bottle with a lime wedge. A distinct bright yellow beer, which is a bit thin in mouth feel but very refreshing and well carbonated. Sure, it is lacking in a malt richness or a long finish but it does OK for its market...

Bottled, 0.33l. Clear golden color with mid-sized frothy white head and fizzy bubbles. Aroma of malt, fruits and some faint hops. Tastes of grainy malt, not really of rich barley, but only plain rice or corn. Mouthfeel is crisp and dry, while finish is poorly hopped. Light body, thin texture and fizzy carbonation in palate. Only worth for statistics...

12 oz bottle pours a yellow-gold color with lots of visible carbonation.  Surer enough, the carbonation level is high; probably a good thing given the light and watery body.  Aroma? ,,, what aroma?  Oh, there it is: adjunct (corn) light lager.  This managed to exceed my very low expectations, but really only good as a thirst quenching cold beverage where I would indeed prefer this to water on occasion.

Appearance is bright yellow, very little head. Served with sliced lime. High carbonated, with bitter and fresh taste. Lime serves this beer nicely, bringing more acid and bitterness to palate. Very enjoyable on hot summer day.
Piss.Mexican Piss.if u like this you?re Mexican,uneducated, or a Faggot . Kill yourself.
Il a un nez très subtile florale. Il y a un goût très légèrement surcé. Carbonation moyenne. Si c’est froid c’est pas très bonne, mais quand il se rechauffe il devient horrible.
Nothing is better than an ice cold corona after a day of golf or sitting in the sun .

citrus, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, thin feel, fizzy, watery finish
Drink out of the bottle with a lime jammed in for some flavour. Not much substance, but refreshing when ice cold. Goes well with spicy Mexican food.

Um, yeah I’ve had a few of these before...This was my daily quaff on my honeymoon many years ago, and I still order a bottle or two occasionally when dining at Mexican restaurants.

The beer is clear and golden colored with a half inch of white head. A good looking adjunct lager.

The aroma is a bit skunky, and I highly recommend the addition of salt and lime to mask / enhance the aroma and flavor.

The flavor is simple and straightforward. Adjuncts, grain, corn, the usual suspects. Again, do yourself a favor and add the traditional salt and lime.

The feel is thin and watery. Good for summertime and/or pairing with spicy Mexican food.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 06-04-2012
Can, gold pour, white head, nose and taste are citrus, pretty good for macro brew

Pale lager. Tastes a bit limey. I didn't have a lime by the way. I don't think it's bad as others obviously do but that doesn't mean I think it's particularly nice. Ice cold on a hot day I think it might be reasonable compared to a fosters/carling. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of typical pale lager skunk with slight floral yeast notes.  Very straw pale with a fizzy head.  Taste is ok with notes of bread, popcorn, and sour yeast.  As good as expected.
24oz bottle.  Pours fizzy pale yellow with no head whatsoever.  Skunky aroma indicative of adjuncts.  Flavor is grain and maybe corn.  Light bodied with no finish.  Not good.
Slightly carbonated yellow water for  summer days with temperatures above 35 degrees Celsius.
Weak shit drank from bottle looks gold not much head smells light waterery lame over priced crap

I remember enjoying Corona when I was younger, and I’m a little disappointed coming back to it. Pours pale gold. Taste is skunky and bitter, slight citrus flavor. Would need a ton of lime to get through a six pack.

well designes bottle - and this is all positive things about this beer. Let’s just see the ingredients:  barley malt, rice and/or corn, hops, yeast, antioxidants (ascorbic acid), and propylene glycol as a stabiliser

PROPYLENE GLYCOL in a beer? 
ascorbic acid in a beer?
rice and/OR(!) corn in a CORN beer? It’s ridiculous!!!!
It should be the joke of the manufacturer calling this ’beer’ pilsener type.
It is more like a urine sample than a beer.
it should be 0/10, but unfortunately 0.5/10 is the lowest score...

I don’t like the big brewer’s much and pale lagers are the bottom of the barrel for me. However, this beer takes the cake!  I drank it once and thought I’d picked up a bottle of ammonia.  It was wretched.  I can drink Bud without too much trouble (I still think it is a mediocre beer), but Corona was rancidly bad.  I can’t understand why they advertise this crap so much, and make out like people actually want to sit in a lovely resort and drink swill.  Worst beer I’ve ever had.  Period.
Oh wow never knew that piss could be turned into beer. Mexicans should stuck to making tequila and resorts.

Poured from 12 oz. bottle.

Clear, bright golden yellow with eggshell white head and good lacing.

Aroma of copper and sweet grain.  

Taste of corn starch, grain and something I hope never to taste again.

Light/medium body and low carbonation.

A most unpleasant beer. No wonder people put lime in it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle with lime wedge. Clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is mainly light corn. Taste is influenced by the lime, which adds a citrus zing. The beer itself is pretty bland. Refreshing enough but quite boring.
16 oz. can. Pours straw golden yellow with a soapy white head. Aroma has grain lemongrass and corn. Taste is just as above. Palate thin fizzy and dry. It’s beer, nothing out of the norm.

Bottle. Pours clear light yellow color with white head that died down quickly. Aroma is malt, corn, hint of some spices and, well, vomit. Flavor is malt and corn, with some odd notes again. Body is super-thin. Very uninspiring.
12 ounce bottle, pours a pale yellow color, aromas of cereal, light old hops, and some grain.  Flavors are the same, not the best beer out there but decent on the beach for my honeymoon.

This is my drink of choice when I go out and don’t like the micros, or they don’t know what a micro is.

You really don’t need the lime, it’s good either way. Just make sure the place actually sells Corona on a regular basis, or you will be drinking out of date Corona.

Bottle from ... It doesn’t really matter does it? - pours like corn oil with a thin white head. Taste is a tad bitter. The palate is both oily and dry. Overall, one of the better ones in the drain pour category.

Bottle from Weis Lewisburg. Pours urine yellow with a thin white head. Smells like a skunk’s bathwater. Looks like corn oil. No discernible hop or malt flavor on the tongue. to describe this beer using the world "pilsner" in any form borders on fraud. This has to be one of the worst beers in the world. #2000.
330ml bottle. Pleasant golden yellow appearance. Almost no aroma. Okay for casual drinks but nothing to shout about.

(330ml bottle from Sainsbury’s) Served ice cold with a lime. Extremely light in body, hardly any aroma/taste. When its complimenting one of our extremely spicy home cooked Mexican meal I don’t mind, so a tough one to rate, its not that it tastes bad, just not much of anything at all - but not surprising when its ice cold. But basing it on the strength of rating beer it has to be low, but I will still drink it anyway. A real oxymoron.

Bottle on a Delta flight from ATL to MDW. Pours a clear pale gold with a fluffy white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a note of musty sweet corn with a hint of backing sweet grains. Flavor is full of sweet corn with notes of hay coming out in the finish.

32 oz Corona Familiar bottle to pint. Looks fine for the style; a transparent light gold with lively carbonation and white head that quickly dissipates into lacing. Smells doughy and a little skunky. Tastes like it smells with an average mouthfeel. Not great, not not bad, and certainly better than it’s scores indicate.

Pale gold color with a big whiff of skunk when I  opened the bottle.  When the skunk went away it smelled of corn.  White head that disappeared too quickly.  Very sweet beer with lots of corn and some buscuit flavors.  I do not drink this with lime, but I swear I can taste the lime anyway.  Too cloying to be refreshing.  There are other Mexican beers that are better for a hot day than this.
Can only drink this with a lime wedge, and only with a lime wedge I can drink multiple in a row. Surprised this has 138 calories- not sure this is worth running ~1.5 miles to burn off...

35.5cl bottle. Mild thirst killer. Light hop taste on water. With lemon or lime this beer is a good entertainer on partys or something like that. I like that beer, but only for party starter or garden working days :)

color is of urine.  only aroma and flavor i have ever had in one was skunk, skunk and skunk.  sure, maybe i’ve never had a fresh one, but has anyone? dont get why people like it, probably because the lime.
Coronary, coronado, corollary, corockery, cocockery, crockery, core, cortisone, cont. You.
bottle. Clear aroma of hop. Pours clear and very fizzy. Light golden colour. Watery, slightly bitter taste. A little dry palate. Nothing special, but drinkable.
355cl bottle. Light golden color with light white head. Watery beer with no body and nose. Only goes with lime as refreshment.

Looks like urine, tastes like stale skynk. Never have understood the love for this. Bud Light Lime blows this out if the water in terms of something refreshing out in the sun.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I guess it's better than bud, miller, or pbr. I'd drink it over any of those if nothing else was offered. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rob loves Corona when we head out to the beach. He was excited too see this big bottled beer in store. After drinking it, he says, "wasn’t great, wasn’t bad."
Just another refreshing lager for a hot summer day- but not excisting at all
Bad Bad Bad. Deserves props for having all the ingredients that you use to make beer but managing to have next to no flavour!
No head at all and a urine-like orange-yellow colour. Lightly bitter aroma. Mild taste. Short fruity finish. nothing special, but drinkable.
Tastes like lime when you stick a slice of lime into it.  Serve ice cold and don’t worry about what it tastes like.  Looks like urine.

A: Just a plain golden lager color, almost like hay.

S: Smells of bitter hops with some off malt in there as well

T: Bitter spoiled hops with a not so pleasant dry malt backend.

M: Very crisp and light. Light body with barely any carbonation.

O: I could do with out, but when available at a beach party I’ll take it.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-14-2011

From memory: I was forced to make a choice between drinking this or risking a bout with Montezuma’s Revenge while at my brother’s wedding in Mexico. I suppose sucking down Coronas on a white sand beach under a clear carribean sky is someone’s idea of a good time, but I come from the Boreal forests, only three hours by train away from being able to fight wild polar bears. Okay, so it was better than spending the week in the loo, screaming for more toilet paper. Given my general view of pale lagers, that rates pretty high (A choice between dysentry and a Bud would have gone to a coin toss.) I can say that Corona Extra is an inoffensive beer-like substitute when you have few other options, though I would like to ask any resort owners on the Yucatan reading this to PLEASE keep some Carta Blanca under the counter for us sad beer people who know that Mexico actually does produce beer worth savouring.
If this beer is cold and has some lime it is hard to beat! You just can’t go wrong with this one!

Pours pale, heavily carbonated but no head. Smells skunky, maybe not at its best but it was a fresh one from the local bottle shop and in date. Very bland flavour - hardly any taste at all. Light bitterness and fades very quickly - watery.
One of the better generic budget beers. Little to no aroma, golden color. Watery taste if drank alone. Lime is highly recommended to give this beer some flavor and distinction.

Color is a pale gold with carbonation. Not much head. Nothing in the nose and the taste is watery with little to no flavor. Not really much different with a lime. I’ll drink it if it’s free but I wouldn’t buy another.
Bottle at a party. Had with and without lime. Can’t really say one way was better than the other. Very watery both ways. Didn’t find it especially refreshing. Glad I didn’t have to pay for it.
Klasická mexická sračka převlečená za pivo. Chuť nijaká, pěna taky tak, barva velmi světlá. Nechápu, že to vůbec někdo kupuje a navíc za cenu tří českých piv.
Barva: světle zlatá. Pěna: prakticky bez pěny. Vůně: prakticky bez vůně, lehká sladově obilná stopa. Chuť: lehce hořká voda sycená bublinkama. Nic co by připomínalo pivo.
this is a quality beverage. when me and my other famous heritage brewer friends went down to brazil we had about 3 and a half of them over our 2 week stay and boy were they satisfying!

Somehow bland liquid, not emotion or arising after taste
 In this drink, I could not remember what emotion

This needs to be drunk cold and with a lime. Otherwise be ready for blandsvillle. It has a skunkiness that is not great but not as offensive as it sounds. Clear golden color with quick fizz. Typical Mexican lager without much to offer. In fact, I can’t really make out any flavors. I would choose this over a Keystone any day but that’s not saying much.
Yellow color with a thin head. Watery yet still manages a bitter finish. Just not my type.

Bright yellow with nearly no head. Noses of some dust, bit hoppy. Rather flat and lightly bitter, thin body and that is pretty much about it. Though a thirst quencher when nicely cooled on a hot day. Finish goes rather unnoticable.

Bottle 33 cl, have tasted this one many times, just this time i wanted to put in here aswell. Pours Clear golden colour. Aroma ant taste of malts, yeasty smell, a little bitter taste, with a carbonate refreshing after taste. This is a non-saying lager
330 ml bottle. This "beer" is probably one of the worst beers I’ve ever tasted. It lacks aroma and taste. Maybe it would’ve turned into a two-star-beer with a piece of lime added. MAYBE.

Ok, I know this is a macro water lager, but still, 1.86? That’s low, you should be ashamed!  If I rated a microbrew ale under 2.2, I would not finish it, yet a corona still quenches on a hot day (and my scores average lower than the mean of the beers I’ve rated).   Smells like lager beer and tastes like lager beer.  Hops are perceptible.  Much better than bud light!
Smooth beer.  Easy to drink.  Has a slight bitter taste but is offset by the lime.  Nice golden color buy has no aroma.

Yellow colour with a white head. What is there to say about this that nobody knows? Do not taste much, but refreshing in the sun. Thats all, and that is what you want sometimes. But just sometimes!
