[A sip from a bottle that a "friend" brought into my house....]

hay, grass, golden, clear, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, average carbonation, 
355 ml Bottle.
Bottle. Very pale gold colour quite tasteless however, dissapointing. A bit of lime helps the taste improve.
Pours yellow with a white head. Aroma is malt, DMS and light grass. Flavour is malt, DMS, grass and pine.
Clear golden coloured beer with almost no head and no carbonation. Herby spicy aroma. Full sparkling palate. Finish is rather dry sweet. Not good.
There’s cat piss then there’s corona. Filthy water with a dash of beer best describes it. Horrible to think its $50 a carton in australia

Someone left this at my house so I might as well rate it.  Pours a clear golden yellow color with absolutely no head.  Aroma is very faint, just a little sweet malt.  Taste is very sweet corn malt and nothing else.  Seems much sweeter than other macros I’ve had recently.  I guess that’s why people use the lime to counter the sweetness.  Very thin and watery.  Pretty much what I expected, I don’t think I’ll ever drink this again.  I’ve had worse but just barely.
Very light, clear yellow. No head. Smell not pleasant; sweet and hoppy.  Overly bitter and no other flavor.  A lot of carbonation.
Corona good on a hot day or just for something light. Nothing special just an average beer better with lime and another beer that should be only drank from bottle.

Una delle peggiori birre sul mercato.....errori di gioventù....
Giallo paglierino limpidissimo....naso assente (meglio così....)
bocca secca e acquosa......e amara......
Ni aprueba. Es una cerveza totalmente aguada, sin personalidad ni tan siquiera una presencia de espuma agradable. Aparenta una cerveza en mal estado...deplorable!
Clear golden colour, out of the bottle, malt, yeasty smell, sweet paper bitter taste, with a carbonate refreshing after taste, nice after a hot day
0.355l bottle. Golden body,white head. Light sweet grainy aroma. Tastes grainy with a hint of hoppyness. Adding a line wedge makes it better.
One of the better mainstream beers. Drink only when like Fosters and Heineken is around.

Bottle shared with McTapps. I am not sure if this one should be called a beer. Tasted like bittersweet water with a rice-aroma. Maybe number one in Mexico but not in my living room. Wouldn’t give that one to my worst enemy.
Bottle shared with MichaelBruch. Very light in aroma and taste, undelicious corn flavour.

33 cl. bottle @ home, bought @ Coop. Drank from the bottle. Pale yellow with a thin white head. Faint grassy aroma. Watered down pilsener taste. Lively carbonation. Quite refreshing but not a beer worth talking about.
Good head, white, mostly diminishing, fair lacing, malty bread aroma, clear light yellow, active carbonation, light crisp body
It’s a Corona. It’s cheap and pale and gold. It’s skunky and probably needs to go into a brown bottle. And now that I’ve checked it off the list, I don’t have to do it again.
Clear golden, looks very attractive on a hot day. And to be honest, it’s very drinkable on a hot day while having a barbeque as well. Child, refreshing, not very tasty, but thirst quenching.
110712. Can in an airplane over the pacific. Pours clear light golden with a medium head. Aroma butter, bread. Slight buttery taste. Low palate, medium carbonation. Bland overall.
A very lemony flavor and pretty sour. Very yellow in color with a very quickly fading white head.
Can from Meny. Pours pale straw coloured with a small creamy white head. Aroma is sweet malty, some lactose sugar. Taste is like carbonized water, thin and watery. No thanks.

473ml can. A pale straw body, medium white head, poor retention. Aroma of hay, grass, lime and leaves. Taste a little harsher than expected, grassy hops, malt, cereals, a decent light bitter aftertaste.

With the abv of a light beer this lager is a watered down version of a brew that would probably not get a second round.  We have all had a few of these and know what they are like.  Not a beer for mature tastbuds.
My grandpa’s favorite, but he thinks Jerry Springer is the best show on television. Always a bit farty and skunky. I don’t even drink this when choppin wood. Fucken hell.
I personally don’t like too many lagers but this one’s the best for me.  Chilled with a wedge of lime on a hot day, can’t beat it.

Drunk straight out of the bottle.

The clear bottle allowed me to see the clear pale yellowness of this beer. Nothing really impressive.

I could smell the overpowering skunk as soon as I popped the cap. It really smelled completely rotten and unappealing.

The taste was even worse. Like dirty skunky water. This was accompanied by a nasty tartness and odd bitterness that I was not expecting. I honestly could not finish the beer and had to pour it out.

Overall, this is probably the worst beer I have had and that is saying something. Don’t know if I got a bad bottle or what but I really don’t see how people drink this stuff. Horrid.

Avec une note moyenne au final, cette bière reste une de mes préférées. Bière de soif, agréable avec une tranche de citron vert, idéale en été. Goût quelconque, rien ne se dégage, extrêmement chère en France par rapport à des bières nettement plus complexes et meilleurs, mais voilà, Corona is Corona.
A decent summer beer if you put a slice of lime in.  Only good served extra cold.
Corona what a great beer for guacamole chips mexican food and summer fun. Gotta have it with a lime
Für mich das beste Bier auf der Welt. Es ist leicht und löscht den Durst. Ich denke die Frische kommt durch das Brauen mit Reis. Aber ganz klar ohne Zitrone im Hals ..

473ml can.  Pours a clear pale yellow with a white head.  It has much more of a nose than I was expecting.  Straw, faint apple juice, a tiny whiff of hops.  As for taste, I let it warm up a little so I could taste it in all of it’s glory.  What does glory taste like?  Well, a strange watery metallic tanginess, and not much else.  There’s a reason people drink this ice cold with a slice of lemon.

Esta cerveza tiene fama de mas. Es una de las peores cervezas que tome. Mas parecida a la soda que a la cerveza. No puedo creer que sea tan mala. Es extremadamente suave y por demás de gasificada. La verdad muy decepcionante.

Bottle at a Mexican restaurant, poured into chilled beer mug.  Color was clear golden, pretty much no head.  Aroma is sweetness, corn and grass.  Not much for taste (I skipped the standard lime).  It was cool though, washed down dinner.
This is a nice cheap summer day beer available at ease. I don’t prefer this beer but its good after a work out.
0,355l bottle. Soft and sweet aroma. Clear golden color. Good carbonation. Maybe, taste is boring, but Corona isn’t bad for the summertime.

35,5 cl can @ Delta Airlines. No BBE info, no ABV info. Rated on 11.07.2012

Aroma has pear esthers, sweet corn, hints of grain and honey. Flavour is sweetish and harsh with corn and some grain. Hay in the finish. Bulky, starchy and unpleasant. Feels flat.

12 oz long neck bottle into a tulip glass...for some odd reason. This bottle is a few months old, but its been stored in a fridge the entire time.

A - Super clear dark yellow body. Yields a small one finger white head. Settles down to some thin edging.

S - Super sweet corny malts. Not the worst smelling adjunct lager.

T - More of that sweet corny malt, followed by a light level of skunkiness. Mouth feel is light and bubbly. 

O - Despite its clear bottle its not the worst AAL on the market. Throw in a lime, chill it to near sub-arctic temperatures and its actually quite palatable.
Of the mass-produced pale lagers, it’s between this and Heineken for me. I can actually smell and taste (some) hops. Grassy, corn, watery. It’s not a sin to drink this on a really hot day.

Come on people, 1 out of 100 overall?  Let’s break this down for what it is.  No one drinks Corona in an effort to find high quality beer.  It’s a cheap beer that’s suitable for hot days and outdoor activities. No discernible aroma, pale yellow color.  Light and lively bubbled mouthfeel. Clear bottle that apparently invites light-induced skunkiness.  It has a decent macro taste and a certain salty flavor that goes well with lime.  I don’t mind the taste of this beer at all.

The only thing that really bothers me about Corona is the douchebag in their commercials - the guy who orders a Corona on an airplane and daydreams about a beach scene, then finds a likeminded girl who probably enjoys the company of a-holes.  You can just tell the guy is a jackass, and when I’m drinking a beer, I don’t like to think I’m supporting or living up to the image of such people.  Actually, the thought of that commercial campaign has made me decide, right now, to boycott their beer.

Corona tall boy bottle wist customary lime wedge on special at local tex mex food place. Ive had this with out the lime and its dreadful. This review is based on "with lime." pale piss yellow with no head. Nose is mix of corn, slight skunk, and lime. Taste follows in order. The corn is harsh on the edges but is muted by the lime. Light bodied. Blah.

Bottle from a closed 12pk box. Pours clear straw yellow with very small head. Aroma has some sweet grain, hay. Flavors have sweet grain, very light fruitiness, some peppery bitterness that lasts. Watery feel. Not light struck and not bad.

Good on a hot day. This beer is overwhelmingly unremarkable. Think water that gets you drunk. Still it came in handy on the 4th of July. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This beer is a watered down Budweiser.  I’ll never drink it again!  That is all I have to say about this swill, but the program is making me add this final sentence which has absolutely nothing to do with the beer, but they have a minimum letter count so I had to waste your time and mine by writing this additional sentence...sorry!

Pour a yellow color and that's about all you can say. No aroma and no taste but plent of fizz. Yum…not!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

One of the worst beers I’ve tasted, only beaten by Budweiser. Tastes like water and beer mixed together, and it don’t get any better with a bit of lime. I’ve heard from a brewer back home that the use so much chemicals in this beer that one batch only takes 7-8 days, in differrence to nearly 5 weeks with a pure natural process. That’s also a good argument not to drink this.
Just so bland. Needs lime wedge for sure to even make this remotely interesting. I guess this would be nice on the beach but there are so many better beers from mexico than this.
Bottle. Small head. Light yellow clear. Some citrus. Watery taste. Dry with a very short finish. Micheal Jacksons worst beer. Good in the summer heat or after to many drinks.
Absolute must to include lime for flavor.  Nice brew to chill out with at the pool our lake.
Great when its really hot out and the beer is ice cold.  That’s about all I have to say about that.
Biere mexicaine tres bonne, mais je crois toutefois que la sol qui est aussi une biere mexicaine pas en vente partout mais meilleur marche est vraiment meilleur.
pours a golden pale, aroma of bread, cereal, resin and herbs. lightly sour, lively carbination, astringent finish, light body.
Average aroma, appearance, taste and palate. Decent, somewhat memorable. Rated in the past from the bottle.
Imported Mexican beer that needs lime. Being that it’s Mexican beer it hit you like a bat outta hell.

Pale island lager. Not bad for day in sun at park or pool.  Drinkable. Clean and refreshing

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pale golden yellow, fizzy with a thick white head. Hardly any discernable aroma, there might have been a suggestion of hop, but only a suggestion! Initially fizzy mouthfeel, then cloying. The taste has a little more to offer than the aroma. A degree of citrus sourness, does add some refreshment to quite a bland flavour. The finish is short.
Bière jaune pâle. Saveurs et arômes plutôt délicats. Une bonne bière d’été à savourer avec un quartier de lime.
An average, very mild pilsener-like taste that eases your thirst, but not your tongue, it’s a little watered.
Red Social de birra... aca me voy al mazo... Ahora #Corona Extra para abrir la garganta, herbs
Best... Herbs, basement aromas, leather, coffee, grass, cough drop, ginger, good better best

Pours a nauseating strawberry blonde with almost no head. Light lacing. Very light flowery nose, with just a hint of bacon and cilantro. Thick crisp flavor, laced with a touch of strawberry and caramel. Chalky mouthfeel and long finish.
Very light, carbonated and almost watered down.  Usually served with a lime.  Refreshing to have somewhere like the beach.
Good beer to drink while at a beach. Not a beer I can drink all the time but when I do you better have enough limes.
Pours as it looks yellow with a white head. Aroma is skunks and slightly malty also adjuncts present.  Flavor is very mild and sort if sweet.  Body is light and finish is clean.  Needs lime
Enjoyably light and refreshing, especially on a hot day. Especially tasty with a lime, but not at all required to enjoy.

355ml can picked up at my local Prix store. Clear, straw coloured body covered by a loose white head quickly reduced to a tiny layer. Fragile lacing. Weak smell of sweet malts and hard water. Sweet malty water to the taste buds, rather tasteless, in fact. Lively carbonated. Metallic notes. Fizzy stuff that has got little to offer (shared with Frau Eva at dinner time in Tromsø, 10.06.2012).
Straight from the Bottle. Aroma is fairly funky but not terrible. Taste is fairly light with a little grain.
Pours clear yellow with a big white head. Dank aroma of malt and paper. Sweet malt flavor with nothing else going on and a thin finish.
33cl bottle. Straw coloured with a ring of white head and heavy carbonation; musty corn syrup aroma;  sweet cardboard flavour.  Best drunk cold and without analysis.
Pale yellow. No aroma. Tastes like colored water. Add lime for a little flavor, I suppose, but you can do that with water as well.

71 cL bottle from Tesco into a pint glass at home.  Tasted without lime, i.e. on its own merits.  Golden, fizzy, almost no head at all.  Unimpressive malty aroma, where are the hops?  Tastes ok, but very plain, wouldn’t want to drink it warm.  Remarkably little in the way of flavours.

I’ve had much worse, if that is any compliment to start with. Yelow, clear pale. Macro through and through, but balanced enough to taste alright in context. Crisper, more smoothly malty than macro Eastern Europe lagers. A change up from those at least.

Perhaps I’m being stingy with my rating, but this really isn’t very good. While many claim it goes great with Mexican food or the summer heat, there are better options including water. No smell evident and taste is very watery with a tinge of malt and corn. Palate is smooth and watery which might be redeeming in the summer versus a heavy stout.

Some head, no bubles, golden. Almost impossible to smell anything but than it is at least not unpleasant... Light body and urfortunately to much length. Taste is sour gunn powder in the unpleasant way. This is really bad.... I think I have to try with some lemon in the glass trying to hide the unpleasant flavopurs....

Poured clear with a pale golden colour with a foamy white head that faded very very quickly. No real aroma. Taste malty with a trace of bitterness. Light thin body. Watery. Finished light and smooth. No distinguishing flavours or aromas.

0,33l bottle form random supermarket, Budapest. Clear, paler than pale ale. It has a small, white head. Simple lager odor, a bit sour. The aroma is also like lagers’, but absolutely characterless and flat. Light, sour taste. Light body, slick texture, average carbonation. Neutral finish. Drink it abolutely cold, with a slice of lemon. That way it refreshes you on a hot day. I see no other way to drink. It’s hard to call this liquid "beer"...

Straight from the bottle. Crystal clear straw yellow. I can see why they use clear glass to show off such an impressive glowing hue... err...?

Wet hay, corn... you know the smell of something that had beer spilled on it the night before? Sort of smells like that.

You know the taste of something that had beer spilled on it the night before? No but seriously... taste is no bueno. This one is gonna be slug bait for the hastas. Hopefully the slugs aren’t as critical as I am.

I’d highly recommend this to nobody.

0,33l bottle from Interspar Budapest, pale yellow color, with medium head. Featureless lager aroma, its good to refreshing, but doesnt give you anything special. It has waterly taste, but its better than average hungarian lagers.

To be honest I have never had this beer without lemon. I’ll add a non-lemon rating again in the future to compare. It’s mainly water with a little malt flavour, the colour may bore some people but I think it’s fun in a uriny kind of way. There are different beers for different seasons and I’m not sure if I could down a doppelbock in 100 degrees on the beach.

One of those beers you have to have in the right setting and it is a 10/10- summer by the beach in 35-40+ heat, with fresh, hot, spicy food eg mexican, with a wedge of lime.  Other wise it is just another watery untasty, unsatisfying beer and if you have it in winter it just reminds you of those awesome summer days with a tasty mexican tortilla and that just makes you depressed.
Well, the only thing I like from Mexico is their fighters. This shit is awful, right there with MBL and Natural. If you need a lime with your beer you have issues.
There is no better beer to Mexican food. Ideally, when drinking from the bottle with a lime wedge on top. The taste has distinct elements of corn and a light hop flavor.

Wie erwartet ist es sehr wässrig und man schmeckt ansonsten nur Mais und etwas Hopfen. Im Nachgeschmack wird es etwas besser, doch immernoch ist es maisig-hopfig, die wässrigkeit lässt aber nach. Fazit: Och joa, is halt überhaupt nicht interessant aber trinkbar, weil Wasser+ Mais.
	
Test vom 5.10.2009, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 6,6,6,7,10,6 - 6,35
Pours a very pale yellow color. Smell is mild, a touch of corn. Taste is light, some corn and grains. Overall a very easy drinking beer, on the bland side,.
It’s nothing special. Clear golden look with no head. Look more than a cider than a beer. It’s crisp and clear but very watery.
very easy beer to drink. Very smooth no aftertaste... great with a lime or Grenadine...def a good one!! x2
A nice sweet pale lager enhanced with a fruity lime shoved in the bottle from the bartender.

Bottle (without lime) from the In House Bar in House of Fraser, Birmingham.  Pours headless, clear and loudly fizzy.  Very pale like watered down apple juice.  Mild, cardboard hops aroma which turns out to be its best feature.  Horrible mouthfeel - so very fizzy - and once the initial bubbles and accompanying stale hops taste have subsided there is simply nothing there.  No taste.  No point.  Now I know why lime is so often added - to provide a modicum of flavour.  Terrible, terrible beer.

Bottle at the local pub (who I won’t name as I don’t want to huirt the local economy).  Waitress gave me an odd look when I asked for no lime.  Yellow, lively carbonation, slight skunk in the aroma, and that was literally it.  No hops to speak of, just quick, cheap yellow water.  This was actually a step down from the Budweiser i had earlier.

Bottle. Pours a yellow body, with a low white head that didn’t stay longer than 10 seconds. Absolutely no lace. Mostly grainy aroma at the start, then it fades away. Absolutely no taste, it’s like water. Very thin body, very watery texture, I don’t like the carbonation level either. It can’t get any worse.

When ever I think of Mexico, I think of big hats, big moustaches, Bandits and crap beer.

You can blame Hollywood and the American film industry for the first three and Corona for the last stereotyping.

Yet here I am about to review the beer that gave Mexico a bad name. The first ’designer’ foreign beer that was advertised all over the place to hit Great Britain (I believe). This bottle was left at my house by someone who came to my daughters Birthday party, I would never have paid for it.

I poured the beer into one of my Duvel glasses, I wanted to give the beer a chance.

To be fair it looked like a Duvel except the head fell away very swiftly. A little lighter than a Duvel really, very pale and crystal clear too.

I give all lager/pilsners a score of 3 unless there is something bad or good about them. This is as odourless as most, but with a stale bread aroma hanging around.

Insipid and tasteless, nothing to report.

Fizzy water comes to mind when considering the mouthfeel.

Glad I didn’t buy this beer.

Pours, smells and tastes just how you’d expect from Corona...piss-stained fizz, clear, representing bland watery malt extract flavor and retired yeasts. Still, goes down smooth and at a party where this is the only thing to drink, there could indeed be worse.
Very refreshing yellow water like beer, close to Miller. Good drink when it’s hot outside.
En helt obegriplig klassiker i samma kategori som Tomas Ledin. Det vill säga; innehållslös, urvattnad och något som bara dyker upp när termometern masar sig över 20 plusgrader.
Very flat taste with suspect notes. Hence a lime should be included to increase sweetness it should have had in the first place and to dull the bad taste
Bottle. Pale and bland. A good lawnmower beer. It’s like having sex in a canoe- f****** close too water.

12oz bottle poured into a shaker. Pours a clear pale gold with minimal white head. Aroma of straw and light citrus. Taste is light bitter. Straw. Light bodied with a thin texture. Fizzy carbonation and not much of a finish. Overall, its crap vut ive had worse.
Easily my favorite beer in the world on a hot day. lots of lime and ice cold. good when outside and swimming.

If you like something that looks like a beer but tastes like a kind of soft drink.. .Then this is your drink! Ok, apart from that.... It lacks of body, aroma, head, character... Still, it’s very soft, no bad alcohol taste and very refreshing in a warm summer day. That’s why I’m giving it a 2.
Bottle at bar. Golden color, white head. Smooth taste with corn and some malts. It's a good refreshment, but not much of a beer.
Good overall mexican mass produced beer. Put a lime in it and drink it on a hot summer day.
It’s refreshing. And it’s good out of a can. Preferably with a lime. Moving on...
Bottle: much better out of a can, yellow water.  It needs the lime stuffed down the neck to give tithe slightest bit of interest.  Boring beer, but if it’s hot, you won’t see me turn it down.

Bottle. Pours clear yellow/gold with a trace of thin, fizzy white head. Aroma doesn’t have much there; faint straw malt and citrus. Flavor is extremely watered down malt without much else there. Light body, medium carbonation, and low warmth.

Happy Cinco de Mayo bitches here is the special of the day.  Loads of watery yet quite refreshing Mexican beer!  If you haven’t had a corona you haven’t experienced the entire beer spectrum.  Here’s the bottom of the spectrum.

Bottle. Pours yellow and clear with a fizzy white head that dissipates quickly. Aroma of hay and grain, with a chemical note. Unpleasant flavor with malt in the foreground and some aftertaste. No wonder it is served ice cold with a lemon... Rerated in Mexico, where it was surprisingly better.
From bottle so hard to tell color and foam. Lime added, that is what I tasted - watery beer with lime. Probably good for thurst. (Galveston 201205)

330ml bottle pours a pale straw color with a small white head that leaves no lacing.  Aroma is corn and grass and light citrus when served with a lemon or lime wedge.  Taste is sweet corn with a light grassy hop bitterness and again some citrus when served with a wedge of lemon or lime.  Typical macro lager swill that is not worth drinking unless it is very hot outside, as this goes down like water.
12oz bottle pretty much flavorless and bland. yellow color and thats about it...how it can be drank is beyond me.

330ml bottle. Golden color. Very small head, disappears quickly. Corn all over the aroma. Sweet body, corn, oily. Thing is if I try it with lime, all I can taste is lime. Without lime it tastes weird sugarish liquid. Complex.

Originally reviewed: 5/30/08. This is the epitome of Mexican beers, yet to get anything out of it, fruit needs to be added. I never understood that. My friends all say it tastes like a Mexican meal in a drink form. I wouldn’t go that far. Pours very pale yellow, virtually no head. Smells corny, some malt, slight hop. Pretty easy to drink, which is dangerous, cuz it’s not that good. Best served cold. Would pass on this for more flavorful beer for sure.

Bottle. I have tried it with and without a lime. I learned that you need the lime to help cover the skunkiness.
I was in the Yucatan Peninsula and a local asked our group if anyone had had Mexican beer. Someone replied "Yeah, Corona." The local replied, "Maybe you don’t understand my English. Has anyone had Mexican BEER."  I laughed.

Let me start off by stating that "Cerveza" is piss. (not literally, but it might as well be) No wonder you need the lime wedge. Clear bottle!? Skunk city if it’s not stored in a dark place. Looks like someone’s drug test sample. Taste is barely passable with mexican food IF you use the lime, otherwise, if you must drink mexican beer with mexican food, try a Dos Equis - but stay away from the one that has glass chips in it (dark variety?)

355ml clear glass bottle (Texas Honkytonk, Tallinn)

I hate clear glass bottles. The beer looks like a urine sample. Started without the lime. There’s bugger all aroma, just a vague pale lager sweet corniness. Thi fizzy palate, very watery. Mega bland taste, this is classic canoe sex. Add the lime, and it tastes limeyer. Worse than that, it makes it taste sour in an off way. Dropping the overall by one because of that, it’s heading towards nasty. Fairly clean, definitely uncontaminated by taste.

From the can poured a very pale yellow brew with a white head that didn’t last long. Aromas and flavors were well balanced but barely detectable. Very light bodied. This beer taste really good when it’s really cold.
330 ml bottle. Light yellow pour with little head. Skunky to the nose. Not much flavor like any mass produced and marketed beverage. Thirst quencher when really cold and one has run out of beer.
Pours piss yellow. Smell of skunk really hits you in the nose. Taste is similar. Lime makes it bearable.

355ml clear glassed bottle from Mexico (it is also brewed under licence in Australia by CUB). Bright yellow pour with a negligible white head. Not much on the nose or palate (faint sweet grainy malts with cardboard notes and barely any hop presence). Light watery mouthfeel. An utterly innocuous pale lager that can only be so popular for reasons of style over substance.

355 ml bottle. Pours clear yellowish golden with minimal white head that disappears quickly. A really skunky aroma with some malt, corn and plastic. A really horrible taste of malt, corn and cigarrette. Watery mouthfeel and stingy carbonation. Hayish aftertaste. Not refreshing, Bad price vs. quality.
La bière typique de masse, sans saveur, sans arôme, sans bouche. Pas imbuvable, mais rien d’interessant

Brief write up. This stuff is total ass. Imagine a Miller High Life overloaded with sulfur and skunky notes - that’s exactly what Corona is. How is something so flavorless and offensive tasting at the same time? All in all, this is terrible mass produced swill that does nothing right. I CAN drink it if I stick about 3-4 lime wedges to take the edge off of the rancid notes, but no beer should require the addition of fruit to make it palatable. Even still, stay far away.
Pale yellow clear body with white head. Aromas sweet malts, grains. Palate thin with medium carbonation and mouth feel. Aftertaste paper and medium short hops finish. Bulk stuff.

Garbage water. Keep it in Mexico. This is a disgrace to beer drinkers the world over. I think bottling my piss and labeling as corona would sell just as well. A lime eh? Which is it...to keep the flies away or mask the taste of piss?
Bottle into a Lager glass. Pours a yellow no head. Taste is water plus the lime. Finish is weak.
I really don’t mind this beer that much. It’s easy drinking, and refreshing if served cold.

Ok, so not the worst beer, or even Mexico’s worst.  12oz bottle.  I typically don’t like fruit in my beer, but a lime goes a long way with this one.  No salt, though.  Aroma is OK, pours bright yellow with small head.  Crisp, clean taste, but mouthfeel is lacking.  I’d drink it on vacation.  It’s a decent, albeit uninteresting beer.

Drinking this brings back happy memories of my honeymoon in Cancun.     Always add a lime, don't expect too much, stay away from the unemployment line.
. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Quite clear.  Smells like cheap fermented corn.  Tastes like It smells.  Without the lime there is nothing to this.
This is not a good beer by any means. But if you are on a beach, thirsty and looking for something cold to drink, this is not bad with a lime.
From bottle. Pours piss yellow with short lasting head. Yeasty lager aroma, not much else. Similar taste, bready yeast, not much else. Sweetish with a lingering finish. Doesn’t have much going for it
This lager is best served with a lime to provide some much needed flavor. It pours light brown with little head and has a light smell. The flavor is light but doesn’t linger.
I find this lager to be more satisfying than all of the other mass marketed lagers. I prefer it to Miller Lite and Bud Light.
Pours light yellow color. It’s like drinking a hopped up water. Hold your nose and drink ice cold.
Average mexican beer, byt very promoted. There is a lot more better party beers around.

Light straw color; Light body; Aroma of cereal, & grain; Flavor of slight bitter hops, grain/corn, and some malt; Fairly light and bland; Overall, not as terrible as some say - decent for hot summer days; Use the lime when you get a skunked bottled.
Not much to write here. Just use a lime and drink it cold and fast. Otherwise you’ll get sick!

aroam, weak watery pils malt aroam, color, nice color at least golden hue, foamy whitew head, taste, I put a lime in it, yes!, added fruity sourness to brew, to make up for hardly any hops at all, overall, its easy on the palate summer beer.

330ml bottle.  Served super cold with a wedge of lime.  Has a dull, citrus like refreshing flavour and no after taste.  Carbonation is actually fairly limited.  The mouth feel is thin and watery but this is the type of beer you just knock back and move on to the next one.  Overall not too bad for a macro beer and enjoyable on a hot day
There is little to no aroma as this beer is nothing but light, light, light.  Only good for hot days and then you let the lime do all the flavor work.

Brown 32 oz quart bottle,absolute zero skunk with a gentle carbonation lasting to the last drop.With murricas new DWI laws these Corona bombers have become a quite popular hipster brew.Hammering a cold one with many test subjects of different weights yieilded a BAC of never over .07 with 15 different brands of BAC meters.A great after work brew to tame the urban jungle commute home without fear of a costly DWI.Election years always result in stepped-up revenue enforcement.Thanks for caring and finally importing these Mexico.

Bottle @ Red Lobster, Northfield. Pours light yellow, no head. Aroma of sweet malt, lemon. Taste is weak malt, grain, lemon. Thin body, low carbonation. Served cold, had to ask for a glass and was then served a frosted one..... Not bad tasting, just weak and watery. 220212
Pours crystal clear and light gold with white head..  Zesty and citrus aroma.  Taste is lightly sweet.

Bottle 33ml. Straight forward light beer. Nothing special at all during winter. Citrus, lime etc.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 oz. bottle with a lime...pours that clear yellow hue with the frothy white head...aroma is corn, grain, not much else...taste isn’t as bad as you would think, the lime makes it more drinkable (don’t care if that makes the beer less manly)...not as bad as people make it out to be, but also nothing to write home about.
From bottle. Is a pale yellow with minimal carbonation. Not much to the smell. Easy to drink but has a watered down taste. Nothing special.

Bottle. Without lime, just the beer, I found a piss colored appearance with little to no aroma, and I’m not talking about a deep yellow piss color, I mean a very hydrated, almost clear, yellow tinted piss. The taste was as if you took a pilsner, mixed it with a cup a water, and tossed it back into a bottle. Shutting out all sound and vision, just me and his piss beer, I could pick up on a faint pilsner hop taste. Otherwise, near nothing. After shoving a couple lime wedges into the bottle, inserting my finger, and turning the sucker upside down (a custom I learned from Corona enthusiasts), I was able to convert this "beer" into carbonated lime juice. Overall, this beer demonstrates the power of advertising. Feel like you’re on vacation, on a beach, with a hot girl, with your feet kicked up! Drink this piss, and the only thing you’ll be on vacation from is beer.
Pale yellow clear body with white head. Aromas sweet malts, grains. Palate thin with medium carbonation and mouth feel. Aftertaste paper and medium short hops finish. Bulk stuff.

well, the most redeeming feature of this is the obligatory piece of lime that bar tenders insist on shoving in the top!
no aroma, no body, very little taste.

Pale golden colour, thin white head. Smell of sweet malts, toast and biscuit. Flavour rather sweet, quite thin. Not too bad on a hot summer night with a wedge of lime in the neck. Stil.. Meh.

(From 33cL bottle @ home)

Bottle labled as Corona Familiar. 
The brown bottle does little to help the skunky aroma and flavor.  It cracks me up that in Mexico they think this is piss but dbags all over America think it’s delicious.  Yuck.
toast, cereal, barnyard, dough, citrus, pale, clear, minimal head, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, average carbonation,

I have a love and hate relationship with this "beer", or drink rather. With a piece of lime this is a nice drink when you don’t feel like starting with a more typical beer, or too hot for many of the stronger more flavorful ales.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Coronita is the name in Spain. Basic, and you know what you drink, the perfect one to start drinking beer

amber/yellow colour with white froth. aroma is quite weak (served freezing cold). taste is slightly citrus, sweet, very carbonated. quite refreshing, and probably benefits from a lime, but average at best.

Obviously this isn’t a "real" beer. But... Some times I do enjoy it. Last night it was either Corona, Miller Lite, or a couple generic crappy beers that I would simply rather go dry than drink. Yes, I put a lime in it, because it helps. I actually enjoy the skunk on it. It’s like the retarded Mexican cousin to Grolsh. And it was free, so I won’t complain.

It has a nice little fizz on the palate, and is refreshing if you’re just looking for a hop soda. But you can certainly find better beers for the price.

This is no special beer in itself. However, when adding a lime to this beer it becomes a refreshing beverage that reminds me of better times sitting on the beach and enjoying vacation in the islands where top quality beer is not available and the weather is too hot for many of the stronger more flavorful ales anyhow.
Pours pale yellow colour no lime added taste  like skunky water with lime tastes like skunky water with lime.

32oz bottle (Familiar) - Pours yellow with white head and thin lacing.  Nose is faintly malty with faint citrus hops.  Flavor adds grass.  medium-light bitter.  Thin texture and refreshing.  

Bottle - pours pale yellow with quickly diminishing head.  Aroma is pilsner hops and wet bread. Light sweet and a bit more hoppy.  Light all around. Metallic nose. Refreshing and easy to mass consume. 4/1/5/3/8  1/21/2012
Ahh. Corona. I drink you at the casino when your free. With a lime.. otherwise. Cheap lager with skunk flavor. Mexico in a bottle. Its 3am an its all thats left..

When 2pac wrote "too fucken expensive for what it is. PISS" He called into question both the quality and the value of this beer.  By his comments I suspect that 2pac holds some concern regarding the wives tale of brewers peeing into this beer as a sign of disrespect for it’s primarily export market.  

Now the bottle of Corona extra I purchased was one of these 32oz Corona Familiar bottles. They don’t come cheap, but they also don’t come skunked, so I imagine that while I feel 2pac’s pain at the cash register I still trust that the product I’m sampling will be one of finer quality given it’s storage receptacle. 



The beer pours a pale golden color with a well retained medium white head. 



The aroma is corny with some light green apple & some light herbal character. It doesn’t sound like much but it doesn’t smell particularly offensive. 



The flavor is crisp and clean but also corny, but not in a sweet corn kind of way, more in a white tortilla chip kind of way. The beer is tad on the sweet side but there is a herbal zippyness from the hops that I’ve never noticed in this beer in previous samplings.

the most overrated beer around the world, it taste like...
it is funny to watch non educated people drinking this beer and thinking that they are so cool, because they have one....it can only be useful if you mix it with tequila, salt, and a little bit of chili

This beer honestly sucks. It is a "yuppy heaven" beer. It is undrinkable unless you cut a lime up and stuff it into the bottle and then it still sucks but it tastes like skunky lime juice. I have never figured out the fascination with Corona. It smells and tastes like skunk piss. But apparently it looks cool to set around the bar with a lime slice stuffed into the bottle because I see it all the time. But, they sell billions of dollars worth of this swill every year to 21 year old college kids and dorks that sit around a bar or on the beach tying to look cool ....so what do I know. $$ signs are what matters in this world.
12 oz bottle pours golden with a white head.  Add the lime and this is a good summer beer.  It has very little appeal though.

Clear bottle, ice cold. Not skunked. Flavor is lightly hoppy corn and mineral water. It took me forever to finally try this one and I can say it is no worse than any other light beer, especially if you had it form a brown bottle or can or something.
Pas envie de faire une grosse critique; ça goute pas grand chose, c’est doux en bouche mais ça n’a aucune autre qualité.  Si c’est la seule chose disponible, je prend du jus ou même de l’eau.

0.33 bottle. Very soft aroma of lemon and some hops. Clear, golden liquid topped with a diminutive white head disappearing almost instantly. Nearly tasteless, only some sourness and sweetness can be noticed but both quite elusive. Light body, thin texture, average carbonation and short disappointing finish, nothing to elaborate on. Although it is not a good beer, it falls quite well in infamous, commercial pale lager category.

why did i wait so long to try this i know why it sucked. A clear pale yellow colour with a small white head. A tone of hay and grass in the aroma. The taste is light sweet. A light body, watery texture, average carbonation and an abrupt finish.
Bottle. Very poor. Yellow. Fizzy. Purely to be used as a hot day thirst quencher.
With a FRESH piece of lime shoved down the neck (of the bottle) this beer is OK to drink in hot weather.
An okay pale lager. I like it in summer when it’s hot. There’s not much to say about it, but it’s refreshing.
Bottle. Light yellow with very weak head. Weak aroma, the taste quite the same.
Straw golden color with small head. Citrus/straw aroma. Thin boddy and taste. can only go on a very hot summer day or beer number 28 at a festival in the province.

355mL bottle poured into a 250mL leffe glass, juice of a slice of lemon [didn’t have any lime]. Thin body, with a very slim, with a detergent like, soapy head that dissipates rapidly. Sunrise yellow golden body.  Aroma was citrusy, delicately soapy. Thin, soft carbonation, the taste was sharp, a nice mix of lemon and this brew together. Mild lingering finish. Very refreshing

Originally rated November 2005. After starting with Corona Light... I now go into the real McCoy, the Corona Extra. I don’t think this one had many reviews either, so here goes. Pours a pale yellow colour, but not as pale as the light version. Same white, very small, foamy head though. Did not smell any skunk this time. Oh no, the Light one has more taste than this one as this one has hardly any malt in the finish. Plain water. At least grain malt is found in the nose. Not much else. You really need some citrus in here to give some small flavour. Even for refreshment, this one is overrated.
Realized going through country ratings that I haven’t ever logged a rating for this! What can be said about Corona? Skunky, sticky, sweet, and watery. We’ve all drank more than our fair share of it.
Certo che se proprio devo bere qualcosa che viene dal paese del sombrero secondo voi opterei per sta roba??

330ml clear bottle with a lemon wedge at a Guatemalan restaurant. Little smell apart from the lemon wedge, a little faint corn syrup and straw, maybe. Straw yellow colour, lots of carbo around the lemon. Not much flavour apart from my citrus slice, some sweet malt and vaguely bitter straw/grass on the finish. Body was thin, but not too thin for the style and there was lots of carbonation, but not enough to cause bloat. Overall, decent Mexican water. Have it with spicy food because you know it is safe to drink.

Bottle.  Pours a bright yellow with a medium-sized white head.  Aroma and flavor are grainy, light, virtually hopless.  Light mouthfeel.  A bit more taste than others of its ilk, but the bar is set pretty low.
bottle from el corte ingles, lisbon. Golden color. Corn/cereal aroma. Medium carbonation. Overall drinkable, but not that much!
Pale yellow pour with a white head. Aroma is cereal grains a is the taste. It is a little sweet, a little creamy and has mild carbonation. Easy to drink. Nice lacing.

To celebrate my 500th rating, I’ve chosen the bottle I have the lowest expectations for. 
Clear golden color, white head starts good but disappears in ten seconds.
Smells lightly of malt andd alcohol, taste of sugar and corn. 
As bad as I remembered it, or worse, cause I’ve had some very nice beers since the last time I had a corona.

Bottle. Golden with foamy head. Very light aroma-maybe a little perfume and a little citrus.  Light malty flavor with a slight sour note. High carbonation.
Earlier Rating: 7/26/2011 Total Score: 1.8
Not my thing. Light, light, light, lively and clean. Could be called refreshing. Kind of like pop.

I suppose this is Mexico’s equivalent to Budweiser. I actually don’t mind this beer. Slight citrus aromas. And a fresh, grassy taste on the palate. I don’t mind 2 or 10 of these on a hot summer day with a slice of lime. Easy drinking - thirst quenching.
hairdressers beer after work to compare styles with a slice of lemon no thanks
Bottle left over after a party. Lemony aroma, pale gold, clear. Not much flavour, but not actively offensive: improved by the addition of a segment of lime, but that shouldn’t be necessary should it?
Refreshing, thats all it has, its a malt soda, it´s slightly bitter. Very ligh body, very low hop level, very low malt level
It’s ideal in a very hot summer. But don’t forget to add a slice of lemon or lime! Very easy to drink, especially when you are thirsty!

Brown bottle pours very pale yellow, a finger of white. Minimal smell, some sweetness. Taste is light and thin but not bad. Light malty lager that finishes with a musty pilsner malt. Ok overall, much better than extra out of a clear bottle, still is enhanced by a squeeze of lime.

12oz bottle.  Like everyone says add a lime or else don’t even think of drinking it.  This gets 1’s across the board if not for the lime.  No flavor at all otherwise and is only good when it is balls-ass hot out with no other option.  Light and dull.
Add a lime and enjoy!  Don’t add a lime and vomit...just a warning...better than no beer at all I guess.

Along with Heineken this is the most overrated beer of all time.  No flavor at all unless you add the lime, but all the calories of an actual beer (unlike Bud Light, for example).  Corona isn’t for people who like to drink, it’s for people who like to pee.
olor ausente y sabor ausente,con un poco de limon es refrescante buena para veranos calientes
You add lemon to this beer simply because with out it there is no flavour..

Ingenting för det speciella tillfället. Helt ok kvantitetsöl som gör sig bäst på en varm sommarkväll. Ganska smak- och fantasilös. Ett substitut till vatten!
Dracks till en ungslagad lax och ris, funkade helt ok.

#1154
Stylishe Massenplörre in Klarsichtflasche mit ner Scheibe Zitrone drauf damit die Plörre wenigstens etwas fruchtig schmeckt. Das Ganze im Szene-Lokal für 5 € die Pulle... Dafür bekommt man ein allenfalls bierähnliches Getränk. Dann lieber gleich ne Limo!

Mine is labeled as Corona Familiar and is in a brown bottle.  Is this really the same as the skunked out Corona Extra in a clear bottle that I’m used to?  Whatever it is, it seems slightly better than Corona Extra - but perhaps it’s my imagination.

Poured from a 24-oz. bottle into a pint glass. Color was pale yellow and clear. Lots of bubbles. About ½-inch of head, that dissipated in a world record. Hardly any lacing on the top. No film on the sides.

Smelled of cereal corn malts initially, followed by a citrus ending. Seemed to be lime or lemon.

Tasted of cereal corn malts up front, followed by a bit skunky finish. Hardly any aftertaste. 

Light body. Think texture. Soft (very little carbonation). Abrupt finish. Clean, crisp and refreshing.

A pretty average beer. Considering that I’ve been rating good beer for about three months, I thought this would have been lower, but really not that bad.
Tastes like corn or rice or something it shouldn’t. Does have a bit more bitterness maybe than Coors Light, but isn’t better.
Skunked beer due to clear glass bottle. Taste is almost non-existant, and what is there is very muted. Won’t be having this again.
Bottle 33cl. Directly drank from the bottle. Colour pale yellow. Both, aroma and taste moderate malted. Light beer with lively carbonation.
Very little aroma or taste. The flavor that existed was a hint of lime with a metallic tinge.

Great taste with great aroma.

Dont forget the lemon...its all the about the lemon

oh yeah

Drank directly from the bottle, what else? Straw color, medium white head, you know the drill. Fizzy, lots of adjunct aroma, no apparent hops, crisp lager finish. Here’s one where the fresh lime wedge actually does improve the taste. A classic ice-cold party beer because it goes down easy, but man, there are so many better beers available at the price point.
UPDATE: I drank the large brown glass bottled "Familiar" version, and it made a big difference. It was still a fairly typical pale lager, of course, but with a nice subdued creamy, almost buttery mouthfeel. It clearly contained corn, but wasn’t mushy, stinky and gross like some adjunct beers. To me, this is proof that clear glass bottles are as bad as you’ve heard (especially for such a light and delicate style of beer with no strong flavors to hide minor defects.)

Ported from BA.

Appearance:
1 1/2 fingers of head, which were gone when I came back from fetching some pretzels. Light light yellow and very clear. Not unpleasant exactly, but far from my norm.

Smell:
Malty, I guess? Very light hops scent barely dribbling out of the glass. It basically doesn’t smell like anything.

Taste:
Bitterness, very slight, in the front. Really weird flavor here. Kind of like a sharp maltiness. It actually has a certain amount of citrus sweetness, which would be good for warm weather.

Mouthfeel:
None to speak of. Light carbonation.

Overall:
Not my top adjunct lager, which still gets to be PBR. It isn’t very smooth compared to most others, but it does have some hop citrus, letting me know why it’s popular as a summer beer.
thin, watery, bitter, bready, citrus, straw, yellow, clear, white head, great on a beach, but that’s about it.
I’m not a fruit the beer guy, but in this case adding a touch of lime does help this beer. Skunky, watery, limey. On a scorching hot day on the beach from time to time it is tolerable....
the marketing department wins on this one, best ads on tv. first if you have to add fruit to any beer something is wrong
In honor of 2Pac: too fucken expensive for what it is. PISS ...Golden clear, thin white head. Some grain on the nose. Thin mouthfell, better with a lime and a Cancun sun.

Bottle at home (not enjoyed)

Very pale, thin head that rapid disappears. Smells very weakly of grain and caramel. Taste is nothing, no finish either. Thin palate. This is even worse than bmc. I can see why the put lime in the bottle - it’s to add some flavor! To the good side, there is no off flavors either
Bottle.  Pours a golden yellow.  Good with a lime when doing work outside.  Without lime it is a little too sweet.
Bottle 330 ml. Corona is only found in clear bottles, something that makes the beer look pretty in the store. And please, don’t mix this great beer with salt or a lime. It just doesn’t need it!
(32oz brown bottle) clear pale yellow, fine white bubbles. Nose of skunk, raw grain. Taste of earth, grainy, a bit skunky. Not terrible like the clear bottled version, but not good either.
Overall, this is a beer that I would drink if there was no other beer available.  The taste is alright, nothing spectacular.  The aftertaste isn’t harsh either.

Possibly one of the worst beers I’ve ever tasted, the only thing good about them is their advertising , which is probably the only thing that keeps them in business. A very thin, strangely yellow beer with a weak head. In addition to being more expensive than other bottom tier beers it has a nose and flavor that can only be describes as ’urinesque’.

Serving glass: Poured from can into clear plastic cup (on the plane to Maui).

Appearance: Pale yellow with stark white head and, surprisingly, some lacing.

Aroma: Very sweet smelling. Actually smells like a Pilsner (apple, grains, spicy hops) but a little too sweet.

Taste: Tastes like a very light, but sweet, Pilsner, with apple, grainy malts and a light pepper finish. Can’t really taste the adjuncts but maybe the sweetness is the giveaway.

Palate: High carbonation, very light body but is actually somewhat smooth.

Overall: Easy to drink and, unlike most adjunct lagers, can actually taste the Pilsner roots. I hadn’t had this in years and expected to hate it. I was pleasantly surprised and prefer this over most macros. Maybe it helped that it was from a can instead of the clear bottles I had in the past.
This mexican beer is easy to drink without much to distiguish it. Great with a lime

Actually not that horrible and not nearly as bland as the two american giants MGD and Bud. This one has a very light touch of hops and citrus in the aroma and actually a bit of bitterness in the taste, although it’s the sweets that dominate. Drunk with a lime wedge, this is definitely not undrinkable and it does have a bit of character.
Drank from a bottle. Straw golden in color, some skunk in the aroma. Bland taste with a little bit of citrus on the finish. Easy enough to drink.
1/5 i mörkhet. Luktar lätt maltigt. Väldigt vattning och lite besk i smaken med en lätt besk eftersmak.

Botella de 330ml.Saboreada, directamente de la botella,muchas veces en muchos países desde 1981.Amarillo pajizo pálido y claro.Transparente.Corona escasa,sin retención,espuma blanca.Aromas de granos y lígero malteado.Sabor y paladar sosos.Amargor lígero,cuerpo lígero y acuoso.Comentario:Por tanto haz lo que debes: introduce un par de rodajas de lima o limón en la botella y asegurate que se encuentra a baja temperatura en un dia soleado y caluroso...entonces será facilmente asimilable.No obstante evita comidas picantes o la excesiva carbonatación te dará problemas.Palabra.330ml bottle.Enjoyed directly from the bottle many times in many countries since 1981.
Pale light straw yellow.Cristal clear.Poor crown,no retention,white foam.Grainy slightly malty aromas.Tasting & mouthfeel are bland.Light bitterness,light body,watery.Notes: So do what you have to do:put a couple of lime or lemon wedges into the bottle & make sure it is at a low temperature in a hot sunny day...then could be easy drinkable.Nevertheless,avoid hot meals or over carbonation is gonna bother you.I promise.

Corona was invented to keep the Mexican water supply stable and supplement its citizens with a watered down product that is actually boiled over. It’s drinkable yes, but if I were in Corona commercial I’d drop the beer and drink the salt water in front of me. Atleast it has flavor. No need to go in to the full details of drinking this unsatisfying brew, the only people reading these ratings are the ones filling in the gaps to drink real beer.
Corona.  Water tastes a little better but unfortunately In Mexico you can’t drink the tap water.  No idea why so many people think this is - you can put a lime in anything.  330ml bottle in Canmore

Bottle 355 ml. A clear pale yellow colour with a small white head. A tone of hay and grass in the aroma. The taste is light sweet. A light body, watery texture, average carbonation and an abrupt finish.

0,33 l. bottle at a hotelbar in Stockholm. Clear light yellow colour, weak white head, that faded very fast. Very light, sweet aroma. Not much taste, just a little sweetness from the malts. Thin body, lively carbonation. No real finish. No taste besides the slice of lemon. Good for a hot summers day, but thats it.

Had this bottle on a sunny day and it was quite refreshing. Didn’t go for the recommended lemon or lime. Pours a blonde colour with a thin white head. Citrusy aroma with yeast, barley and caramel. Citrusy lime flavour with some barley and a caramel linger. Foamy mouth-feel. There is a place for this beer, the beach!

Bottle. Pours light golden, with a light head. Aroma is surprisingly good, in that it’s not bad at all. Notes of corn, hay, spices and some hops. The taste is somewhat worse. A slight touch of herbs and hops, but with a metallic bitter corn flavour predominating through the finish.

05-AUG-2011, bottle @Johan. Served correctly with lime in bottle neck.
Pale yellow with lively quickly dying white head. Not much on the nose.
Corn, hay, and citrus. A little sweet, big bubbles carbonation, watery. OK refreshing. At least it seems clean and fresh.
Bottle. Pale gold with no head. Fairly bland, waterty malt aroma and flavour. Palate is dry sour bitter

From quart bottle (remember those?) purchased from CJ’s Beers and Fine Wines in Addison, Texas (suburban Dallas) on July 26, 2011.  Clear golden color, small white head that mostly disappeared with some lacing, sweet/sour aroma, watery taste with bitter finish.  I mainly bought this thinking Mrs. Drjohnrock would like it, and it was labeled "Corona Familiar".  As it turns out, this is just an alias of same old Corona.  Beware:  familiarity can breed contempt.

Bottle (330ml): 

Mainly corn and grain with water and an all round weakness to it.


Golden straw colour with a tiny white head that disappears fast.


Hardly any taste. Mainly adjuncts like grain & corn with faint lemon at the end.


Light bodied with tonnes of carbonation & an overall gas like feel to the beer, pretty watery overall though.


If you have to drink it then make sure it is cold, straight from the bottle & add a wedge of lime if possible.



My 1001 Beers Blog:
It’s lots and lots of skunk and grain and nothing else. I see why people like putting lime in them, it removes a little of that skunkiness.

As a newly converted beer geek I take my hobby very seriously, far too seriously according to my wife: the beer must have the right serving temperature, I only use proper glasses cleaned with potassium carbonate, I use a rating form and take plenty of notes. The Corona on the other hand was treated as the unpretentious summer beer it is: outside, in the sun, with a freezing cold bottle in the hand (I skipped the compulsory lime wedge, though). The traces of malty aroma that I can detect is actually not that bad, I don’t get much bad stuff, except for some faint hints of vegetables. Medium sweet taste, hardly any bitterness, mild malty flavours. Guess I’ll go for the lime wedge the next time. A boring beer, but not very bad. And the name, the bottle and the lime all shouts "SUMMERTIME!".

[33 cl bottle, courtesy of my mother in law]
I don’t believe this beer is as bad as most scores say it is. At least to me it wasn’t. Just a fresh pale lager as so many are. Good on a hot day.
I could drink it and not want to puke, which is better than I expected (last time I had one 20 years ago, I did want to puke)

This one has enough water in it to hydrate you after a marathon. Not sure I could bring myself to call it an actual beer, to be honest. Thankfully, it gets all the commercial attention, distracting others from the true treasures of the beer world.
Sweetish grainyness, watery as expected. Nothing to it other than that. Not the worst pale lager I’ve tried.

Pours yellow with a soapy diminishing white head. Aroma is of grain and a slight skunkiness. The taste is watered down and tastes just like it smells. Overall not good beer, yet very refreshing for the beach or a summers day.
Bottle. Tastes like nothing, which is why you always drink it with a lime...to add some flavour to this flat watery beer.
Mild and decent. (This beer rating was imported from FB and unfortunately lacks any further comments.)

Its Corona. Pale, thin, watery, almost flavourless. Needs lime/lemon to make it taste better because it is pretty much watered down by cheating mexicans to rip off drinkers. I swear is only popular due the the hipster-trendy gimmick of the lime/lemon wedge. 

Why the hell do people pay AU$75 a carton for this? You even have to provide your own citrus slices on top of that price.

Beer RAAAAAAAAAAAAGE.

1% rating is too high for this, and the 12% style rating... sigh.

FUUUUUUUUUU.......
Clear yellow with a white head.  Corn aroma.  Taste is corn with a sour note and no hops as all.

After a long hot day at work in the south of Texas nothing says day over much like sitting at a Mexican restaurant with one of these in front of you with a lime on the top, although its not one of the best Mexican beers out their it hits the spot.

This beer has a very light taste and just begs for some citrus in it. Doesn’t develop at all in the mouth and tends to be very boring after one bottle. Anyway the light taste does make it ideal for drinking at the beach in the sun.
very nice bottle, good taste with and without the lime the best mexican beer

Bottle- Pours a golden yellow with a nice head and no lacing. Has a musty smell with some grain sweetness. Not a lot of flavor just a bit of sticky sweetness. Light body, without the fruit, it has a some rough edges. This is what is seems, a light beer for lounging at the beach, with a bit of fruit to temper the rough edges. It must be good because this is what cool people drink.
Bottle from K-Supermarket Kamppi. Originally rated on 1.7.2009. Ugh, horrible lager, one of the worst I’ve tried.
It poured a clear, light golden color with a tiny white head. The aroma was grain and a bit of malt. The taste was sweet heading to lightly bitter.
It’s smooth and okay, with a slice of lime. But since i’ve had dunkels and doppelbocks, this kind of beer just doesn’t stand-up.

Appearance - I hate being vulgar or not professional in my reviews, but what can I say? It really has a pale, urine-like appearance to it. 

Smell - I have said it once and I will continue to say it no matter how many people disagree with me. This beer literally smells like burning marijuana. My brothers are the ones that buy this beer all the time and they keep it in the garage. I will walk into the garage and can immediately tell if this beer is present because it smells like marijuana. 

Taste - it reminds me of drinking spoiled beer. The taste is unique if there is anything good to say about it. Really have never tasted any other beer that tastes like this one. Can detect some slight corn taste with some retro-nasal breathing. 

Mouthfeel - Like drinking carbonated water. Not any body to the beer to speak of.

Overall - not impressed at all. If I had to choose between Budweiser and this beer, it would be a very hard to decision between which I liked least. I probably would have to choose the Budweiser over this one because of the smell coming from this beer.
a pretty good beer for chillin in the sun with. goes down nicely for a cheap beer.
I am not a fan of Corona.  It smells, looks & tastes a little bit like urine.  This is the frat guy’s choice for a "upscale" party.  I’ll pass.
There’s not much to say about this one. It sucks. Avoid at all costs, and resist any and all shameless marketing techniques.
I do like this beer don’t put a lime in it because a don’t drink cocktails but a do think its a Ok beer and I do drink it alot just great for a hot summer day
crap crap crap crap crap crap crap crap crap crap crap crap crap crap crap crap.
Easily the best beer I’ve had in the last 10 minutes. Unfortunately I’m drinking it sans lime so don’t have that little kick of flavor to help it along.
Not much to say. Make sure it’s ice cold, add lime and consume. Pretty good commercials but the beer doesn’t match the type.
Better than the light beers and other mass market american lagers like bud, but the taste highlight is the lime added to the bottle.
Not much to say about this beer, it’s not bad for a hot day or a beach bar but it’s fairly bad.

Bottle.  Straw yellow color with a thin, fizzy head.  Not much to say about this one.  Not awful to have one with lime after a day in the hot son.  Besides that, however, can’t think of much to recommend it.  One of the world’s most overrated beers.
Fra flaske, dufter af korn, majs... pilsner gylden med meget svagt hvidt skum...smager frisk.... korn,hø, vand...... meget vandet eftersmag....

It’s an unexciting beer that I can definitely stomach in social events but don’t want to come anywhere close to if I don’t have to. I feel like getting drunk out of this will make me puke like a son of a b*tch. You can do much better than this, but you can do worse as well.

Colour very clear yellow/gold. Smells nice, taste is also fine. In all fairness, it’s not very cool to say as a craft beer drinker that you like this, but on some occasions it’s just fine to drink this, like during the world championship soccer. And if you like: just throw a lime in there.
Easy to drink, different than pilsner, bit dry though.
A beer that goes unmatched when paired with a lime.  Goes great with summer parties.
The beer all my uneducated friends like to drink. Awful beer yoo expensive for for what your getting and you have to get a lime to make it bearable, just not good

I dont understadn why does this beer is drank in europe, is even worst than the european macro brews like heineken, carlsber, etc. Its refreshing, i give it tath, but its more a barley soda than a brew

Pale straw yellow with a fizzy yellow head;  Aroma of sweet lager malts.  Taste was watery and boring.  Not much sweetness, with a touch of bitterness at the finish.  Tasted like "beer".  Not sure how else to put that.  Thats how boring this beer is, I can’t describe its flavor.

One of my least favorite beers, always so dissapointed when a friend brings over a case for a BBQ, but hey, we’re all human.  
Not to be pretentious (seriously) but there is almost no taste, no eye appeal and no aroma.  
Oh well, to each their own.
bottle at bens ... golden ... soft grassy lager hop .... sweetmgrainy hop .. typical lager ... not my thing
Not the best, or the worst, yard work beer. Does need a lime to taste good (not a positive mark for Corona), but drinkable in the right situation if its ice cold
Bottle- golden yellow watery color.  Little aroma.  Corn highlights throughout.   All in all a shaby little lager.

Süßlich-grasiger Geruch. 
Im Auftakt passabel frisch und perlig. Zur Mitte wird es etwas malziger. Dann baut das Bier doch stark ab und verabschiedet sich mit einem fast nicht vorhandenen Abgang. 
Hm. Lange, lange hab ich es nicht mehr getrunken. Das einstmals so coole Bier von damals entpuppt sich heute als flaches Gesöff. 
Insgesamt eine wässrige Sache.Test vom 11.2.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche
Bottle @ a Morroccan restaurant in London. Grassy vegetable aroma. Golden yellow colour. Dry vegetable corn flavour. Unpleasant lingering aftertaste. Bad lager.
Bevanda che non considero neanche birra, ottima per rinfrescarsi in estate con un po’ di limone. per il resto, da evitare.

Very overrated and overpriced, it’s a fashion and exotic beer. And wait... antioxidants? Thickeners? Not standard ingredients at all. Without it’s lemon slice in the neck it tastes nothing (justa a hint of apple and lime), it’s more like a soft drink. Ok, ok, it’s good iced under bursting sun but it stops there.

Thin yellow, almost watery or a thin apple nectar. As good as no head. Metallic smell of smoke. Tastes like carbonated water, with a bit of citrus (tasted in glass, ie without lime in the bottle). Not bad in the sun when thirsty, but not a good beer when you want taste. Take it for what it is.

A habja nulla! Snassz sárga szín. Gyenge malátás és szúrós illat. Savas vízíz nagyon kevés komlóval. Már régen ittam de nem emlékeztem, hogy ilyen szar. A legtöbb helyen ahol van sokkal jobb sör is képesek ezt kétszer annyiért adni. Igazi marketing rettenet. Ja és még egy sokat mondó adat az összetevőkben: "kukorica és/vagy rizs" :)
Pfújjj!!!

Very watery "i cant believe its not light beer" ale. Pretty much non-existent aroma. Not much flavour to distinguish on the palate. Over all though i will admit it is a refreshing/over priced/over bought/over marketed beer.

Can. Very clear light yellow, and clearer than most pale lagers with a fizzy white head that lasts all of about two seconds. Apples and light corn are in the aroma basically, but not much to report on.  Appley flavor, light veg, and some sulfur in the taste.  Barely-there body that’s lighter than most in the style, and it’s obvious that I needed a lime with this.
This is Mexico’s version of Keystone.  Place a lime in the bottle....why?  It tastes bad either way.  Surprising, it is the top ten selling beers in this country.

Straw-yellow colour, transparent with little carbonation or head.
Fresh citric smell, lime, yeast. Subtle sugar cane sweetness.
Limy citric taste, sweetish, tangy. Refreshing.
Släckte törsten. Limeskivan ger mer smak än själva ölet. Vad finns där mer att säga om detta öl? Inte så mycket, så då låter jag bli.
Bottle.  Light gold in color.  Fairly refreshing on a hot day, though light on flavor.  Not much carbonation

Corona needs a lime squeezed into to bottle, because else this will taste like used bathwater with carbon. I’ve never seen it served else than in a bottle and that bottle looks pretty nice with the printed logo on it. Best enjoyed while relaxing in the sun. Don’t forget the lime, also to keep the flies out.

There’s a reason this is served with a lime. Because the beer tastes of very little. Very little hops, very little malt. However, add a bit of lime and this is a really refreshing drink and would score a few points higher. I’d drink this on a hot day anytime, but would never drink without lime as it is too light in flavour.
12oz bottle with lime and half lime slice... felt like this is the way an enthusiast is meant to drink this. Taste is heavily reliant on the lime, just a light sour yeast taste without it.
You need the lime just to give it some taste. There really isn’t much else to say about this beer.

Reviewed from notes.

Poured into a pint glass. Not sure what the point of that is, considering that this doesn’t really form a head or produce lacing and I can tell its color by looking through the bottle. Color is golden. No head. Nose is skunky hops. That’s about it. Light with a lot of carbonation. I can see why people like to lime this up. Faint whiff of light bread. Not really much like beer and what is does not taste good.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-14-2010

Bottle. Pours ...well there’s a reason you don’t usually pour it out of the bottle...pale yellow. Nose of metallic corn and hay. Taste is essentially the same. It’s fine at a BBQ on a hot day with a lime in it. Pretty bad without the lime.  Meh, it’s a Corona.

(32oz bottle, labeled “Corona Familiar”, from Dixonian)  Pours a clear pale yellow with a small white head.  Aroma of metal pipe, mustiness, and sweaty gym socks.  Flavor of corn, hay, and grain with a dry finish.  What did I do to deserve such a treat?

Served in a bottle with a lime slice.  Appearance was pale yellow.  Aroma of lime and lager.  Taste as similar - smooth and light overall.  Palate was on the light side.  Overall, a typical mass produced lager.

Poured from the Corona Familiar bottle. My Crown Imports representative said this was a different beer... Apparently this s just a different bottle presentation of Corona Extra. I’m upset to find out this is the same. One thing I note is that it is less skunked than a regular Corona... Why, Regular is in a clear bottle ie, skunked. This is in a Brown bottle, ie fresh! Appearance is piss yellow. (My dad always said Coors was Rocky Mountain piss water, but it’s better piss than this!) Aroma is nil, Flavor is to be expected from a mexican lager. Honestly Pacifico is way better!! So I’m disappointed that this isn’t a beeter Corona, but honestly if your at a party and people have Corona I’ll drink hat over a Bud Light any day. But Corona and Coors Light is a toss up.

Corona Familiar if that matters.  Poured into a pint glass.  Color is piss yellow with little white head.  Aroma is weak but of light sweet malt.  Flavor is weak as well but has very light breadiness and sweetness.  A small bit of hoppiness at the finish.  Very light body body.  Overall a decent substitute if your drinking water is deemed unsafe.
12 oz bottle pours a clear golden color.  The lime covers every else, which is a good thing
12oz can in a plastic cup.  Pours light golden with a white head.  Aroma of light bread malts and some resin/tin.  Flavor the same.  Light texture.  Not really good.
Brown bottle, "familiar". Very light nose with a hint of plastic. Thin and watery, very drying finish with metals and fizz.

Bouteille 330 ml. Cannette. Bue au Canada, au Mexique, avec lime, sans lime. Arôme assez régulièrement de mouffette ;-), sinon assez absent. Légère en bouche, peu gouteuse, trace de malt. Sans arrière goût. À 35 degré, avec une lime, elle se boit bien mais en terme de bière, assez faible.
Tastes watery and not much else as far as flavor.  There are much better beers from Mexico than this.

bottle@bar: had it without the lime/lemon, no smell, extremely bland, close to water with some minor corn/grain in it and hint of disinfecting alcohol, actually looks better in than out of the bottle, I now understand the need for lime/ lemon, bit like drinking water which probably explains its popularity

Drank out of the bottle.  Color is golden, clear yellow.  Aroma is skunky with some grainy scent.  Light bodied and carbonated mouthfeel.  Taste is bland and skunky yet easy to drink.  A sad excuse for a beer.
341 bottle. What can I say? As watery as they come and when combined with a lime proved to be reasonably refreshing during my Arizona vacation. Meh.

Surprised to see this beer in my locale Chinese grocery so I bought it out of curiosity. Kinda waterish, not very elaborate taste, Frisco is way better (hehe) and this is even twice as much expensive. But still I believe there are far worse beers than this.
This is the classic beer of summer...unfortunately it isn’t the greatest beer. It can be refreshing on a hot day, with some lime squeezed inside.

Not a great beer, but sometimes, specially in summer, she does her job.
It’s not always time for a strong ale :) That’s why I’ve rated 10/20 Overall.
I think it’s not even necessary  to judge this beer. It’s Corona, nothing more (unfortunately), nothing less (fortunately).

Only thing they had in a party i went. Skunky smell, yello straw color. Very easy to drink with very little bitterness. Some crisp. Overall i think this beer comes closes to tasting like water. So i didnt give it to much of a low score, cause water aint that bad.
Eh, overpriced crap. I guess if you want to be a cliche douche, this beer is for you

The nose is slightly caramel but in a skunky kind of way. The appearance is that of a watery rice-based thin beer. This is confirmed on the palate but there is a really metallic unpleasant after-taste - I know length is important but not if it’s unpleasant and it lasts this long. I would never buy it and even a watery Budweiseer would have been less unpleasant (well less of everything really).

Best beer in the world for sure. Smells really good. Taste is so clean and crisp. Very refreshing. This is my dad’s favorite beer. Awesome. Give me one of these over anything else.............Please note sarcasm.

35.5cl bottle left over at a party (you don’t think I’d pay for a Corona, do you? ;-)
Bland tasteless lager
Too bad they got famous with the clear bottle because these are often skunky and usually need the lime to be drinkable.  I prefer pretty much every other mexican pale lager to this one.
Bottle a golden yellow colored beer with a tiny white head aroma cardboard and water taste water some cardboard and some lime
Pretty okay lager, really. I like putting in the slice of lemon... some people think it’s stupid, but oh well.
Bottle. Light yellow colour. Light taste with little bitterness. Don´t have a strong beer taste. Works well as a thirs quencher on warm days.

Is this the best beer on the market?No way.But it is very enjoyable.I keep this stocked in my home bar.Its funny that some people talk about this beer as "piss water" but at any partys or get togethers this is the beer everyone asks for.
Gold colored with a white head. I personally hate garnish on my drinks. This one boasts lime, but with grenadine and a lime finally keeps this from tasting like piss.
Bottled. Clear, golden beer. No head. Taste: Lightly sweet, some bitterness. Palate: Light body, watery. Average carbonation.
Smells buttery and has a ring of bubbles around the edge.  The flavor is sweet with a buttery aftertaste.
Clear yellow without head. Aroma is weak hops. Flavor is medium sweet and light bitter. Finish is a bit acidic. Very light bodied and watery. 150809

Ehh..... not the worst industrial lager on the planet.  But for the price point that they sell this shit at, it may be the worst value.  I actually find the taste non-offensive.  Very light and lively carbonation.  Nice marketing campaign too.  Maybe that’s why it tastes so good.  The #1 party beer among 25-30 year olds.
Bottle. Caramel, lime, weak hops. Yellow body white head. Bitter. Dry finish. Boring but acceptable.
Before i discovered what real beer was, this was my favorite, now i realize this is barely drinkable. Drop a jalapeno in it to liven it up.
The classic corona is the staple mexican beer. It is plain, almost resembling a light can of coors or natural ice. The only thing to refresh this beer is adding a lemon/lime
Only good on hott summer days served ice cold. Other than that this beer sucks.
Wouldn’t call this a beer. Taste like someone has pissed into the bottle. Can not believe this is the most sold ’beer’ in Australia
2011 - 01 - 26 330 ml botlle. light yellow colour. smalle white head. drank it out of the bottle. almost no taste. waist of money.
Well put your lime in it. Flip it over and drink. Really just a normal beer with a little flavor from the lime. Lol.
Really light beer that’s not very good. I don’t know why it’s sold in clear bottles because I get slight skunyiness in the ones that I’ve tried. Gross.
pours really pale yellow, disappearing head. skunky, corn, rice, maybe some malts. not just plain and boring, it’s really bad.

Lucent gold, thin bubbly white head, 



Aroma: skunked stale noble hops, adjuncty corn.



Taste: really skunked noble hops, funky sticky adjuncts.
Does not have many things with most liquids called beer. Still quite enjoyable to drink on hot sunny day when thirsty.
Bottle 330ml. Boring pale lager. Aroma of corn, disappearing quickly. Taste is sweet, and short-lived. Palate is thin and watery. Pale yellow, bubbly, head disappears.
ill never understand how this overpriced "beer" is so damn popular. smooth and easy drinking... yes. any taste whatsoever... no.
What can i say that hasn’t already been said. It’s a rather insipid beer that without the almost obligatory lime/lemon is completely tasteless. It’s beer, but barely!

From a 355ml bottle on 3/1/2011. Seriously has next to no aroma. Has a slight sweet grainy flavour with a tiny hint of hops. Whack a slice of lemon or lime in this and it’s okay on a hot day. But as a stand alone drinking experience, this one is a shocker.
Bottle 355ml. Pours clear, light golden with almost non-existent white head. Aroma is grain and a bit of malt. Taste is sweet heading to lightly bitter. Watery with soft carbonation.

12 oz bottle.  Pours golden, without any head, some bubbles.  Grassy hops aroma hit as soon as I opened the bottle, then some sweet notes came through as the beer wormed up in a glass.  Good, medium body.  There is a taste to this brew, although not much: some light hops and some sweet notes.  Overall it is drinkable beer, although much more difficult though by the end of the bottle.
Maltainen, maissinen ja hieman hedelmäinen aromi. Maissinen/riisinen maku, jossa myös melko voimakasta pahvisuutta. Vetinen ja laimea tämäkin on. Parempi kuitenkin kuin Sol.
Bottled in Vail, Colorado. Pale yellow appearance. Clean pale malt aroma with lime. Very smooth pale lager flavor with some lime. One of my favorite Mexican pale lagers.

330 cll flaske. lys gul farve med hvidt hoved som dog hurtigt falder. Aroma og smag findes nærmest ikke i denne øl. men måske noter af mejs og lys malt. Blid afslutning og finics. En rigtig begynderøl for unge mennesker. Øllen vil dog gøre sig godt en varm sommerdag til hotdogs, burger eller andet grilmad. En god letdrikkelig tørstslukker. DK-B-42,75

Sampled from bottle. Pours yellow next no head, quite bubbly. I can’t say that there is much scent at all, some grain. Tastes of grain and malt. I would definitely say I understand why the lime is there now.

Bottle 330ml @ home

Pours pale golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of grain and malt. Taste is light bitter. Texture is watery with soft carbonation.
Not a good beer, no taste at all, it does help to have it with a lime, can’t really rate this beer. It’s corn and urine mix, so not much to say. Awful!
