Bottle served with a lime. I think I just had this beer. I can barely recognize a difference between this and Pacifico Clara thought the bottle is clear vs. brown. Light hay nose, fizzy carbonation, watery texture. Sweetish corn flavor. Lime slice adds complexity.

Corona Extra. How the mighty have fallen. I used to swear by this beer when I first started to drink beers regularly. It goes best with a slice of lime. It pours a clear yellow with heavy white head but it dissipates very fast and has no lacing. It has thick carbonation and has both a skunky aroma and flavor. It goes best with lime cause it masks the true flavor of the beer. I have a hard time drinking this beer nowadays. Makes me kinda sad.
330ml bottle. From bottle with a lime wedge. Aroma was little to non existing. The taste is good, but should last longer. Only usable on a sunny day, but then it’s a splendid one :)
Barely a beer. It’s OK if you’re at the beach and there is nothing else, but overall it pretty lame. The clear bottle does not help.

From a 330mL bottle, poured a transparent yellow reminiscent of piss. the head was white and abundant but disappeared quickly, leaving just a very persistent rim of foam on top that once again, made it look like piss.

The aroma is virtually non-existant, just a hint of hops and wheat...
The taste is... it has no taste. it’s almost like drinking very slightly bitter water... and that quick-disappearing foam I described before? it feels awful in the palate, making this beer not even an easy drink.

The aftertaste is just a very slight bitterness...

This beer is expensive and awful, I wouldn’t drink it again (I only did because it was free in the first place)
Because of its practically nil taste, I think this is the perfect beer for people who don’t actually like beer but enjoy pretending they do.

Bottle.  Pours a thin white head that disappears instantly.  Tastes like Mexican toilet water, though is drinkable when mixed with Sprite to make a shandy.  Apart from painted labels and savvy advertising, this beer has nothing going for it.

Very little aroma. Has a moment of bitterness then fades away. A very blah taste to it if any. Not offensive but seems to be nothing there. Adding a lime just brings it up a hair but not much. I thought there would be more to this beer.

sample from a bottle.  skunk aroma... with light grain.  pale yellow pour with a very small white head.  light to medium body up front, falls to water on the back.  sweet corn flavors up front with more skunky bitterness.  dry weak watered down finish with more corn / grain.  one of my least favorite beers.

Not as horrible and low quality as most of these comments make it sound, for the price? Perhaps, but overall? No way is this beer any worse than an american domestic. I would take a corona over a budweiser, bud light, miller, ect ANY day. Good lawn-mower beer. Has a scent of bitter hops upon opening without much else, very hoppy flavor as well, impressing for a mexican lager IMO, considering most i’ve had taste like toilet water.

330ml bottle.  Pours a pale yellow with a small head.  Aroma is soapy pale malt, a little sweet.  Nothing at all to taste at first, then some astringent honey malt on the finish.  Weak effort.  Now, where’s my lime?

Bottle, produced in Spain. I tried to evaluate this with an open mind. Pale body, low soapy head. Aroma is very weak but not offensive. Taste is watery and sweet. This is just ridiculously light, I can’t believe there is a more lighter version of it.

Bottle:
White foamy head on top of a clear orange yellow beer.
Smell is sweet, fruit, sugars, spices, grains and malts
Taste is way too sweet and bit piss malty, don’t like it that much…
(though it must be ok when eating a hot Mexican plate)
Bottle pours yellow with a quickly disappearing white head.  Aroma of hay & cardboard.  Flavor is thin and watery with some malt giving way to a metallic tinge.  Whatever.

The best beer. Really good.
appearance: nice
Aroma:
Body: nice booty
 and finish
It tastes better than a corona light, but the the Mexicans still think it is shitty.

I had this at a Chicago Blackhawks game, really the only reason why I’d choose to drink this one as the selection at the game is minimal.  One of those beers that you drink and then monitor how many you’ve had..not a beer to drink for flavor but to get a buzz on when there’s no other beer to drink.  I’ve had worse tasting beers out there, it’s not horrible.

Bleh.  This has an aroma??  Seriously?  Another "beer" that satisfies the masses’ desire for beer that has no flavor, but that they can drink large quantities of to get drunk.  Refreshing in the sense that it has little flavor.

The king of the watered down lagers, and in a negative way. Not the best watered down lager but the most watered down, the complete lack of hops and malt should make the beer look like mineral water but I quess they add colour artificially.
this beer is rubbish water. i don’t understand why its so popular, i reckon my urine might taste better than this. Very Bad beer.
Straight from a 12oz bottle, has a clear yellow appearance with hardly no aroma, it is very sweet and just not good, pass.

330 ml bottle. Rated @ 29.7.2010.

Light yellow with a small white head. Aroma of citrus and malts. Flavour of sweet malts, citrus and metal. Light bodied. Watery. Not good.

smells rotten eggs,  cheese and beer 
tastes like transmission fluid mixed with sweet water
looks like bumblebee sweat pretty good but overhyped

Enjoyed at my company picnic last week.  Drank straight out of the bottle.  I’ve had this brew before.  There are little hops present and low malt.  No head nor foamy lace.  Aroma is of a light lime smell.  Appearance is a typical yelow lager.  Taste is average with a corn and lime notes.  The palate is clean and crisp.  Overall, this brew is great for a summer thirst quencher enjoyed with a lime and some nachos and light appetizers..  Light and refreshing..

Bottle left over from company picnic.  Pours clear yellow, with a thin, quickly diminishing white head, fine lacing.  Aromas of biscuit, hay and caramel.  Thin, watery body, crisp.  Lightly sweet, then just enough bitter in the finish to mostly balance it out, some lingering corn sweetness.  Very drinkable.
Another very generic beer.  The corn flavour is obvious.  Nothing interesting at all.  Bland.
Barn party! If only this beer actually approximated a decent pils. As is, a competent PL that had the virtues of cold and carbonation. Tasteless, but at least it lacked demonstrably bad taste.

207 ml bottle (Coronita) from LCBO.   Pours a clear, somewhat pale yellow gold with small white cap.  Aroma of harsh grains with lots of corn.  Taste isn’t quite as harsh but still grainy/corny.  Light body; no finish.  Junk.
Water tasty.No taste.With some lemon it is ok for thirst quenzing on the beach.But only this.
Bottled beer had on 10/9/10. Golden coloured with a thin white head. Little taste and palate. Easy to drink.

drank out of a bottle. this beers name far surpasses its taste.  i guess i am not the biggest mexican beer fan either.  not to bad since i only got a six pack, but i need to brush and scope after i’m finished to wipe out the bad aftertaste!
Fun beer to drink, very good served with a lime, Goes down easy and well like by people I know, this isnt a bad beer to find yourself drinking often

12 oz. bottle. The color is light yellow with very little head. Smells of grain malts, lemons, and some light spices. The flavor is bitter, but well balanced. The palate is light and sticky. There is an acidic feel and a lingering bitter aftertaste. I didn’t have a lime, but I might have to try it again with one.
Pours very pale yellow with little head. Not much flavor or aroma, but one of my favourite beers to drink on a very hot day.
Ahhhrr, totally disapointed. I cant understand why i bought this bottle. To expensive for the experience. Sry guys..
12 oz bottle.  Poured a golden yellow color.  I did not have a lime to go with this as is standard practice but overall a bad beer.  Better then the avg Coors light, ect.   Bah....
Another average beer.  Has a relatively boring, but not bad, taste, with a golden color.

Bottle, requested without a lime.  I got a lime wedge stuffed in there anyway.  Are these ever served without lime wedges?  Anyway, pours a weak gold color with a small white head.  Aromas of sour malt, skunk, and grass.  Flavor is not much better, a touch of citrus (from the lime, of course) amidst watery malt.  Bitter adjunct finish.  Fizzy yellow beer pretty much sums it up.

What can you say that hasn’t already been said? I got offered this at a friends place after arriving in Seattle. "Wanna beer?" is always a dead giveaway, especially when I followed with "what kind of beer?"..."I don’t know, beer". Ah well. It’s a corn bomb, weak and uninspired...a great example of why beer in many places in the world is nothing more than alcohol infused bong water.
The lower end of Mexican lagers. Mostly folks think they enjoy this because of marketing. Serving: Bottle
This poured a weak clear yellow with a white head. Aroma was oof light skunk and corn. Flavor was skunk, corn and other crap adjuncts. Terrible stuff.

pours like average macro beer.  no head retainment.  dark yellow.  clear.  there is a mild smell of hops and grain, corn of course.  not quite skunked on the sip, but something really funky in the taste.  never the less, a little bitter on the end.  fairly light.  who would drink corona light?  I find this beer ok on a hot day but can’t say I’ve ever caught a buzz of this beer.   basically an alternative to water that may make you poo funny.  viva mexico!

Golden beer with no real head noticeable, skunky pale lager aromas. High carbonation, fizzy. Taste is pretty non-existent, but it really is quite refreshing. Add some Sprite/7-Up to it to make it a shandy. It becomes so much better.
Bonne bière mexicaine...douce, rafaichissante, pétillante et peu houblonné...délicieux avec de la lime...me rappel voyage à la Riviera Maya!

Can on Delta Airlines flight 183. Very little aroma. Flavor is some sweet malts and grass. Almost no taste, but then again, absolutely nothing offensive about it either. Didn’t get the lime, unfortunately.
Pee yellow as highlighted by the clear bottle.  Usually a little skunky taste that is covered by the lime.  Drinkable at the beach when ice cold.
gold color, light consistent head, not too much foam, light citrus smell, tangy smooth taste with the citrus really coming through at the end

This one was free, so don’t judge me. Haha.  Served from bottle into a Blue Ridge standard pint.  Pours pale yellow with a one finger white head with AGGRESSIVE pour that subsides to none almost instantly.  There was no apparent lacing present at all.  The aroma was comprised of malt and a small hint of fruit.  The flavor was of malt, sour fruit, water, and citrus.  It was light on the palate with medium carbonation.  Overall I tried to be fair with this brew in my rating but it is just bad.  I have never really been a fan of this brew and will probably never be.  It is just missing too much to good.  Maybe this is why the tell you not to drink the water in Mexico???
The worst beer I have ever had, if you can call it beer.  I wish there was at least 1 good thing I could say about it, but there is not.  If you like beer don’t drink it.
ice cold with a slice of lime it’s hard to beat on a hot summer’s day........

I guess we all have to rate corona because you show up to a party and its all they have .... golden yellow pour white head aroma of funk, corny malts ... tastes the same way malt and watery with a funky floral hop going down
12 oz bottle.  it is what it is.  At Brian and Debbie’s in Santa Rosa for the first time in 6 years.  Thank God for Russian River.  Blah blah until  I get to 75 characters.

Had this beer for the first time at a club in downtown Orlando, it was served with a lime and it was delicious. Second time I had it was without a lime and was not good at all. Yes, this beer needs a lime to make it taste good, which is a bad quality in the beer. With lime=good, without=awful. Very bland, piss yellow color, bitter and watery. Served with a lime makes all the difference though. Beer by itself= 6/20.
any beer that you NEED to put fruit in for flavour (yes, i know that isnt why it was originally done), is not a good beer

This is a joke beer for those who have no clue what beer is all about.  Beer is sensitive to light people.  As soon as it hits it a chemical reaction occurs which is why most beer is in a dark bottle and the fact that this beer is in clear glass, smells like a skunk peed on it and is why a lemon/lime is required to make it drinkable.  If you enjoy this beer, just save your money and get a glass of water instead.

This is everything that is wrong with beer...filtered to death, pissy straw colour, horrible piss water taste. Friday night out on the town will show you the exact demographic that this shite aims for - pretensious wannabes doing their best finger over the opening and twist impression. Bleuughhh...

This beer has a thin, white head, but a very bubbly, golden appearance (weird).  Aroma is faint, but not unpleasant.  The taste is good- simple and somewhat bland- but, good.  Mouth-feel is light and watery.  Corona Extra finishes crisp and watery;  it’s somewhat dry.  There is a slightly soapy under-taste with this.  Apparently, this beer is brewed to have a lime squeezed into it and to be eaten with salty chips.  You know what?  I like it.  Why do people hate this beer? Is that the fashionable thing to do?  Well, I recommend that you try this one, although I’d strongly recommend that you drink it out of the can, as the clear bottle can allow for spoilage.  Luckily, the one I drank today (out of a 12 oz. bottle) was not skunked.

RJT
Clear-straw. Very little to aroma. Tastes is bland. Better than Keystone though lol

Cerveceria Modelo, S.A. DE C.V.--Corona Extra--1999 22 oz. Clear Bottle.  5.00% ABV.  (2.0 / 5.0)  Pilsner?  Clear very light thin straw golden color.  Light hop front is indistinct.  Crisp watery light malt flavored body with distinct Mexican aroma.  Thin end is refreshing with light hint of hop bitterness.  Sampled 1/6/2000.

Cerveceria Modelo, S.A. DE C.V.--Corona Extra--2000 12 oz. Clear Bottle.  5.00% ABV.  (2.5 / 5.0)  Pilsner?  Clear very light straw color. Pours foamy.  Light lager front with delicate fruit aroma.  Thin mild lager body with distinctive Mexican note.  Clean without much flavor. Ends with a hint of spice.  Sampled 7/22/2000.

Cerveceria Modelo, S.A. DE C.V.--Corona Extra--2002 24 oz. Clear Bottle. 5.00% ABV?  (3.25 / 5.0)  Pilsner--Light.  Clear thin bright golden color.  Mild floral Macro scented hop front.  No head or lace.  Smooth mild rice malt body.  Minimal light fruit flavor.  Easy mild CO2 spiced end.  Bland but easy.  Sampled 9/30/2002.

Cerveceria Modelo, S.A. DE C.V.--Corona Extra--Chinese--2003 11.2 oz. Clear Bottle.  4.60% ABV.  (3.5 / 5.0)  Pilsner?  Light laceless CO2 head.  Clear thin light golden color.  Mild hop front.  Mild body with light sweet flavor & adjunct hints.  Light butterscotch fruit taste.  Clean refreshing crisp mild hop end.  Sampled 8/5/2003.

You have to serve this beer with a lime. Why? its skunked. Please mister Corona guy please put your beer in a dark bottle. Oh what that would F up your advertisement? Then you wouldnt be able to mass market your sun shiny beer to the US  tastless masses? For real review. It taste like I ate weed drank a bunch of good beer then pissed and bottled it.
A quite average beer,nothing special,too  tame for my preferences,flavour is too week and its aroma doesn’t quite resemble a beer’s.

(Bottle 0,33l)
Weird sweet cornish, light grass aroma. Clear light yellow color. Quickly done white head. Very light bitter-sweet. Plain taste. Light fizzy. Light dry finish.

Pours clear pale yellow with a faint cereal aroma.  Light bodied, medium sweetness and low bitterness, average carbontation with almost no flavor in the finish to mask up this well below par beer, a decent way to drink your way to a buzz.

A - Skunky, wheaty and grassy
A - light gold with thin white head
T - A touch sweet, with a tinny finish (it was not from a can)
P - a touch fizzy and extremely thin
O - Its Corona
I like its unique taste, almost nutty, its not for everyone but its a decent beer and throw on some salt and a lime and its party time.
So what to say, not very interesting, not very natural, less carbonated and not very drinkable, specially when hot temperatures. Very sweet and sirop taste, pass your way.
What is more important the beer or the lime in it?  Like a chemist adding the citrus creates the catalyst to release the hay aroma to taste of bitter citrus.

La prendo solo come ultima scelta nei bar, con abbondante limone a coprire il gustaccio che questa birra ha al naturale.
Bibita estiva manco troppo buona
Bottle. Yellow color with thin head. Almost no aroma and taste. If you try it with lime, you have limonade, not beer. Disaster.

Round 3 in my Light Latin Lager Showdown: now it’s Corona’s turn. This tastes almost the same as nr. 2 in the contest, Sol. Almost. Unfortunately, the flavor is tainted by some notes of cooked vegetables, therefore not escaping the macrobrew trap of bad brewery skills. Drinkable and light as the others, yet not quite as good as its closest competitor, Sol. Final ranking goes like this: 1st place: Sol, 2nd place Corona and 3rd place Salitos. Salud, and thank God this rather unexciting tasting event is over. :-P

Bleached blonde pour into thick foamy white head that dissipates quickly into a ring of bubbles as carbonated bubbles rise from the bottom of the glass into a weak swirl of foam. Aroma of a wet dog atop a bale of moldy straw. Bland flavors of musty cardboard and damp drywall. If there was a beer deserving a ZERO rating, this would be it.
Pale yellow with white foamy head.  With the lime, the beer is drinkable, which is not saying much.  Without the lime, it’s just bad beer.  My ratings are without the lime.

The story of this beer goes that it was originally brewed in San Antonio Texas...but it failed because, well, quite frankly it’s terrible. So the owner of the beer simply took it south of the border, labeled it an "import" and amazingly it became popular...some people... If you can’t tolerate a beer without a lemon or lime you’ve got a problem...this is skunky, unimaginative, and boring.
330 bottle. Pale yellow beer with almost no head. A  light beer pleasant to dring on a hot summer day.
This beer may have begun the "wedge of lime in the bottleneck" problem with bartenders.  Sadly, it needs it.
Without a lime it really is just another cheap, mass marketed beer without much character.
at a convention from the bottle.  smells of corn.  pale straw color.  pilsner style my a$$.  taste is weak with metallic and corn.  lame.  no wonder everyone puts a lime in it.

There’s a reason why people are always shoving lime wedges into the neck of their Corona.  I use to think it tasted fairly decent with a big squizz of lime juice intermingling with this golden lager.  Not bad with spicy food and or mowing the lawn.  Unfortunately, I always associate this beer to memories of spring break and toes in the sand from years past.

Pours a golden color with a white head.  taste better with a lime, but the fruit does not cover up the flat taste.  

12 oz. bottle

Pours golden...nose is skunky with none of the pleasantries of a sweet malt or hoppiness. The taste is the same...like the sweat off of a skunk. You’re supposed to serve it with a lime and ice cold for a reason...good beers don’t need masking effects to be enjoyed. Utter swill.

straw yellow pour, no addition of lime this time.  
Aroma is skunky with some light grassy, grainy, cardboard aromas.  
Mouthfeel is light, fizzy, Flavor is dull carboard, some light grain, somewhat skunked.  Really bland.  Good on a hot day when there’s nothing else I guess?

Rating 16- I have given this beer many chances throughout my drinking life and each time I try it I am reminded of why I don’t ever buy it.  People swear by this beer and I honestly don’t know how it has such a following.  It always tastes skunky to me and a warm sip of this is about the most disgusting thing you can put in your mouth.  If you add lime there is a chance you can finish the whole thing but I would never want to waste 30 dollars on a case, which is how much it costs in my area of the United States.
No lime, straight up 12 oz bottle, Sweet, lightly fruity, but still skunky.
33 cl bottle. Definetely a bad beer, I didn’t like it. One of the worst beers ever tried.
I expected this to be utter rubbish - pale lager in a clear bottle etc,  but found it to be surprisingly pleasant and thirst quenching on a hot day, goes well with a lime or lemon in it.
Decent; It’s better with lime. Great cheap, beach beer. Also, goes well with pizza and tacos.

06/2007: [NOTE: for fairness’s sake, this sample was consumed without a lime or any other synthetic flavor-altering element. I thank you.] 

The color is straw-yellow, absolutely see-thru. No head, no lace. No color or depth. Some (read: non-beer drinkers) might find this appealing because it’s light, but to me it’s weak. 

The smell is actually not all that bad. It has the smell of a very weak, summery Belgian white. It is a tiny bit stale (naturally, as are all Coronas) but has a surprisingly pleasant-enough fruity (orange) aroma. 

The taste is more like a pale lager than a Belgian white. The wheat aspect is nowhere to be found in the flavor. It’s more like a corn/rice cereal drink. It is light, which could be considered a positive, but it’s too high a price for no flavor. The smell is far superior to the taste, for what that’s worth. 

The feel is light and watery and malty. Leaves a minor, wheaty film. For a pale lager, it is dead-average. And it is summery. Overall I suppose this might be good for a hot day, and maybe it’s closer to an iced tea than a beer, so for that, I suppose it’s fairly drinkable. You could do worse for a pale lager; just don’t expect much flavor.
Drink this beer for Cinco De Mayo, beach get aways, pool side, depressed and wanting to be by water.  Great with or without a lime.

I drank this from a bottle, I tried it both with the slice of lime stuck in and without, either way it tasted very citrusy and sweet, very drinkable beer, although better for a session rather than a taste experience

Bottle at home. Pours a clear golden color without much of a head. Flavor is heavily skunked and with grains. Somehow I never really worry about skunkyness, while others detest it... It reminds me of those sunny days at the beach, which is a good association. Probably the reason I can’t hate it. Taste is watery bitter with a nice bitter finish. After all these years, I still like it.
Not my favorite needless to say, very watered down beer with hardly any flavor.  Its amazing how popular this stuff is- I would take this over a Bud, but thats not saying much...

No aroma to speak of other than the faintest citrus zest. The appearance is yellow and murky, but with a decent looking white head. Any flavor or taste this brew might have had came completely undone by an unholy fizzyness which was accompanied by a dry finish and lingered on my palate just long enough to burn a small whole into my tongue. 9 ounces went down the kitchen sink, nearly undrinkable.

Pours a clear yellow with a moderate head with some good lacing. It has a sweet, malty aroma of corn with lots of skunking too. The taste is skunky, fusely, bland and watery with just a hint of malt in the background. Mediocre as can be
just some nasty mexican swill that i have never ever liked in my life.  even the addition of lemon or lime do not help.
This is my workhorse beer.  The right combination of taste, heaviness, alcohol content, and price.

Bottle with a slice of lime. Golden color with small head. Poor watery aroma, nothing really to shout about. Flavour is fresh (specially with the lime), watery with hints of sweetness and hops. Nothing in the palate nor aftertaste. OK on a hot summer day but not as a quality beer I’m afraid.
Bottle. Pale yellow body with white head. Falvour is malt, watery and citrus.

Ok, so i was forced into drinking this last night as my dads buddy bought a sixer for us while we were at the shop working on my ’64 Dodge.

I’ve had Corona before, but never thought of reviewing it.

Its a bland yellow color with a skunky sulfur like smell.

The flavor is non exsistant.

The only reason i can see for drinking this is if the beer is ICEcold and its a hot summers day and there are no other choices. 

As far as the lime trend with Corona, i just cant do it. I hopefully won’t have to drink one again to find out if lime actually makes it drinkable

Bottle at a friends house. A little hard to call this one a beer, more like some kind of soda for me.. A bit ugly yellow, little head, disappears very quick. Goes inside quick, no beer for me... They told me to add a slice of lemon to it, but i think the brewer should put it in the bottle if they want it like that. Maybe the slice would be the best. Something you need to put fruit in to taste "like it should", hard to call it beer I think... Taste is ok, but not for a beer.

Every one knows this beer. A Corona is synonymous with Mexican beer. While alone, it tastes pretty standard, A Corona sure offers a refreshing beverage when served ice cold with a lime on a hot day. The super chill and lime mask the otherwise standard cheap beer flavor.

Pours very pale yellow, with a small pond scum-like head.
Aroma shows some sweet.... nothing.... just sweetness. Not malt or anything. There seems to be some grassy skunk hanging round, even though I’d heard they use isohops. A sharp chemical note is also present.
Flavours are very similar: very sweet and faint with hardly any bitterness. Hints of sweet rice and a weird solvent-like note can be found. Very short finish. Incredibly short.
Body is very watery, but surprisingly this could actually use more carbonation, it’s quite low.

Bottle.

A - Very faint yellow. Slightly below average sized, white head. Disappears fast and leaves really no head.

S - Some light grainy, corn malt.

T - Similar to the smell. A lot of corn sweetness. Slight mineral and skunky taste.

M - Light and carbonated.

D - Light and easy to drink but flavor isn’t great. Typical to its style.

Notes: Pretty similar to other beers of its style. Not great, but there are some occasions that it would fit well in. Never really a supporter of fruit pieces in beer, but a slice of citrus isn’t a bad addition to this.
I will never understand why anyone would buy this. I have tried maybe 2 (years ago) and remember I could not finish even half the bottle. To say this is bland is a understatement.
Looks like water, smells like water and tastes like water.  Need I say any more?

Bottle 33 cl from Aux Gourmets in Neuchâtel (CH).
Golden shiny blond, fkleeting foam, lively sparkling. Slightly acid nose and corn. It’s a sweetish beer, with touch of bitterness rather acre. Taste very thin, body idem, citrus edge. Even drunk frozen, we lose nothing of a nonexistent flavor, lime or not. A beer which owes its succes to the publicity, more than its taste.

Golden pour, slight head. Aroma of malts and grains with a added sweetener. Flavour is fresh watery maltyness with a hint of sour sweetness.
When the beer is cold and the weather is hot, then it can be quite nice.
Basicly a lawnmower.
Bottle with a lime wedge jammed in it. Clear golden. Aroma-corn juice, metal, lime. Taste-corn, grain, lime. Good beer in the right setting.
Reminds me of vacation, so I had one at an after meeting party at work a week before my vacation to get me in the mood.  Bottle with a lime, ice cold and refreshing.
Refreshing with a lime on a summer day.  I’ve tried other pale lagers with a lime and they tasted like Corona.  I guess I’m reviewing the lime.
Only because I had fuck my ex girlfriend drunk with this beer...!!!!!
What is the point? Merely light and tasteless. Beer should not have to provide lime for flavour. no good.
Undrinkable without a lime.  A skunky, pungent and foul tasting liquid.  For best results take about two sips, pour in a bout a shots worth of orange juice, mix and enjoy.

A: A pale, pale yellow with lots of tiny carbonation bubbles and just about no head. Pretty much what I expected.

S: This is probably one of the skunkiest beers I’ve come across. Lots of sulfur, metal, and a hint of grainy sweetness.

T: Slightly better than the nose, but still fairly skunky. The sweetness is more apparent here, but the lack of any other flavors is really disappointing.

M: Light and fizzy.

D: This is probably the least drinkable of the adjunct lagers I’ve had. The smell just puts me off before it even gets to my mouth.
Bottle - An easy drinking beer, light in color, flavor and substance. Very watery with a bitter finish.

Bottle. Uninspiring beer. Best ice cold. I enjoy this beer with food, as it goes with anything, and doesn’t clash. Its refreshing, but the lime or lemon I often put in it sometimes is the only flavor. Its straw yellow color and pale in complextion. Weak pour. Grassy, hay, and oats flavor. Lightly hoppy flavor.

This is the worst beer I’ve ever had. Virtually no flavor or color, insipid color. It amazes me that it’s so popular - a testament to marketing. I’ve had it once and wanted to rate it so I had a bottom reference point.
Pours a light yellow with no head.  the aromas are skunk and rice.  The flavor is rice and alcohol.  Cheers!

This was actually the first beer I ever had. I’ve had a ton of these. They’re drinkable. However, I drank them to get drunk--not to enjoy the beer. It’s just another cheap pale lager. As everyone says, it’s good with lime. It’s all the same to me though.

sicuramente la cosa che colpisce di più, è la bottiglia...se ti casca su un piede!!!!!
forse ho capito anche l’uso del limone...sicuramente serve per coprire il sapore della birra....Ottima idea!!!!!
se bevo un bicchiere di acqua mi disseta meglio aroma assente gusto inesistente retrogusto....boooh
Tastes good, a little bit like candy. The bottle looks really fresh and makes you feel happy.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle.
It pours a pale gold with a foamy white head that is gone in seconds.  The nose is corn and skunk, the later half probably because of the clear bottle.  The flavor is well, devoid of flavor outside of a little corn.  Best with at least one lime slice, more if you can fit them.  Listen, do yourself a favor and don’t drink this stuf.
Beer is what I expected, Color was a light amber. Beer had barley any aroma , good for a warm day or a baseball game but thats about it. A Girl Beer

Pours a clear, highly carbonated gold colour. Very slight aroma, could not discern any particular traits. Very, very watery taste, with little impact on the pallet. Great on a summers day just as a refresher, but a glass of water is probably healthier for you.

Yellow color, small white head; very mild aroma of some corn; body is so thin that it´s almost hard to believe it weighs as much as water; some corn in the flavor; goes down okay with spiced mexican food with which don´t want to waste any real beer, but on it´s own I can´t think of any use to it.

Not much can be said about Corona that hasn’t been said before. There just isn’t much of anything to the beer. No smell. No flavor. If you put enough limes into the beer you can get it to be almost drinkable.

Slight hints of hop.No real flavor or taste. nothing offensive, just nothing. A girly beer. The water in Mexico has more flavor than this. Having said this, it is more palatable that Bud or Miller. Yeah, right, like that takes much to accomplish.
A beer to drink when it’s warm outside or at the beach..I prefer without a lime(I’m weird about Corona I guess).  I prefer this over the mass light beers(bud light/coorsl ight/miller lite, etc).

Refrigerated bottle served with a lime.  Pours a pale yellow with little head and no lacing.  Taste is light corn and hint of citrus.  Lime wedge required.  On tap at Isla Mujeres rating.  Pours clear golden with small white head that dissipates quickly.  No lacing, medium/light body, low carbonation, and light malt aroma.  Taste is light malt and crisp finish.  Not bad.

Yellowish pour, one of the first beers I’ve ever had.  As a beer drinker now, I realize the lack of flavor.  A bit of corn and hay with a bit of cereal as well, but not much to write home about here, just drink and be done.  Nice on a hot day, with lime to cover up the taste.

Pale, no head, thin, watery, almost no flavour. But refreshing enough when having spicy food (such as Mexican). Any situation other than on a very hot day or while having Mexican food and this beer would be a huge mistake.
Nothing good to say about this fashionable yellow liquid. It’s incredible the marketing work made. So soft to call beer. Is like Bud. Sorry I don’t like it

12 oz bottle 

Appearance: Clear yellow with a small white head 

Aroma: Skunk aroma from the clear bottle, not as much as a green bottle though 

Taste: Thin mouthfeel with a skunk taste
Indispensable on on a boat on a hot summer day. Don’t forget the lime. And for those who never had it, try it with key lime...oh yes indeed!

Bottle. Thin, watery, and generally flavorless (unless you count "skunk" as a flavor). Highly overrated / overmarketed. Maybe it takes you to the beach mentally in the dead of winter, but I’d rather drink the melted ice at the bottom of the cooler (ok, slight exaggeration, but you get the point).

Pours a pale yellow with moderate carbonation. Medium white head that dissapates very quickly. Light aroma of corn, none of the skunkiness others mentioned. Tastes lightly of corn and citrus (no lime or citrus was added) and very thin on the palate. I like corona, especially on those scorching summer days. I mean after all it is a pale lager

If it has not been ruined by hot/ cold handling, I like the sulpher back taste when balanced with the acid/sweet of the lime.

Good beach beer.

The biggest problem I have with corona is how many people like the stuff. And the price they pay. Just about any Mexican beer I can think of is better than Corona, including Tecate and Pacifico. This beer tastes the same going in as it smells coming out if you know what I mean. Nothing worse than opening the cooler and seeing that everything there is Corona. Lime wedge? Yes please!
MAHAHA..EMBARASSING BEER. HAVE IT WITH LIME I SAY.. HAHA FUKIN FAGGOTS!
pale color, possibly stale but i’ve drank a lot of these and consistent, bitter after taste, almost no body, mild hops...
(7 ounce bottle -  half pint glass)  Pours a golden yellow color with no head.  Has a very skunky aroma.  Bitter hop taste.  Light bodied with a thin texture and lively carbonation.
I don’t  know what words to use in order to describe this "thing" that they use to call Beer. Water, water and only water. That’s all.
I made the mistake of declining the customary slice of lemon, and all that achieved was being able to taste it.  Pale, watery, very little flavour, skunky.
I will always have a soft spot for Corona, as it was my first "go to" beer.  Piss yellow and skunky as hell, I’ll still drink it if you pop a lime in it.
This rare gem was graciously gifted to me by my girlfriend’s host mom. Super skunked. I kinda of like skunked aroma though. Gives it a sort of herbal hop character. Flavor is less palatable though.
0.33l bottle. Small white head with poor lacing. Clear pale yellow color. Skunky aroma, empty taste. Flat carbonation, light body.

yellow beer no head. light hop aroma. The taste is watery, bland, and boring. light bitterness. Good for refreshment, but then again, so is lemonade and I’m not going to pay $15 for a 12-pack of lemonade. Horrible brew.
Its golden yellow its light, no need to pour. Looks the same in the bottle. Small head.....yada yada..... its corona.
This gives u extra and a great tasting fresh lime sort of lager, worth drinking all the time.
unpleasant but actually a tiny bit less unpleasant than molson canadian. nothing really comes to mind idk...

Bottle.  Now, I’m surprised by this score (2%).  This is not the best beer in the world but surely, great in summer!

Clear yellow colour, medium carbonation, skunky aroma/taste.  Nice beer when it’s +25C!  I would buy again but only on a hot summer day!

I usually have it with 1/8 of a lime + 5 drops of tabasco sauce.  Turn upside-down until the lime reach the bottom and drink!
Its golden yellow its light it looks like it glows in the dark, small head good with a lime.... ETC... What else can I say its corona.

Antes de avaliar essa cerveja li todos os comentários - coisa que nunca faço para não ser influenciado. Fiz isso porque essa cerveja me surpreendeu. Estava esperando uma "brahma’ da vida e logo veio o lúpulo aromático e uma ótima drinkabilidade. Suave e gostosa. Posso ter tido sorte vez que essa cerveja está em uma garrafa transparente o que faz perder muito a qualidade com o tempo e transporte.

Bem, a cerveja foi realmente boa. Cheiro suavemente lupulado. Colração amarelo ouro, espuma branca de baixa formação. Suavemente amarga, refrescante, traços suaves de malte. Ótima para dias quentes.
2005-11-12, Bottle Mexico City to Acapulco, needs a lime, prefect on a beach in Mexico. I can tell you that is much better in Mexico!
Bottle.Pale yellow colour.Aroma??? Light body.Weak and watery.Citrus in taste.Not for me!!
Yellow light color, fizzy white colored head, and clear.  The smell is skunky, malts, floral, and not good.  The taste is malts, floral, and ok.

Aroma: citrus, 
Appearance: pale, clear, minimal head, 
Taste:  lightly bitter, 
Palate: light body, 
Overall: Brings back memories of Cancun, not the greatest beer.
Bottle. The perfect beer for those 16 year old kids. Not a fan myself. How about those commercials though.
Pours pale yellow with a skunky hop aroma. Flavor is typical watery pilsener. Light grainy malt and faint skunked hops.
330ml bottle - pours pale yellow. Weak and watery. Just another run-of-the-mill pale lager.
33cl bottle. Golden color, fizzy very thin head.  Very mild and watery, hint of citrus in taste.
Clear gold pour. Fizzy, quickly diminishing head. large lacing bubbles. grain aroma. flavor is mild and watery.

Mexican Nite!!!  Viva la cerveza!!  Actually, I’m not that excited.  I’m not even looking forward to these three cervezas I’ve had in my fridge for awhile.  Expectations:  low.  Though I’ve had them all many times, it’s been awhile.  Ist up:  Mexico’s most famous beer--Corona!  12 oz can.  I pop open the can, and an unpleasant cloud of an old gym locker aroma wafts over to greet my senses.  No skunkiness, surprisingly.  Every time I’ve had this in the bottle it’s uniformly skunky.  Must be those clear glass bottles.  The can has protected it, by golly.  Pours pale golden, medium head with no retention, pour lacing.  Flavor is better than expected.  Slightly sweet, notes of citrus (no I did not put in a lime in it--though I wish I could in this review to improve it).  Slightly sour.  Highly carbonated, watery.  Overall, better than I expected, but still pretty terrible.  Next up:  Tecate.
09.10.2009, 0,33l Bottle. Pale yellow colour with white head. Aroma is weak malty with a crisp bitter ending. Some flower-flavours. Actually not to bad.
The appearance AND flavor of urine??? Right on, keep ’em coming. (not that I’ve ever tasted urine....)
Label should read, not to be consumed by those over the age of 21 or those not wearing a baja jacket that reads Spring Break 89 ’

The antithesis of taste, Corona is the classic underachiever in quality, richness, and flavor. The hyper-neon gold coloring speaks volumes of this beer’s makeup, as it has little body; this beveridge should be seen as no more than soda water.
An overhyped beer that has great marketing. On hot day with a lime this isn’t too bad although definitely not my first choice. A little bit skunky and overall pretty overrated.
I forgot to rate this apparently. This isn’t as bad as I remembered, until I had another beer and then tasted it again. Yeah, bland and boring. Not offensive, just watery as all get out.

THE ONLY REASON THIS GETS A 1 ON FLAVOR AND PALATE IS BECAUSE WITHOUT A LIME, IT IS GUTTER ROT. You add a lime, and I swear to God it makes it a totally different beer. Add the lime and you have 8/10 flavor and 6/10 palate. Mexicans get crazy on this shit because they mix it with Tequila and go ride around hitting switches and blasting off caps and trappin them thangs.

Better than most other yellow fizzy beers. A little bit of sweetness and bread provide some substance. Not nearly as skunky as its American counterparts. I’ve almost never drank these without a slice of lime. Make sure the lime is mixed in well- stuff it in there, plug the bottle and flip it upside down. Don’t bother without the lime, in my opinion.

average fizzy white head. good lacing mostly lasting clear thin medium yellow body. aroma: light bread, moderate hoppy honey. IF and FF: light bitter and sweet. average duration. Palate: light body, watery texture, lively carbonation and metallic finish. aroma melhor que o da média, lembrando o de uma bohemian. toques de mel no paladar, tambem lembrando uma bohemian. acima da media comercial brasileira. 9s
A very distinct flavor, kind of light, but very sharp and enjoyable bottle after bottle.

I’ve never seen anyone drink this out of the bottle so I’ve added the design of the bottle as part of the apperaence which just about brings it up one. also adding lemon and lime is typical of most mexican drinks so again i’m taking the taste of the lime into account. Ok that said it tastes and smells like lime &#40duh&#41 a little bit of corn overall goes down well enough the lime making it a refreshing beer but still rather bland.
Yummy piss colored beverage. Is this really beer? With lime? WIthout lime, that will be the never ending question per this clear bottle of coolness ;&#41

12 oz. bottle- Skunks galore, one of the worst beers i’ve reviewed, and the worst Mexican beer i’ve reviewed. Every Modelo brand beer i have tasted had the same problem, skunk. I reviewed this without a lime, the nice thing about fruit in your beer is it masks the poor quality product you are drinking.
Not too bad for what it is, definitely requires a lime.  Without the lime it’s not worth it.

Huh, I haven’t rated this yet.  Oh right, because I hate it.  It feels wrong to even pour this in a class.  Sigh.  Okay, pours the all-too-familiar straw golden color of macros.  About a finger of stark white head.  Aroma is light, almost not there, but what you do get is that sickly syrup smell.  Starts off with a bit of a straw taste with maybe a tiny amount of sweetness, that fades into a bitterness that ends with a God awful aftertaste.  Seriously, just terrible.

[330ml bottle at Copa of Reading] By quick-talking I managed to avoid the inevitable lime wedge so I could actually taste the beer.  Pours yellow-gold, white fizzy head.  Carbonation actually not too bad - this is very easy-drinking for a lager. Slight citrus taste up front, reasonable bitterness to finish.  Very bland and watery, but surprisingly crisp and refreshing.  Just an average lager really.  The lime is clearly a sales gimmick - there’s nothing to hide here, and nothing to enhance either.

okay, so it’s not always the greatest, but who doesn’t enjoy it on a hot day? it has to be ice cold and it has to be hot out. with that being said, that’s where my rating comes from. otherwise i’d never drink this because it doesn’t go good with any other predicament. oh yea, make sure you drink it with a slice of lime

I didn’t love or hate this one which I believe is the case with most people who’ve had it. It’s light and smooth without a lot of falvor &#40a lil’ corn-chippy lol&#41. I drank a pint and got a little buzzed though.

12 oz. bottle.  Another one that isn’t fun to rate or drink, but I had to get around to it at some point and just had one this weekend.  Weak corny, grainy aroma, and flavor is just as weak.  Very light and easy to drink.  Swallow your pride and use the lime, it makes it much better.

Standard lager, usually dished out with a lime wedge in top, taste is corny, cereal like, mild bitter finish but not hoppy at all.  Not good for a lager, the lime helps take the edge off the artificial taste.

Smells of corn and rye. Flavour is a skunky mix of alcohol and grain. Can detect a bud or two of hops. Light. Easy to drink one quickly, difficult to drink several. Leaves a bit of a gross rotten corn aftertaste. 



The beer is refreshing simply because it comes in a clear bottle. Low overall score because it is inconceivably expensive, given its quality.

Standard adjunct lager beer.

Light exposure gives the skunky flavor, which actually is balance out nicely by a wedge of lime.

Nothing special, nothing horrible. I’d drink it if you handed it to me, but I would not pay for it.

If I am going to drink fermented rice I would go for something with a little more flavor, or is that an oxymoron.
A great summer beer when cold. On its own there is no great flavor, but with added lime it tastes very refreshing. Drink it with hot dogs, burgers, or other bbq foods on a hot day.

Bottle.  Pale water pour.  White head.  Aroma is thin and quite adjuncty.  Sort of an overcarbonated, water bland lager.  Bitterness is barely perceptible, with maybe a bit of grassiness behind the corn.  Meh... nothing worth mentioning here.

Bottle. All around, in every aspect, I hate this beer. It smells like urine, it tastes like an old penny, and it appeals to the worst types of people in the world. I’d rather drink a glass of milk. This fluid is an affront to the word beer.

Straw yellow liquid, foam free, aroma of industrial fertilizer. Flavor: not really! After putting in the compulsary lime twist, that’s what dominates the beer making it work all right along with mexican food.
Overrated and expensive beer. Sold very often in Bars and Pubs all around Switzerland &#40world?&#41. That’s why so many people drink it, not because of the taste...
This beer is great!  Well, great if you like the taste of a skunk’s rear-end rubbed onto a pile of vomit filled with cream corn.
Yellow with a decent sized fizzy head that quickly recedes. Very light aroma and flavor. Thin.

Not much of an aroma from this beer. Appearance is not particularly nice either, too yellow. The beer is not flavorsome enough except that it is a bit sweet. Refreshing on a hot day and not bad with a bit of lime. Nothing special but it is OK.
A mediocre beer at best.  Very yellow in color.  Nothing overly distinct about it good or bad.  Best with lime.

12 oz. Bottle. Clearly not the worst beer I have ever tasted, but nonetheless, I find it extremely boring. Surprisingly a slice of lime will make it a little more exciting, but still not to the point where I would consider it good. There is no existing head that I have ever seen as it dissipates before I am done pouring it. the color is kind of like urine after a heavy night of drinking.
12 oz bottle. Pours a pale yellow with a tiny white instantly vanishing head. It has a skunky aroma. It has a skunky taste and tastes a little of hay. This is a fairly tasteless but refreshing beer.

A fine mexican made beer, with a very nice light yellow color. tasting refreshing, some kind of a differet taste than usual pale lager beers. try for something new, maybe with a slice of lime in the top :)

12oz can.  Pale yellow color.  Minimal head which is gone in a few seconds.  No real aroma other than grainy,sugary corn.  Very soda-like in it’s sugary carbonation.  There is a hint of toasty malt under there somewhere.  Maybe the slightest hint of factory-fresh hops in the aftertaste, but mostly an odd lemon-lime adjuncty schwagitude.  Captures none of the attributes of quality beer.  A crime against the beer world.

Bottle. After helping a friend move yesterday, I was drenched in sweat. Had not had a beer in days, so this actually tasted rather refreshing. While it is certainly not my favorite, I would take this over other major brands on hot summer occasions. After drinking so many big beers for so long, I don’t even really know how to describe this other than ’exceptionally LIGHT’.

Bottle, served in a botlle. Very similar to the Estrella: light yellow colour, not much smell (only light grainy notes, but quite OK). The difference from Estrella is in the taste: where Estrella has a good taste and no finish, the Corona starts without a taste - watery and some light grainy notes - but has a good grainy finish. Also artificial. Maybe this has to be served in a glass, also fort the Estrella, to give a better opinion overall on this one.

Au, contrere, mons freres! The Mexicans make the best mass market yellow beer on 2 continents. pours a clear bright yello, white short lived head from cold bottle. Faint aroma of malt with slight candy or sweet bread notes. More uncomplicated flavor of light malts than other yellow commercial beers. Distinct, but again, light, hops adds to the crisp flavor. Probably the great strength of Corona is the steady finish. No Road to Hell in this light beer.
Oh boy. Terrible even with a lime. Absolutely not worth the premium you’ll inevitably pay. Mexican beer is pretty poor but this takes the cake. Not even particularly refreshing.
Nothing but an overpriced swill.  Looks and smells like wee-wee.  What is the fascination with this stuff?  Maybe the slice of lime gives it some flavour?  Save your money and have a Bud.
In clear bottle @ local grocery store : golden in color , med carb, cook vegetables, low bitterness. Made for the beach.
Split several bucket-o-Corona’s with some Corona’s with some co-workers at Jack Astor’s.  Thank God for the limes that came with this or else I’d this is as bland and boring as it gets.

Ah, how to write a serious review of Corona Extra… that may just be scientifically possible, but I am going to give it the ol’ college try. One rare occasion of possible enjoyment is when hungrily snarfing the best fried shrimp in the world at Safe Harbor in Mayport, Florida. Their humble fish and shrimp shack on the river also offers the best fresh seafood cooked and fried to crisp golden perfection. The view can’t be beat, either. But I am deviating from the subject at hand, along with developing a mean craving for their fried shrimp.




He came to me one sunny afternoon a clear taxi-cab yellow that defies all natural laws of brewing. A white head disappears in a flash, opening up a nose sweetened with lemon juice, sweet hay, and sweet summer corn. A touch of key lime peeks in during the finish, but overall, very little to ponder over. I had to dig rather deep to gild what I did; a weakness I feel will carry over superbly to his body. (I mean, come on, it’s not as if this is my first Corona Extra, but it is my first one taking notes and without lots of lime to add flavor and refreshment.) Moving on, my first quaff is spritzy, bland, and watery. A couple more quaffs in and some faint sweet lemon and sweet corn makes a pathetically weak play for the flavor scene. The wisp of lime in the back of his nose is present in the finish, though just as dismally faint as everything else in his portfolio. Keeping the lime esters in mind, it then makes sense why lime wedges work so well with this thin cerveza “import”. A hard bitter lemon skin finish lingers on the top of my tongue far longer than I would like. Surprisingly, not a drain-pour, but then again, it was so thin and bland, it was more like drinking lemon-lime accented seltzer water than beer.




The next time I am at Safe Harbor I won’t be quaffing a Corona Extra with my deliciously golden fried shrimp. Thankfully, they have a few decent bottled beers to choose from for my quaffing and nibbling pleasure.
Coronita it-s a beer that should be considered a soda. I just drink it in summer when it is very hot outside, for me its like drinking a coke or something like that. Refreshing and nothing else
this is pretty much my least favourite beers. I cant even chug this stuff as the skunkiness is so gross. It smells like corn and tastes like vodka diluted with water. hardly any bitterness...yuch

Poured from a 12oz. bottle into a pint glass

The color is a very light yellow, clear, with a tiny white head that does not sustain long.

The smell is a very little grain smell but not very much there.

The taste was light some grain and a little floral hops.

This beers has it’s place but it’s usually with a lime and some salt and being sipped on a beach somewhere. Not strong, it’s real good on a hot day or a BBQ.
Just NO. Many of my friends think they’re cool because they have to buy a sack of limes when they buy this shite. Well they’re NOT cool, let me tell you.
Poured pale light with sufficient head.  Very smooth with little bitterness.  An excellent thirst quencher at the beach.

Bottle. Poured light yellow in color with a slight white head. The aroma had a hint of citrus and smell a little skunked. Mouthfeel was way light with very little carbonation. Tasted very watery and needed a slice of lime for flavor. Overall a refreshing brew on a hot summer day but nothing special.
Wow! I used to drink alot of this. The cost of lime must tell you something man, why, why drink this? Well when its hot and its this or US macro its great I guess.
Bottle with lime. 4.6%. Not my favourite mexican beer, but is enjoyable on a beach or a warm day. Needs the fruit to really be enjoyed, however. Pretty plain, clear, pale of pale lagers.
Despite the relatively high price, it’s just an average beer.  It only has a allure because its an import and there’s pretty good marketing with it.  Bland taste and short duration.

33cl bottle poured into a lager glass.  Looks like piss.  Smells like corn and skunk.  Barely tastes like anything.  Slightest hint of hops.  Doesn’t taste horrible, pretty much beer flavored water.  Slight hint of carbonation.  Very watery.  Thirst quenching.
(bottle) light yellow colour; not much flavour or aroma; I would have to be pretty desperate to drink this once more

I have tried this one many times every time it has been skunked and now I can write an honest opinion.... this beer is a very light beer in taste and aroma, I think that everyone puts the lime in to cover-up the skunk taste. I can’t say much about this overrated and underflavored beer. 
I had this beer again in Mexico it’s a lot better the closer you get to the source.
Boring beer, not much taste, cardboardish, very light, see-thru yellow. nothing to it.

Bottle w/ lime.

Small bit of foam on top of a light yellow.  Not too much to smell or taste really.  Goes down pretty well, mostly because it’s pretty thin, like water.  Decent beer for a hot summer day when your thirsty, but other than that, nothing special.  Wouldn’t go anywhere seeking for it.
You know the story--fairly typical, bland lager. Slight sweet flavor with a bit of cardboard. Not much else to it.

You know, it lacks a lot! Isn’t a great tasting beer - doesn’t taste like doodles, but it doesn’t acctually taste much. Kind of the ugly member of the gang (not the ugliest of pale lagers, though), and doesn’t do much in the mouth.

But it smells nice. Really. Came with a nuty scent that, for a while, made me hope. As already said, for a summer barbecue, great! To bad it’s quite expensive for what it offers.

bottle from summit beverage. Light yellow color. Aroma is grain. Taste is very light and refreshing. doesnt taste like mich but is nice for the summer. Not worth the money though. wish it was cheaper.

Straw, fine non-homogenious head.

 Pee aroma.

 Neutral flavor.

 Watery.

 Ok for summer - no character, bad aroma.

 Purchased in superbrugsen

this beer is an OK mexican beer. if you go to mexico, this ain’t shit there. i do agree that its definitly a beer for bbq-ing on a summer day. its not the best, but its good with a little pinch of salt and some lime.

Small lingering white foam. Light thinn yellow color. The aroma is not plesent with some canned corn and old dusty malts. Small malty taste that stays for a while but no bitterness. Small body no residual sweetness.

330 ml bottle. Finland.
Clear golden colour with thin white head.
Skunky hoppy aroma. 
Crispy hoppy flavour with hints of bitterness. Beats Sol clearly in parallel comparison.

Ah yes, gotta love that good old skunk smell.  The aroma is quite offensive but the flavor really isn’t BAD.... just extremely weak.  I guess no flavor is better than horrible flavor.  But yeah...Corona sucks.

Bottled.
Golden with white head. Aroma and flavor very weak of malt. Thin palate
Had to drink a few of these while golfing this last weekend - not sure what I hate more, golfing or drinking shitty beer.

Before I knew any better this was one of my favorite beers.  Now its just another run of the mill nothing.  I’ll drink it in Mexcio, although, I’d probably take a Pacifico, or maybe during the summer at the beach.

I always wondered if it was just a bunch of Mexicans standing around a big vat and pissing in it that made Corona..... that’s why everyone insisted, inside and outside Mexico, that I squish the lime into the Corona or help-you-god you’d dread ever letting your lips touch the bottle. Never poured this stuff - does anybody? It’s not a bad way to beat the heat though, but there’s nothing worth recommending here. More of a marketing phenomenon than a beer that has become successful because it’s good.

This beer’s awful, but you gotta hand it to ’em for the best marketing scheme ever.  Sure it tastes good when you’re on a beach or at a picnic (most beers do), but if you actually stop to think about the taste, it’s easily one of the most overrated beers on earth.  Bland, tasteless, no complexity, and nothing to keep me coming back.  Note: I do not put the lime in it, so whatever that means, factor it in.

Overall Impression: 
If you keep in mind that you should only be drinking this beer on a hot summer day outside at a BBQ/Tailgate/etc, it works.  It really serves its purpose there, and obviously its much better with a lime.  It’s cliche to take shots at Corona, so I’m not going to do it, just drink it in the situations where it fits, and stay away the rest of the time.

This may be a guilty plasure for me, but put a lime in it and this is one of the few lagers I can enjoy.

Just tried "Corona Familiar" out of the brown bottle which cuts down significantly on the skunky edge that the clear bottles cause.
Clear yellow with a slight oranging and thin fizzy white head. Aroma of stale corn and additives. Taste is more corn and standard macro lager tastes, metallic...it is what it is...

Cm’on guys!  Aren’t we being a bit harsh?  The graphics on the bottle are gorgeous.  The marketing campaign is sheer genius.  Spicy Mexican food deadens your taste buds anyhow.  What more do you f-ing want?  Seriously, though, despite MANY comments to contrary, it really *IS* refreshing on a hot day.  Moreover, by Third World beer standards, this is an easy 5.  Ever had a beer in Egypt, Morocco, Yugoslavia, Texas ... ?

Not bad when you’re thirsty. Does have a distinct taste so it’s too easy to call it watery. Had one today and thought it would be better. Maybe it’s like white beer, if you really need to add things like fruit or salt it probably isn’t a very good beer to begin with.

At a friend’s suggestion, drank with a slice of lime, which made the experience bearable.  Before adding the lime, I noticed a very thin but skunky aroma, after adding the lime I noticed lime.  Taste was watery and weak.  If it’s hot and you have limes, it’s drinkable, but I’d never recommend it.

I wouldn’t really call this "beer". A "beverage inspired by beer" would be more descriptive.
I can’t say that this beer was bad, as that would imply it had a taste.
Basically a beer for people who hate beer but want to show off.
Actually a nice beer that is different from many others. One that i definitely recommend. Ok with lime but drinkable without as well. Nothing quite like Corona.
the color is like a lot of other light beers. it is great with a slice of lime.
Flavor is somewhat bitter. Needs a lime to enhance the beer. A little watery. Can have a bit of sting every once in awhile.
tinny, crisp, light, grainy, lame. at least there is flavor there. Very little but there is some.

I’d add a few points, but this beer actually isn’t worth the effort.  Pours thin and watery with little head, has a light grain flavor.  Basically a light beer without the marketing.  Wouldn’t have disbelieved the rumor that it actually contains human urine (even though it was proven false!).  Honestly, this wasn’t even refreshing on a hot day.  I’d prefer water or lemonade...or good beer.

Thin and tepid yellow pour with an unimpressive head. Aroma is almost indistinguishable, and flavor is very poor, with extremely light flavor and nothing interesting or redeeming. Gets the job done if someone gives you one (or twelve) on a hot day, but wouldn’t ever buy it.
Drinkable.  Very thin, watery... but after a shot a tequila it’s liquid gold!

This beer gets a resounding.......Meh!

Just typing to fill up the character count...

Golden filtered appearance with white cap. Bring out the lemons or limes for this one because skunky phenols dominate. Aroma is otherwise mild sweet grass as is the flavor. Finish is abrupt and could be called crisp if it wasn’t so lacking in flavor. Watery, thin body and little substance mean this one is best served ice cold. Not my preferred Mexican beer.

Although this is a very thirst quenching beer on a hot summer day, I don’t think it should be ranked very high. The smell is skunky and the light watered down taste is very boring.
Not anything to write home about.
Average.

Granting that it is rare that I have ever consumed a Corona outside of a warm climate, maybe I cannot understand its apparent lack of appeal in the northern United States and Europe. This is a very refreshing beer, which given its origins should be  understandable, with a light, crisp flavor that is not overbearing or offensive. The flavor does lack complexity, but that is really not the game in this category. The aroma of the beer does not really do its flavor justice, I will admit, but it isn’t horrible. Overall, this beer accomplishes its objectives and hits the targets it aims for. An additional bit of information about Corona is related to the clear bottle: it has been explained to me that beer in clear bottles spoils faster than in tinted brown or green bottles because of exposure to light, and there does seem to be a cetain "skunkiness" that does seem to develop some of the time when it is purchased in a six pack as opposed to the twelve &#40presumably because the twelve pack bottles are fully enclosed in a box&#41. Having said that, many people I know seem to prefer the taste of Corona when it gets to that state, so it isn’t necessarily a bad thing.

Very light gold and a surprising one-inch cap was produced that had some good retention, it’s really not that bad looking of a beer. Skunk explosion erupted from the bottle when it was opened but seemed to die down a touch after sitting my glass for a while, lots of dark sour malts and rotten apple juice round out the rest of the aroma. On the first sip the first thing that comes to mind is egg yolk. This brew is very malty with no hops really show up until the beer warms up a bit and then they come across as moldy apples. Way too much carbonation for me it’s like trying to drink antacid pills, the beer seemed to finish with a sweet citrus to it. I truly under stand the need for the lemon wedge in this brew to give it some other flavor then the one it naturally has. But this was probably the best Corona I’ve ever had I guess this one was still relatively fresh compared to other times I’ve had it, over all it is very substandard but still drinkable only in an emergency situation
Unskunked, this is marginally better than an American macro. I can’t really claim that my opinion has nothing to do with the environment in which I typically drink it, though.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear yellow with a fading white head and an aroma of some malts and skunkiness. The flavour is very watered down and the flavour that is still left isn’t really nice. There’s some hoppyness I like, but it’s just far too weak. This should be forbidden by law.
A fine wash when you’re out of Margaritas and tacos. Cinco de Mayo would not be the same without it.

Pours a pale yellow with a small fizzy head. Aroma is pretty skunky... Mmmmm sexy impractical clear bottle. Even the nose is acidic. Grass and apple show on the nose as well. Tastes, well pretty bad. Grass, sour, acidic, skunky taste. Forced carbonation. I think I need a lime wedge and about 10 degrees Celsius hotter outside to make this beer even approach enjoyable. Funny story about this beer. The clear glass bottle was chosen originally by Modelo because it was cheaper and they didn’t care about this beer. Well I don’t care much about this beer either.

bottle. They call this a ’beer’ but I’d call it more a ’cocktail’. You have to drink it from the bottle and they put a lemon in the only gate you can smell the beer. So: smell: lime (because it was a lime in my bottle). It’s a very nice refreshing drink but not a beer in my opinion. But I’ll have to rate it because they call it a beer.
Pretty weak flavoured watered down beer.  The only way I enjoy this beer is outside on a patio during a hot day and somebody buys it for me.
I’ve done this review with a lime jammed in the bottle because to review this without is just cruel. I also have to make the minimum 150 characters. Nice lime taste.

Many points deducted for it’s ridiculously high price here in Australia. Weak as a dead kitten though inoffensive, the lemon in the bottle thing pisses me off, good beer shouldn’t need that! Have had it on a 42 degree Celsius day and it was great then, otherwise don’t bother unless it’s free.
Pours golden amber that just looks dysfunctional.  No head on there at all.  Tastes kind of skunky but that is the way it is.  Light bodied.  Drink if it is free.

Smells of sour grains, pours a light gold color, with a little bit of white head which dies quickly, no lacing. Taste is kind of skunky... like watered down grains, a bit of hops, and some alcohol notes. Not a fan!
Enjoyed this beer in bottle with lime wedge. Aroma is skunky, but has genuine cervaza taste and goes great with lime especially on a hot day!
Not much of anything to say about this. I guess it’d be refreshing if you’re at the beach on a hot day..............

Pours clear pale yellow with almost no head. Aroma is light. The beer has that cheap smell.  Flavour is very light and unimpressive. Almost no palate. It is very smooth crisp and refreshing. I I think it would be great on a beach in Mexico. But, I’m not in Mexico and this beer sucks.

Goes great with a lime on a hot day in Arizona!
Average carbonation.
Pale yellow color.
Crisp and refreshing.
Slight citrus taste.

Bottle.  I have had this beer several times, but am just getting around to rating it.  Pours a golden yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma is really skunky.  Pale malts and hops kind of come out.  The flavor is very watered down, but kind of refreshing cold.  As it warms, throw it out.  Not by any means a good beer, but cit can be refreshining on hot summer day.

I like beer, but come on.... This is probably the worst beer I’ve ever had when you consider bang for your buck. Why anyone would pay $14 for a 12 pack of this swill is beyond me. It is pale yellow with a nasty skunky aroma. Skunk is all I get from the aroma and the taste, maybe a little corn. There are just so many better and cheaper choices out there, I can’t ever see myself choosing this one again. I like all beer... but this is the closest thing to a drain pour that I’ve had.

unimpressive club/party beer, but better than other economies.  

Take it in the bottle + lime in the neck, gives it a bit extra flavor.  While I’m not chugging this, I can tolerate several bottles before getting bored.

The Corona 12 oz bottle courtesy of the latest family party. This beer is ayellowish clear hue, a little darker than piss, typical white carbonated head that dissipates to nothing. Aromas are typical graininess, corn as a featured adjunct. Light, smooth, definitely sessionable and quenching, the brew features more skunk than nost due in large part to it’s clear glass. Finish is bland, with some skunk. A mediocre macro lager, I’d prefer most over this, but the lime and salt can make this a nice alco-pop in the summer months.

Sweet, mom’s having a corona so I can rate it.  Should go well with my chips and salsa.  Piss-pale and clear.  Bubbled, little head.  Cloyingly sweet aroma with a bit of pepperiness and citrus.  Exceedingly carbonated.  Weak but not a bad finish.  It’s not the worst mass-market beer,  but definitely much better with a lime
Light clear beer with very sweet taste. Yes I could drink 8 of them on a beach and no I don’t really want to.

Pours golden with little to medium head; aroma is reminiscent of citrus with a little skunk. Flavor is initially bitter then watery, but does manage to finish smooth. Overall, unless you have some limes or it’s Cinco de Mayo, you’re better off saving your money, as this import tends to be more and more expensive the further north you go.

Golden pour with little foam, good coloring and smells citrusy (even before my lime).  Mild hops with a pale light taste, slightly sweet and crisp with a mild grain aftertaste.  Stellar with chips and guacamole or mexican food, otherwise its just kind of blah after the first one.

Left in the bottle with a lime thrown in on Cinco de Mayo. The first couple sips were actually very good. Slightly sour and balanced the tastes of lime and beer pretty well. After those first couple of sips though, it just got worse and worse. It turned into a struggle to finish it by the time I was nearing the end. Not one of my favorites.

Poured poolside into a plastic cup. Turned down the lime and salt.
Pours a very pale straw yellow. I mean, this beer poured paler than the guy from Minnesota laying across the pool form me.

Small foamy head, leaves a baby halo. No Lace.

Taste is slightly offensive. Something is gross, not sure what it is. Tastes like their malts are stored in an old shoe.

330 ml bottle. Pale golden body with a small and diminishing white head. Not much aroma here. The body is thin and watery and the flavor is weak grainy with just a hint of bitterness, no aftertaste. It’s possible to say it’s light and refreshing, but I honestly could not have much of a boring beer like this. But there are actually no off flavors and I have tasted a lot worse beers than this as well.
12 oz bottle... for cinco de mayo... man this stuff is piss.... only 2 bucks a bottle tho.... what a waste of 2 bucks

Light golden color...fluffy head, with decent lacing.  Mildly hopped aroma that is pretty consistent with the style.  Very light malt flavor up front, with just a touch of citrusy sweetness...slightly crisp mouthfeel.  Notes of citrus from the front continue in the back.  Finish is somewhat tart.  This brew ranks between styles...not even comparable to a classic European pilsener, yet much better than your typical light lager.
This beer is only nice when it is ice cold and you are dying of thirst. Lime needs it to go down more easy.

Bottle found while cleaning out NickTheElders fridge, shared with JoeTheYounger.  Pours an ultra clear filtered piss color.  Aroma is skunk roadkill on the highway and new tires.  Tastes like piss in the rain gutter with soggy bread.  Palate is thin and watery, but at least the carbonation is nice.  One of the worst beers ever made and it’s a mystery why so many people like it.
Sampled at the pre-Cinco de Mayo tasting at Blacklick Wine and Spirits on 5.1.09.  Clear gold with a big white head.  Lager yeast and skunky hop aroma.  Same flavor.
Pour from a 24 oz clear bottle. Weak skunky aroma. Pale pissy color. Little flavor. Watery and thin in the mouth. Over rated. Over priced.
Appearance of apple juice with a small head around the rim. Smells like I hit a skunk running across the road. Taste of funky butt loving piss water. Its like water with added color and skunk-ass.

Yellow color.
Strange aroma.
Bland taste.
Not a huge fan, though refreshing if really cold and with a lime.
Yellow colour, no head. Aroma of malt and citric notes. The flavour is malts, corn and some fruits. Light-bodied and some bitterness in the finish.

Bottle. Yellow with small head. Not a nice smelling beer, maybe like stale bread. taste is about the same. If you are already drunk, on the beach, and have a lime it may be tolerable (but just because of the beach!).

can drink these when I have to, but other than that you can get much better beer for the same price...you need a lime to add flavor come on...only drink this if your stuck in the Baja Desierto in Mexico...
Over-hyped, too expensive. Maybe if I had a preppy Latina girlfriend with a preppy Latina father I would buy this beer again...but until then I will drink what I like. And its not Corona.
Clear bottle, no head, no taste, water like in effect,  chlorinated water has more on this.
Bottle 33 cl. Apperance; Yellow, clear with a minimal white head. Aroma; almost none. Flavor; almost none, juice, water.

Ok, I have beef with this shit.  They charge you an arm and a leg for a sixer of this piss and the only tolerable way to handle it is by liming it.  If you need to put a lime in a beer to make it drinkable, you beer sucks.  And Corona my friends, SUCKS ASS.  But hell, if I am ever in Mexico and I have to chose between this and water, I will take this for fear of Montazuma’s Revenge.

I must admit that I have probably drunk a hundred of gallons of this stuff over the years, so it is only fitting to actually take a minute to rate it (without a lime, and I really think the lime does help this beer). Aroma of light grains with a slight corny grassiness. Clear light straw golden. Big white head that collapses quickly. High carbonation. Flavor is slightly light grain and slightly skunked corn. Finish is dry with just a hint of bitterness. Nice refreshing and pretty good really ice cold on a hot day after working in the yard.
this beer is not good the only way to make it even tolorable is with a lime
An overrated beer that isnt anything special but better than the light variety. not much taste or aroma.

(bottle, no lime). Pours a yellow color. Large white colored head, with minimal to moderate lacing. Aroma of alcohol and grass. Taste of light alcohol, grass, and very light citrus.  Smooth and watery finish. High carbonation.

Pours pale gold with a thin, fizzy white head that has no retention. Aroma is cheap malt, rotting wet grass and some hay. Flavor is about the same with an overly sweet malt profile and a little straw. Finish is slighltly grassy and seltzer water. Palate is thin, with an apropriate carbonation level and a neutral finish, oddly sticky on the lips though. Overall, this beer suck, worse than most U.S. macro-light beers at a semi-premium price, a ripoff. Everyone who likes this beer seems to say, "Oh its awesome with a slice of lime." Bullshit! that is a waste of a good lime, basically makes this stuff taste like a wine cooler watered down with river water.
Same as carib. Another summer beer. Not worth the money. Too light and easy.

This has a taste not far from the likes of keystone.  This beer does offer quite a bit of refreshment, much the same way that a cold glass of water does.  The one thing I liked about it was the lack of offensiveness, as many beers may offer taste, but too much bitterness.  This has neither.

better than most cheap swill lagers, but still, not good. I’ll take it over a bud or miller or coors anyday, but otherwise, ugh.
watery. no flavor.
I drank this shit everyday for 7 days straight on my cruise. No other fluid. Full of water flavor with a hint of lime from the lime. Good swill.

This really isn’t a very good beer.  I’ve been drinking it for the better part of two decades.  The only good thing about it is its appearance.  And really, what beer doesn’t look fantastic?  Thin, watery, skunky...this is a "lets get drunk" beer.

Bottle. Pours a nice golden color with a decent size off-white head. Smell is just awfull... skunky.  Taste isn’t much better. Corn and funky aftertaste. Needs a lime to even be passable... Even so this beer has always been my choice when nothing decent is available.

Another beer that I can’t stand.  It is very weak on taste and has a very skunky aroma (more so than Miller High Life, which is famous for skunkiness).  I can think of SIX Mexican Beers that are better than this swill.  Truthfully, a slice of lime doesn’t help much.

Some odd bitter to go with the odd metal flavors.  Better than nothing, but not good.  Tried it without lime for rating purposes, but going forward, this beer needs all the flavor it can get so add all the fruit you want.

Pours a nice golden brown with enough head.  Aww come on, this is a decent session beer that is readily available.  I can buy it, buy some lime, and everyone I know will drink it.  That is a good thing and deserves an adequate rating for it.

[Look]: Pale straw color with almost no head. 
[Smell]: Very skunky aroma, corn.  Just awful! 
[Taste]: Very thin and watery. I can taste corn and rice.  Has a nasty dirty water after taste. 
[Overall]: Awful beer!!  I rather drink Bud than this awful piss!!

Pale gold beer with basically no head. The beer has a stale aroma. Flavor is about as stale as the aroma.  I would rather drink a Coors Light than this beer.  About 20 years ago it was my favorite beer.  Times have changed my friends.
Typical light beer, light color with slight bitter taste.  Memories of drinking beer before I developed taste buds.
Generic light straw pour. Decent hop aroma. Mild, very slight bitter. Tastes better than a Budweiser.
This is a good beer for a hot day or lounging on the beach. It’s crisp and refreshing and is good with a bit of lime. This is not a connoisseur type beer and should not be judged on that basis.
Not my favorite Mexican beer, but a decent one at that.  A must have with lime.
We all have had corona and we all know it sucks. There are way better beers out there in the same style. I wouldn’t even drink this garbage on the beach. This is toilet water.
A bottle from local market. Pale head fast disappearing. Pale hey coloured. Mild soft nose. Mild taste. Some hoppiness.
Liquid piss in a bottle, it is barely and I do mean just barely drinkable if you put a lemon in it. Absolutely apalling how popular this swill is in this country.

Pale golden colored beer with a small thin head. The beer has a subtle malty aroma with hints of rice malt. Flavor is very boring but actually with very slight whiskeymalt hints. No complexity at all though. An OK beer for its purpose; introducing people to malt beverages.
Diluted fizzy watery malt beverage better describes this drink than beer. It’s so thin, I wonder why it’s labeled "extra".
Light yellow with a small white head. Aroma is of grain and weak. Taste is bland.
