Poured or in the bottle you can see that the beer is a pale yellow - nothing hidden here.  Aroma is lime - because that is the only way this beer is drinkable - by sticking a lime in it.  Fine with your standard Mexican fare or standing over the grill if you you don’t have anything else cold to beat off the heat.
Mexican donkey piss.  any beer that you have to add more lime then beer is not worth drinking.

This beer is light yellow in color with very little aroma. A lightly favored beer with no after taste. A lime wedge is a must for this beer. A slice of lime brings life to this brew. It can be refreshing in the hot summer months.
The beers is served in clear glass bottle... kind of says it all! Thin and watery..... after the rating I put a slice of lime in to give it some flavour.
Out of a bottle [several times]. Light in color, light in taste. Excellant with Mexican food.

710 mL bottle. Pours a pale yellow with a scant, fizzy white head that quickly dissipates into a film on the surface, leaving some lace on the sides as it is sipped. The carbonation is quite lively. The aroma is a light mix of malt, corn husk, hay, and a subtle accent of yeast. A light-bodied beer, the taste is like a light mix of malt and corn with no bitterness and no aftertaste to speak of. Not that impressive for the price it sells for. A wedge of lime is what really makes this beer drinkable. Strictly a summertime beach beer. Disclaimer: this assay was done without a wedge of lime.
Skunky yellow beer in a clear bottle that tastes a little better than it smells.
Pale yellow, extreme bubbles, diminshnig head with aroma of grass and low malts, very watery, flavor is boring, mainly hoppy with some malt in the aftertaste. Might be refreshing.

Blaskig. Vattnig. Utspädd. Välj själv, eller hitta på en egen synonym. Långt ifrån odrickbar, men våldsamt anonym. Passiv i sin framtoning. Hade önskat mer attack, mer beska, mer fyllighet. Mer av allt, helt enkelt.
This is closer to being water than beer but I would much rather have a Corona than a Bud or a Miller.  Ice cold with a lime. On the beach. Sure, I’ll drink a few from time to time.
Pale yellow color, medium bodied white colored head. Leaves no aftertaste. Best served with a wedge of lime.
12oz bottle and can.  Light color, light aroma, light flavor and it tastes a lot better with a lime.  Is one of the better mexican macros for summer drinkin.

Light gold, tiny pale head. Plastic, alcoholic and sweetish pineapple nose. There’s not much here to hide that booziness.  Flavor shows quite a lot of alcohol, sweet corn, some solvents. Tastes more than Sol, but it ain’t defitely all for the good.

Bottle

The only reason I rate this one a 2.3 is because I really like it with a lime. Something about it brings out a nice smooth flavor. However the beer alone is not very good at all. I’d probably rate it a 1.5 or so, maybe SLIGHTLY more, but not by much. A yellow pour with an almost non-existent head. A bit of skunky taste but not too much, a little bit of corn and grain as well. Again nothing special, but the drinkability increases dramatically when a lime is thrown into the mix.

Unbelievable that most people in the US consider this a "premium" beer.  It’s one of the worst there is.  Yellow urine-like color with thin white head.  Flavor of corn, grain, and adjunk.  Awful without a lime.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a wimpy, thin head of poor duration, over a  clear pale yellow body.....nose of faint hops and corn.....tastes minimally of mild malts amd mild hops with a bit of bitterness lingering in the mouth....mouthfeel is very light and watery. This meets the style of a "pale lager" almost perfectly. It is a style that is easy to dislike.
botle, without lime, really  awfult taste. a strange spicy sweetnes which is disgusting bascially.
12 oz bottle.  Poured a clear gold color with a thin white head.  The aroma and flavor are grainy.  This is a great beach beer.

Drank from the bottle at a local mexican joint complete with a lime wedged in.  Aroma is lime.  With perhaps a litte bit of mexican piss added for good measure.  Mouthfeel is more mexican piss.  Tastes like mexican piss with some lime added.  Overall a nice brew from our neighbors to the south.  Disclaimer:  I have never really tasted real Mexican piss.  Just imagine this is what it must taste like.
Bottle - No point in pouring as there is no aroma dn no head.  Light flavour, neds the lime to give it a chance.
I hate this stuff.  The smell is pungent and skunked, I mean it just stinks!  The flavor is not enjoyable.  Minimal grain flavor along with a very thin head.

Sadly I have to rate this. Bottle. If tasted like a normal beer rather than a chique drink with a lime stuffed up the bottle, it pours a piss pale yellow with high carbonation and little to no head. No retention and no lacing. Aroma is skunked malt all the way with sweet corn and hay. Taste is watery with some faint citrus (maybe I’m trying to taste the lime that is badly needed) but is mostly corn and cereal grain. Clean finish. Not bad for a beach beer to go along with spicy food. But that does not mean that this is in anyway good.

Name: Corona Extra

Date: November 01, 2008

Mode: Bottle

Source: Tasting, Cellar Party

Appearance: pale gold, wispy white head, bits of lace

Aroma: sweet corn aroma with a green apple bonus, light floral hops

Flavor: sweet corn flavor, long bitter finish with a touch of astrengency

Aroma: 2/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 3/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 5/20

Rating: 1.6/5.0
Drinkability: 5/10

Score: 4
Bottle. Poured fizzy and yellow. Nothing more then a beer for the beach. Very light in flavor. Better with a lime.
330 ml bottle in Germany. Like most pale lagers this should have been put back in the horse. True crap to the end. Not even worth talking about.

Appearance: Light golden. Clear. Small bubbles. Fizzy white head.
Aroma: Some malt and fruit. Yeast.
Taste: A bit watery. Some malt and fruit. Boring, but not bad.
Info: 330ml bottle, 10/1-2009

Corona pours an apple juice hue with a slight head that quickly dissipates. There’s a fair amount of carbonation and no hops or bitterness (makes for an exceedingly easy beer to guzzle). Not much flavor to speak of - perhaps malt and grass. There’s a reason why people add a lime slice. What flavor there is leaves without saying goodbye. Only if you are really thirsty on a summer day and want a beer would I recommend a Corona.
very easy drinking, with a  refreshing flavour, not a great tasting beer but a nice beer to have  on a hot day  chilled and with a slice of lime.

Rated in the Nelson sun with sdriessen. Pours pale golden, white fizzy head. A sweet aroma with a bit of yeast, hop and hay. A nice clean flavour. Sweet with yeasty hay like hops. There is a little bit of citrus fruit. A nice session beer for a hot Nelson day (with a lime slice in the neck!).

Bottle. Corona actually doesn’t taste bad. Light hints of citrus/lime... or maybe it’s just because it always being served with this on the pubs. Think of it as as soda and it will be probably feel quite refreshing a warm summer day - on the other hand ice cold tap water with some lime in it will probably not be that faraway from this.
Pours fizzy with big white head which disappears quickly. Piss yellow colour. Thin watery body with big corn flavours. Corn aroma. Is Ok if you are eating Mexican food.
Pours fizzy and pale yellow.  Lots of adjunct i.e. corn.  Very watery, lacks substantial malt and hops flavor.

Clear yellow, with a small white foam. 
fizzy carbonation, watery, corn.
This beer is marketed as a Sun Beer, and it is that correctly.

(Bottle at office party at the beginnin of November 2008) Very pale piss like colour. Very light palate with high carbonation. Hardly any taste, the only flavour comes from the slice of lime pushed into the bottle. This is no beer. Yuck.

Very pale golden colour, nice carbonation. 
Hay yeast nose with some hops.
Simple, mainstream flavour with a hint of lime and straw malt. 
Gassy on the palate with almost zero bitterness. Quite watery.
Finishes with a hint of hops. Nice when the weather is hot and the beer is very cold.
Pours a light crystal clear golden. Metallic,  synthetic taste. Horrible unless your somewhere really hot and crave something cold with alcohol. D

Clear yellow with a slight oranging and thin fizzy white head.  Aroma of stale corn and additives.  Taste is more corn and standard macro lager tastes, metallic.  Posterboy for the term glorified Budweiser.

very pale goldern colour, very little head. not much aroma or taste, almost a shandy in taste. not much of a beer but still drinkable in bulk on a very hot day with mates all drinking the same beer/water. more for good times than taste.

Bottle. Pours very pale yellow with sticky white head. The aroma is skunk, corn, a sharp soapy note, and a little bit of salt. The flavor is lots of corn. Not much else. Once in a while there is the twang of rotting fruit or the dull bitter of papery hops, but mostly just corn.
Bottle. Beautiful clear yellow colour with very small white head. Maiza aroma and also characteristic maize flavour, otherwise quite ordinary.
Pale yellow with no head. Aroma...um is this beer? Cardboard flavour, watery and lime. Oh wait the lime flavour was from the actual piece of fruit placed in the bottle...
A great beer for a hot day or after a long day at work or outside.  it has a skunky bite to it that is actually kinda good.
Bottle.  Faint hoppy aroma.  Pale golden body.  Watery, bland, almost no flavor at all.
Piss.  OK, chilled piss.  Any beer you have to stick bits of fruit into should not be classed as beer.  This is truly awful.
330ml bottle. Poured very poorly - no head at all. Taste is okay - sweet aroma but not much else.
330 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pale yellow, watery.  Little aroma and not much flavour.  Corn flavour prominent.

Bottle.A very pale gold/yellow color,thin head.Aroma of corn,cat feet,and hay. Flavor is very watery,kind of a skunky band aid taste, thin mouthfeel,funky finish. I could see drink this if you were really loaded allready but I’ll pass

12 ounce bottle pilfered from a party. I cracked a Dark Lord at this party and I end up with a Corona? Huh? Pours the ubiquitous very pale golden with a thin, fizzy head, almost cola-like in retention and no lacing to speak of. Grainy and grassy aroma with light skunk. Skunky, grainy taste with corn and other adjuncty notes. Thin-medium bodied.
Bottle. Nothing much to say about this one, except that there’s nothing too much worth the saying. Poor fare.
Uhhh my girlfriend loves this, and i have no clue why.  It is disgusting.  If you want a decent mexican beer go with modelo negra or dos equis this is just bottled bull piss....

Appearance: Pours a clear, appropriately corn-colored, yellow body with a thin, white head.

Smell: Blend of light pale malts and white corn tortilla chips with a very, very minor yeast note.

Taste: Corn and light pale malts with a mild sweetness. Very light hop bitterness. Tiny kick of yeasty sourness. Finishes relatively clean.

Mouthfeel: Light-bodied. Medium carbonation.

Drinkability: Mostly harmless. Eh, it’s not a great, classic lager, but I will say I have tasted far, far worse.

Bottle.  Never bothered pouring it into a glass because the bottle it comes in is probably the best way to drink this beer.  Maybe its the fad thing, but it works.  Tastes sweet malty, just a good well rounded beer as far as drinkability, flavor, and affordablity.  The lime works, but not neccesary.  Definately a fad, but good.

I can not believe I have no rating for such an accessible beer.   
Clear, 12oz bottle.  Clear piss yellow appearence.  Nice skunky hop aroma.  Aroma of a fresh Czech Pils.  Flavor of very light malt, well balanced with a smooth crisp hop.  Surprisingly enjoyable, not really.  Better than I was expecting.
Not a bad beer....not a great beer......honestly...this would be a beer if I was out on a summer day at the beach or someplace really warm....but you gotta have the lime......
This pours pale yellow with a small white head and some corn taste but a lot of water.  It is a little bitter with acidic taste.

12oz bottle from the LCBO
Pale yellow with a small white head
worse than i remembered 
avoid at all costs
This beer is so delicious when its cold and you are chillin in a sunday afternoon. VIVA MEXICO
Clear yellow colour, very little head, slight skunk aroma, not much taste, not too bad though.
A tasteless beer, with almost no aroma, a dissapointing lager, for mexican beer i’ll keep the cucapa beer.

clear yellow color, quickly disappearing head, no lacing.  aroma of musty corn.  flavor is also mostly corn with  a hint of grainy after taste.  watry mouth feel, musty finish.  not a very good beer, but i have drunk a ton of this stuff, especially at mexican all-inclusive resorts.  i guess anything tastes good when you get out of chicago to a tropical paradise in january.
bottle, clear gold, slight foam, nose is sour, flavor is skunky soapy corn, finish is sour

Not good. A fine example of why democracy does not work in practice - this vile liquid is one of the most popular beers on the planet. That should make anyone despair at the state of humanity. Pallid yellow in colour. I would not know what kind of head it has, as I drank from the bottle - trust me, it’s not worth soiling a glass. Watery and flavourless. Appalling.
Clear yellow with no head at all. Sweet malty flavor with a skunky aroma. OK if there is nothing else to drink.

Bottle. pours a a deep yellow colour, no head. The taste is a little bitter and acid. 
Not very good.
Pale yellow with a small head. Not much aroma, maybe rice and corn. Watery mouthfeel with no finish to mention.

12oz bottle, courtesy of mom-in-law.  Pours a clear, medium copper-golden color; thin white head with decent retention and lacing.  Skunk and basic sugar and lemony fruitiness in the aroma; bland and skunked, with a passable sweet maltiness underneath.  Medium mouthfeel: toasty malts, mild skunkiness, and basic sugary notes; well-carbonated, drinkable, and not overly repulsive; some skunk and a very basic toasty, sweet core.  It is what it is, and I’ve had a lot worse.

Clear golden liquid with small white head. Faint grainy aroma, and somewhat skunky. Without a lime the flavor really is pretty boring and bad, would normally be a "drain pour" brew, but I’ll be generous since it is moderately refreshing here under the sun in St. Thomas with a lime in it.

The only reason I gave this a 2 overall, is because it is pretty good on a hot day. But by any measure, this is a macrobrewed garbage beer. It’s a very pale yellow, with bleached white head. It’s very skunky, and I’m not sure why it’s typical to add a lime garnish, other than to maybe mask the flavor a bit. Cheers!
bottle. has a very skunky smell and the taste isnt much better. it may be better with a lime but i refuse to put a piece of fruit in my beer.

Bottle. aroma is grainy and sweet, the head is white with a light yellow sparkling body. The flavor is bitter and a little acetic i think. Not that great but if i was to rate it with a lemon or lime it would probably be a 2.5
great summer beer, especially with that lime.  Can have a nice bite to it if its not freezing cold, overall its pretty standard beer

Almost bright yellow, a little chill haze, and a spot of fizzy white head that doesn’t last at all. 

Husky with a touch of corn sweetness. A bit of a sulfur aroma without being skunked to high hell. 

A bit of tinniness. Thin, and lacking much for substance. Graininess and a bittersweet - almost sour finish; rather astringent. Pretty unpleasant. 

Prickly and slick... but with enough body to leave a bit of a residue behind. In this case, it’s not a particularly good thing.

There are far better lawnmower beers for better prices. Not a very good beer, and not something to allow to warm even in the slightest!
I had the 3.2% version.  Light, sort of skunky, bland, eh...this is barely better than not drinking beer.
Without a lime, it’s not a good beer. The color is weak and the taste is lacking and is almost bitter. Like I sad, unless you’re throwing a Cinco de Mayo party, I wouldn’t go near it.

Consumed from the bottle, without the benefit of a lime.  Some carbonation, but very little else going on.  Something sour was going on in what little taste it had; fortunately, it faded away almost instantly.

Even among Pale Lagers and other American Macros, this beer blows.  The appearance is the familiar urine yeloow.  The aroma is like a pale lager, with the malty sweetness, corn, rice and other adjuncts thrown in, but is also noticeably skunked.  The flavor is a similar to, but a sour, spoiled version of Bud, Coors, or numerous other Macros.  The palate has nothing distinguishable.  In a bad style, this tends to be on the low end.

I don’t understand the hype among most people with this beer.  It tastes like skunky bud light and adding a lime dumbs down the little bit of flavor that is there.  They really should get away from the clear glass, and invest in a real recipe.

I cant even fathom why they ever made a light beer after taking one sip of this...  I would much rather have this than most american macros, but that isnt saying much about its quality... I put a lime in after trying the first few transparent sips... I like lime, i like beer, but a good ipa and some guacamole with a hint of lime this does not compare to...

Bouteille transparente de 330 ml. La bière est de couleur paille très claire et possède une mousse blanche fugace. Au nez on respire des arômes de maïs, de céréales sucrée avec des effluves métalliques. En bouche le corps est mince avec une effervescence moyenne. On goûte des saveurs de céréales au départ suivit par une amertume métallique.
Light, crisp, weak.  The lime is for flavor.  Slight hops and grasses.  Not very enjoyable.
Weak, watery, light, not even tolerable without a lime.  I think Corona did very well with this beer considering how very indistinguishable it is from other pales.

Bottled. Pours the color of straw with a medium white head that dissipates quickly. No real aromas to speak of. Needs a lime to have any flavor, but with out a lime you get the taste of grass and faint hops. Not good.
Nothing special in this beer just the classic lager flavor, not bad not good
Cerveja muito fraca e sem personalidade. Quase sem aroma, e o sabor é muito tênue. Pra matar a sede apenas.

Bottle shared with a friend. Heard so much about it and always avoided it until this week. Granted, the lime probably helped. Very weak an watery. Consistency was very thin and flavourless. Water with a hint of hops at most. It wasn’t horrible (probably because of the lemon), but it wasn’t good either.

Bottle. Piss yellow, smells like you won’t enjoy it, tastes like it also, but add a lime and the dimension changes slightly. Inviting bottle reminds me of drunken BBQs. If that’s all that’s available you’ll live.

bottle. didn’t know what to expect. the comments that I read weren’t positive. just drank this out of a glass without a lime or lemon to chance the original taste. pours a light clear yellow colour with small head. bad aroma and almost no taste. no aftertaste. watery. beer is refreshing but in overall I didn’t like the beer.

Just not happening! Should be called a lame ale instead of a pale ale. Anyways pours golden with a extra fast disappearing head. Taste Mexican spring water with a slight bitter end. Overall it doesn’t taste like crap, but then again it doesn’t really taste like anything.

One of the most unpleasant beers i’ve tried. Its very metallic and corny. Doesn’t do much to mask those tastes either. Finishes off with a bad after taste. Need much more than a lime to make this drinkable.

Do i have to rate this one??? Im Mexican and in the past i believe what i saw in the tv "Corona.... the best beer in the world" What a liiiiiieeeeeeeeerrrsssss!!!
[EYES] looks lihe a bad juice of orange
[nouse] cero!
[mouth] fresh... fresh and fresh! mmm do i drink water???

i hope soon Modelo back in the good formula to make REAL beers

This is one of the worst beers i have ever tried, I can not understand how people like. It tastes like nothing.
This is famous because most americans like it, beacause most of they do not know much about beer, except for Bud Light haha, which is eve worse than Corona
Extra? Extra what? This is like Corona light, with more bad taste. Stay away... far, far away.

Mexican piss water.  You don’t drink this beer you rent it.  Lime or no lime it’s trash.  If you’re not supposed to drink the water when you go to Mexico why pay to export Mexican flavored water?  What a waste unless you want to get some young hotties wasted!

Bottle. Very popular amongst self-proclaimed trendy people in Holland. Very corny and watery lager, rather sweet, no real flavours. It doesn’t offend me (no skunky flavours), but I’d rather drink something else.

To top off my crappy mexican beer experience in Cabo San Lucas, I thought I would rate the arguably most famous Mexican beer! Pours with a Murky - clear yellow hue with a small white head that is mostly diminshing. The aroma is of grain, yeast, and some hops. I smell some light pineapple scent in it as well - not much though. 
Flavor is extremely waterey, and a tad bit bitter on the way down. 
Light on the palate with lively cabonation. 
This was bottled as Corona Familar! Same waterey Corona - different alias!

Drank from a bottle.  The faint whiff of skunkiness upon opening the bottle was not encouraging.  The flavor was mostly water, some skunkiness, and if I concentrated really hard, a whisper of hops.  Watery is good here, because if the flavors were more concentrated, they would be more offensive.  There are plenty of other beers one can find at the local supermarket that I find far more refreshing at the beach.
Classic.  Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Fusce consequat amet.

Ahh, brings me back to the days when this was the “classy beer.”  I was in High School, and Corona was the cool thing to drink.  I still won’t rag on this brew too hard.  Flavor is on the weak side, with a bit of malt, bread, and corn.  Appearance of this beer is two-sided:  classic corona elegant bottle shape and label, but the beer is the color of dehydrated piss.  Without a lime, there is really nothing that attractive about drinking a Corona.  With a lime, this becomes a tolerable summer drink for a hot Hawaiian evening.
Pale yellow with a small white head, some lacing. Skunk aroma, tastes soapy, corny, metallic, and bitter. From a glass, no lemon or other masking devices. Hard to finish the 12 ounce bottle.

I recently had a conversation in a bar while sipping whiskey with a person about drinking preferences. He was holding a corona bottle with a lime wedged in his hand and proclaimed that he is  a beer drinker. I disagreed.

...bottle.  Nothing special here.  Yellow, clear, no head.  Smooth, watery, metalllic with a dry finish. Over-priced, not worth it, but for some reason people think so. Must be drank with a lime if you want any flavor.

12 oz bottle, drank at a BBQ.  Clear gold, with a small off white head.  Aroma is light corn and a touch of malt- not anything else really.  Taste: light (of course) with light corn and gets metallic.  Not much to say about a beer that you have to put a lime in to make it tolerable.

Lets start off by saying that this crap is not worth the money, EVER !

You know there is something wrong with a beer you almost HAVE to have a lime in it because it’ll taste like deer piss otherwise.

A Splash of Barardi O with this stuff is A bit better then lime, but would i ever buy this crap, no way, unless a had to hop a fence / cross a river getting chased by La Megra. . .

From the bottle, as intended (no lime).  Clear gold, with a funky, astringent aroma.  Flavor is sweet, but not particularly interesting.  Palate is acceptable.  Overall this is a run-of-the-mill beer, but a highly refreshing one at that.
Sweet and boring. A "so what" beer. usually served with a lemon in the neck, which complements it somehow, but still, not very exciting at all.

Bottle - no lime. Pours clear yellow with a medium head. Bit malty flavour and a little hops. Flavour is the same. Best thing to say about this beer is the big hole in the top of the bottle so you can get the beer out of it very quickly - either in your throat or in the sink.
There’s really just nothing to it. Especially for over 30 dollars a case. What a rip off!
Pretty dull beer. Nothing particular. Its better with a lime or lemon. Not bad on a sunny afternoon in the summer.

Absolutely devoid of any good flavour.  Sick of listening to "how good a beer this is"!!  Gives me a sore head drinking it.  Very metallic, too fizzy, served at a ridiculous temperature most of the time.  AHHHH!!!

No: 376

Rated: 16.04.2008

Bottle transparent (white), 330 ml,11.2P

Appearance: Pours pale, metalic, bright yellow body in colour and perfectly clear texture, like well filtered water, body is carbonated like a fizzy drink. Head is initially white to grey, fizzy and after 30 seconds it disappears, later on the beer is bubbling less&less intensively.

Aroma: Old fermented rice and corn, it is hard to find there any, even thin malty accents and there is very slight skunky hoppy note strengthened by the intensive carbonation, some citrusy notes, lemon, a bit harsh, notes of melon. Very thin and simple, not the worst I’ve ever had.

Flavour: Front is salty, carbonated nose, fizzyness, lime&lemon is quite percepteable in nose but apart of it very thin in maltyness and drastically watered down. Very poor hoppy character as hops are interchanged with lime aroma, no bitterness, rather sweet beer, soft and I have to say I had expected something far worse. Very thin and wattery but not that bad in flavour. Finish duration is rather short.

Palate: Body is light, texture is wattery, carbonation on palate is quite lively, finish feel is thin and wattery with gentle lime notes in nose.
Served in the bottle with a lime. Pale yellow in color. The taste and smell of the beer is almost entirely masked by the lime wedge.
Bottle. Bright straw yellow with white head. Aroma is almost non-present, slight citrus and grass. Taste is the same. Has to be served with the lime boat, to give it...well, something.

Bottle:  The aroma is nothing "especial"...  In fact, I like to get a lime in it quickly to offset the fragrance.  Appearance:  Bright yellow, not a color I "intake" often... Overall it’s average at best.  Not a bad choice at a summer party when the other choice is Coors Light...

12oz bottle in St. Maarten.  I’m pretty sure there’s a giant brewery somewhere in the Caribbean which pumps out one beer into a dozen or so different bottles, and they’re all the official beer of <insert island name>.

I think the lime on the Corona is the only thing that gets this up to a rating of "1" for me - that’s a gift, given the most redeeming part of the experience is the piece of fruit attached and not the beer itself.  Mexican Budweiser at best.

Bottled. Pale yellow beer with a minimal off-white head. Fast diminishing lacing. Aroma has corn, lemon and some grass. Not much hops. Flavor is sweetish and a bit sour. Palate is overcarbonated and very light bodied.

Bottle. Light in colour, light in taste, light in head. Aroma of some... something. Not disgusting, just nothing special. Refreshing in the sun, though. Better with lime - get some nicer taste finally.

Bottle. Pale yellow color. Round white head, smells of grass and citrus. Taste is bland and abit watery with some hops in the background.  Needs to be really cooled down so it atleast goes down pretty smooth.

Poured from a 12 oz can and served sans lime.  Very clear, very pale yellow color.  A white head is produced but has no retention and seems to be more of a result of the being churned by the pour rather than by carbonation.  Somewhat sour aroma, but also has hints of honey and grass, along with canned corn.  Watery, adjunct filled flavor.  So close to water in texture and flavor that it is quite refreshing for a hot day.

Bottle. First 1 for me in the appearance category. Just no way that this doesn’t look like piss. Aroma mildly skunky, mildly grainy malts, not too terrible. Flavor pretty bad, just a bunch of abrasive, bitterish malt. Too much carbonation to balance the wateriness, not on the level of American "lites," but still enough for the 1 in palate. Just not good.
pale yellow pour with some white fizz.  watered down malts on the nose.  like water on the palate with a flavor of malts that isn’t great at all.  the carbonation is awful too.

For being the old standby for summer bbq’s and poolside buckets, I don’t mind this beer.  On Isla Mujeres, it’s practically the only thing you’ll find on draft.  It may need a lime to help cover the skunk, but it is still a refreshing drink when baking beachside.  It may not have a good flavor or aroma, but there are other intangibles that bump up my overall score.
Drank this straight out of the bottle.  Looks like dark piss.  Very skunky.  Some wheat, light sweet fruits hide in the background.  Dominated by the skunk.  Not terrible but close.

Pale yellow color with almost no head.  Light and not as refreshing as it’s made out to be.  I do not enjoy this beer.  I have not tried it with a lime, but I’m very hesitant to try to make a beer taste better by adding a lime wedge.

I agree with another reviewer here that this beer does transform itself with the addition of lime, but 1- it still isn’t that good and 2- aren’t we rating the actual beer itself, without additions?  Either way, a typical sweet macro with very little character and no real aftertaste.  Not my thing.  Won’t try again on PURPOSE but I’m sure someone will bring/have it somewhere.  Can’t escape this guy...
over-rated watered down beer that can only be stomached if you already drank several margaritas.
It’s light, with a minimal aftertaste.  There is something that almost bites in the first couple of sips.  Light color and taste.

Dark golden with a white head. Aroma is barley, corn malt, faint spice and hops. Flavor is somewhat spicy, weird hops, corn tortilla chips, and with a terrible bitter aftertaste. Not a fan of this one

Presentation: Poured from a 12oz clear bottle into a pint glass. It pours a very pale shade of yellow with a thin white head that quickly fades out. The aroma has light grain, corn and husk notes. The flavor without the lime is well, plain old American pale macro lager. There is a mildly sweet, light grain flavor with corn adjunct and bland mildly grassy hops that offer some bitterness for balance. Its palate is light and crisp with a light body and refreshing carbonation. For the most part this is really just a trendy drink so for best results serve ice cold in the bottle with the lime and enjoy on a hot summer day.

Bottle, 33cl. Pours a very ligt and clear beer, with a very white head. Close to no aroma. The flavor is thin and watery. The mouthfeel is thin, and overall this is a boring beer, that has no caracter.
This one I don’t like either. Most Mexican beer are watery and bland. I call it pee water. The ingredience are used sparingly. It is a week beer. I probably wont have it again.

Head vanishes instantly. Not quite as watery looking as I remembered. Faint, sweet aroma of corn. Nothing positive really but surprisingly it’s not foul. Quite summery I’d dare venture. Too sweet, too little flavour and body though. It’s uninteresting and inoffencive.

I think the laid back style of the Corona commercials greatly help the sales of this beer.  The Corona bottle looks great, and the image of the bottle with the lime on the top is one of the most classic beer images ever.  Aside from the bottle and the lime, this is an average beer at best.

Wow, I am amazed at what a low rating this very popular beer gets from the Ratebeer crowd.  I have a couple of theories about Corona.  One is that the beer’s cool decal label and clear bottle are the main factors in its popularity.  It is a great label, one of the best ever - simple, simultaneously old and new, classy.  I could look at a bottle of Corona for a while.  My other theory is that the added wedge of lime (often stuck in the bottleneck) is the main thing that makes it good.  Without that wedge of lime, we’re talking about a very ordinary beer, no better than Bud, for example.  But something about the Corona recipe interacts very well with lime and turns it into a pretty good beer.  Very pale pour with a little head.  Aroma is pleasantly sweet and fragrant, a nice surprise!  Without lime it tastes like a mediocre sugary pilsner with a light touch of tingly hops.   Now we put in a generous squirt of lime.  This does not improve the aroma, unfortunately - but it does transform the flavor into the "la cerveza mas fina" that everyone knows about.  Now the taste becomes complex and likeable, but still light.  The citrus notes bounce off the gently bitter hops, while the summery sweetness plays in the background.  There are lime and hops in the finish, and you can vary the tune by how much juice you put in.  Not bad.  So my rating will be an average of the two (with lime and without).  The high appearance rating is a salute to the label.  I will have to try the lime test with some other brews too - hasta luego.

Bottle, pours a beautiful light golden color with lacing.  Tastes watery, not overly carbonated, slightly sweet and a little bitter.  Very smooth, tastes pretty good with a lime in it, but otherwise it’s not that great.
The colour is ,bright, and clear light yellow. The fine white foam is a bit artifically, but nice. very liittle taste of hops, but minimalism has also a point

Pale and watery with little aroma (unless its skunked by being in the sun for 30 minutes) and zero head. Virtually no flavor and usually flat. Not terrible but not worth the price you pay for it, either.

Pale beer with no head; a bit of hop aroma (banana?), but not much else; flavor is thin with a bit of bitterness and some cardboard; finish leaves sweetness as the bitterness fades; unlikely for a repeat

For a hot summer day, especially tailgating for Jimmy Buffett, this is the perfect beer. It is light, watery, and yellow in color without much flavor. But you can drink a good 10 or 12 without that bad aftertaste of a demostic light beer and feel great for the Tiki Bar Party.

Pale, watery, no aroma, but largely inoffensive. Mild malty flavor, with little or no hop presence. When it’s hot out, and there is nothing else to drink I have no problem knocking back a few cold coronas. That being said, I don’t think I would ever buy this beer when there are other brews available.
There’s nothing to be said that hasn’t been said before.  It’s a pale yellow liquid with no aroma.  I bought a sixer to make some micheladas at a party.  Use only when mixing.
An absolutely pointless beer. The brewer should be ashamed of himself…on the way to the bank I suppose…

first off, you should never fruit the beer
this watery imposter is horrible,  and skunky

Yes, we all know that Corona is watery as hell and a pale yellow nothing of a beer... BUT when it’s 100 degrees outside and hydration is more important than a buzz (or than flavor for that matter), this beer with an added lime is quite refreshing.  No amount of beer snobbery can tell me otherwise.  Would I ever buy this beer?  No.  Would I ever drink it without a lime?  Good lord, no.  Without the lime it may be the worst beer I’ve ever had. If someone hands it too me at the beach, will I drink it?  Hell, yes.
It was 90 in the shade yesterday and my other choices were Coors Light and Miller Lite.  Corona was a good choice. Before I could tell her the bartender stuck a wedge of lime in it. Ugh.
You know it like 93 degrees here today with a heat index of 100. I’m putting these things down. And you know hat they taste damn good.
This is the Bud Light of Mexican beers.  Now that I’ve experienced a wider variety of beers from South of the Border, I don’t enjoy this as much anymore. Still a decent beer at an indecent price.

I was for 2 weeks on a holiday in Mexico. I taste several local beers. First of all I’ll give a general personal opinion. All the beers were served to cold. There was no, or almost no foam. If you ordered a beer, you always have to ask for a glass, which is also very cold. Always there was a lemon in the bottle. If you like it and put the lemon in your beer, than every beer would taste almost the same, because of the strong taste of a fresh lemon. The temperature in Mexico makes it understandably to serve cold beer. But you loose the real taste of the beer.
It is a clear light yellow colored beer. There was no head. A little aroma of appel juice. A very watery taste.

Don’t you dare fruit my beer... unless it’s one of these.  Sure I’ve had about a million and a half of these and when I wasn’t wise enough to know about good beer so it’s definitely drinkable.  Just really bland.  Watery.  Pretty skunky too. If you’re drinking cheap beer why not go really cheap and pick up a case of pabst or the beast.
Not a beer for everyday enjoyment, but on a hot summer day you can appreciate it`s unique medium flavor and it will always make you feel like magnum p.i.
Ez is csak a reklámok és a divat miatt olyan kapós.Gondolom azért kell egy cikk citromot gyömöszölni az üveg szájába hogy legyen valami íze ennek a lének.
Popular to college kids everywhere, but lacks in flavour. Finishes with a skunky after taste and doesn’t really go with a lot of foods too well.

Bottle @ home

I think a re-rate is in order. After having had a few Coronas on a brilliant night out with friends I have come to understand Corona. It isn’t meant to be a sophisticated and complex brew like you’d expect from top shelf craft beers. This beer is brewed to be had from the bottle and to go down easily - all night. The dulled and inoffensive flavour and aroma, which I originally thought repugnant, in actuality provide a decent beer in the appropriate social context. This isn’t a beer to be savoured by itself but rather enjoyed amongst the fun and revelry that goes with a long night out.


As to why this beer is so popular I have no answer. Appears an off yellow colour and since I drank it straight from the bottle I had no knowledge of what it looks like when poured but I imagine it lacks a decent head in addition to there being nothing noticeably good about the beers aroma. The taste is weak and watery and not very enduring, very similar to a lot of other mass produced beers. Avoid where possible.
An excellent beer for breakfasts or summer days.  It goes down easy and is surprisingly flavourful.
Horrible taste and looks flat and like piss.  It baffles me as to why this beer is so popular.
Light pale yellow, no head. Smelled like corn, tasted like cardboard, finished dry and crisp, though. Not the worst thing out there, but I would never pay money for it.
This beer is really boring.  I used lime, which gave the beer its only flavor.  Although the beer is bad, I buy it in the summer on hot days to cool off.
Good beer when mowing the lawn but totally overrated. The lime helps cover the bad taste
12oz.  Not a whole lot to say, slight salinity and good carbonation makes it an expensive alternative to tap water.
Sort of tasteless, though I did it without the lime.  Just a very very overrated beer that just goes to show you marketing is indeed everything.
A true favorite with the lime. Without the lime I don’t really care for it. It is a good beer on a hot sumers day
My favorite beer, goes well with everything.  I’m no beer expert just a regular guy that drinks occasionally.

This beer, can not count as a beer. Watery no taste.

it should be forbidden.
Une très bonne bière a boire accompagne de lime par contre. c’est une bonne bière d’été

Bottle, courtesy of whoever left it in my fridge. Pours a....... oh wait the intended serving vessel for this beer is the bottle, I don’t care what the website says. Aroma is sweet nectar, corn and water. Flavor is much the same, with corn and nectar sweetness melding together along with a touch of skunkiness. Adding a lime helps disguise the skunkiness and keeping it ice cold makes it that much better as well. I’d love to slam this beer, but it has it’s place and alongside mexican food served ice cold it can be refreshing.
Es un atol de elote sin el atol, digamos q hacemos una bebida de lo q se evapora al hacer el atol y le agregamos agua del chorro
Watery, weak flavor of grain. No hop aroma or flavor. Weak head. Clear bottle shows me that they care more about marketing than quality.
A watered down tasting brew. The pale malts used here leave a skunky flavor. Not at all a good beer as all the commercials lead one to believe.

Bière de style lager à 4,6%.
De couleur jaune paille.
Bière rafraîchissante, mais avec des saveurs limitées.

Fruitty fragance, bright color and nice appearence, a fresh beer to drink more than a couple of them. Is not a gourmet product, however enjoyable in warm weather, acceptable taste, a good average one.

An all around, fairly decent mass produced pale lager. Decent in taste, and ecspecially enjoyable on a hot day, nothing says relaxed, like having a cold corona in the hot desert sun. Bright golden, thin head. slightly watery, but citrusy, and arguably refreshing.

Didnt bother drinking with a lime. Generally has no taste so the clear bottle is a bonus - gives it a skunk taste which saves it from being totally tastelss.  Ive had worse beers - not too many though.
Bottle,  Corona (hard to beat on a hot summer night)  Not much to say here.  Definately needs a lime to make it work.  Small white head with a corn/hoppy feel.  Good lawn mowing beer.

12 ounce bottle. I am a believer that fruit should not be added to any beer, so I decided to try this without the lime. Poured a typical pale lager yellow color with a small white head that disappears quickly. The aroma is very skunky with hints of bread and corn... awful smell. Tasted very watery with some hints of malt and corn. After a few drinks of this, I decided to throw in a lime. It definitely helped, but like I said, I do not think fruit should be added to a beer. Oh, well. Refreshing at best and is moderately tasty after mowing the lawn.
I really like this as a social beer.  Drink in the bottle with lime, otherwise you are wasting your time.  Flavor is great when mixed with lime, although it is admittedly not very complex.
skunky and smells like corn  with a hint of malt....hardly any bitter flavors to balance out the sweet malt/corn flavor....it needs the lime to cover up the gross flavor

very pale yellow pour with little to no head, aroma of toasted corn, bread/corn flavors with a slight bittering.  This beer is way better than the average domestic swill but that’s about it.  It is pretty hard to get it un-skunked too which makes this almost a never buy for me.

Pours a sparkling light pale color with thin, quickly discipitating white head.  Subdued aroma with slightly discernible sweet corn/rice malt scent.   Very thin, watery mouthfeel and a lot of carbonation.  Weak flavor with subtle hints of rice/corn flakes and sweet malt.  Crisp, short finish with clean, very gentle hop bitterness and slightly astringent aftertaste.  This beer is very refreshing and appetitizing, especially when well-iced.  Just the thing on a blisteringly hot day on the beach or the backyard.  Try with traditional Mexican street-stand tacos, or guacamole and tortilla chips.
Perhaps it works a warm summer day. Taste is water,hints of citrus and a decent finish.Pretty refreshing.

Clear bottle poured a clear pale yellow with a small disapating white head. Aromas of bread dough wsith a light hint of citrus. Palate was light bodied crisp and a bit watery. Flavors of water, light bread and a faint hiunt of citrus with a crisp clean finish.
Hot day beer. Put a lime wedge and some salt in it (and some tequila wouldn’t hurt). it’s not bad, but it is not great. Cools you off, and it is better than Bud.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a yellow with little, fully diminishing head.  Aroma is of straw, light yeasty/dough, and a bit stale.  Light body with a bitter flavor, watery.  Needs the lime to make it better.

Bottle.  Had a chance to re-visit this beer at an after party, from ringside.  A great lawnmower beer and it helped offset the cholinergic effects (drymouth) of allergies.  This beer does suck for the most part, i know why limes are stuck in the bottle neck but i stuff them in because i love lime.  But without lime this beer sucks and so does your breathe after finishing one.  Leave this one to the flys. (rating without lime).
Very drinkable for a cheap mexican beer.  Goes great with a lime.  Good for hot weather as well.

I thought since I was hispanic, I would pay tribute on Cinco de mayo.  All I did was "Sinka my stomach".  Yikes, I could not imagine ever drinking this, even if I was a 15yr old kid stealing dads beer.

7 oz. bottle to celebrate Cinco de Mayo. Pours fizzy yellow with a fizzy white head. Aroma is dirty dish water. Light body. Flavor is much better than the aroma with very lightly sweet malt note. Not much other than that.
12 oz. bottle, enjoyed straight from the bottle (no lime).  Aroma: Slightly stale.  Appearance: Pale golden yellow.  While not fantastic, this beer is obviously perfect for a hot summer day.

Light golden pour.  Head fizzles into nothing.  I’ll give the appearance a 2 only because it doesn’t look undrinkable.  There is a reason people drink this beer with a lime.  Because without it it basically tastes like carbonated water.  Inoffensive beer, but very watery, even more so than say a miller or anheiser busch product.  The only reason I have this is that I bought some for a friend/coworker of my wife.

This stuff is typically overrated by a bunch of people who went to Cancun or Mazatlan and spent their time completely drunk from dawn to dusk.  It does look like a real beer, aroma is not too bad, but nothing special about the flavor.  Something about the feel to the mouth seems off to me.

If I have to drink a Mexican beer, I’ll take Modelo over this stuff.
Was my favorite beer in college.  Very drinkable at least.  Used to think it was great, now it’s a slight upgrade to bud.
Slightly more drinkable than American macros, and slightly less offensive flavor-wise, this goes good with Mexican food I suppose....
Not bad if you and lime to it. goes well with a mexican food or if your laying on the beach.

Oat soda,or if you like, Hops seltzer. pure and simple. Slight hoppy bite gets your attention,  but this beer is essentially flavorless. It was designed  as light summer fare. Too light for my liking.
Great summertime brew. Very good taste with a lime in it. Not a great beer, ut refreshing when ice ice cold.
Like previous raters on here, this beer is good for a hot day.  Add some lime and it will be okay.  I would definitely choose this over most others macros.
It’s a decent tasting beer after you’ve added some lime, but after about three of them you gain a headache
It’s good thirst quencher with lime. take another gulp before the aftertaste. yellow and carbonated, white head.

Bottle:  Simple and smooth enough with a nice dryness toward the back of the palate.  Light and watery which lacks flavor alone...never a good thing when fruit (lime) makes a beer considerably better.  Though, with lime, this is very drinkable on a hot day.
i was pugging these and couldnt get loaded to save my life i guess after you add some limes its pretty good but it has a wierd skunky after taste

Let’s be realistic.  Lower your expectations.  Add some lime.  Add more lime.  And this is a good beer to drink quickly, working outside.  If you sip and slow down - you’ll regret it. Relatively clean, clear and crisp.  Would save my money for a real beer, elsewhere.
Good for the summer.. and memories of times when you didn’t know what good beer tasted like.  At least beers that you don’t have to mask flavors with fruits.  Thanks, I’ll pass.

24 ounce bottle.  Pours a light yellow with a large active white head that fades away fast.  Aroma comes off skunky, but is of fruit, malt and corn.  Taste is much the same, but watery.  Easy to drink when cold.  Overall, it is passable, but it is overpriced for what it is.
Quintessential lawn mower beer.  Drink ice cold on a hot day and you can’t complain to much.  Definitely better Mexican beers out there though.
Easy-drinkin, smooth if not plain taste. Everyone raves about putting limes in, but in my opinion, you don’t put fruit in your beer,

2008 Bottle - It is Corona, not a fucking craft...it still tastes good even if not that  complex.  Why is everyone so hard on a beer that is so good in the warm weather?  It will not challenge anyones palate, but is pretty damn satisfying after (whilst) doing some yard work...Don’t go looking for some session, just enjoy for what it is...

Corona Extra is light yellow beer with white head or is there any head? There are corn, cereals and some metal in the aroma and it is almost unpleasant. Flavour is fusty and hoppines is very biting. Very light and wet-like to drink. There is only one purpose for this beer, it reminds you for bad kind of beer.

Not horrible for pounding in the sun, which I’ve done on more than one occasion but nah, it’s not a good beer. Corny, grainy, sometimes skunky. I’ll drink one in the sun if someone gives it to me but I doubt I’ll be buying this anymore.  For whatever reason it does seem to go OK with spicy foods.

Yes, extra...right...who invented this is a real jackass. First, who would put a yellow beer in a not colored bottle to look like piss!!! Second, when it looks like one, why it doesn’t taste any better?!?! Then many, of course even more retarded morons around the world see that it is sooo good idea and try to copy THIS beer. Right. Of course, when it’s easy to put water in bottle piss in it and sell it like a beer. And then, finally, those fancy people around enjoy paying 3 euros in a mexican bar to drink it but of course with lemon squeezed inside becuase it’s better like that. Lemon was used 100 years ago as a desinfection not for drinking!!
This is the nastiest beer that I’ve ever had in my life, it is disgusting, it is Mexican piss.
When it’s 85° F outside, and you’re in Mexico, this is one of the beers to drink.  It will quench your thirst.
Pretty weak, with little aroma or flavour, yet some strange bitterness bite that makes spicy food taste better.  Terrible beer on it’s own, yet elevated artificially when consuming tacos or fajitas.
Piss yellow, no aroma. Crisp taste but sort of a garbage finish. I think that’s why they put lime in it.

When taken in context, there is not a finer beer on the markey for a hot day, or to accompany a spicey meal.  I am a little dismayed at the bias apparnt here.  While CE may not be the finest, or fanciest  for what it is, Corona is fairly close to perfeection.  A good cheap beer to quaff with friends on the dog days.
A must while on the beach or camping!   While the aroma is different (some people say it smells like a skunk) it is unique.  This is also a great beer while having a nice summer meal.

Clear straw color with small ring of white head.

Sweet light malt and some fruit and yeastiness along with the carbonic stench.

Crisp, aggressive carbonation, but doesn’t sting the tongue too much. Medium bodied feel for macro lager.

This must be a pretty fresh sample as there is no skunk or cruddy off-al-ness which I usually associate with the name.  Actually, there is not much flavor here at all, good or bad.  The sweetness from the nose seems even to be lacking in the taste.  Pretty much a generic light "beer" flavor with some metallic notes.

Pretty drinkable for what its worth, whatever that means. Still not gonna buy it.

Bottle.  Pours a piss like color, smells lilke a pilsner.  Kinda grassy drinkable taste.  Very well carbonated.  Very pricey for the quality of beer.  I will continue to drink this beer for free at many events.

Not bad for a mass produced beer with a distribution almost as big as Budweiser.  A rather generic pale lager/pilsner.  Nothing outstanding about it, but hard to find fault with either.  There’s absolutely nothing offensive in the taste, but nothing interesting either.  It’s a slightly richer and prettier yellow than the average pale lager, very little head, and a light but almost soda-pop like carbonation.

I remember way back in the day when I used to love this beer.  My how the times have changed (for the better).  This is a very light beer which is basically good for the novice beer drinker, or to look "cool" at a club.

Refreshing and unoffensive, yet nothing to write home about. I think a lot of average Americans like this beer because it makes them imagine that they’re on a beach somewhere down in Cabo with a harem of hot Mexican bitches fawning over them in nice warm weather. This is in contrast to the fact that they’re actually stuck selling insurance in Wisconsin, and 5 hours from now, will be driving an ’89 Taurus home through a blizzard to a fat nagging wife who can’t cook worth a shit. So I think you market this as typical North American lager, which is what it is, and it doesn’t get any play.
um, why? This is not good beer. This is by no means good beer, even if you stick a lime in it. I guess it’s better than Budweiser though.

drinkable, refreshing...yet no distinctive aromas or taste, watery and expensive..
about 55 pesos/six..i think the only thing people buy this beer is because of the publicity, but dont get fooled..although it kinf of reminds of the beach.

Average beer.  You kind of need the lime to kill some of the off flavors.  There are many better Mexican beers, though Corona is the most widely recognized.  Try Modelo Especial, Bohemia, Indio, or Victoria for a much better Mexican brew

Classic mexican beer, but I think you’re better off exploring Dos XX honestly.  It’s good with lime, but after drinking many kinds of beer, coming back to Corona is almost impossible.  Flavor is good, but aftertaste just seems to bother me nowadays.

12 oz bottle poured into my unfortunate stein- poured transparent very weak yellow color, white head came and went in 15 seconds, heavy- light carbonation.  Weak aroma of corn and stale dishwater.  Hits the mouth with a watery thin body, corn is apparent, finish goes away, thank goodness.  I add a snort of Everclear (grain alcohol) to it to give the brew a kick in alcohol level, but it’s an unfortunate use for the rocket fuel.

12oz bottle.  Piss color yellow with a head that looks like soap.  

Skunky smell,
Oh I can tell
I’m gonna pour you right down the drain.

Sour astringent, watery, tasteless, metallic.  Pours down the drain well, so at least it’s got that going for it!
Bottle. NO LIME! I SAID NO LIME IN IT! Drinkable if cold. A heartless industrial lager.
NASTY NASTY NASTY.  The only way to enjoy this is with a hearty shot of Bacardi Limon in it.  Too much carbonation, not enough flavor,.  Watery.  Yuck.

12oz bottle.   Clear yellow, weak white head.   Corn and hay aroma.   Light sweetness and very light sour bitterness.   Light and empty palate with ample carbonation.   I confess that if kept out of the light to avoid spoilage, this isn’t all that bad.   Pretty flavorless, but preferable to american macros with the flavor that it does manage.
What can I say? This beer was made and marketed for Americans. They have a superb ad agency. Looks like a sample for the urologist. An eyelash above the standard fare.

Not a good beer. The taste is a little like nothing. Water and a bit of lemon. Not bitter at all. I find it over carbonated and fizzy. Smells like nothing. This is a good beer for when you’re in Mexico, but don’t bring any home/
Skunk. Fails to taste of..anything really, especially without the added ’lime’ or ’lemon’ Refreshing, yes.. but so is water.
Ew.  It’s too carbonated, too light, and too skunky, as many other have said.  It’s not my kind of refreshing beer.  It reminds me more of stale seltzer water.
light and refreshing, not much head. serve ice cold with lime and sunshine, that’s about it.
Pours clear gold color with thin white head.  Nothing special about the aroma or flavor other than it is refreshing on a hot day.

When a beer tastes like is skunky but you know it to be fresh, you’ve got a problem.  Some lime helps cut the nasty flavor a bit.  Overly carbonated and yet has almost no head.  There may be a place for this beer if you’re sitting under the summer sun on a beach somewhere, but that would be about it.
Nice refreshing taste only on hot days, only drink with lime.  this beer is not the greatest but if you go on vacation its one of those beers you just drink....

When you have to throw a lime into a beer you know its bad.  There is practically zero head... smells like urine and looks like urine.  This MUST be cold or else its undrinkable.   No palate.

In the summer when dilusional from the sun this is slightly more refreshing then water.
average highly marketed beer without much flavor, only drink in the bottle with a lime

No need to really explain this stuff. It’s a pretty bland pale lager without much flavor. Just something watery and fizzy that goes well with spicy food, sitting on the beach, or mowing the lawn. Everybody hates on Corona, but it isn’t horrible. At least the bottle is cool looking. Toss a sliced lime in there and enjoy it for what it is.

Poured piss yellow with little foam. Smelled like skunk and tasted as bad. I know why everyone puts a lime or lemon in this beer, because if you did’nt the beer is undrinkable. This is Tijuana tap water with skunk piss ! The only reason I give it a 5 for overall is because the marketing guy is a genius.
What can I say, my taste buds were shot from the three bombers we drank and had these sitting around.  A mass produced yellow beer that’s good when already buzzing.  Other than that, its just Corona.
Nice refreshing taste, only drink with lime. However very poor taste on the tap! Marketing beer yes, like Heineken, but nice to drink out of the bottle!

I was guilted into drinking this when a priest friend of mine bought a round.  He shoved one at me and I could not hurt his feelings.  This beer tastes of fillers and there might be a hop or two in there.  I do not like lagers to begin with, but this one tastes of rice, cheap grain, and water.  Avoid, and if you must drink it, ask for several limes and buy one for the guy who is forcing it on you.

IThe marketing makes this beer.  Cheep pilsenr backed by a huge marketing campaign .Metallic  and skunky,  not very good.  Good when in the mood, like when your in the Keys.  Just make sure to mask the taste with a lime. For even better results wet the mouth of the botte with lime and dip in in salt.

This is definitely a beer to be enjoyed on occasion.  Fits in really well with Mexican or Tex Mex food but other than that I wouldn’t drink it.  Fizzy and carbonated but has a flavor all it’s own.  Sweet, and refreshing.

Not even better with the lime.  Probably the most overpriced beer in America today.  I could name a dozen beers that are better than this and are cheaper.  Smells and tastes like piss, and only marginally better when ice cold.  Women love this beer for some reason around my parts.
Tastes like rice, corn and dishwater. Pours golden, tastes better with lime. Only drink if you have to.

One thing I like about Corona is its freshness and unique character. It is light and breezy on the nose with hints of sea foam and maybe even agave? The colour is coastal and clear, very inviting if you are sitting on a beach. Flavour is full of refreshment and thrist quench. There is nothing really quality here except this. In this case however, its what makes Corona an occasional treat. Palate is the only thing I can’t stand. Overally buzzy and finishes fizzy.
Enjoy Corona for where it can take your mind on a cold and stressful day, or a gorgeous hot summer one.

If it’s cold and I mean freezing cold, it’s wonderful.  If not it’s a bottle of p*ss.  It’s a wonderful complement to Mexican food, but that’s expected.  I think the appeal of it’s foreigness has been cliche for about 15years.  It’s proof that a good beer shouldn’t need accoutrements, limes, oranges, or spices.  Aroma is absence, appearance is ordinary, flavor is ok, but only if it’s practically frozen, which tells you something, and palate wise it’s vulgar if even slightly on the cool-warm side.  Novelty and that’s it.

It rates a .5 without the lime.  On a hot day, with a bowl of fesh cerveche, nothing better.  Something magic happens when you float the lime.  This normally skunky smelling cervesa becomes the nectar of the Aztec gods.

Smells clean enough. Small, fizzy, white head, with a clear yellow body. No lacing or retention. Flavor again clean, boring, mellow, macro. Fizzy and dry mouthfeel. Past expiriance tells me that lime helps flavor, kills paracites, and hides any skunkiness of this beer.
smells almost like burnt rubber... but TASTY burnt rubber. it really does taste good in warm weather, but i wouldn’t drink more than a couple before moving on to the next flavor.
a great beer one of my favorites if your not a big fan of mexican beer this would be a good one to re-consider
just another boring beer add the lime and its drinkable on 90 plus day in the  sun
Bottle: Yellow colour with minimal head.  Unclean notes of hops and brewing cereal.  Tastes like water and cat piss.  Add lime and it becomes a drinkable beach beer.
not much to this pale lager, esp since its only enjoyable with a lime, it just is blah like all the rest of the main stream crap out there.

Corona Extra what? Pale skunk? Pours pale yellow with a 1 inch head that doesn’t last a second. Good skunky aroma like a great quality undergorund earthen pils. Flavor is good, and earthy pils, but less than the aroma would let on. Unfortunately, they put corn and sugar in this beer, the only thing ruining it from being a 3.5+ beer. All they have to do is leave that shit out. And lime in this beer, does nothing but burn its great skunky pils aroma and flavor into the ground. Guillibles stop! The lime was originally to keep flies out of the beer. Don’t you know? Fools! Best enjoyed con us amigos mejores mexicanos. Entoneces este cerveza es un cinco.
Amazing marketing,  people will buy all sorts of rubbish if there is a glossy poster and flash TV advert.
I see not alot of people like this beer. I guess its the mexican in me that likes it. But I do agree with the fact that you have to drink this beer with a lime. Any other way just dose not cut it.

(bottle) I’ve gotten into arguments with friends who have sworn to me that this is one of the best beers ever. Some of them tell me that I’m not drinking it right if I don’t add the lemon or lime; and on occassion I have humored them and added said citrus (after first making it clear that the beer should be able to stand on its own without the addition of fruits). In either case my opinion remains the same. Corona is unfit to be bottled. I apologize for the graphicness that is about to spew from my keyboard, but I swear that the recipe of Corona is: drink tequila and then urinate into a bottle and chill.
The Budweiser of Mexico.  Not a fan of it at home, but tastes great when sitting on a Mexican beach during the winter.
pale yellow body a no head. A lot carbonation. aroma os grain and grass. a littel bitter in teh finish. For me it´s not a beer. didnt taste like a beer.

12oz bottle: pours golden yellow with small whit head. aroma is of low quality grain and slight skunk smell. flavor has a slight malt taste with some skunking added to it, i think its from the clear botles. not a good beer would only buy again if i was in mexico.
Light sommerbrew. Nothing special. But it is okay to drink at a sunny day.........
Pretty watery. No real smell and not a horrible taste. Wouldn’t spend money on it.

The only time I reach for this extremely pale lager is when im sweating to death in the heat of the summer sun. Tastes like piss when it gets warm and can be very un-drinkable under the right circumstances.

Someone brought like 40 Coronas to my Super Bowl party and they’re still in my fridge. It’s been something like 3 years since I tasted the stuff so I decided to break one out for the hell of it.

Appearance is a sickly pale gold with a very fizzy white head. The carbonation isn’t quite cola-like but it’s close. The suds disappears in seconds and leaves nothing on the glass.

Smell is pretty bleak, with faint creamed corn and sulfur.

Taste is almost nonexistent. Light adjunct malt tinges, no hops. Luckily this wasn’t skunked, but it still tasted more like tap water than beer. Hard water aftertaste.

Mouthfeel is highly carbonated but kinda slimy, and body is paper thin. This contributes to a very high drinkability and refreshment. The only circumstances conducive to enjoying this beer are 3 digit temperatures.

33 cL clear bottle. One of these beers by which you wonder why you hadn’t rated that before - just to get it over with...Pours clear golden yellow with a fizzy white head. Aroma is hayish to light grainy. Strange flavour of malt and acidic notes, somewhat dry. Ends with a continued acidic and slight bitterness. Couldn’t finish, no wonder they add a lemon to this...
Not my favorite Mexican beer - tastes bad without the lime. With lime and cold, it can wash down Mexican food in a fair manner. Decent party beer when the other option is Bud.

A friend brought this over and it is better than I think I remembered, even without the lime!  Pours the colour of piss and tastes like slightly off water.  With a plate of Care Asada it isn’t half bad though.  Kinda of cools the mouth.

Cheep beer that’s easy to find.  One of my first, though I don’t remember it fondly...pretty boring overall.  Ok for a hot day or when the alternative is something worse (Milwaukee’s, Natty Ice, etc) at a party, but overall, just does not do it for me.
Yellow color, thin white head, pungent aroma, not good, watery, piss like taste, awful aftertaste, when served freezing cold it is hardly drinkable
on a hot day in the south its a refreshing and nicely crisp beer. nothing more nothing less.

Corona Light is better. This beer is great when its freezing cold, but anything warner brings out the skunkiness in it. The taste reminds me of a beer thats been left in the sun. Smooth, bitter. Small head, and average consistency. Best in bottle, horrible in a can like most beers are. Dont think they make corona on tap.
without a lime this beer tastes like piss.  with a lime it tasts like piss with lime juice in it.  bla.
They have good commercials...and is ok if you "fruit" the beer.  But that is looked down upon.  Pretty boring really.

Awful.
There is no flavour whatso ever.
Tastes like water and lemon juice,
low alcohol.
I honestly do not know why every one keeps buying this piss.
Pours yellow with thin white head. Very thin, crisp taste, best served ice cold with a lime. Nothing special.

Golden clear color beer with a white small  head. Don’t care for this beer and you need several wedges of limes to finish it. Have never cared for this and can’t figure out why friends continue to buy it.

Yellow, crisp, clear, skunk piss best served ICE Cold.  Look, when it’s hot and your thirsty from throwing some horse shoes around this is a beer of choice.  Chuck a lime in there and your feeling great!  Not the biggest fan of fruit in my beer but for this I make an exception. I can put down six of these like, well water.  Hey, it’s better than light beer.  God lets not get started on light beer!
golden, clear, aminimal head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium sourness, light body, thin feel, flat,
I have no idea why people like this beer.  it’s expensive too!  this beer is garbage and i laugh whenever people spend money on it.

Agreed with Haslinger on this one.  This is Mexico’s equivalent to Heineken.  This beer is not worth $1 a bottle.  Hell, it’s not worth 40 cents a bottle.  Won’t buy again and probably won’t accept one from a friend either.

Exhibit A in why Mexico is not famous as a beer brewing nation. I know so many people who drink this and WILLINGLY pay the absurdly inflated prices. Congrats to the  brewers for tapping into stupid people who think it makes them look cool. Overpriced and    undrinkable. If I had to drink this beer for the rest of my life I would give up beer drinking altogether.
This beer has the skightest touch of a beer like flavor to remind you that your not just drinking yellow mexican water.  Not very good.
Often skunky thanks to the clear bottle.  The non-skunked version is thin and not actively unpleasant, but bland and pointless.
Odd tasting fizzy water. How this could be considered "premium" in Oz... no one will ever know.

One of most over-rated beers of all time.  Only way I can drink it is ice cold...dead giveaway for a cheap beer.  I’d buy it if ie were $8 a 12 pack instead of $16!  And no..the lime doesn’t make it any more palatable.

I never realized how skunky this tastes until I sat down and really evaluated it. It does hold a some what special place in the world of beers for its symbolic summer feelings but there are some great wheats or lighter beers that could fill the void in a much better way.
the worst beer for the price possibly in the world. alot of people i know drink this and think they look like the shit. skunk. nasty. no good beer requires fruit of any kind to taste tolerable

we all know what it looks like. Tastes skunky as hell, but amazingly it is possible to knock many a  back on a hot day. There is a reason you have to drink Corona with a lime - it tastes gnarly by itself.

Bottle.  Skunky, funky and day old bready aroma.  Weak watery body, with the tiniest bit of malt flavour. Watery finish.  This was urged on me, I would not buy it myself. Advertising sells this beer, not flavour.
Pours yellow with no head.  Bready and bland aroma,  flavor is similar with a bit of funk and not much else.  Watery.  Good at noon on a hot summer day I guess.
A yellow beer with almost no head. It has a slight aroma of hops. Medium body, unclean notes of malt and brewing cereal. Some cardboard notes as well. The finish is dry. Watery body and finish.
Gold in color, no haze or anything. Not bad tasting, just no flavor whatsoever.

Bottle. Pours clear gold with a fluffy white head. The clear bottling might not have been a good choice because there is a definite skunk smell. The taste is typical pale lager only with a bit more cardboard and skunk spray. I’m not impressed. There is a reason why people shove limes into the necks of these things.

Inexistent aroma.
Golden near water colour with no foam (fresh appearance).
Too soft flavor (in Spain they use to put a lemon piece to have any flavor).
No palate at all either.
You can drink it anywhere, anytime and with any kind of glass (in Spain they use to drink it from bottle); the effect will be the same. Recommended to drink cold in summer (Great sustitutive of water).
this stuff is one of the worst beers I have ever had. It’s sister beer Negra Modelo is much better. this beer smells bad and doesn’t taste good either.
not very good. suitable to be consumed straight from the bottle, ice cold. very blonde with no foam and a dry, alcoholic aroma and finish
Safe to say, this stuff is pretty freakin’ awful. I only drank it because I was at band practice and thirsty. We didn’t have any water.

This one is drunk straight from the bottle, Ice cold.  Very blonde beer no foam present with aroma slightly skunky and a little toasted bread.  The taste is of sour corn with toast and no mouth feel at all.  Just slides right down. Easy to drink fast.  I had this one time on tap in Puerto Vallarta, yuck.  It tastes better from the bottle.
[Sampled in 2003.] Boring beer, which is best direct from the freezer, to be enjoyed in the sun.
The bottle looks not really good, no labels. No foam. Alcoholic aroma. Tastes the same, dry finish. A terrible beer.
330ml bottle pour heap of carbon,head gone in 20 seconds,colour nice yellow,aroma salty ,stinks a bit of rubber,flavour,gross indecency,sour salty,bloody terrible.

This beer is kind of whatever but I honestly don’t mind it that much. It’s not great but it is smooth, refreshing and goes down easy. Clearly a better alternative to other typical party beers such as Bud Light, Miller, Naty Lights, Coors, etc.

clear bottle, painted label, whats inside is just not worth the price... unless you want to re-enact a beach scene from the commercials.  As many have probably said before me Dos Equis is a better alternative
Stick with Dos Equis Lager if your in Mexico. Corona is as often as not very skunky. It tastes better if you stick a lime in it,
Decent Mexican/beach beer. Had my fair share of these down in Mexico. Go down pretty easy. I prefer it without lime, but everyone else seems to like the lime. Drink very cold.
Definitly needs to be with lime. Smell isnt to pleasant, and the tastes is not much better. Beach Beer!
Im just trying to figure out which is more overpriced and overrated, this or heineken.  nothing good comes from clear bottles exept soft drinks.  beer should never be in clear bottles!!!!

12-25-07 bottle.  
 Clear yellow appearance.  Skunky (but not as much as I was expecting) light yeasty aroma.  Very watery taste and palate.  Quite metallic and has no other flavor.  Typical piss poor pale lager.  ho hum.
well this is one probably to have on a hot day. A good cost effective thirst quencher, that’s about all.
It is a good imported beer but it has to be cold. Cool or almost luke warm is not the way to drink it.

Rubbish! Perhaps I have to be pissed out of my head on a beach. Sorry to the brewers and all that. This was actually the first beer I ever bought in a pub. So thanks for creating a drunkard. Like licking exposed metal on the bus, tube, train. No wonder they almost insisted they dump a bloody lime in it. Tossers.

I can’t tell what the head is like when it pours. A number of years ago I made the mistake of pouring this beer in a glass and discovered why this beer is meant to be in a bottle with a lime. The aroma is almost sickening. If you can get past the smell, this is a light, refreshing not too hoppy, not too malty beer that goes good with chips, salsa, sand, and sun.
Bottle.  Kind of skunky aroma.   Crap color.  Crap taste but if it is cold enough I’ll dive in.

Once the skunky hops blow over, a lightly grainy aroma is revealed.  Brilliantly clear golden body is topped by a fizzy, white, fully diminishing head.  Corn is prominent in the dry malt flavour.  Light bitterness but no real sweetness to speak of.  Light and refreshing in body with overly strong carbonation.  Bottle (BCLS on Cambie at 8th, Jun-07).

One thing I will say, if you need a piece of fruit to make a beer taste better....it doesn’t speak to highly of the beer.  With a lime, this is a great drink that finishes smooth with a nice light taste.
Smooth, drinkable, light and unchallenging, best with a slice of lime shoved down the neck

Bottle. Pours a light yellow with fizzy little white head. Aroma of light malt and light hops. Flavor of light malt, grain and light hops. Mouth feel is light body with very high carbonation. Overall, it is a shame that a Mexico Macro can kick a American Macros ass...This beer finished nice and clean and you can actually taste the malt and hops. This is a nice refreshing, easy drinking beer, but I believe it to be over priced. It actually seems to taste better then what I remember from a few years back...
Needs a lime to complete the flavor.  Not bad for a mexican though...  I’d definitely buy this again though... you always gotta have something to put you over the top.
this is one of the beer were i just like to drink at home watching a football game its just a hang out beer
This straw colored beer is watery and without much taste, but it kind of resemblances a beer...

Head disappears quickly, extremely fizzy, clear amber appearance, better with a lime or maybe two.  Strong wet grass odor that gets worse the longer it sits.  Aftertaste sucks, overrated & overpriced.  This is the worse of the Mexican beers thaT crosses the border.  For some reason I used to love this stuff & I don’t know why.

12oz bottles.  anything you have to add lime to in order to make taste better is an indication that something aint right... decent vacation beer but has is so watery and unappealing, the name recognition is the only thing going for it.. had one last night and remembered why I stopped drinking them.. its because water is cheaper and I get the same buzz!!!!

Aroma is light but what’s there is bitter and yeasty. Pours the a radioactive piss yellow. Tastes like absolute garbage. Doesn’t even taste like beer. Has a bitter flavor combination of corn, straw and yeast. Very over-carbonated as well. I can’t say a single positive thing about this "beer". It’s undoubtedly the worst I’ve had in my life. It’s just lucky the lowest rating I could give it is 0.5.
A decent beer. Best served very cold and with lime. When served with lime it is actually alright but without lime it is very sub par. How’s that for a glowing review?

Woo hoo! I said I would rate it, so I am. Pours a light gold. Hints of very faint citrus on the nose. Taste is very crisp and faint hop on the backside. Finish is very crisp and refreshing. (WITH LIME) Other than the pour and aroma, this happens to ad to the appeal of the beer. This beer is very refreshing and definately an eveyday drinker.
Its a beer that I can drink on a hot day, it’s great with Mexican food however its a beer I have to be in the mood for.

~Smells like wet glass bottle with a hint of straw. 
~Little head that quickly disappeares. Golden clear color with lots of carbonation bubles.
~Felt a little heavier than expected with tongue tingles.
~Hardly any taste at all. The taste that it does have is similar to how its smells. Wet straw. 
~I added lime and it tasted like a wet bottle with straw and a hint of lime. The lime added an improvement but not much.
I have no idea how this beer became so popular. It’s not the cheap either compared to better tasting beers.
Appearance is clelar yellow with a small, fizzy, white, diminishing head.   Taste is of malts and grain.  Good for the beach, not much else.
OK for a thirst quencher if you luck out and find a bottle that isn’t stale from soaking up sunlight through the clear glass bottle. When stale it stinks like a rousted polecat.

Like most Mexican beers, better with a lime. Refreshing like none other after a day in the sun. You don’t drink this for the complexity, and if that’s the only element of a beer that you enjoy, you’re probably a pompous idiot anyway.
Useless without a lime. Not worth describing the flavour or palette--there is none. Grab a Holsten instead and enjoy something that doesn’t give you a headache.
Tastes like piss water with a cigarette put out in it.  Slightly more tolerable with a lime.
Great beach beer, but from a cooler with some lime.  The beer isn’t fantastic, but they didn’t do much to screw it up either.  It’s MGD or this on a super-hot day.

I agree with most of the posts that I have read.  On a hot day, this is a good social beer but it does need to be very cold and while I can take or leave the lime, I guess it adds a bit of flavor to an otherwise bland beer.
