I do like it better than most of the American macros so I would choose this over 99 percent of those, except for Sam Adams (I consider them a macro now)

Agree with other ratings. A decent lager on a hot day, or when I’m too busy to run to the beer store (a sad thing indeed), as the wife drinks it. The lime really is a nice touch. Otherwise, a run of the mill lager, but better than the American crap.
Good to drink on the beach in Mexico, or a hot day.  Very light beer, but fairly refreshing with a squeeze of lime.

Ok it’s pointless but this beer is a drinking beer. You need to have a lot to really appreciate it. Not that it’s better when your drunk, it’s just that you can actually for once have a ok beer not too expensive and you can drink a lot during the day.
decent if its almost frozen...  overall its a crappy beer.  Very bland and a watery mouthfeel/finish.  I hate that people think this is actually a good beer.
A weakling of a beer. Very low aroma and taste. People will $5.00 for this at a bar. Why oh why?
This one, do not touch if is not almost frozen. Warm, is horrible. It maybe the mother of the "fashion beers". Very watery.

This is something that should only be drunk at a temperature near freezing, at which point the taste actually becomes tolerable.  Having to be served with a mandatory lime wedge doesn’t help the cause either.

207ml bottle. (coronita) 

Pours a clear golden yellow with a weak bubbly head. Aroma hits you with strong grassy hops and alcohol. A little maltyness in there too. A touch too carbonated for me, but thats not a big deal. Flavour starts sweet and a little sour and finishes with some more sour weirdness. Aftertaste is just more of the same. Refreshing and easily drinkable but not one to appreciate.
If it doesn’t at least have a lemon and it isn’t ice cold I wouldn’t recomend even trying it. With those two ingredients it still isn’t good. Just tolerable.

I wouldn’t say this is a horrible beer. It is very refreshing, and tastes good with a lime. But in my opinion a beer certainly has some flaws if you have to put a lime in it. Good for the beach, but Molson Golden, and Sam Adams Summer are better.
Again, overrated.  Very, very overrated.  This lager is weak, light, and not impressive.  Go ahead and load it up with limes, it can only help really.  By itself, it doesn’t perform for the price tag
I still don’t understand its popularity; it’s everything you would expect from a macro Mexican beer; no head; light urine color; bad flavor.

Bottle. Citrus, metallic aroma. Extremely clear yellow. Thin to no head. White lace with medium carb. Sweet with a subtle citrus flavour. Actually quite refreshing at first but soon draws out to a thin watery lager. Poor beer but I could down some of these very quickly if gagging for a drink.

Pours a yellow color with white head that dissipated pretty quickly.  Has a chemical metallic odor to it.  Taste is light and of corn adjunct.  Not really offensive, but bland and boring.  I guess the drinkability is reasonable high.  One of the worst buys considering the price.

Smells funky and disgusting.  Totally watery texture, flavor is horribly muted but has some corn in there somewhere.  So bland I can’t believe there’s a light version of this.  seriously that stuff must be water.  This is totally underwhelming and one of the least flavorful beers i’ve ever encountered.  I can’t believe this stuff costs more than the craft beer at supermarkets usually.  The only thing this is good for is college parties because it’d be so easy to pound this shit.
Pours yellow with lacking head. Aroma of hops. Flavour is metallic with some corn grains. Watery body and lacking character. Refreshing at least.

Metalic cereal grains in the aroma.  Pours yellow blonde with little to no head.  Cereal grains, corn, metal, feint honey flavor but very dry, maybe a lime would make it better?  (and a beach i guess?)
very good drink with a lime for the beach, thats the only time i drink this but it’s good for that
It has a great classic mexican taste. I actually prefer it with out the lime. It is nothing special in the colour and scent part. The "skunky" aftertaste is something that I actually enjoy/
nice light easy drinking beer, taste great with a lime, kinda skunky bitter taste, expensive though
Bottle.  Aroma of grainy malt, same with the flavor.  Not bad on a hot day or with some spicy food.
fletch82 says this is one of the best beers to do yard work with and to pound,and its great with dinner

10/7/07 From 24oz bottle.  Aroma is sweet, very corny pils malt and extremely faint hop flora.  Appearance is light clear gold with a low white head.  Flavor is simple with bittering hops but no flora, low earthy malt and some light metallic/carbonic notes.  Mouthfeel is light bodied with a high carb texture.  Overall, always refreshing and easy drinking, but never the most interesting.
Original mexican presentation "barrilito" as shown under "Cerveza de Barril". Only notable is the bottle.
This is horible.  The only way to make it drinkable is to put a lime in it.  It doesn’t make it good it just makes it drinkable.  I think I will add limes to bud from now on.

well i can say i dont mind this water on a nice summer day with a bit of lime but still not a wonderful beer, yellow color decent head not much flavor other then water and corn ohh and the lime i added.
Bottle. Over priced. Pours a golden colour. Smooth with a bit of fizz. Way too expensive. This beer is only good when you are mowing the lawn and would drink anything near you.
Golden color.  Definately tastes better with a hit of lime.  Goes down smooth, rather "fizzy".  Not good for the high priced charged at most places.

Bottled 33cl. It pours a pale yellow beer with a small and quick diminishing white head. The aroma is extremely metallic with hints of cheese, lemon, soy sauce and hops. The taste is slightly bitter, sour, citrussy with hints of burnt tyres. Rather watery. Poor mouthfeel, (yet quite spritzy), metallic and grainy. The finish is very weak without a trace of bitterness. Poor, bland but not disgusting. Slightly better than Sol.

I have recently re-rated this beer, it has grown on me in only a few tries, and it is my wife’s favorite beer. I think that the lime is essential, but the resulting taste is quite good. It is something that you can drink with spicy and strong tasting foods very well, it has a very nice fancy yellow diamond color to it, and it goes down pretty smoothly, but not because it has no taste, because it does have a taste, a good one!
this beer is awsome but it just has a weard after tast the aroma is finne aperence very good but anything ells is  a ok

Had this on 10/15/1998. Color is a light bright gold.  Aroma is a bit skunky.  Taste is light and skunky.  Starting with a very light body that goes down bubbly.  Finish is skunky and bland. The only way people can get this stuff down is to mask the flavor with lime.
A very overrated beer. Compared to a Budweiser, but a hint easier to stomach.

This is a very bland, boring beer that has little more flavour than bitter water.  It is drinkable, but just, and I never buy it.  Compared to other Mexican beers, it is near the bottom, certainly below Pacifico and a tad below Tecate.  However, I might take this over Budweiser (close, though), and certainly over Bud Light.

[i] Bottle, (given to me!) whilst cruising along sedately down the Thames on narrowboat 15-09-07 [/i] Light golden, busy white head. What can I say other than bland, in fact the lime which someone had popped into the bottle before passing onto me probably stood out more than anything else about this beer.

If I were stuck in Mexico and had to choose between Corona and water, I guess I’d take the Corona (though not by much). If they put half the effort that they put into marketing into the product itself, this might taste like beer.
Insulting to Mexico.  Incredibly lame.  However, Miller Chill redeemed the classic use of Corona and lime.
This is the Budweiser of Mexico, do I really have to stae anything else?  I guess I do because of a 75 character minimum.

Pours a very light straw color with very little head. This beer is put into clear bottles which allows for damage due to light. Not a good idea. The taste is very weak, similar to a Bud, and a slightly tart finish. A very generic, forgettable brew.

Skunky right off... I can’t smell anything else because the sulfide fumes are so overwhelming. The only other smell is of cannabis... and I’m sure that’s not supposed to be there. Tastes almost like nothing, very watery with an acrid sweetness. Plus, there’s something metallic here... It’s almost as if I’m tasting the cap instead of the beer. All that said, it’s still hard to drink because every time I pull the beer close to my face I get a big whiff of skunk. Still beats Miller and Bud though.

Bottle. 

Cheap, light, chuggable beer. Thats about it. Nothing too different from a Miller’s or Coors.

I hate this beer.  I haven’t drank it in some time but its poor quality has indelibly scarred me.  Bland, watery aroma gives way to a slightly bitter but uninviting taste that is bland and finish is surprisingly bad for such a bland taste...
Standard pale lager. Has a little bit more kick in the palate. Sharper in the mouth. Other than that a lime is necessary in order to be able to tolerate it.

I just went to an All-Inclusive Resort in Mexico that served only Corona on tap. So I drank whiskey sours the whole time. This stuff pours pale golden with no head retention. It smells like cardboard and tastes like old white printing paper. This truly is one of the worst out there; why do people drink this stuff?
I drank this in the mid 80’s with the lime.  I will think well of this for the memory of that time. There are Much better Mexican beers available in the US, Tona and Modelo….

The best you can buy at a gas station.....tastes much better with lime. However there are many other beers I’d rather drink, just not widely distributed. Basically if you have no other choice go for it, beats most crappy light beers.
For what is advertiesed this beer sucks. The taste is bitter and skunky, even with a lime the beer is awful. It is too high priced as well.

"Skunky" was probably coined to describe this beer.  By itself, I’m convinced that it’s undrinkable, garnished with a lime it’s perhaps tolerable, and I think this is the only reason anyone drinks it, along with the "feel good summer" advertising campaigns.  I think that when properly garnished it does go down smoothly enough, and the finish lingers.  But this beer never fails to give me one helluva hangover, almost like they use some dirty south-of-the-border drinking water in the brewing process.  Personally I go with Pacifico over this beer.
Someone gave me one without a lime.  Yellow pour with a sizeable head and lots of carbonation.  Grassy aroma.  Tastes a bit grassy too.  I was unsatisfied with it.

A Mes rate: 
Bottle at the Hobgoblin in Baker Street. I really don’t like this place. A fitting venue for a beer of this quality. My fingers smell of lime...
Ya..not so good. Almost always smells like skunk. Much better Mexican beers available in the US are Pacifico and Sol. I’d prefer to drink even Tecate than this.

0.33 l bottle. Look really bad in the bottle. Cooled to the right temperature with the glass to feel the best of this so low rated beer. Yellow body with moderate head diminishing quite fast. Aroma is weak. But the taste is good, strange and not encountered in European lagers. Medium bitter, some wheat and corn? Nice palate - feels good with the long finish. Not bad at all, however, such a high price (At least in Europe) is definitely unacceptable for such a beer. Better to have a Belgian triple.
Update:Impaired rating
WHAT THE HELL???!!!! Why would anyone drink this? I was so upset that I beat my wife and children after drinking it.
What can I say, everytime spring/summer arrives and I see a Corona commercial, it gets me in the mood to sit by the pool and drink one.  Once the winter arrives, I forget about this beer.

What’s the premise with this one?  That by adding a little corn edginess to it that it is now set apart from the other North American macros as a distinctly Mexican beer?  Here, try this one, it smells and tastes a little more like a tortilla than what you’re used to.
this is a terribly watery brew that even a slice of lime cant help... the best yellow beer from Mexico is Pacifico or Sol, but thats not saying much

aroma is skunky with a piss yellow appereance . a lime and salt make it only drinkable alone is better. i use to drink this all the time when i was younger . what was i thinking .if you like mexican beers pacifico is by far better than corona

Had after a softball game from a team mate. We just spanked a team, and one of the guys brought a case. I reluctantly took one, and didn’t even finish because I’ve become such a beer snob! Even after a hot game, it just didn’t hit the spot. No limes were available, either!  Very single dimensional. Not worth drinking.

I’ve been railing on Corona (bottle) for awhile, but it’s not quite as bad as I remember it. I mean, it still sucks, but it’s not Milwaukee’s Best terrible. Maybe I’m only saying that because I’m drinking it for breakfast (brunch, maybe...no, no, it’s lunch-time already) for some dumbass reason. It’s got a nasty corn taste and a bad hay smell. Yeah, Corona’s still pretty offensive.

Without a lime, it’s bitter Mexican donkey piss.
With a lime, it’s actually better than most as a simple, summer day thirst quencher.  Take it for what it is.  Beer snobbery doesn’t really apply to Corona.

When fresh, a better beer than most of the so-called conoisseurs here give it credit. A highly drinkable, hoppy pilsener that packs more taste than alcohol. Far better than American and Canadian macro-brewery product, this Mexican beer nicely bridges the gap between hoser beer and European imports. And if your Corona actually NEEDS a lime, then it’s skunked.

330 ml bottle. oh corona, this may be the biggest mystery in the beer world that is the lcbo. you look like piss. you smell like skunk. you are a boring pale lager that sucks and yet you are a #1 seller. how we loath you. to be honest this isnt the worst beer. it pours pale yellow with a small head. it smells skunky most of the time. it has no complexity but its very drinkable.
I want to stress that I am not interested in beers as a fashion accessory. Corona with its lime, is all image little beer. It’s not the worst drink, slightly sweet, but there are so many better.
MUST HAVE A LIME. That way, you have flavour! See post by MaliMisho on 8/17. Couldn’t have said it better myself.
Decent with lime, and is mildly fruity when cold. But otherwise, they don’t call it mexican pisswater for nothing. Only redeeming quality is that it goes down without a fight.
It tastes good with a lime... but you should not have to put stuff in your beer to make it taste good.  Drink it cold on a hot day to numb your taste buds and use as a supplement to water.
Another summer beer in my opinion, best on a hot day served ice cold with a lemon. Not much to taste or look at and a little bit to steep a price for the quality of the beer.
Overrated beer with a good marketing team. Ironically enough, the biggest tools drink this piss.  This  beer sucks, whenever i see a newb drinking this i want to smash the bottle over their face.
Budwesier mexicano.  That’s it - if you are thirsty down the shore and the store ran out of water....

This beer stinks and is a waste of shelf space.  It’s no different than bud or coors.  Pale, straw color with a fizzy head.  Tastes nothing but overbearing malt to make an unsatisfying body of seltzer water.

You really do need a lime with this beer-without a lime, it’s a 1.6. Light aroma of cereal, pale color, golden hue, clear, a minimal head, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, light body, thin feel, fizzy, astringent finish

When you are on a hundred grand a year you can afford to drink this brew. Very light and pale in colour, not much of a smell on the nose and has a very tame flavour. Best served ice cold with a slice of lime, or lemon if you will. This beer is one for those who like an easy drinking and not over powering tasting beer.
Bottle. I’ve had worse beer, but this is not much better. Basically water with slight beer presence. Need I say more ?
ok so this is no upscale micro brewed beer but it is good for the summer picnic sitting out on the patio. light golden in color, definitely much better with a lime, and good carbination.
I hate this beer.  Hate it.  It’s everything I hate about Pale Lagers made on a grand scale: Light, wimpy, fizzy, and bland.  Why oh why do so many people buy this stuff?
Yellow colour with no head,thin and watery even with lime not good.Has come citrus aroma but its still bad.
Bottle. Ugh. Slightly sweet. Very mild flavor. I actually looked for a lime to wash it down.

Maybe the problem is that I didn’t have the lime. The beer looks like a regular beer watered down (with maybe a little extra yellow food coloring thrown in..really, how is it so yellow?). The flavor is skunky corn. The mouthfeel is syrupy, but unpleasant. This stuff is really bad.
Decent beer if (like the commercials show) you just want to relax on the beach with a beer in hand. Nothing i’d drink on a regular basis but wouldn,t turn down if offered.
One of my favorite beers because it reminds me of Mexico trips.  Its a great beer to drink during a bbq or a day by the pool.
very pale yellow, fizzy, and a very sharp taste. Kinda bitter aftertaste. However, it tastes a little more acceptable s a draft (if you happen to be in Mexico).
bottle,yellow fizzy piss water,thin white head,poored into a glass,it is not pretty but it was smoth crisp and suprisingly not skunky.no hop bitterness,very bland.
Yellow color, thin bodied, have after taste, you need lime to drink it, very nice to drink it when you are hanging with friends

Bottle.
Clear pale yellow colorued with a small white head.
Skunky aroma of grain and malts.
Flavour of malts and fruits with skunky and hoppy notes.

12oz bottle with and without the lime, yikes this is bad, not as good as i remember, either way this is bad and overpriced thank goodness for 2.00 dollar bottles tonight.

I will be passing, on corona from here on out

Corona used to be my "base" beer.  It is cheap, and light to drink.  It is pale golden, has a skunk smell, and is undrinkable without the lime.  Very thin bodied, and the lime eliminates the aftertaste.  OK beer, nice for hot summer days - it’s a very light feeling beer.
Update to previous:  Had this in a 24 oz. can.  Taste bland without the lime.  Amazing that people like this, but great marketing to "add a lime" since the beer is just bad without it.
The color was pale golden.  The head was thin, fizzy, and white. The aroma was skunky.  The flavor was corny.  The palate was thin bodied and the finish, abrupt.

[433-20070724] 207mL ("Coronita"). Light alcoholic aroma with faint wheat. Clear, yellow body with a quick foamy white head. Alcoholic wheat flavour is not unrepeatable. Light body, watery. Better with lime -- marginally.

Guess I missed this one at some point.  Corona is about as foul tasting a beer as you can find, yet their marketing campaign still prompts me to shove a lime in the bottle and drink one when it is extremely hot outside.  Ah, the wonders of advertising.

(Bottle 33 cl) Courtesy of joergen. Pours a clear, pale golden with a small, white head. Very subdued aroma. Medium body, unclean notes of malt and brewing cereal. Some cardboard notes as well. The finish is dry. Actually this comes out a little more like a drinkable beer than what I remember. 270707
Clear bottle.  good mexican beer. great with lime. low head with good carbonation. goes down smooth.

Bouteille transparente 330ml. De couleur jaune et transparente. Nez de maïs sucré, léger de grains de malt pâle et assez herbeux (gazon mouillé). Mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture aqueuse aux petites notes crémeuses. Léger goût de grains de malt pâle lors de l’entrée en bouche suivi rapidement d’un goût de maïs légèrement sucré et accompagné d’un goût herbeux (gazon mouillé) puis en finale l’on retrouve une très légère amertume de houblon herbeux (notes florales) ainsi qu’un petit goût chimique. Post-goût court, aux petites notes amères de houblon herbeux avec des traces chimiques.

Can! I was shocked to see this in a can as I  still like Corona in bottles as a lawn mower beer. It poured ok into a slight head that disappeared rapidly. With little aroma to mention, I tasted it and found slight traces of its original glory. It had a bite as a after taste, which made me dump the whole thing.
Must have LEMON or LIME in the head of the beer to give it a quite refershing tatse.  Enjoy:-P~
Ah Corona, what lovely memories i have of thee. The pound beer in highschool. Or the pound beer when you wanted to wow your friends. WOW, Corona?! What silly minds we were.

Corona can be a good beach beer or it can be a bad taste of skunk. Easy to plow down , a very light light lager at a regular alcohol %. Seems to be a pretty trendy choice at the clubs. Why is this more famous then Canadian beers around the world really it dosent make sense.

Light medium gold with no head.  Smell mostly of the lime in the drink, and not much else.  Taste is what you’d expect in a pale lager with a slightly different, bitter, yeast, or skunk taste or something, but not too bad.  Mild malty taste and a drinkable beach beer, but not great.
on a boat or a beach in the hot hot sun, this beer is almost required.  To me it beats the rest of the ’em
Lots of carbonation in this pale yellow watery aroma- and flavour free beer. Can be refreshing.
Bottle... I guess the easiest way to put it is that I have yet to like a pale lager.

Pours light yellow.  I can drink this and I find myself drinking this often in gatherings and at bars where this is the top of their import listing.  Have to have a lime for that extra burst of flavor.
Not totally awful, but very few redeeming qualities.  As with its light cousin, only advisable in a Mexican restaurant or when no other beers are available, and a lime is ESSENTIAL.
Not the worst macro that could be consumed in the U.S.  Pours the standard pale lager straw color.  Very little head.  Not bad w/ a lime and when served cold.
Questa è una porcata una sera l’ho pure bevuta calda; sale, limone, ma siamo matti. E poi che tamarrata la bottiglia; mai stata tra le mie preferite, neanche da piccolo.

Smells something like warm .... Bright golden color with a white head that quickly filmed. Thin to moderate body. Mild carbonation. Starts with light light malt and virtually no hop. Maybe some sour bitter in the finish, or could be soap. Corona Light was much better.
bottle.  small, white, fizzy head into (big surprise) staw yellow clear body.  pretty typical aroma and flavor from the Mexican pales.
not the worst beer in the world. ive found  myself drinking one sometimes if theres nothing else left but crap and corona

It’s beer, so it gets points for that. Not much else. OK if that’s what’s available but I don’t see what all the fuss is about not much taste, and like the commercial says, if you gotta add fruit, then somethings wrong with the taste. Actually I prefer it without the fruit. I think it tastes better, nuff said.

This is a beer that lacks aroma and a great taste but in the summer time I have been known to consume large ammounts. Best served with lime and with friends. MUST be ice cold. Once it has gone warm it turns very skunky even after re-cooled. Still if cold it is better than most American macros (on the right day)

Bottle. Tried in Barelona; very clear yellow color, no white head. Good to hot days, is refreshing and watery.

Cerveja clara e sem espuma, boa para dias quentes, aguada...

Very Slight head that quickly disappeared, no lacing, moderately bitter in taste, light body, bitter aftertaste that grows as you drink it.  Wouldn’t buy it again. Would rather drink most American Macros.

Poured no head. Very watery consistency with barely any lacing, but not as bad as many other Mexican beers like Tecate. Grains and earthy notes in nose and taste with medium bitterness. Not much going on here.
Really Watery mediocre compared even to other mexican beers. Grassy not too hoppy alot of carbonation which is common in mexican Macrobreweries.

The pour beers a very light, clear, straw color with a medium-sized white head that consists of very fine bubbles. The foam doesn’t lace the glass at all and does not last very long. The aroma is dominated by yeast. It smells mostly like a freshly opened smack-pack of brewer’s yeast. There are hints of grassy hops, too, and the mildest notes of sweet malt. The beer starts quite watery with a flavor that is difficult to describe as bitter or sweet. It has hints of hop flavor and huge carbonation bite that tingles the tip of the tongue. The middle of the tongue can detect sweet malts and caramel-like diacetyl, although they are mild and fleeting.  The finish is a combination of lager yeast with a gentle touch of bitter hops. The finish is quite dry and leaves a subtle zing of bubbly carbon dioxide. The mouthfeel is quite thin and excessively carbonated, too. Overall, the beer doesn’t have any horrible off flavors. I was expecting lots of corn in the flavor, but I didn’t really detect it. The main flaw is that it is very watery and weak in flavor.
The skunk of beers?  Corona is nothing to rave about but I’ve got to admit, it’s still better than all the american crap pale lagers like budweiser, etc.   Terribly overpriced. Not worth it!
Only beer I could get on the golf course. Straight from the bottle. Yellow color with head that grew with every sip. No aroma or flavors that stood out. Very drinkable.

To me, this is the definition of beer coloured and beer flavoured water.  The aroma is very weak.  The colour I’ve only seen before in toilets.  And the taste is watery.  Like Budweiser, it amazes me how many people order this beer instead of the multitude of great tasting treats in Canadian bars

what can i say? corona is a drinkable, not particularly spectacular summery beer. imagine being hot, and in mexico. you’d want one of these, mas frio. this is the beer i drink instead of american macrobrew, despite the fact that it tastes similar. 

it IS a little grassy, the lime is a must, and the clear bottle is OK if you buy the 12 pack, as it’s pretty dark in there. overall i’d say..."eh"

Bottle -- Aroma is light and floral, with grassy tones.  Liquid is light amber in color with a soapy head that diminishes quickly.  Light in flavor with a crisp clean finish that takes well to added citrus flavors.  Heavy carbonation.  Similar to most American pale lagers, nothing special.  Leaves much to be desired.

Bottle -- Dying to try this after all the bad things I’ve heard about it! Pours an insipid yellow wth a medium sudsy white head that soon dies away leaving a touch of lacing. Aroma is the standard corn bread, cheap lager smell. Very watery palate. Flavour is thin, metallic and unpleasant. It tastes for all the world like cheap lager watered down about 2:1. 
The guy at the pub who sold this to me told me that the slice of lime is intended to kill germs, seeng as the water in Mexco City, which is what this stuff is made of and is used to rinse the recylcled bottles, is about the worst in the world. Urban legend?

Bottle.  I’d say it’s better than most of the American macrobrewed pale lagers, but it’s still ludicrously over-marketed and over-exposed.  I love Mexican beers and while I don’t find Corona particularly objectionable, it’s also nondescript.  Add a lime and, voila, it tastes like lime.  Maybe I should add limes to anything by Budweiser, Miller, or Coors too.

I was trying a whole bunch of beers one evening, and after a few I came to Corona. It was really refreshing and the lime gave it extra flavour, almost tasted as good as a cooler. 

Later I tried it while sober and found that like many say, it tasted like grass clippings (think the lime may have had something to do with it though, never tried it sober with no added citrus). 

Bottom line: after having a few and are looking to keep up your buzz, can’t go wrong with a Corona.

PS: Don’t drink and drive and enjoy responsibly.
xxx I hate corona, it tastes like grass that my dog peed on (or so I can imagine, never tasted that)
Sickly pale yellow/gold. White fizzy head which rapidly dies, Thin bodied, with high carbonation.Slightly acid with a mildly bitter, dry finish. --- rather flavourless and boring.
Came in a clear glass bottle. A light bodied pale yellow liquid. Highly carbonated. Very small white head. Watery and rather bland. Very short bitter finish. Nothing good to say about it.

Some cheap beers, such as Budweiser, don’t have much aroma or flavor.  Corona manages to have an offensive odor and flavor, easily masked, however, by a lime wedge.  Why this beer is so sought after at its absurd price of more than a dollar a bottle is down to advertising.
not much head, not that, that would make or break a beer but it pours yellow/watery with very little aroma or flavor...one of the worst mexican beers(even for 25cents a pop in Mexico).

Aroma like any lager.  I disagree with the reviewers that say that this is as bad as the mainstream American macro beers.  Oddly, this one was not at all skunky, in spite of the clear bottle and what I have heard--it must have been fresh.  To its credit, I can taste hops--there’s a tad of zing.  There’s a little of that macro-sourness, but less than I expected...a hint of the creaminess I associate with Mexican beers, but less than any other Mexican beer.  I did not expect much when I tried this beer, but it exceeded my expectations by a lot.  It really is better than most American macros.  That said...it is still a mediocre beer.
Not really any different then miller, or bud.  But the lime does give it a little more flavor.  Nothing special.

Flavor? what Flavor? if you don’t shove a lime or a lemon in the bottle/glass there aint none. I only rated this beer so highly because I own stock in the parent company (Constellation brands). I am holding because this is still one of the great college party beers, and a reasonable alternative to the US macros.
Bottle. Pale yellow colour with small white mostly diminishing head. Malty aroma. acidic flavor.
Beer 67 Summer 2006 trip in Europe.  Drank on 7/13/06 Vienna Austria paid for with winnings from gambling machine.  Thought it was nice and ironic having this in Austria.

bottle.  Almost transparent.  If you have to drink it.  It is better in the bottle.  That way each drink is filtered through the lime.  If you don’t have a lime.......drink something else.  In fact, if you do have a lime see if the guy at the liquor store can allow for some kind of bartering for something better.
Bottle. Pale yellow with a slight white head. Aroma of starch followed by a slight grainy flavour and no finish other than a metallic aftertaste. Terrible.

6/17/2007:  No need to even pour this one into a glass...  Looking through the clear glass bottle, it is quite obvious that Coronita Extra is a very, very pale yellow color (picture a gallon of water with a drop of yellow food coloring added to it - actually, that still might be too dark for comparison!) and is extremely transparent.  A couple shakes of the bottle produces some loose, foamy white froth that quickly fizzes away.  Surprisingly, there is some light lacing toward the end at the bottom of the bottle!  The aroma is telltale Mexican beer:  grainy, grassy, sour, and slightly skunky.  The flavor is much the same with some additional urine and/or sweat characteristics and the typcial bite in the finish.  Seriously, how do people drink this stuff?  Ah, I know how:  Add a wedge of lime...  Yep, now it tastes like foul Mexican beer with some lime in it!  Actually, all jokes aside, adding some lemon or lime not only adds flavor, but it helps to smooth out the flavor and take the edge off the bite.  It’s definitely better with some citrus added, but anything is an improvement when starting at the bottom!  This beer has a light body and is very light and feels heavily carbonated on the palate.  This *might* be good served ice cold on an extremely hot and humid day during the Dog Days of Summer, but I’ll pass and just have water, thank you!



7 fl. oz. bottle (GI09C131 18:10) from Bigg’s Hypermarket in Harrison, Ohio.  This beer earned an extra point on the overall score because it’s available in 7 oz bottles.  That’s good for two reasons:  (1) It’s hard enought to get down 7 ounces of this beer.  I can’t imagine having to drink an entire 12 ounces of it (just kidding, it’s not *that* bad); and (2) 7 oz. bottles are great for the shower since they don’t last long enough to get warm!
Not bad with lime because the lime overpowers most of the beer’s otherwise lacking flavor. I am a firm believer that the taste should come from the beer, not the additives.
good infamous beer. little bite. and a little over rated. but still good. just not as good as its marketed to be.

Bottle. Very pale gold in color with a thin white head that doesn’t last. Definite aroma of skunk, undoubtedly due to the fact that it comes in a clear bottle. Although I used to drink this a lot when I lived on the border, the best thing about this beer is it’s appearance. If you really want to throw down, this is a good beer to do it with.

one of my favorite beers, i dont know why it has such a low rating. maybe everyone that rates beers on this site are just hardcore beer drinkers that will give any light and smooth tasting beer a bad rating... i have enjoyed all kinds of beer from all around the world and this is still one of my very favorites... nothing like sitting at the beach on the baja peninsula and cracking one of these open and adding a little lime if u feel like it...

Wow, so I was at a company party yesterday with free beer but the hitch was my only options were the two dutch "premium" piss brews (the big A and the big H) who I just hate so much for their ridiculous "premium" status among striped shirt wearing ass-monkeys that I cannot stomach them ever.  So I opted for Mexico’s mediocrest export, figuring that the lime would kill the inherent skunkiness.  It did.

From a 12 oz. clear glass bottle with a freshness date on the shoulder of bottle, sampled a cold temperature in a restaurant shaker glass with a slice of lime on the side.

Poured a clear yellowish lager golden with a small white head that dissipates quickly into a fine lacing, not an impressive start.

Clean and faint, but no mistaking the corn aroma, lightly fusel as well.

Good carbonation and a crisp, dry, smooth medium bodied mouthfeel, this is the best thing about this pale lager.

It’s an understatement to say this is bland and boring, corn, corn and more corn with the corn husks as well, flavorless hops that have a mild bite towards the end and a dry corn grainy finish, a clean finish overall. This was something that I was all to happy to dunk the slice of lime it.

Went o.k. with the chicken tacos I had for lunch today, but the next time I want a cheap Mexican beer I will just order a Tecate.
An over rated, highly marketed, chick beer with ’Extra’ in the name. Obviously they ware not talking about flavor, because this is donkey piss.

Clear bottle, check.  Skunked, check.  Needs a tablespoon of lime juice squeezed in to be considered drinkable, check.  Paale, clear, golden color with a fleeting, fizzy head and no lacing.  Smells of skunky corn and stale grains.  Thin and watery.  Consumable on only the hottest of days and most desperate of circumstances.

Believe it or not this used to be my favorite beer.  Of course at the time I only had that, Fosters, and Nat light.  It’s drinkable but not very enjoyable.  The commercials I think are what keeps the product alive because it appeals to younger drinkers.  I’m an ale (more specifically stout) fan anyways.  It may be the #1 selling beer in Mexico but everybody is trying to leave there! LOL  I drank this from the bottle

Even in AZ, this beer is weak.  You would think being closer to the border would possilby enhance the flavor.  It may be good for putting out the burn of a chili pepper, but that is about it.  One way to make it a little better is to take a couple sips then top off the bottle with Bacardi Limon.  It will make you warm enough that you won’t really care what it tastes like.
Bottle, 33 cl. Yesterday evening @ Harlequino (mex. resto) Ligth golden color, small white head. Aroma very light hops. Watery, thin body. Taste is boring, watery, very low malts and hops.

Again a highly commercial beer. Any beer that needs to be served like a sipit mixer is wrong! Flavour should come from the beer. No slice of lime or worse lime cordial should be needed to lift a beers quality -its liek putting got damn ice in one. Poor aroma - mimimum smell part from lime. watered lime cordial with little hops or character. for non beer lovers and students need i say more

I drink Corona from the bottle; to pour it into the glass just seems wrong. In Japan, Corona is usually sold with a little packet of lime juice, dressed up the Corona colour scheme of yellow and blue. It is not as good as a fresh juicy lime, but it’ll do in a pinch.

I empty the packet into the bottle, then seal the mouth of the bottle with my thumb and flip the beer upside-down to allow the lime juice to permeate the entire bottle. Then, flip it back upright and remove my thumb with a satisfying *pop*.

The beer has no aroma whatsoever, or at least it is completely overpowered by the lime. It is a pale golden colour, but I think it has character in its coordinated bottle, especially with a lime slice bobbing just under the long neck of the bottle. So an extra appearance point.

The flavour without lime is watery; with lime it turns into a taste explosion. The perfect answer to a hot and humid Tokyo day. The palate, to me, is perfect. The lime and heavy carbonation combine for a zesty ride all the way down the gullet.

Corona is one of my guilty pleasures; in my heart of hearts, I know it is not a good beer, but it is just so damned satisfying in the summer!

I’m definitely not impressed with this beer. It claims to have pale beer quality
or to be partial to the pale beer family,but its not!...Its "piss yellow"..Not much else to say about this beer, but this.....Buyer Beware..

trust me if i was on the beach like their on in the commercial, a corona is the last thing i`d be drinkin.just put a bunch of penny`s in a cup and have a mexican piss in it.it`d be cheaper and you`d get the same taste.i work at a liquor store and you wouldnt believe how many dipshits buy this like its liquid gold.

Rated 11/6/06:  Not a great beer and absolutely overpriced, but it still hits the spot once in a while. Grainy aroma, very pale yellow pour with a solid white head (at least for a short time), and a semi-crisp feel. Flavor is enjoyable in small quantities and best serves it’s purpose on a warm day with a light meal. Overall typical expensive "import" brew, better off spending less on a nice American Wheat.
There are better beers from Mexico.  It’s a good looking beer, and i like the clear bottles.  A fun ocasional diversion, nothing more.

Poured from a bomber into a wine glass.  For some reason, some guys at work drink this.  On purpose.  Pale yellow, clear with weak white head.  Smells stale, faintly sweet, metallic, and ever so faintly of rotting grass cuttings.  Not to be confused with fresh cut grass, this is like wet, rotting old yard waste.  Tastes watery, with a little sweetness made cloying by the lack of other taste.  This beer is so much worse than the average macro.  Are hops employed at all?  The finish is flat and sticky.  Other reasons to detract from the overall include the clear bottle and the relatively high price for such an awful beer.  Maybe some ice-draft-light beers taste worse, but they are clearly intended to deliver maximum alcohol for the buck.  This product is marketed as something to enjoy in a relaxed setting?  All the other Mexican lagers I’ve tasted are better than this.  In my experience, this is the most overrated beer on the site.

Not much of a beer.  Has a huge following with hispanics, much like budwiser here in the U.S. which goes to show how many millions people can be swayed by advertising both in U.S. and Mexico.  Very light appearance, like yellow water.  Intense skunk taste.  Make sure to and lots of limes with this one to get it down.
33 cl bottle. Ligth golden color, small white head. No aroma, just a hint of taste. Not just boring, there´s something bad in there somewhere. Lowest rating so far.
Bottle. I don’t know, I tasted the lime I put in it.  Otherwise went down pretty smooth.  Nothing else.
Low foam in spite of the high carbonation. Smelled ok for being a light lager, but the taste was worse. Initially it was just a watery light lager, but then it finished with a touch of cat urine.

Sampled at friend’s college graduation party. The Diet Corona just barely even made a rating from me, maybe full strength Corona Extra will fare better.  Pours a high vitamin C urine golden yellow with a fast dissolving white head. Aroma, ah man! More skonk than bread scents. Now I feel like "Sam-I-Am’s" friend who refuses to eat green eggs & ham.  
I won’t drink it in a box.
I won’t drink it with a fox.
I won’t drink it in a house.
I won’t drink it with a mouse.
I won’t drink it here or there.
I won’t drink it anywhere.
I do not like Corona Extra, man.
I do not like Corona Extra, Sam-I-am.

Bottle. Odorless and nearly colorless. Tastes like watered down corn. Garnished with a lime, it tastes like watered down corn with a splash of lime. The gods of corn are angry, and this is their revenge.

It’s not a bad tasting beer, but is made from mostly corn.  Although it does not taste like it, a professor at the university of wyoming did isotope analysis on it and found more of the carbon isotope present in corn (a C4 plant) than beers that only use barley (a C3 plant).  So basically you’re paying top dollar for a beer that was PBR - cheap to manufacture.  Hey but it taste pretty good for a inferior ingredient beer!  But yeah.... over priced.  If you’re gonna pay that kind of money get some becks or grolsch, brewed under the german purity law of 1516.
a yellow sparkling body with a white head  a light spicy hoppy aroma a verry watery flavor  with a short finish a verry flat beer almost no taste
Bottle. Pale golden colour with a fizzy white head. A light spicy aroma with notes of over ripe banana. Watery flavour. As good (or boring) as expected.
Very, very bad. Will only drink again if almost dying of dehydration.. or if in Mexico.

horrible to say the least. carrying little no more flavor than or equally crappy beers. this drink is overrated by the population. lacking aroma, being watery and tasting at best a little sweet when its ice ice cold this beer is made for people that think they are classy drinking a imported beer.
Im Mexican and this is the worst attempt of pilsener that i can recall, no real aroma, overpriced, it leaves you with a salty palate. NOT IN MY NAME ANYMORE!!
12ozer. pale. flat. weak. boring. pissy. overpriced. the king of the college girl beers.

No real aroma except slight adjunct sweetness. Golden yellow color. Flavor is almost non existent. Some faint sweetness. Not even really crisp. Can taste adjuncts though. I can drink this all day and not get drunk. That will give it more points than it actually deserves. Good to drink at the beach, in Ensenada, or with fish tacos amigos!

12 ounce bottle into a shaker glass, pale golden with a small quickly diminishing head. The aroma, if there was any, was light and grainy. The flavor was bland and watery with a touch of bitterness. If you squeeze a lime into it, this tastes like lightly carbonated lime juice. Not a good beer, but a great job of marketing to get people to pay extra for this beer and pay for there own lime to boot. When you squeeze a lime into any cheap pale lager it will taste pretty much like this one.
Great on a hot day with a lime.  Nothing too special though.  Not a great value beer either.
You must put a lemon or a lime in this one otherwise it tastes like a skunks a$$.
bottle from anywhere ;) - no explanation needed - better disquised with lime wedge - good when you are mowing the lawn in Florida or can’t afford good beers for a larger party

Bottle. I tried it from bottle, with and without lemmon. I prefer to taste the beer original, lemmen does the taste that there is not away. Tried it also from a glass, really this beer has no taste of all for me
Very refreshing with a lime during the summer, but not many redeeming qualities othat than that.  No head, pale gold.  Watery flavor.
A great beach beer because of its refreshing taste.  Add a lemon slice and you have a generous fruity flavor that is even better.

Pure escapism.  Live the dream. Demand limes.  Demand them.  Once you have entered the vortex the desire to marlin fish will grip you fervently.  If you have no means for such entertainment chase these thoughts with tequila.  Demand 100% puro de agave.  Do not settle.  If no such elixir is available switch to Dos Equis and hunker down.

I just love drinking this beer.  If I had an everyday beer then this is it.  If I can’t make up my mind or if there are no good craft brews available then it is time for a corona.  Call me a queer but I also like it with extra lime.

355 ml bottle.  Pours a clear pale yellow with minimal head.  Sweet noise with a slightly skunky overtone.  Sweet palette with little body.  Break the rules and add a little citrus twang to make it drinkable.

Bottle, 33 ml. Pale golden, small and quickly disappearing white head. Some bready malts with a clear - and quite unpleasant - touch of corn. Thin body, with a spritzy CO2 feeling. Slightly sweet, which is not good since it basically lacks any bitterness. Perhaps a slice of lime can save it if drunk at the beach, but i doubt it.

not sure why it got such a low rating by lots of people.
must be because:  A- it tastes like shit by itself and B- tastes like heaven with a slice of lime in it. i used to say "worst beer in the world is Corona, best beer in the world is Corona with a lime"
now i say best beer in the world is none, it hasnt been invented yet, and worst beer ever is high gravity and natural light

in bottle.
Very pale yellow, very gasified and with little head. The aroma is really bad, something very bitter is behind. The flavor is something sharp and bitter. The body is Light, very watery. It is really necessary to congratulate to the publicity agency and the handling of marketing. Which is the reason, because as much people drink this beer?. Is very bad

Typical Mexican beer that is way overpriced. There is no evidence of malt or hops in the taste. I would love to have a brewery tour to see what is actually in this. Bottled in one of the few clear bottles I have seen. It is only slightly enjoyable on hot days at the beach.
24oz. bottle, $2.99.  Hmm, I thought they tinted beer bottles for a reason?  What can I say, it sucks but, at least it smells better than heineken..
Not a bad brew when your sitting down to some fine Mexican food.  Better than the American lagers (Bud,Mich, MGD).  A thirst quenching brew.
I do subscribe to the Man Law, "There’s no fruit in beer."  That is until I met this little Mexican beauty.  The only way one can enjoy it is with a lime.  Enough said.
needs lime to be drinkable . . end of discussion . . thanks . . (i hit the 75 character limit count . . i apologize . . at least with the malt liquor ratings i gave you catch a buzz . . )
easy to drink great with lime on a really really hot day not much good for a beer tasting night or the like though

Bottle.  Pours light golden color with no head to speak of.  Aroma has hints of citrus but more skunk.  The best part about this beer was that it was cold.  Flavor again has light citrus but a skunky finish. I will not have this again.

Pours a light golden colour. No head. Light citrus aroma and hint skunky hops. This brew only has a refreshing part to it, and not much else. I have yet to try a stunning pale lager, but the search will continue.

In a bottle with salt, tapatio hot sauce, and lime.  A local taqueria serves their mexican beers that way.  I pretty much only get Corona there, mostly for the way they serve it.  Otherwise the beer is pretty much useless.

Bottle. Pours a very pale yellow with no apparent head. Quite a bubbly look. Aroma is malty with loads of hay (mind you: I got it without that terrible lemon slice). Taste expands the hay-like feel and adds a light sweetness.
Light golden color, with no head. It smelled a bit skunky with lemons. A good blend of skunk and hops, but little else. Fairly average.
Bitter skunk is the only recognizable flavor, plus at the price you can afford much better, even at a grocery store.
Because it’s so bland it’s hard to hate it, but I just don’t understand why this beer is so popular.
Bottle. Small head with short duration. Color is pale yellow. Aroma is weak and malty. Taste is light and malty. Hardly any bitterness. More refreshing than good.

I’ll admit that I drank this one out of the bottle (no lime) so I can’t accurately describe the pour, but I’m quite certain that "ultra-clear with a paper-thin white head that offered no lacing" would be a safe bet.  What I aroma I got was sweet corn and dirty water.  I’ll admit I’ve never liked this beer, something about its flavor I just don’t enjoy.  Mouthfeel?  Watery.  Shocking, I know.
Bottle at work. Clear light yellow - white head. Corn, lime, bitter, very boring.
Well, my search for a decent pale lager continues, as this one also tastes terrible. Haven’t had this without the wedge of fruit. Will update when I do.

Bouteille. Zoo Bar, Puerto Vallarta 25/03/07. Arôme faible de maïs. Jaune clair, mousse s’efface vite. Goût de maïs, légère amertume, effervescence forte, mince. Désaltérante et meilleure que l’eau mexicaine !

i think there is something to be said about the magical inl ife. do this on the hottest humid day of the year when you’re just burning up. pop one open a little lime and drink 1/3 rd down. instant air conditioning in a bottle. you can feel it running down your arms. come on now that deserves something!
An awful shade of clear yellow. No head. Very boring, I cant think of any other beer with less aroma or flavour. With the lime it actually tastes okay, but more like a soft drink then a beer.
Le gout est pas génial mais elle peu être très rafraichissante pendant l’été

Hmm...it tastes alright, but there are SO many better Mexican beers.  I have to admit, though, that it is one nice refreshing looking bottle.  It looks as good as an old-school longneck bottle coke on a hot day.  Not bad flavor, but pretty light and watery...keep searching Mexico for better brews.

Great casual beer.  If you are striving to impress others with an obscure high end beer, then this is not the beer.  For all other occasions Corona is a great choice.  The flavor is best described as mild, but this makes it particularly refreshing.  It is a great summer beer.

Biggish offwhite shiny head quickly shrinks. Pale yellow body with some carbonation. Light, rubbery aroma. Taste is sweetish bitter grain with a dry, rubbery, buttery aftertaste. Somewhat salty. Did not enjoy this, and poured out the rest after rating it. (0.33l bottle.)
Very little flavor except for the lemons and limes we perptually stuff in the bottle.  There are much better Mexican beers.

Hate it Hate it hate it.  I am not normally a wiine drinker but if I’m at a party and the choices are wine or corona I drink wine.  I prefer natural ice to this abomination.  Mexico gave us Tequila and the taco so I’ll forgive them

overall high rating is due to high rating in flavor which i based on having with a lime wedge, without lime wedge this beer is a 1.2-2.0. Good summer brew, good brew to buy in mass quantities for parties.

this is a horrible mexican beer, if you have to put a piece of fruit in a beer to make it taste better then thats a bad beer in my book. This beer should be sold only one day a year conco de mayo thats it other then that it should be used for target practice for cub scouts. thats how bad it is.

I was introduced to this by relatives at family gatherings and it quickly became one of my favorites. I usually bring it when I’m asked to supply the beer for a poker game, or other social event. Simply because you can’t go wrong with it. It’s one beer that everyone seems to enjoy!

Stillish pale gold, white foam. Really struggling to discern any aroma or flavours here. A trace of stale antiseptic cardboard graininess. Fumbling for...whatever the opposite to superlatives are. Watered-down ricewater? Too kind. Undeniably refreshing and easy to drink, but so is tapwater. And much kinder to your liver. Not to mention your wallet. A cornflake dissolved in a glass of water. Criminal.
ITs an ok beer, not the best, its just that this beer is so easy to get and is better than drinking a domestic beer.  great memories drunk off this watery beer.
Hey Speedy.. .you don’t be speedy when Corona is around de corner essay. Jumpin cactuses
Nothing special other than refreshing on a hot day. Almost like carbonated water, but with a hint of hops and malt. There is worse out there. No flavor is better than bad flavor.

Can a beer possibly be good if you HAVE to include a lime to enjoy it? There’s barely any aroma, the head is white and medium sized, the flavor (without lime) is bland. It’s like water. More carbonation than hops, and more hops than malt! This brew is definately not worth anyone’s time, except with a lime. But again, how good can a brew be if it needs a lime to be drinkable?

Really terrible stuff and way overpriced. Thin thin flavour, overcarbonated and always stale tasting. The clear bottle is really a bad idea and this stuff seems more often skunked than not. This beer is an insult to finer Mexican brews and anything else sharing its premium price tag. I would’t be caught dead buying it.

For some reason, I really like Corona, perhaps its the memories of long hot summer days or of even hotter women that I have drank it with, to me, its an "Old reliable" cold, clean and lovely with a bit of lime, available everywhere and a nice session beer, sure it doesnt taste as good as other beers, and sure it is drank in 2 mins, but heck, why not give it a chance?

On a very hot summer day, I do like an iced cold Corona, with a lime in it.  I feel like I should rate this beer with and with out a lime.  DON’T FRUIT THE BEER.  Okay...I will rate with out.  Without a lime, this beer is like drinking from a urinal.  With a lime, it is a delicious refreshing summer drink by the pool.  A lime can make a huge difference huh...maybe I should add lime to my wife’s cooking?????

Bottle, only with a lime. Due to this I feel the taste w/out the lime is horrible and almost undrinkable, with the lime its a very tasty beverage.  Still holds a golden/urine coloring and not really to my liking unless i’m on a beach

By far one of my least favorite drinks. Sampled a lot in Tucson but it is way to pricey for what you receive. Only thing nice is the pour but it is horrid with a bad after taste. Basically a beer for trendy people.

Bottle. A ’gift’  from some associates.  Urine like appearance with a faint beer like aroma.  Virtually no lacing.  First sip is not bad then a weird funky aftertaste overwhelms the tongue and taste buds. I just do not get the lure of this beer. Never underestimate the power of marketing and advertising.
this beer is a bottle of donkey piss the only way to make to tasty is to put a lime in it i think they made it this way. with a lime good without one mexican piss in a clear bottle
Bottle.Pale yellow.Thin.Not a lot of flavor.Not horrible,but not very good.On this occasion it was better than the available domestic alternatives.
pretty good brew, but it cannot compare to Pacifico, but i would drink this stuff till i passed out for sure
Typical summer thingy.. Something between water and beer. Weak aroma. Weak taste.
Pretty bad. Skunk, dirty bar, urine aroma. Next to no taste. Maybe a decent summer pool side beer, nothing better.

There is nothing that hasn’t already been said about Corona Extra, but I always find myself grabbing a 12 pack at the grocery store when I want something to drink besides water.  It’s not as rancid as most US domestics and I much prefer a non-twist off cap when drinking out of the bottle... the threads are obnoxious.  No one in their right mind would pour this into a glass unless it’s the can variety.

(Bottle) Well this is pretty crappy but not as incredibly skunky as I remember...Pours pale yellow with a little bit of white head. Aroma is a little bready/yeasty with notes of sour corn and light skunk. Mouthfeel is very watery. Flavor is sour corn, bread, yeast, skunk and quite acidic. Bleh.

Light yellow with no head.  Light aroma of sweet biscuit flavor malt - kind of like hard tack. Hops are very mild. Very carbonated and watery. Tastes better with Mexican food. Not too good on its own.

Not an impressive beer, too much like the typical American lager. Color is pale and weak, and flavor is thin. I drank my sample with a lime, so the test was not done under perfect circumstances; however, I probably got more flavor from the lime than from the beer.
Bottle - Watery yellow with no head to speak of.  Not a good beer.  However, while being served Mexican dishes under the hut canopy at Passion Island in Cozumel, it’s better than the water.
I hate this beer if I dont have a lime I think it tastes like piss very very old piss with mold on it.
i do not see why this beer is so popular.  it is really not very good.  do not let it get warm.  it is worse
This beer is definitely not without it’s charm---average carbonation, average taste. But for some strange reason it goes down great on a hot summer day, with a lime of course. Weak and watery.

I dont know why I love this beer, but i do. I think it tastes like mexican piss. But their is nothing like standing on a beach in Cancun or PV with a cold Corona with lime. over priced and over rated, but a centamental favorite.
Well, the one benefit to this beer, is it doesn’t taste too bad warm, so its good for just sittin out on the beach drinkin beer. Other then that, i’d much rather drink something else.
my favorite beer to drink on a warm sunny day with or without a lime.  I love the taste.  Mexican pee all the way!!
Over-priced and over-rated.  However, I can’t lie about enjoying them (with lime of course) when I am drinking them in the casino.  However, I can’t imagine drinking one without a lime.

I don’t know how to rate this beer... by itself or with limes.  The limes make a big difference.  Without a lime it can be difficult to drink.   But there isn’t much that beats a Corona and lime on a hot summer’s day.
befor i moved to englandi used to drink this and i had to put 2 limes in it. now a days i dont think i would bother. but i do agree itsa beer for summer time but it always makes me have to pee

Hey someone peed in my seltzer!  At least if I put a slice of lime in it, there’s a hint of flavor.  Why do people buy this??  How did this become the number one selling beer in Mexico?  When I see people drinking this beer (or worse -serving it), I can’t help thinking they’re not quite right in the head.  Of course, I’ll down a few if they’re free and no actual beer is available.   Oh and don’t try without the lime whatever you do!  The lime is accounts for 1-1.5 points alone.
Very enjoyable if you are in the mood for a fruitier beer on a hot summer day.  Corona is less than satisfactory if you don’t use a lime wedge.  Good beer for the beach.

I don’t think there is an aroma, guess thats better than a bad aroma.  About the same appearance going in as coming out.  What the hell is a "palate" anyway?  Tastes like its been skunked for a few solid months.    In hindsight, I probably should have used more limes.

I love the look of this beer to be honest. It may be the outright easiest to drink on this beerful planet, partly because it isn’t really beer of sorts.. but it definately has a certain appeal. There’s just something about the clear-glass bottle, and the urine colour, and the delightful colour-matching lime rammed down it’s throat that makes me quite happy. If im not in the mood to drink beer then I’ll take this over anything else and I’m still happy when I am in the mood. light body, thin feel, lively beer.

Could be worse -- could be the "light" variety.  Sans lime, it’s pretty awful.  And that’s not the most ringing of endorsements.  Typical lager blonde, typically flavorless and unexciting.  Quickly diminishing white head, moderately hoppy.  Decent lacing, but who the hell cares?  Maybe a chick magnet on the Cancun spring break.  Otherwise, not worth it.
I know, it’s a gimic with the lime but on the beach in the Outer Banks when its about 100 degrees, I’m OK.
Corona?  I dont hate it.  Mind you, it’s not a great beer, but give me a 12er of corona and a few limes, they will disappear.

No head, yellow colour, no aroma, taste sour, lemon palate, no body.
Not the beer for me

My favorite beer as a juvenile. This beer just doesn’t taste as good as it did back then. Maybe they changed the ingredients or maybe I like good beer now. Goes down smooth, no taste. A friend told me if you have to add fruit it must not be a good beer. This deffinetly applies. I would still drik this over the "big 3".
Nice apperance, crystal clear pale yellow with a proper white head. Nice artwork, nice bottle design, no offensive aromas, no flavors, no reason to to buy another one...

Bottle. Frothy white fair mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Week to no aroma, touch of lemon though. Bad light bitter flavor, thank god not powerfull. Very watery palate and very fizzy. I would rather have a radler!!!!!!

Bottle. Pale yellow with short head.  A hint of malt, the rest is water. If I have to drink this again, I think I’ll have that wedge of lime after all.
This is proff that packaging and marketing is everything.vThey even ship this to the Arctic wasteland of Svalbard!
Ice cold corona & a handful of limes are perfect for a summer day.  I always add a pinch of salt - it just seems to make it taste better. ::shrugs::
Bottle. Clear yellow colour with almost copletely dissapering white head. Malt and a little hops in the nose. Watery on the palate and just a hint of malt in the flavor. Very short and watery finish.

Thin pale yellow colour with a fast disappearing small white head. Aroma and flavour: weak and grainy. Not a bad beer just tasteless. Some times its actually good WITHOUT a lemon in it, but served well chilled.
alcohol, banana, bubblegum, butterscotch, clove, cooked vegetables, cough drop, ginger, licorice, raisin, rotten eggs,
Just plain old Mexican beer near the bottom of the pack. Not too much taste goes down really well on a hot summer day. Seems as it goes on it gets a bit skunk maybe due to clear bottle.

I totally agree with IPAGargoyleGuy on this one.  This has the distinction of being the only beer in the WORLD that is worse than Bud Light.  I honestly had no idea what heartburn was until I tried this travesty.  I thought I was having a heart attack.  Honestly.  That was 5 years ago and I have not had heartburn since.  UGH!!!

Honestly, I think this is the worst beer I have ever had. I will drink Keystone over this garbage (I’ll take no taste over bad taste). Even with a lime it still tastes dirty and cheap. I don’t understand how people can enjoy this.

Bottle, from mug. An aggressive pour produced a big frothy white head, which faded fast and left some very poor lacing. Color is the typical pale lager yellow, but half a shade darker than Budweiser. Aroma of corn syrup and cheese. Body is a notch above tap water, with a syrupy texture and fizzy carbonation. Tastes more like soda than beer. Finishes with a weakly astringent bitterness atop the sticky sweetness.

Bottle.  It’s a Corona, for goodness sakes!  Not anything special, but I’d take it to a Bud any day of the week.  Corn flavoring is overdone, and it comes off as cheap... but it’s imported cheap, so it’s better.

bottle - but with a lime.  Do not try this beer without one.  If it wasn’t for constantly being skunked I might have a better rating for this one.  Definitely marketed well which would explain it’s popularity.  Light taste, usually ruined aroma, not quite watery but no body whatsoever.

Not a bad beer, tastes watery and I guess a little sweet. If you put a lemon or lime in it the beer becomes decent. Just because girls like this beer doesnt mean that its not a good beer. Its a lower-alcohol, low-flavor beer that mixes well with food and taquilla

Worse beer in the world!!  Anyone who drink this should be shot!!

Might as well drink your own piss!!!!!
Bottle - Memphis. Bright yellow, head was clear to white in color and large bubbles. Served with a lime...so the beer tasted like lime...
A good, simple, typically available beer.  Better than similarly widespread beers but lacking the depth of other Mexican and latino brews.
Not much to write about this one, yellow in color and lacks any flavor.  The lime helps when you have no other options.  Although better than MGD etc.

It had been a while since I had a Corona but there’s always a work “party” to remedy to this situation.  Clear yellow body with a short-lived white head.  Despite the clear bottle I don’t remember coming across a skunky corona (probably too watery to be skunky).  Not very offensive, some corn in water and that’s about it.  Lively carbonation.  Over here there’s that ad running all the time on tv with this guy sitting on a beach watching a gorgeous babe walk by while there’s a Corona on the table next to him.  I guess the message is that watching a nice woman behind is more interesting than drinking a Corona.  I couldn’t agree more.
i agree with pretty much every one on here with a low rating. not bad for drain pours, but if you need fruit in a beer to make it taste better forget about it!

I’m struggling to find something to write about this beer. I mean it’s pretty to look at. It tastes of... tastes of... things that are like... well I’m buggered if I can remember if it tastes of anything to be honest. You can learn a lot about people from the beer they drink and as a barman when people ask for Corona (which we don’t stock) I have to tell them, that the only thing that’s brown and tasteless in our bar is the door don’t let it hit your arse on the way out. A trendy beer for trendy morons who don’t want to taste anything.

What I like about it is how light it is.  I could drink a case of this and not bat an eye.  Yes, its bad and needs the lime, but once limed its a better alternative to domestics such as bud light, miller lite, etc.
Any beer that requires the addition of a lime to improve flavour...give me a break.  The best thing about this beer is the clear bottle.
Mexico’s piss water describes this beer. Possibly the most overly hyped beer ever. There is nothing special about this exept its "miles away from ordinary"...Yup, miles away from anything good.
Multiple bottles and drafts over the years. Nothing offensive but not amazing either. Best enjoyed on a beach and served by a bikini clad woman.
not very nice at all, i don’t think it’s cerveza, I wouldn’t call it beer. drank it warmish. laced my mouth with a cloying, cheap cigar aftertaste that don’t quit. now can’t macarena.

Ok, I’m having it, but I’m in Mexico, in Nuevo Laredo
Blond color. Light aroma and taste, very common and undistinguishable.

Served during an Xmas event by some friends. I haven’t had one of these, or anything other than high-end beer, for quite a while.  Bright clear gold color - is this natural or enhanced?  Head of large bubbles not unlike a soda.   First whiff - mercaptan / skunkiness and lemon, CO2 sharpnesss.  Gotta love that clear glass and who knows how old the bottle was.  Flavor, more skunk, more lemon, some sourness and lots of harsh carbonation.  At this point I’m really wishing I had a slice of lime.  Ah well, beats a glass of water .  I need to try a fresher bottle that isn’t skunked - surely they aren’t all this way.  I find myself watching my buddy drinking the New Glarus Enigma we brought as part of a gift pack and hoping he appreciated the offering.

I try constantly to convince my Mother in law that this is horrible, but she thinks its the best ever because she can drink them fast.  I can’t believe this is still so popular.  In a word..........Disgusting.

Wow, I don’t know what to do when I drink this! I sometimes think of simply ending my life! Just kidding, but I do think that this beer is simply crap and should be pulled off the shelves. I don’t understand how a catchy commercial could lure so many suckers into buying this peer flavored beer. I am sorry I should not give this beer that much credit. You must forgive me for my bad attitude, but this beer just really sucks. Without the lime this beer is lost.
Pale yellow color. Average head. Very light aroma of malt, possible corn. Skunkish. Nice light summer beer taht requires a lime.

I find this to be a harmless Mexican lager. It doesn’t seem to be as convoluted as Budweiser, but without that lime, what’s the fuss. Without the lime, it’s got a bready aroma and a stale taste without any of the hoppy finish that a decent lager should have. And why is it so expensive?
Undrinkable without lime.  Better than a Sol, but significantly worse than a Pacifico.  Amongst mexican beers it is definetly an average contender.

I find this guy to be one of the most overrated beers around.  Maybe it’s not as widely distributed elsewhere as it is here in Texas, but this beer just is not worth the price it goes for. Do yourself a favor and get tecate instead: its cheaper and in my opinion a bit tastier

Blech.  Tastes like carbonated water colored with Yellow #5.  A six pack costs the same as a six pack of Bells Two Hearted Ale.  So, how anyone could be at the store, see the two next to each other, and then choose this crap is beyond my understanding.  Drinking Corona Extra is just plain unpatriotic.
good. a classic, but not as tasty as the light.  xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx

Bomber, pours yellow with a white head, yeah what can ya  say, pretty flavorless, added some lime juice, and now i’ll probably be able to throw down one glass, painfully... why the hell do they make this in bombers?!?!
What can you say its Mexican beer.  You need the lime just so it has some flavor.  We call it chiwawa piss.
Bottle. clear with light head. Skunky beer,but better tasting with 2 limes in it. Mexican beer. They can keep it.

Can: in a taxi without air conditioning.  I think I sweat this out before it was absorbed by my system.  Nearly undrinkable without the lime...Even the lattitude didnt help this much. Nose of corn medium body.  Yellow color.  EEK!

Of the people I know that drink this, 95% of them are women- 75% of which, drink it because they think the lime looks cute in the bottle. Just another weak flavored pale lager like every other one, but I’ll give it extra overall impression points for their clever commercials.

Why anybody would pay so much for such an aweful beer is beyond me.  Take away the ad campaign and the cool bottle, and you have a skunky, adjunct-ridden swill beer on par with bud light.  Almost no flavor what so ever...I can’t imagine what the light version is like.
It is better to have this one with the lime. Class of its own kind, but would not really call it a beer, but a limondae.
Smells like urine, Looks like urine, Tastes like what? God only knows what, but chances are, it’s urine.
there are 3 beers that all the yuppy bars in chicago stock and charge $5+ for a bottle... heineken...amstel and of course corona.  wtf? am i right?

Pretty much a "meh" beer for me.  Ratings based off of no lime...my overall goes up a couple notches when had from the bottle with a lime.  A thin bodied beer with a bitter taste and quick finish.  Ok to have on the rare occasion.

Im not a huge corona fan i perfer dos equis, but it is a good beer on a hot day with a lime in the bottle.  It seems to me corona tastes better one day from the next.  Corona is not horrible but it does not deserve all its sucess either.

RERATE::: 8 years later::: Bottle served while moving Andrew into his new apartment with Brendan and Streets. Golden yellow body with light white lacing. Aroma is sweet bread, light corn cereal and a nice malty bread sweetness. Mouthfeel is carbonated with the same basic flavors coming through. This isn’t as horrible as some of the other mass-produced pale lagers out there, but the price point is certainly unwarranted. +1.1

::::::
Overrated by the "mainstream" and certainly over-priced. The only time my friends and I have ever thought about buying a case of corona was to do Corona bombs (with a shot of bacardi limon).  Ive heard this beer referred to as "Mexican piss" and I cant help but agree.

Another favorite of college kids with little money. For a better Mexican beer, try Dos Equis or Negro Modelo.

Re-rate:8/4/07....I was at a BBQ and this stuff is freaking GREAT with BBQ stuff.....you can drink alot of it. Tastes ok, better that heiniken, I think. Had them side by side.
What kind of beer needs a lime to at least drink it? Oh, thats right any kind made of piss.

One of the only beers I HATE. Were it not for the cool commercials I would throw up everytime I saw a bottle. I love all types of beer, but for some reason I can’t even take a sip of this without gagging. Is it the clear bottle that lets the sun light in? Who knows.  Dress it up with any fruit you want. It’s awful.
There is a reason why people will fruit the beer: because it tastes horrid.  Thin yellow urine color.  Smells slightly skunked.
12 oz bottle...  blah... piss water.. you need a lemon or a lime just to drink it..
Never understood the hype surrounding this one.  Aroma is skunky, flavor is skunky, lime helps marginally.  Definitely best ice cold out of the bottle.  Overpriced.

A solid mass-distribution beer, which tastes best out of the bottle.  Sometimes good with lime, depending on the season and my mood.  The beer has a rich golden color, and is clear with a light whie head.  It has mild to moderate carbonation and is dry and smooth.  Also contains a subtle kick, which I can best describe as spicy.
I’m with you guys on this one.  I’ve never understood why people are so crazy for this beer.  Tastes a little bit skunky all the time to me.
Even with a lime its not that great.  Don’t understand the consumer infatuation.

Look at all the limes in this god damn thing! This fuckin’ thing is tropical! Look at the limes, how they float. That’s good news. Next time I’m on a boat and it capsizes, I will reach for a lime. Like I’ll be water-skiing without a life preserver, people will say "What the hell?" and I’ll pull out a lime, and a lemon too. I’m saved by the buoyancy of citrus."
This has probably got to be the worst tasting lager I have tried this year. It’s foul and a total waste of £2.10. The only enjoyment I got from this was sucking on the lime that came with it.
Poured out from 12 oz bottle,  off yellow appearance with a white foam head.  Aroma was of stale beer.  Very drab and uninspiring pils type brew.  Just taste un-clean to me.
Great beer, light clean smooth taste, nice looking bottle, i prefer to drink it without the lime/lemon wedge, one of my favourite imported beers. Money well spent!
good if you are in a bind but only a step above budweiser. sdandard color ok head  nothing special
Skunky.  Very Skunky.  With a lime or without it, still tastes just as bad.  This is a definite Pass.

If you want to drink Mexican beer and enjoy yourself, why not get some Negra Modelo.  Why even put up with this stuff?  I thought that Corona was the shit, when I was 21.  6 years later, I think Corona is shit.  But IMO it is better than Budweiser, albeit barely.

I have a special love for Mexico in general, which includes especially its equisite food and light beer, as well as its culture, history, language and movies, to name a few things. Just like Sol, XX Equis and the others, Corona is far from an exception, especially accompanied with Mexican tasty and spicy food, it’s just about the best there is. :) Some complain that it doesn’t taste suficiently, perhaps that’s one of the reasons for it’s strong popularity among many Scandinavians, as the standard beer we get in the food store or the local pub, in many cases would have been nicer without it’s taste?

Ugh... a beer with little flavour that for some reason is available everywhere. Every bar that you wakl into serves this beer with that obnoxious lemon on top. Taste is light and body is non existent. If I have to drink it, I just turn it into a Radler by mixing it with Sprite.

Bouteille claire de 207 ml, vendue sous le nom de Coronita Extra, achetée chez ANBL (Dieppe, N-B). Arôme: Légère odeur de moufette. Apparence: La couleur est blonde avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Pas vraiment de goût particulier qui ressort. Courte durée de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps et la texture sont mince. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence de fruité en arrière goût.  (Rating #733)
if it weren’t for PBR this would probably be the worst beer that I have ever had. Why anyone would pay this much for this trash is beyond me
Even though its not bad, i have to say i was a little disappointed when i drank this for the first time. Definitely not worth the price
clear gold.  fizzy, quickly diminishing head.  large lacing bubbles.  grain aroma.  flavor is mild and watery.
Pretty stabnard lager - similar to XX Equis really, but nicer than Sol.  Not much taste, but good served ice cold.

Pale corn yellow colour. Very thin head. Catty or skunky aroma, probably (likely) due to the clear glass bottle. The cattiness masks any hop or malt aroma that may be present. Flavour sweet and vegetal. Large amount of cooked corn flavour and a note of cooked cabage. No discernable hops or malt flavours. I added a wedge of lemon to the glass (no limes in the fruit-bowl, atm) and this balanced the sweetness somewhat, but the lemon acted as a nucleation point for the CO2 and the beer rapidly went flat. I would add citrus only to the neck of the bottle and drink from the bottle next time, although there may not be a next time. I really did not enjoy this beer.

Even without the lime, Corona has the best tangy finish of the Mexican beers.  To call it cheap is to miss the point.  With a fresh tortilla in one hand, I wouldn’t be caught without a Corona in the other.
The best beer from Mexico yet, in my opinion.  It may be light but it packs a good punch.  Drink this on either Mexican Independence Day or Cinco de Mayo.  It’s better than Dos Equis.
Better than sol, but not by much.  You can get much better beers at the same cost.  Get Negra Modelo instead.

Any beer they recommened a lemon to boost the taste is likely bad news. This one certainly is.  I’m not too sure as to why this stuff is so popular. Pretty bland, even with the lemon if you ask me. Good one a hot day I guess.
