Cheap, Commercial Beer, Nothing Special. It’s definately miles away from ordinary because it’s horrible. The mexicans have no skill in brewing.

Bottled in Mexican restaurant in Vienna with my friend Rainer. Without lime it is really nothing special but with lime and Mexican food worth to try it. Since then I go for it in every Mexican restaurant.
From the bottle. Clear yellow gold, light in taste. It improves with a slice of lemon or lime.
Nothing new to add.  It is what it is.  A cheap, thin commercial pils that is light in both body and taste.  Not the worst, but nowhere near the best . . . but hey, it was free.

Bottle. Almost noone drinks this in Australia without a slice of lemon (or possibly lime). Interesting that this hasn’t really caught on with other dull watery pale lagers. Can’t really see VB being marketed this way, but might be worth a go.
Not the best tasting beer out there, but I’ve tasted worse. Tastes better with lime.  The after-taste will last for hours.

This beer is very refreshing when cold.

It also tastes rather good with a lime, and you can drink it fast.

But, drink it fast, if it warms...not so buena...
Little flavor, aroma, and palate. Adding a lime however, can make for a satisfying experience.  A mediocre, yet drinkable beer.

The best beer you could possibly bring to the beach on a hot day... thanks to marketing.  I like this beer though.  But I’ve heard that a friend of a friend visited the brewery in Mexico and will not drink Corona any longer.
Very little I can say about this that hasn’t been said already.  Weak, watery, dry, pale, bland.  Lime helps, but you shouldn’t have to add something to a beer to make it taste better.
Good on a hot summer day with a few lime slices...not a serious beer in any way.
Yellow beer with not much aroma, not much flavor, not much afterstaste, but thousands of fans worldwide. Something wrong? Quite good thirst quencher if you haven’t any othe drink

I know, this isn’t a beer I should be proud of, but it was offered to me free and I had it without a lime. It’s an extremely thin and watery beer, it looks so light, it’s like carbonated water with a touch of dark corn syrup or something. Smell and flavor are skunky as we all know. It’s obvious why people put lime in here.
12oz bottle-Light golden color with a nice white head and an aroma of corn Taste of corn and kind of watery. I don’t understand what people see in this beer.
Bottle. Light and not very tasty beer. Low aroma (if any). Kind of refreshing with a bit of lemon.
Bottle. Memories from being young and thus i cannot be strict. One night with Corona Extra and Lemon (not lime) .....anyway never drunk it again once i grew up :P

Never liked this beer. Why the youger crowd think it is "hip" to drink I will never know.Watered down, pour it in a glass and it is flat city. The profit must be huge in terms of its price and cost to brew. Very watery beer.
Pours yellow and watery looking as well as taste. I really consider this garbage. Very over hyped.
Corona...With a lime please...Not a bad beer.  One of my choices for Mexican beers.  I’d rather have their other brand...Modelo Especial.  But corona is classic Mexico beer.
A beer that can only be drank by adding citrus to cover up the unpleasant taste.  No color, bad finish, almost water.

Vile crap. I wasn’t going to review this beer, but it is classified as a beer, and I have had it, so I guess I should rate it. Pale straw yellow, little head, little lacing. Sort of has a skunky - dirty water taste to it. I just cant drink this crap. Every once in awhile I get a 6 pack for my wife. She rarely drinks beer so they always sit in the fridge for a long LONG time. It needs a lime to mask this nasty brew. BLECH! Quick test... Sort these reviews by "Highest Ratings" and check out the experience those reviewers have. Then sort this beer by "Top Raters" and check out the scores from the most experienced. This is total crap.

What a lovely looking beer, but the pleasure stops as soon as you crack it open. Everyone loves a corona with lime, especially in the summer. Even if your not a beer lover - it looks good to have one in your hand when mingiling with others on a saturday night. Lets face it, the beer isnt the best brew to drink, but it does the job.!
tastes just a little bit better with a piece of lime added but its not bad by itself

I have had more of these than I care to remember, so can’t believe its taken me this long to rate it.  Okay, so its not a great beer in the sense of the categories, but is a great sitting at a black-jack table/pool/beach/cabana/backyard barbecue/[over a plate of nachos/insert your own] kind of beer.  Low on aroma and taste (though a lime kicks it up a good notch), however I gave it okay appearance, because, face it, seeing a corona means good times.  Not a great beer, but a great beer nonetheless, if you know what I mean.
This is the first beer I liked when I started drinking beer, now I can’t figure out why.  Not much flavor even with the lime... I guess I just followed the crowd.
i dont mind corona.  really nobody cannot like it. its just one of those beers nobody can hate on.... goooo corona
This is a fun brew. I don’t like the clear bottle, but otherwise, it’s crisp, tangy, refreshing, with a great citrus zing.   This is a great $1 beer at a bar.

Well, I’ve drunk plenty of these, but there’s nothing really good about corona except that you can put that lime in it to actually give the beer a taste.  Yellow color, some citrus flavor mixed with lager taste.  I only drink corona from the bottle and they are only good to drink on a hot day at the beach.
TASTES LIKE A REGULAR BEER.THE AROMA IS OKAY BUT NOTHING SPECIAL.THE FLAVOR TASTES LIKE LEMONS AND BEER.
The most famous beer that is a overrated beer-ish water. Pale beer, fine head, not much taste but thirst-quenching beer when its really hot
What can I say, this famous beer is great with a little of lime to kill your thistines and refresh you, it always refreshes! But is it really a beer? ;)
Bottle. Llight yellow colour without head. Hoppy aroma and citrus flavour. Watery.
Bottle, light yellow colour without head. Hoppy aroma and citrus flavour. Taste better with a lemon. Absolutely best to a hot mexican dinner.

Your typical pale yellow american beer with just a little something extra.  When I first drank this beer, I thought it was the lime the barmaid put on top.  However, even without the lime it has a slight citrus lime flavor.  Cost was $2.50 a bottle at Little Traverse over by Racoon State Park.  A little expensive for the typical american beer. I guess mexican food made this popular.

Maybe I just don’t get it, but why the hell do people like this so much. I work at a chain discount liqour store and we can barely keep this garbage on the floor, and it costs $7.49 a six pack! I understand wanting an easy drinking lighter style beer in  the summer, but there are far better choices than this. A nice weisse, summer ale, or even a pilsner would certainly be a better choice for the palate and wallet. Corona is crap with or without the lime. Better with the lime though, at least there’s some flavor then.
12 oz bottle.  I think it tastes a little better w/ a lime actually...So far, I like this the best of my Southern Neighbors’ concoctions...

Had this one whilst wasing the auto today. Found it in the fridge leftover from something or other. Was a very hot day. The warmer the beer got, the better it tasted. Poured yellow, carbonated, with a flat hoppy aroma, same for the taste. Although this one IMO is much better than BMC but not sure why the price is so inflated compared to BMC.

citrus, clear, golden, aminimal head, light body, average carbonation.  Throw a lime in one of these and it’s not a bad brew.  I mean its a light beer meant for Mexicans because its hot, and girls and frat boys because they don’t know quality and Corona is trendy.  My qualm is that its too expensive, you can pay just as much for something way better.  But for a year round lite beer, its not bad.
(0.33L Bottle) Yellow with no head. It’s amazing how much people will pay for this beer, even though it’s just as bad as Miller or Bud. Watery and carbonated. Slightly sour aftertaste.

bottle.  Aroma:  Skunked.  A little bit of malt detected behind all the skunk.  Appearance:  Seemed just a little lighter in color than the usual BMC lagers.  Head was white and foamy, but didn’t last long.  No lacing.  Flavor:  Skunkiness with a hint of malt and hops.  Palate:  Light bodied and watery.  High carbonation.  Was expecting a clean finish, but left a funky flavor in my mouth.  Overall:  Drank this with some friends after work.  Their choice, not mine.  Took notes without the lime, and finished it with.  Tolerable with the lime.  Still tasted like skunk, though.
Corona loses points with me because of its skunky aroma and dubious looks. Get past these things and Corona is not a half-bad tasting beer. More of a summertime thing, though.

I picked this up ONLY because I spent the day at work in humid 90 degree conditions and had nothing cold. Stopped at quickee mart near home. It was ice cold. I kiledd the bomber in about 10 minutes. Nothing great but it sure beats BMC.

12 oz bottle. Clear golden color with thin bubbly white head that didn’t lace the glass. I made sure to ask the waitress to leave out the lime. It had a light fruity aroma and flavor with a touch of grainy malt. I tried the corona light side by side with corona extra and couldn’t really discern much of a difference. Both were uninspiring. I leave the lime in if I ever have to have this beer again.
pale yellow with white head. Little malty aroma. Medium carbonation. watery texture. No thrills really. Adding a lime to a beer says it all!
Bottle. Pours pale yellow, white head, Aroma is malt and skunky and tastes the same. This is not a great beer, but can be consumed easily in mass quantities during the summer.
Enjoyed this on the beach recently, Zandvoort in Netherlands. This is not a good beer, we all know that, but with the lime, on the beach, always elevates my mood.

Bottle.  Pours very pale yellow, not much of a white head.  Smells like skunk, tastes much the same.  I really don’t do fruit in beer, but you have to if you want to stomach this nonsense.  I don’t like this beer.  When I eat Mexican food, I steer clear of this.

Very pale without a lot of flavour but it does the trick when the weather is brutally hot. Without lime this beer has an aroma that I can only describe as ’off’ (skunky?). Also, for such a bland beer, it leaves an unpleasant aftertaste that makes the back of tongue with a slimed feeling. My advice: shove the lime wedge in there and guzzle er back if need be, but there are much better beers out there.

Little to no aroma.  The pour is bright pale yellow, a very small foamy head ringed the glass.  The flavor had a thin hint of hops and a thin hint of malt.  Nothing special.  HIghly, HIGHLY carbonated.  Pretty weak beer over all.
Bland and watery best describe corona , but like most beers this style if  you shove a wedge of lime in and drink it quicky  its not so bad.
Corona is good cold, terrible warm, and always a bit bitter/skunky. Throw a lime in though, get some chips and head to the beach and you’re alright for a nice day of boozin.

A nice beer to drink in the warm weather.  Its a light beer with a low alcohol content, I think if they sold a higher alcohol content version of this beer I would enjoy it.  You pretty much have to drink a case of this stuff to get drunk.

Must make sure that when drinking, it must be cold and drank fast.  Very watery and no flavor.  This beer makes me think of being a poor college kid, buying "classier" beer after finals.  sad times...

I don’t think I couldn’t have enjoyed this beer without a lime in it.  Looks really watery and tastes just the same.  The aroma wasn’t pleasing at all-- same watered down smelling.  Don’t recommened this and by the looks of it, nobody else does either.

The only thing this beer has going for it is that people who drink it thinks it makes them look upper class, or simply like the thought of ’mexican’ beer. Besides that, it has no head to speak of. It’s color gives new meaning to a ’pale’ beer, and it has less flavour than many light beers. Corona Light must just be colored water. A fairly bitter aftertaste, so add a lime, drink it very cold, and swallow fast - there’s nothing to savour.

Ok Ok.. So I know that this is an overrated college drinking beer... but I can’t help to say that I do like it. It reminds me of when i went to college at the beach and this is all that we could ever get. I say though, you HAVE to have lime with it, and try to get it as fresh as you can! So if you’re in the mood for a light crisp summer beer that you can chug a few and go back to the days of being a poor college student, this is the beer for you!

i really cant see what the big deal is about corona. Its a glorified metrosexual beer that has almost no head, taste is very light (and very watery) a shows little aroma. Surprised they even say its a beer as its more akin to cats piss

Cold 12oz bottle: Pours a clear golden color with very little white foam head.  Aroma is light, as is the taste; of light malts and grass.  Very smooth and refreshing, especially on a hot summer day.  Best served with fresh sliced lime.

I judge beers mostly on taste, since that is what ultimatley matters to me. Other than the  bland taste this beer sucks. If you are into watery, mild tasting lagers with little to no "beer" flavor give this a try. I used to drink this when I was younger, a very poor choice when the same pricetag can get you much better beers. DO NOT BUY, if you like good beer DO NOT BUY this product.

Is it...ya, I think it might be... OK this is definately piss.  If you stick in a lime (go ahead and use the whole thing) you may not taste the urine, but the filth, it’s stilll there.  Why drink the brew if you can’t drink the water?
white head that goes away. there is a strong taste/aroma that might take alittle getting use to. good taste. the fresher the better
Bottle. A pale straw coloured pour with a small diminishing head. A skunky hoppy aroma. Maybe some citrus there? Taste has banana and citrus with a watery finish. High carbonation. Not great.
Bottle 0,33l. Very pale golden - almost yellow. A rapidly disappearing white head. Noticed some sweet malty flavour, otherwise close to water all the way.

12 oz bottle-Had this @ a cookout where it was the initial best option-considering the other choices were Bud Light & Coors Light!!  Not a lot to it. Bitter malty flavor- you need the lime to smooth it out & get it down. Makes it kind of fruity & drinkable. Doesn’t have much on it’s own. Does quench your thirst on a hot day, just get it ice cold & slurp it out of the bottle!!



Had this again @ a July 4th cookout. Seems the more I get into good beer the less tolarant I am of crap. I couldn’t drink this. Too bitter & the Lime didn’t help!
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head.Light malt aroma. Flavour is light malty.

This brew is simply reserved for those trying to look "upper crust" while at a party. Especially the guy who brings his own to a kegger because he is "above" the piss in the keg. News Flash guy, NOT BY MUCH!

an excellent tasting beer, i could drink this all night. its not too bitter, just right. after 2-3 brahmas, i switched to my usual drink, corona and its like night and day. the only problem is the sourness at the very bottom cause of the lime.
This is the beer that white trash uses to attract women.  It’s overpriced mexican piss in a clear bottle.
a major step up from the light garbage, but this beer is still pretty much a mass produced dog.  very watery and very bitter without lime.  Something better can always be found.

Nothing to see here people... move along. 
That about sums this dorm/"Thug-Life" favorite up for me. Hits Bitter and pulls you straight through into mediocrity. This sad offering from Mexico is proof positive that a solid marketing campaign and “neeto” logo can sell anything. The only reason this gets out of the 1 rating for me is its ability to quench thirst. Ice cold for this one. As far as it "Being better with lime"... the only thing that could make this beer acceptable is if you put a $5 in the neck.

There is only one purpose for this beer. To attract women. When all your friends have Natty, and your the only one with something different, your the life of the party. Although the taste of Natty and Corona are on the same level for me.I honestly do not know how people think the taste of this beer is SOOO great. At $31 a case, you can keep it. Ill go get myself 3 cases of Lionshead and call it a night.
12oz bottle pours out a yellow who cares??? This is the Mexican BUD and they have it down. way down.

Clear medium yellow with a small fizzy, quickly receding, white head. This is Mexico’s answer to Bud, and I don’t particularly like the question or the answer. Corny adjunct ridden nose and flavor. Watery, but still more flavor than a Miller or Coors light. Bad, but not the worst.
What can you say... Grab a lime and a crab leg? Corona is easy drinking for those who don’t like drinking or are counting calories.
This claims to be the number-one beer in Mexico.  Its not.  Yellow and fizzy, full of corn and pee.  Do not attempt to drink this without a lime, otherwise you may be able to taste the beer.

330 ml transparent bottle. 
Without lime: Color is a pale yellow. Very clear. Aroma of citrus and white bread. Doesn’t taste of much. A little bitterness in the aftertaste, or is it sourness from the carbon dioxide? It’s probably both. Somewhat low level of carbon dioxide. Watery mouthfeel. I read somewhere that this is the most popular beer world-wide. It is definitely the most simple-tasting beer I’ve rated to date.

Bottle on spring break - Clear yellow with a puny white head; Skunk to the nose; Bland and slightly bitter initial taste; Bitter backtaste; This tastes like someone peed in the bottle...maybe they did for all I know. The lime does nothing for the overall flavor as I had it both with and without. Neither was good and there wasn’t really any difference.
A light but dull beer with a off-sweet but bland taste and a bad hop bitter finish. This is bad beer

Looks good when your thirsty, ill give it that. The taste however I dont like. I used to love this stuff a few years back before I knew what good beer was. I dont think ill be drinking any more of these.
Addition of a lime improved flavor a bit but ill pass.

Bottle 36F Lager Glass, Light struck and skunky as usual. Clear yellow color, little white head, slight notes of bitter hops and sweetness. A Light palate with decent carbonation.  Its drinkable but best served near frozen with a lime.
Very salty and bitter. Light yellow color and tastes like mexico. Decent beer with mexican food.
Goes along with that hot hot summer day... and a hot hot summer day ONLY!  Again, as mentioned before, only half-way decent with a lime.
First time in years, I couldnt even get myself to finish the bottle. Lime made it a little better, but still not what I like.
Skunky.  I had one with lime one without.  The lime helps.  Not my favorite mexican beer.  Clear yellow, no head, no hops aroma.  A little maltiness and lots of skunk.

This beer is good when the weather is hot. Only good with a lime, which is a shame. Without a lime it is terrible. I rate this beer higher than normal but only because I only drink it when the weather is hot. A good thirst buster.
Bad, bad stuff. I had a few at the beach with my brother. The only things that made it drinkable were the limes and the heat.
Just something to make you pee alot. Speaking of which, I hear Mexicans pee in this at the brewery.

finally had this classic.  classic piece of shit.  there was definitely nothing positive about this.  a few years ago i bought a 6-pack of it and watched igby goes down.  this time i ’enjoyed it’ as a brief respite from a wine tasting.  it looked like urine with foamy head.  drank from the bottle.  tasted god awful, i dont think there was any aroma.  loses points for masquerading as a quality beer.  still, not as bad as rolling rock green light because it doesn’t have a heavy metallic taste.
bottle. allmost white in color. no head. i failed to detect any malts or hops. good if your thirsty i guess. i just realized why they put a lime in.
This is only good on a hot day by the pool or the beach. Must be ice cold and served with a lime, that is the only way I can endure this beer. Way overpriced.

At this rating, probably the best mexican beer, especially if it ice cold.  Does actually taste different without the lime than with the lime.  I have a recipe for mararitta’s where this beer is the base incredient.
12 ounce long neck clear bottle and clear pee yellow brew. skunky hop flavor and skunky aftertaste. drinkable ice cold
Good at the beach, Only good with a lime, which is a shame.  Without a lime it is terrible, and I give it this high a rating solely because every time I have it I’m at the beach.
Hey, if it’s free, why not? Small head.  Solid yellow color.  A little hoppy.  Mostly a very slight step up from a typcial American macrobrew.
This had a small head.Color typical straw.aroma was somewhat hoppy.This is a glorified budweiser.Very drinkable,but nothing special.
I still can see what everyone sees in this swill.  Especially to justify paying premium price for cut rate brew.

The overpriced pour is a golden-yellow with almost no head at all.  The overpriced aroma is non-existent.  The overpriced flavour is akin to the palest of malts and that’s being generous.  The overpriced finish is heavy on lime, oh wait, that’s because I had to stick a lime in the damn thing to give it ANY TASTE AT ALL.  Overpriced conclusion...easily the most horrid beer I have ever had the misfortune of drinking.  You know, it says a lot when you need to add lemon/lime to a beer to make it taste better.  You’re better off drinking water, at least you’ll save yourself the cash which you can spend on a real beer.
This is the perfect beer if you like American light beers. It does not have a good taste and the finish is too light.

Tasted 03/06/2006. 330ml bottle from Matahiwi.
Pale yellow with no head and a soda water fizz. Corn on the nose, slightly skunky, and a touch more in the mouth.  Dry and skinny. No hops, no malt, no flavour. Shocking stuff.  No wonder they need lime in it.  Two sips and it’s down the drain. I’ll have a Bundaberg with lunch instead.
Pale yellow with white head, minimal aroma and flavour.  Very bland, uninspiring.
If you can get this beer before the skunk does, its fine for Cinco de Mayo or what ever.  Its just typical swill.  Corn.  Yellow.  Fizzy with no head.  Hey, the lime is fun.

Look, if I want lemonade, I’ll order lemonade. There’s clearly a reason why they serve this with a lime. The beer is watered down and a tad bitter by itself. I’d take it over all American macros, but this is only a slightly better Mexican macro. Kinda reminded me of Heineken with a funkier aftertaste.
Bottle. pours yellow with a white head. Aroma of pale malts and grain. Flavor is bland, pale malts, grain, no hops, no life. But if you place a lime into it, its like a whole different beer.
boring, just like water. lack of any quality aspects of aroma or flavor. citrus makes it worthwhile....
Better taste than Corona Light, still best served with lime.  A beer for hot days and laying in the shade.  Decent, but not as good as its made out to be.
Dull gold appearance – no head - nose not present - taste only if a lime is added – not a good beer except to quench thirst but the lime is what really does the thirst quenching

Well, I made the mistake of pouring this into a glass.  That was a mistake because then I could really smell it, and that wasnt a pleasent experience.  Not much taste to talk about, and in general a pretty unremarkable beer.  I like RCL’s comment: "The people responsible for this beer’s popularity deserve a raise"

From my notes, June ’05. Nothing noteworthy, nothing terribly offensive, just...nothing. Like drinking water, and had the same effect on me being the tank that I am. Why people think this is great I will never know. But at least its not skunked like some things...
i drink this when i want to feel like a middle-aged booze hound.  average brew best consumed ice cold and with a fresh lime (i’m talking farmers market, here)

Well as has been said a thousand times.
This beer is drinkable. not above decent in any aspect.
Just popular because of cinco de mayo and a good ad campaign.
Good for Cinco Dey Mayo, days at the beach, and high school parties.  Of course you must use a lime.
This ia beautiful brew, very easy drinking, with a fabulous flavour. Its mexican beer but is enjoyed all over the globe... All those who say they dont like it, stop pretending.

ugh...."mexican piss" as the nickname says.....nothing good about this even with the lime.  only drink this when you are at someones house who would be insulted by your rejection of it and make sure you are drunk before it touches your lips.

The quintessential cervesa.  This beer could use a lime.  While not overly skunked, the nearly absent flavor and thin body needs a tart lime to excite the palate.  However, on a hot day, it’s refreshing when cold.
Cheap mexican piss , displayed as beer. But it does get the job done. If your looking for a great way to celebrate Cinco De Mayo this would be it. Drink your ass of like the mexicans do!

Cheap Mexican beer marketed like a premium product.  The people responsible for this beer’s popularity deserve a raise.  Required drinking on the Mexican-American answer to St. Patty’s day.  What we need in this country are more immigrant groups bringing with them their own quaint festivals that we can then bastardize into unofficial American drinking holidays.  Preferably ones that fall on weekends.  We’re open to suggestions here, let’s hear some!

Stand alone, without the lime, this beer is no different from a million other macros available across the world. With lime, and on a sunny beach -- where is it made to be enjoyed, it does its job well. Nothing more, nothing less.

Definitely one of the worst beers on the market.. In my personal opinion .. The lime does nothing more than trick your nose into thinking that you are drinking down urine w/ a hint of lime - Absolute Garbage.
This was a drink I drank at college parties where they actually had worst swank than this. It tastes terrible by itself but does get a little better with a lime in it.
Once heard it called "the ice water of beers."  Easy enough to choke down with a lime, but can hardly be called a beer.
Mexico’s answer to Budweiser. Very watery, little taste. At least my beer taste buds are maturing as I drink more beer.
I actually like this beer...but I live in Houston and it’s hot here quite often. Basic pil color...yellow...Little citrus with the taste, but not much. Not bad...always satisfies!
It drinks what it is, a lightly flavored and refreshing above-solid Mexican session beer. (not an domestic American piece of boring shit.) Take this over the pretend Sierra Nevada IPA any day.

As a teen I thought this was the coolest brew on the planet. Mostly due to the fact that my friend saw it in Point Break. Today however, I don’t think too much of it. Allthough I do still aprove of the yellow goldish color.
Bottle. Pale golden colour with a small white head. Fruity citrus aroma. Sweet malty flavor, smooth. Malty finsih with some hints of citrus, no bitterness.
Not too good. Probably the most popular Mexican beer in the US, but not anywhere close to the best!

This definitely falls into my "unpleasant" beers category.  I suppose if I needed alcohol, I could drink it, but even cheap beers like Genesee taste MUCH better.  The fact it NEEDS a lime to even be passable says something, IMO.
Beer should not be in a clear bottle.  It is alcholic but tastes very wattery.  Only good on a really hot day with a lime....and have to drink enough to get drunk
Golden, yellow coloured brew. Had it in the transparant bottle and the "barril" version. Not to alcoholic, but carbonated. Very light beer. Watery.

Bottle, in the bottle with a lime.  Super clear, yellow, fizzy looking.  Smells like a lime.  Tastes like cold, wet mexican beer with a lime.  Watery, light, refreshing palate.  What else can I say, it’s a corona.  Nice on a really hot day after mowing the lawn.
This beer is far from spectacular, but it is rather smooth. That said, it does not beat out any of the better premium macro brews.
not to much of anything in here good on a hot day but nothing else I prefer sol over corona.
Budweiser’s little cousin south of the border can be nice on a 100 degree day, but under standard teperature and pressure, I’ll pass.
Basic, lager that you pay a little more because t is imported.  BUt hey, on vacation ion the Caribean it can be fun!

You have to take corona for what it is. An easy to drink light bodied mexican beer. Of course you can get better beer. However, when you are lying in the mexican sun nothing beats a corona extra avec lime.
Bottled. Sparkling, pale golden with a next-to-none white head. Malty, hayish aroma and flavor. Thin, lightly fizzy body and a artificial-like bitterness at the end. (060408)

I first drank this beer after the pub I was at ran out of Heineken.  I’m not a fan of Heineken, but when I tried to drink the Corona, I almost vomited.  What little flavor it has was so putrid that I couldn’t drink even half of it.  I tried it a few days later, and it was the same.  Lightly piss-flavored water.  I’ve come to the conclusion that selling Corona in the United States is hands-down the greatest marketing success in the history of business.  Never has such an inferior, horrible, cheap product achieved such success.

Bright pale yellow color, skunky nose at the openinig of the bottle, sweet pale malt, wet straw aroma follows through on a light-bodied palate with a zesty toasty pale malt character, hint of citrus flavors, leading towards a crisp faint hops impression on the finish.
33 cl bottle. No yeast at the bottom. Golden clear colour with a weak head. Light aroma of corn also in the flavour. Very dull.
Everyone knows this beer.  Tastes better when you add a lime...you know that is a bad sign.  About as good as the best Panamanian beer.  Drink very cold.
I got to give this one atleast 2 though it doesnt have an interesting taste but this beer got my vote for smoothness.
this beer always reminds me of my father, because this is all he’ll drink..hahaha.. it’s an okay taste if this is the only thing available to drink. yellowish color, with no white head.

Had this after a Amber Bock because thats all that was left after the horrible Amber Bock. I have had this many times and this is not a horrible beer. If you eliminate the skunkiness from the clear bottle then its not a terrible vienna lager just fair. Decent malt flavor and decent bitterness. Clear yellow light palate.
pours yellow served with live light hoppy flavor and tastes not good but not awful
Bottle. Clear yellow in color with no head. Hoppy aroma. Hoppy flavor. Citrus hops. Corn notes.  Crisp and refreshing. Clean. Ok

I tried this beer in Monterrey, Mexico, under the name "Corona Genuine Cerveza de Barril" and I am 100% certain that it is NOT the same beer as Corona Extra as stated on ratebeer, but in any case here goes.The beer I tried was golden in color (not light yellow as C.E.) and had a very hoppy scent and taste (not pure malt and corn as C.E.). It was very refreshing and deserves to be tested when found.
officially i like this beer. it tastes great, but thats where the fun stops. this beer always gives me a hangover.

The most overrated beer I have ever had.  And that’s saying a lot, seeing as how I live in Baltimore, and everyone worships National Bohemian.  Honestly, this is just another pale lager...given huge overrating due to the excessive marketing blitz that they force on us unsuspecting American beer drinkers.  Looks pale, tastes dull, requires a lime to taste like anything at all.  Not worth any amount of money.  If you’re going to spend money on a pale lager, just dont blow the excessive load that you would when you pay 3 bucks more for a 6 of this.  Jesus god, man!
Great beer.  Pop in a lime.  Too expensive for a beer that’s probably cheap.

Bottle. Looks like urine. Smells like water, which essentially means it has no actual aroma. I could barely finish one bottle as it tasted like tainted water from a faucet in a country surrounded by a salt water ocean. Nearly spoiled the taste of my meal. Corona may be the lowest rated beer I will review on this site -- in fact, I sincerely hope so.
Pale gol with a thin white head.Malty yeast aroma and flavortypical Mexican lager carbonation, very little aftertaste and little hop flavor.
A very pale golden body, urine colored.  I’d never have this beer unless I’d put lemon or lime in it.  Once that is done it turns into a nice sesson beer.

Bottle labelled Corona Familiar on 07/25/2008. Clear pale golden body with a small white head. Light skunk and dry grain aroma. Dry grain, faint honey flavor. Light body with moderately high carbonation. 2/1/4/3/8 - 1.8

03/14/2006: Very pale clear yellow color with a thin fully diminishing white head. Slight sweet malt aroma with hints of corn. Flavor is sweet with some citrus hops, and a slight corn aftertaste. 3/1/3/2/6 - 1.5

Very hard to rate this beer.  Normally it is not good.  Just tastes bad.  Does not have what I know belongs in a good beer.  However, after working in the sun all day, this is the most refreshing liquid I can imagine.  Great in the Texas sun.  Not good any other time.
O.k. this is not a beer connaisseur’s beer I agree, but on a hot hot hot summer day I prefer drinking a Corona then a Coke. It is refreshing even if it’s not that good a beer.

Bottle at the Kulturbrauerei, Berlin 11/07/2004
Golden coloured crisp and hoppy. Slightly dry malt finish.
Pours yellow and looks like pisswater.  Smells and tastes of water with tinges of citrus.  Very boring with no palate.

This was served up in a 24 ounce bottle.  I was given a pint glass to pour it into.  Corona Extra poured up a clear light gold into the glass.  There is little to no head formed and what there is does not last long.  There are plenty of bubbles to be seen rising from the bottom of the glass.  It looks inviting, but looks can be deceptive.  This has a very earthy aroma to it and I can detect faint aromas of grain.  The taste is Musty!  There is a little hint of sweetness if you leave it in your mouth long enough.  
It is light and crisp with a nice carbonation.  As it is this is not something I’d sit around and drink a lot of, but I buy a lot of it.  Why?  It’s the lime.  This marks only the second time I’ve had a Corona without lime.  I’d say I’ve been drinking Corona Extra for over 16 years.  (The things I’ll do for a beer review.)  I hope to never have a Corona without lime again.  After a hard day of working in the yard in the spring or summer there’s nothing more refreshing to me than a couple of 24 ounce bottles of Corona (ice cold) and some lime wedges.

This is an average run of the mill pilsner beer.  I agree, that I am not sure what the hype is that surrounds this beer.  True it is a little better with some lime, but thats sad when adding something to a beer makes it taste better.
Not much to say about this beer. Light yellow pilsner color. Okay taste, nothing special about it. Works fine on a hot day, too bad it’s snowing outside..

This famous Mexican Pale lager is a top selling beer and I cannot figure out why.Don’t get me wrong,its not the worst beer in the world,if theres nothing else better around ,like a Coors Lite...and don’t forget the lime.

I know that this beer has a complete lack of taste and that it is skunky and has macro written all over it.  That being said I still like it occasionally.  I like to pull one out on a very hot summer day and stick in a lime wedge and sip on it.  Its one of those beer you can keep drinking and it won’t give you a headache and you won’t get drunk with.  Great summer beer.
Pale yellow and not very inviting.Poured flat with little flavour and left no lacing .I am told by my son that it is very popular with young people in the u.k Why?

bottle - This pours a deep yellow color and has a mild, skunky aroma.  The taste is very watery and the body is very thin.  The finish is extremely mild and inoffensive.  Yes, it’s another mass marketed, mostly flavorless pale lager.  It’s not the worst one out there, but I certainly can’t recommend it.  If you must drink it, get a couple lime wedges.  That helps.

Absolutely, without a doubt, the only redeeming quality, whatsoever, about Corona Extra is that it looks so very, very, very, very inviting in that skunkifying clear glass bottle, sweating in the hot afternoon sun.  That is it.  There is a reason most people drink it with lime ... or a few limes ... and that still doesn’t get rid of that awful light-struck aroma.  I encourage people to share this with friends, slightly warmer than the near freezing it is usually served, in a proper, tulip glass:  the results are amazing and no one who participated in that cruel test will ever drink it again.

I don’t know if this is the same beer here.  This beer was in small little barrels and was called corona de especial de barrel modello.  Its had a Nice semi deep yellow color but little aroma.  The taste was good. Had a corn, malty flavor with a nice hoppy finish.  I thought this was a good beer.  So I don’t know if we are talking about the same beer because I have had regular corona and it dosn’t taste the same.

Interestingly forgettable..... very reminiscent of a pils, from the aroma on.  I honestly bought it for the rating only, and now I wish I would’ve bought something good, but here goes:  A bit earthy and skunk on the nose.  Flavors are muddy, with notes of hops trying to overdo a light citrusy, almost cloying body.  Finish is much the same, very forgettable.  Too bad.... I can see why so many limes are used to cover it up.
As I drank these beers I came to appreciate the marketing machine that is Corona.  They really do an outstanding job at that.  An inoffensive, bland lager made for the masses.

I find it difficult to believe that one of the most commonly drunk beers in North America has managed to garner such a small number of votes without "assistance," but here is my honest vote anyway.

Common does not automatically mean good as anything that has come out of Anheuseur Busch beside Sea World is cheap and dirty. But Corona hits its target consumer admirably, which is those that want to drink alcohol and minimize the acrid taste and perhaps throw something mellow into the mix. You can throw a corset of flowery language at an ale, but that will not change the harsher brewing process and resultant flavors/carbonation. Being assaulted by pungent taste and having my mind do sommersaults and my stomach buzz is not my idea of a good beer.

Aroma - By itself a mildewy 2. But drinking Corona without the lime is sacrilege! 8 with the citrusy, semi-mildewed lime. I compromised.
Appearance - Liquid gold, once you appreciate it.
Flavor - Corona is tart, but that tartness and sour kick from the lime blends smoothly with the warming alcohol effect. 
Palate - Light, watery, bitter. Lively carbonation.

Not so bad! Clear yellow color with okay head. Very hoppy aroma. But the flavor is watery even for a pale lager. Slightly bitter aftertaste. You can drink tons of these on a hot summer day (in Mexico ;-)

I have to admit, at certain times, i like the bready background of certain mexican/carriibean beers but corona just doesnt do it alone for me--in fact, i never liked corona without a lime even before i hopped on the beer wagon. aroma is skunky corn, only a little bready - taste is the same plus some weird malt--a lime is necessary for this-i dont mind drinking this at a party/bbq but so far i cant say ive bought any for myself--fyi corona is a fad for those who are not on the beer wagon and are in search of a way to still drink beer while being able to disguise the taste as much as possible (lime). So, if youre a hipster who doesnt know what to order at the bar, chances are, youll fit in with a corona w/lime

Maybe a step above Red Stripe.  Not saying much there.

I visited ol’ Mexico last winter, and I drank this stuff for a week straight.  I thought my liver was going to revolt.  Made getting back to the ol’ USA, and its premium Blatz, a truly grand moment.

Some countries (Mexico, Jamaica and so on) really should avoid brewing beer.  Stick with what you know, ie. Tequila or the hashish.

If I never drank this again, I can die a happy man.

Blatz forever.

This is the almost the absolute worst beer ever.  I’ve had one other mexican beer that made this palatable.  I would not recommend watering my lawn with this beer.  The yuppies and other "beer snobs" seem to think this is great, they should go have a real beer sometime.
This is the single most over-hyped beer in the world. Corona and a wedge of lime, give me a break. This is bad beer that benefits from great marketing and a world full of yuppies drinking this swill.

Very light yellow, clear color.  Smooth taste.  Best if drank with a small slice of lime.  Taste doesn’t last long.

Funny story about this beer: The last time I got it, I got home and realized i had lost my bottle opener.  I tried to pry it open with my car keys (one of my less brilliant ideas).  I broke one key and had another key slip loose, causing me to rake my fingers across the sharp edge of the cap.  I ended up with 5 stitches in my index finger, and four in my middle finger.

Ok look, I’m not a beer snob nor am I qualified enough to go on and on about the subtle complexities of a beer. Take this at face value... this beer stinks, literally! Bad aroma with a slightly skunky taste. Light gold color. Ice cold with a lime it will stay down. Not the worst thing out there but not that good. Far better mexican beers are out there.

Just what the world needs, another review of this slop.  Poured clear-colored and flat, the lime gave it a nice aroma anyways, but I like lime Perrier water too.  I tasted corn - adjuncts and nothing else.  Quite bland.
Very few beers can top a corona with lime, very few.  Goes down like water, but tastes awesome

In my moderately extensive travels, I have encountered this beer everywhere-- it is pervasive if nothing else! And it nealy is nothing else. A bland macro-style cookie-cutter pale lager, more on the watery end than many others. Drank ice cold with lime squeezed into it, it admittedly is refreshing on a hot day, but then again so is a glass of water. It’s fine, but if you think this is an awesome beer, get over yourself.
First sips while nice and cold are OK. After a while you start to notice a bitter skunky aftertaste. This is one of those 1 is enough for me beers.
it looks, tastes and is generic beer. It is certainly not bad as it is most thirst quenching. certainly uninspiring in terms of making concessions for mass production.
I buy this beer when its hot outside and I want to drink something different than miller lite.  Yellow color with watery unfavorable aftertaste.

Bottle. Pours clear with little yellow. Perfect white ring for a head. Decent carbonation streaming. Smells like nothing. Tastes like carbonation. Watery palate with slightly bitter aftertaste. Hydrating, and that’s about it. Not the worst I’ve ever had.

Let’s see. It’s called Corona Extra so what’s extra in this beer? Juan’s piss perhaps? You use the lime so you don’t have to taste how horrible this crap is. I guess perhaps if you were sitting on some sandy beach in Mexico and all they had to drink was this or water you’d better stick with this crap or the next day Montezuma’s Revenge will be knocking on your bowels.

Golden in color with a bubbly foam. Taste is sweet with hint of lime. I prefer not to add lime to it for this reason. Aroma leaves plenty to be desired. I prefer the ones bottled in Israel vs. state side. Overall I will stick with my Euros.
Bottle--Thank God for the lime.  Bright yellow color, fizzy head, no flavor, bad aroma. Yuck

710 ml Bottle, 4.6% a/v
Pours a pale amber,. with a quickly dissapating white head. Corona has a VERY distinct odour, somewhere between a skunk, a joint, and a lime. Flavour is nothing really special.. tastes a little skunky like the nose (not just this one, all that ive ever had) with once again a hint of citrus. Goes down easy though with very little after taste.

Im not really sure why this is so popular.. not a bad beer, but not a great one either.

chu pu capable de voir su monde qui boive cette biere! elle est tellement mauvaise qu’on y ajoute une lime en esperant qu’elle goute meilleure. je sais pas qui a bien pu inventer ceci mais retirer le comme citoyen mondial! gout degeux, couleur se rapprochant du jus de pomme mais est bien pire que ce dernier, en fait, evitez la a tout prit, c une maladie de la boire!

Corona Extra pours to a straw gold color with a slight white head, and a lively carbonation. The nose on this beer is horrible. Corona is marketed in clear glass bottles, and with clear glass, or green glass, beer can become what is known as light struck. I won’t get into the science of it, but the bottom line is, light, and heat are deadly enemies of beer. It makes a beer smell and taste skunky. The nose on the bottle of Corona I drank was very skunky, no malt or hop aromas were present. The palate? More of the same, a slight skunky flavor, mixed with lots of fizzy carbonation on the tongue, and a very thin, and watery body. This beer finished with more skunky flavor that ended with a black hole of nothing. In a word, this beer was disgusting. 

That is the true flavor of Corona folks. As a beer, it is a mass produced, bland lager with little flavor and character. How does Corona get over on us, and why is it so popular? People drink it ICE cold, and with a healthy dose of lime to mask the flavors. Or on the odd chance you might get a bottle that is not light struck, lime add some flavor, to a beer that has virtually none. Try a Corona thats true flavor isn’t numbed with cold, or spiked with lime, and you will understand what a poor beer Corona really is. What really boggles my mind, is, people are willing to pay MORE for this beer. You might as well save yourself a few bucks and squeeze a lime into a Miller Lite, or even a Milwaukee’s Best, those beers have as much flavor and character as Corona. Corona drinkers are being duped, and ripped off in my opinion. What are you really paying for? A painted bottle? The quality is just not there, it is just great marketing of a poor beer. 

I will leave you with this. I attended a beer dinner with Micheal Jackson, The Beer Hunter. He is the most recognized authority on beer in the world. As chance would have it, Jackson and I was in the men’s room, doing what men do after they drink lots of beer at a beer dinner. Someone asked Jackson when he was doing his business; "That coming out like Miller Lite?". Jackson replied: " I was thinking more like Corona. ."
Light golden beer with minimal head.  Not very good alone, but decent with a lime.

Pitié, retiré sur-le-champs ce vinaigre alcoolisé de la vente libre ou il favorisera la multiplication d’autre sous-produit (si cela peut être chimiquement possible!) jaloux de sa fausse popularité estival.  Un mot pour décrit cette bière : OUACH!

One must live in searing heat to fully appreciate the restorative powers of this once cheap, now overpriced brew.It pours like coloured water, and has little malt and hop flavour. For a pilsener style it does not measure up to European counterparts, but wait...try this American remedy...sugared lime juice in the bottom of the glass, about 1/8 of an inch.  Pour in the Corona, squeeze a fresh lemon wedge on top with a dash of salt.  Now its a drink to refresh.
pours clear with slight yellow tint.  aroma is slightly skunky, luckily they put a lime in it to mask the off smell.  taste is vertually noexistant.  one of the worst out there.
bottle  Pale yellow color with a small white head. Has a corn aroma.  A mass produced over priced fad beer from Mexico.  But its not awful.
Even with a lime, this stuff is undrinkable.  Give this to your dog if you want to see him stagger around the house, then poop on your new carpet.
Bottle. White head. Yellow soda looking body with lots of carbon dioxide.  Cannot distinguish what the aroma is but I do not like it. Weak hops flavor. Too watery.
add a lime its at least drinable, sorta, just dont bother spend the extra money and get something good

The first time i ever had this, years ago, i thought, gross! it smells like a skunk! But im a bigger fan of it now for sure, a lime in it is a must though. Pretty plain tasing brew other then that. It is a token brew to have when at a mexican reasturant though
Tastes like water. Those pure kind of water with no taste. And it has a lemon aftertaste. And by after, I mean well after, only when you burp.
Ma tout première bière, je l’aimais que j’ai commancé à boire la bière, là j’en ri. Sans lime, c’est de l’eau nul, mais avec un citron c’est pas mieux.

Must be served cold.  There are however better Mexican beers as commonly available for the same price - Pacifico, XX, and Sol to name three common ones that achieve the same result in a nicer overall package.

Bottle, at home (030714).
Light yellow, white head immediately disappearing. Very light aroma and flavor. Watery.

Very pale yellow lager, highly carbonated with a white medium head. Almost non-existent aroma of cereals, corn and lemon grass. Very soft flavor, too much water accompanied by slight sweet and sourish hints. Refreshing, just like water, but an incredibly weak beer.


With a Lime in Easter Island: I think this beer was intended to be drunk this way. The lime gives it much more depth of flavor if you can say that of a swill macro lager. It gets very refreshing and quaffable. Points: 5/1/5/2/9 scoring 2.2.

Golden lager-yellow color with a nice, even, slowly diminishing head.  Very light aroma with only a touch of skunky grain.  Flavors of skunky grain, lime, and aluminum are present, and the aftertaste is some more skunky grain.  This beer is great with a slice of lime (lime not used for evaluation) and when drunk with some fresh Mexican food.  It is not, however, what I would call a good stand-alone beer.
Not bad, very light and great for those hot summer days and to drink with Mexican food. However, you MUST drink it while ice cold otherwise it really sucks. I also recomend the lime slice ;)

It is TERRIBLE.  There aren’t enough limes in the world to make this taste better.   I can’t get over the odor.  Yes odor, not aroma.  Just skip this pale unless you get it on happy hour special and are aiming to stumble around and try to dance to Mexican Fiesta music.  My friends who even only like really crappy beer on special will tell you its bad without the lime.  then its just lime flavored yellow alcohol water.

The only reason it is served with a lime is to keep the flies out, and no beer should be rated with any additives period.  This ultra clear headless yellow beast is one of the worst beers I have tasted.  It’s a pale lager for one which means that it’s brewed for the uneducated masses and its only saving grace is a 2 for 1 at a mexican restaurant.  If you are truely sampling beers, don’t waste your time. Oh, and it always tastes skunked.

NOTE: DON’T BOTHER RATING THIS WITHOUT THE LIME (OR LEMON) - ITS PART OF THE WHOLE PACKAGE. 
THERE’S A TRADITION AMONGST BEER SNOBS OF SMASHING LIGHT LAGERS, EXPECIALLY THOSE WITH LITTLE HOPS.
BUT THEY HAVE THEIR PLACE... ON A HOT HOT DAY BY THE BEACH IN THE SUN, NOTHING IS AS REFRESHING AS AN ICE COLD CORONA WITH LIME. HEAVIER BEERS WOULD BLOAT YOU.
IF YOU LOOK AT THE TOP 50 RATED BEERS ON THIS SITE, MOST ARE STOUTS, EXTREMELY HOPPY IPAS AND HIGH ALCHOLIC BREWS. OBVIOUSLY THAT DEMOGRAPHIC IS GOING TO SNUB *ANY* LIGHT LAGER, INCLUDING CORONA. IN MY OPINION, WITH A LIME, CORONA IS ONE OF BEST  BEERS IF YOU WANT A REFRESHING LIGHT LAGER WITH NO OFF FLAVORS.
Corona tastes terrible without a lime, with a lime it is just ok. Corona is popular in the US because of the American sweet tooth towards beer.
the lime is the only thing that makes this worth drinking... mmmmmmmmmmmmmm, limes.
"Okay I went and had this one aganist my better judgment. This is a watered down something. Has a skunky smell and taste. With no lime this beer is just awful."
Bottle of Course.  This isn’t a bad beer.  Usually will drink this at a Mexican rest. with a meal or whenever someone has it cold.  Not one of my top choices, but it’s pretty good with the lime.

Although I am inherently biased against any type of lager, this beer appears to be one of the few decent mass-produced lagers out there. It has a large, frothy, white head which takes quite a while to dissipate. The only beer I will touch a lime to (mainly because it needs a little help in the flavor department)

Pours a mellow golden yellow color.  Aromas of grains, light hops, and a funky musty smell.  Flavor is bland with a weird funk, add a lime to it to kill the funky taste and it is almost drinkable.  This is probably the worst mexican lager on the market.  Why drink this when you can get Pacifico, Modelo, Tecate, or Dos Equis.
Without the lime and only the lime, this beer is worthless and not worth the extra couple of bucks.

Poured a nice amber color, but that was about all it has going for it. Full flavored, just not very good and a bitter finish. Tasted better with mexican food, or maybe it was just becuase I had already drank a few before the mexican food! The lime adds a little to the flavor.
GOld blond colour, small white head. Not much aroma, same for the flavor, hard to detect, finish is a very little bitter, This isn’t is.
Uninteresting beer with bad presentation. The lion and crown doesn’t work for me. Imported but not sophisticated.

Very light, light blonde, light aroma. In Italy we drink this beer with rind of lemon.
Perfect for the summer.

Bottle, golden color with fluffy white head, medium lacing, huge skunky aroma upon opening, can’t get over the skunk in the taste either.  I’m not big on skunky beers.  I see where people are fussing at the price.  It’s not expensive around here and not in mexico.  i’m guessing the price where people are fussing are because of the shipping/export prices.

big ass bottle that i apparently bought on my way home from several bars last night. i find this, moosehead, guinness, celebration, and a giant bottle of irish cream. so i reheated the chili i made yesterday that made my aunt and uncle sweat and walk away from their bowls. i thought it wasmild, but what do i know? so i crack this bottle and enjoy it, really enjoy it with my mild chili.. this smells like skunky urine, but in a good way. watered down corntastic salty alcohol with some mildew, but damnit this works for me. not a bad looking lager, clearish yellow with a nice fluffed white head. raw vegative sour finish. but it works with spicey food when i am feeling homesick. now if someone can explain why every bowl of chili i have had served to me around here has had pasta in it i would be grateful. seriously, chili does not require elbow macaroni, what is wrong with these people?

bottle. I don’t like clear or green bottles. Beer just seems like it should be stored in a brown bottle. Skunkly smell, I guess this is why people put the lime in it. very little flavour. If you were in Mexico you would probably drink this because you cannot drink the water. Thats its only selling point.

Resembles a beer, so they got the color right. Way too much skunk and no flavor.

Just barely a step up from the water in Mexico... Nuff said.

24 oz can.  Nose is sweet, corny and lightly dusty.  Just a touch of floral hops.  Clear lightish golden with a soapy bright white head.  Extremely watery body with cereal grains, not fully dry but drier than most big Pale Lagers, floral hop contributions, hay, gently crisp and mildly refreshing.  Has the ’unclean gene’ but it’s not overwhelming; also a touch buttery over the corn.  There are worse options, especially if this is available canned instead of in the clear glass bottle, where a new set of problems present themselves.

33 cl Bottel
Color - Light Amber
Head - Very littel white
Aroma - Hops
Flavor - Non, littel hops/malt

the only good about this beer is the first smel by open it.
this is popular becouse a lot of people like to drink beer to be popular but don’t prever the taste of beer
All has been said about this beer. And they have the nerve to charge a premium for this beer !!!!

Why this beer is so popular i’ll never know??????  This is the nastiest beer of the nasties!  From what i’ve been told this beer was once the bottom of the barel cheapest of cheap mexican brew that some guy bought, and poured money into marketing, so your paying big bucks for a cheap beer in an expensive package.  Funny thing is i’d much rather drink pbr, old mil, and milwaukee’s best any day over this nasty stuff.  If you want good mexican beer drink modelo, and pacifico...

Tasteless. Like drinking a bottle of water with a hint of beer flavour. Very easy to drink, good if your looking to get drunk. Extremely over rated and over priced. No way I would pay $50 + for a carton of this.

Bottle, no lime.  Poured out a very light gold, quite transparent, no head.  The aroma is a little skunky and that’s about it.  Corn is the predominant flavor maybe a hint of malt in there somewhere.  Very light on the palate, easy drinking.   Any port in a storm I guess, but that’s the only reason I’d drink these.  Maybe I needed the lime.
I’ll drink it if nothing else is available or I’m already drunk.  Often called Mexican Piss Water, and with good reason.
I smelt something incredibly mild. I sorta tasted something. Better than city water, but not for the money.

Probably the best widely distributed beer out there. Yet that’s nothing to brag about. Its my standby when the local bar only has piss beers. Very easy on the taste buds. Very hit and miss with this one. Tends to get skunky when not fresh. Definitely need a lime or its a no go, but you’re kind of backed into a corner when its either this or the shitty three.

Not that bad for a macro brew, but not that great of a beer.  Better than some beers, but there are many more that are better than this one.  Rather soda-like.  The lime wedge helps a bi with the flavort, but not a good beer in general, unless you’ve had a few and stopped caring what you’re drinking...
Skunky.  I can’t drink it without a lime.  I feel like if I’m not drinking it on a beach than I’m doing something wrong.

Very smooth, crisp, refreshing.  Easily available macro brew that has won over the hearts of many americans jaded with piss water beer from Coors/Anheuser.  It is easily superior to those.  Very light, easy on the palate.  Not much flavor or aroma but oh well.  Add lime+

After rating modelo, I realized I hadn’t rated old Corona! I’ve never had a good bottle, even though I live close to Mexico, I suppose I should try a can, it would probably improve it abit, terrible beer, but the light is even worse!
Heh- used to think this was a good beer! Kind of urninish. Light, no body, no head. Metallicy taste as well.

Okay.  The first time I tried one of these I instantaneously turned up my nose, curled my lips, and vowed never again to allow this beer anywhere near my palate.  But that hasty vow soon gave way to curiousity.  Although Corona is overhyped, overpriced and just another pale lager in an overly saturated market, it still has some unique quality to it that no busweiser will ever attain.  So, while I still won’t ever buy a six-pack, I will happily enjoy one with a friend on a hot July afternoon cookout.
Bottle. Clear amber with small white head. Light grainy aroma. Light body with thin texture. Light flavor with short finish. Add the lime and you have a citrus flavor.
I will not drink any other beer, i simply love this beer especially ice cold with a slice of lime!
A staple amongst a common party.  Not a lot of taste or aroma.  Add a lime and it helps a bit.  Take the beer for what it is: a pale lager that anyone will drink.
Not bad.  Good with a lime and barbecue, especially on those hot summer days.  I drink this relatively frequently.  Try with some clamato and a dash of hot sauce, then you got your self a real beer.

For those who like their beer without aroma or flavor, this is the beer.  Apparently the only thing is offers is alcohol.  Like so many other pale lagers, it offers little for beer samplers.  Certainly there is little to offend, but neither does water or milk.  My suggestion is for our country to stop fighting against dictators and send the military after brewers of pale lager beers.  Just blast  them back to the stone age.  It would only be just.
Simple, crisp, nutty dirnkable beer.  I find that the general flavor is palatable and generally pleasing.  A staple when there is not a generous selection.
I’ve heard that Americans don’t get the same beer as in Mexico, and it tastes like it to me.  Of all the Mexican beers, it’s a shame that this is the one that got the popularity.

I don’t understand why this beer is being so harshly rated.  Take it for what it is.  It’s a party beer, that girls love to drink (there’s a reason to buy a couple), and it’s made to be downed  easily, and in quantity.  It’s not trying to be a great beer (I think).  It certainly beats drinking Genesee or Pabst.  That stuff is really disgusting.  I think Corona is ok.  Got me a date.... ;-)
The bottle looks great (albeight the trendiness is long time gone I guess) ... and that’s about it ... tastes like more like a soapy artifical lemon juice than a beer ...

The comprehensive review of this beer..... I think a lot of the experience of this beer is the fact you drink it in a bottle with a lime shoved in, without it has a sharp nose but definately smells like beer, if you wanna drink piss try deperados. 
Corona has a lot more taste than budweiser (to compare, ive had guinness tonight then corona, thats always a test to see if beer has flavour, drink guinness then bud and bud dont taste at all). The taste itself is rather limey. It does get a more offensive taste as it gets warmer though. Light bubbles, not that fizzy. Too expensive to buy in bars (£3 a bottle in some, which sucks) but for the home drinker not so pocket hurting, (£3.51 for 4). The marketing department at modelo hit some nerve somewhere to get this so big, i think it was just a case of being there at the right time. Gimme this over american lager any day, MGD burns your throat, bud is ok but makes you bloated, coors is flavourless water, michelob is like crap bud, other mexican beer like sol is baaaad, like acid that burns your tongue. the best lagers can be found in Europe, that lil continent east of america where all the best people live. The worst lager can be found in england and is called carling. The best beer though, BITTER, oh well. You yanks should give this a chance, better than lake michigan wee.
I have to say ive been buyin the 4 and 6 packs atm, its an easy home drinkin beer if you dont want anything overly flavoursome, or something excessively tinny like stella or fosters. This thing certainly doesnt taste bitter like all you yanks think it does. Try some of our beer in our country, it’ll show you what bitter tastes like.
Wow..I now see why people put lime wedges in here!The is no flavor!No Body,Not a good aroma to be had.

The only good thing thing that I can say about this beer is that it didn’t taste bad. In fact there is little, if any, taste at all. No wonder everyone squeezes lthe ubiquitous lime wedge into it. This is an example of a beer for people who don’t like beer. I would prefer water.
I cannot understand why so many people drink this beer. It has absolute no taste, no aroma, no body, but the advertising campaing must have been good.

I guess it helped that my expectations for this beer were low.  Still nothing really impressive about Corona aside from its utter lack of aroma and scarcity of flavor of any kind.  Sure it was fizzy and yellow... but... well... I won’t go there.  It seems that the brewers of this beer actually came stunningly close to achieving a perfectly tasteless beverage.  And that is perhaps as frightening as it is intriguing.  The twist of lime was good though... and the nachos.

Bottle shared with HogTownHarry, GregClow & tupalev -- courtesy of HogTownHarry. Ah,  Corona Extra, I’d eluded you for so long but here we are, we meet again. You pour a clear sparkling pale yellow with a spare fizzy white head. You don’t look that bad but you are a master at deception. But I had you pegged, what with your sickly yellow colour and practically no head. Your mildly sweet aroma was quite skunky but I’ve had worse -- at this point you were still thinking you could fool me but then I tasted you. You know what I tasted Corona? Nothing. You have the flavour of a big mild nothing. What’s that you say, I’m supposed to stick a lime wedge in you? No, I think I’ll save myself the money and put a lime wedge in a glass of water instead. What, you say there’s a Light version of you? Ha Ha Ha Ha, Corona Extra you crack me up.

Bottle shared with blankboy, HogTownHarry and gregclow - courtesy of HogTownHarry.  Light yellow.  Slightly skunky aroma.  Very watery mouthfeel.  Bland taste, grainy, slightly skunky but pretty mild.  Not terribly offensive but as bland as they come.
I know its cheap but, like Blue Moon, I’d take a corona over bud or miller any day.  And it was my first beer ever so...

Very gross when imbibed without lime.  Has a very unpleasant, extremely long-lasting aftertaste.  With lime, the aftertaste is masked slightly, but the normal beer taste doesn’t match the lime.  Should be avoided whenever possible.

Bottle shared with blankboy, HogTownHarry and tupalev - courtesy of HogTownHarry. Pale yellow with a greenish hue and no head. Aroma of skunk and wet, slightly rancid grain. Flavour follows the aroma pretty much exactly. Very unpleasant. I don’t think even a slice of lime can salvage this stuff.

Bottle (330ml).  Shared with blankboy, GregClow and Tupalev, bottle courtesy of me and LCBO singles bin.  Poured pale clear flat yellow, wispy white head.  Aroma of mild skunk, quite liquid invert sugar sweet, some stale grain.  Also tastes slightly skunky, sickly-sweet grain mash, a harsh chemical bitter finish - quick finish - and a somewhat nasty aftertaste.  Flat, oily and light mouthfeel.  I see why they add a lime slice to this swill

Nearly clear straw colouration with overabundant carbonation.  Nasty adjunct corn flavour makes it hard to believe that this is considered a smooth light beer by some.  There is that distinct "Coronaness" which I suppose is the malt; it sure isn’t the hops cuz there aren’t any that I could detect.

Aroma: smallest hint of lemon, dust and hop. Appearance: clear golden yellow with small shory lasting soap bubbly head. Flavour: soapy, watery with a hint of bland hop. Palate: thin and not too highly carbonated. One day I will try this with a wedge of lemon (only when no one is looking.)
Water, pure Water... overpriced as well. Better than Bud, but thats not saying much, the only stase is slight corn thats about it
Why use lime?  To cover the water taste that comes with the beer.  Bitter, but could be worse than some of the drinks out there.
Corona looks very appetizing for some reason. You know it’s not great because you need a lime in it for it to be good. It’s pretty good compared to the other generic brands.

I say that if you are going to drink a beer that is basically water, Corona is better than Bud, Miller, or Coors.  It’s water, but at least it’s not gross tasting water like the other three.  I would take a Corona on a hot day or to have with a burger, but only if someone gave it to me free of charge.
Decent with lime; crap by itself. Only really acceptable if you’re out of everything else and you don’t want water.
Clear and syrupy looking with little head. Sweet skunk smell. Sweet and corny with a vegetable finish. Light bodied and gassy.
You’re better off drinking tonic water. This is Mexican piss, fermented and bottled.
Sweet hop aroma. Pale yellow colour with poor head and lacing. Light malt flavour. Fizzy palate.

Corona has a grain like aroma and is a light golden in color.  The head is white and short lasting.  The taste is grainlike with some bitterness and just slightly above being light bodied.  The aftertase is quickly diminishing.

About what one should expect when ordering a Mexican lager.  Very middle of the road in the style.  People seem to think it’s good because they can put a lime in it.  I guess there’s no point in putting a lime in a beer that actually tastes like something.
Clear light yellow body, white head.  Small, lightly sweet aroma.  Not much flavor just a little malt; no real aftertaste.  This beer is ok when it is too hot outside to have a real beer.

Skunky aroma and light pale yellow appearance. Classy bottling with a strong ad campaign going for it. Bitter tasting when consumed independent of a citrus fruit such as lemons or limes. Very nice (and cheap)  on a hot beach day in Mexico.

9 Sep 2005 (Hunnshof) - Light sweet simplistic hop aroma.  Clear light yellow (wc) colour, flat head and suds lacing (almost 1/5 for appear).  Light low sweet malt-hop flavour.  Watery, light bitterness and light hop finish.
Very thin light pale color. Water is most prominent tasting substance in this beer, nothing else has any flavor. This is a bad beer, avoid when you can.
OK way over priced!! I see one more uppity little college kid with one of these and a lime and I’m going to scream! Skunk beer!!
This beer is best on a hot summers day. Goes down nice and refreshing. Nice after taste

Very pale colour, average disappearing head. Smells of some corn, not very nice. Taste - ugh; watery, corny. As if I drank average lager mixed with water. Leaves a nasty sour aftertaste. Maybe they make some drinks with this but on it’s own it’s even worse than Polish lagers. Barely drinkable.

I like the bitter beer aroma.  I like the gold color.  I enjoy this beer with a nice thick slice of lime, and it has to be very cold.  Overall not bad, but I think it is overpriced on the market, I’ll buy one here and there but not a case.
A good beer if you are not sure if you want beer or water. Very light. Not much taste but refreshing. Adding a lime helps makeup for the lack of taste. A good beach beer.
What a waste of good water. This beer has I guess a "spicier" bite or something than Bud and all that crap but it is still nasty and near undrinkable.
Very nice bottle and... that’s it. No head and absolutely no aromas, but’s for thirst quenzing it’s more than fine. Though it’s way overpriced (marketing buys everything).
Absolute garbage brew, I’d rather have a Carling Black Label.  They must brew this outside so the hops (or isomeritized hop extract) can skunk to the max.
Golden Yellow. Very Watery, Very carbonated. DO NOT drink without lime. Best thing about the beer is the bottle.
Looks like beer and smells like beer. Passable with a bit of lime. If you can’t find any real beer, then what the hell.
it’s probably better with lime, kind of bland, I’ll have to use lime next time and see if it improves.

Malty
o Light, moderate, heavy,h arsh
o Bread - light, dark
o Cookie
o Grain, Hay, Straw, Cereal
o toasted, roasted, burnt, nutty
o Molasses, Caramel
o Chocolate - milk, dark
o Coffee - mild, strong

Light yellow, small head, heavy carbonation.  Aroma and taste are watered down skunk sweat and grain.  Here’s a thought, why not try a beer that you don’t have to dilute with lime to make it drinkable?

Overhyped...Yes 
As bad as others make it out to be....No

Just an average Mexican lager. Not drinkable without a lime.

It smells way to skunky. It tastes ok. grainy and a little bit watered. not very good without the lime and salt. without that, its just boring. it feels light, and bitter in your mouth and has a very yellowish tint. and a thin white head. But great for the party girls (damnit I love those girls...sigh)
12 oz bottle-pours a white head, color is yellow/pale gold.  Aroma is grain.  Taste is light, refreshing grain taste.  Good carbonation.

This used to be my favorite beer.  This was when I was underage.  I hated Bud and liked this beer when I started drinking.  Now after drinking over 100 beers and many years later, this beer sucks.  Too skunky.

I really dislike this beer on it’s own.  It has a very odd, way too yellow color.  And it tastes terrible without salt and a lime.  Even then I won’t drink it.  Although with a little hot sauce, worceister sauce, squeeze of a lime and over ice with a salted rim, it works very well.  I believe the drink is called a "michelada".
Very watery, but for bad water this is a really expensive bottle. Almost no taste. The bottle with the long neck makes it easy to handle. (Bottle 33cl)

Alot of corn in the mash. Corn and faint, dry hops in the aroma. No head, little soapy lacing. Tastes salty, slightly grainy and bitter with a sweet aftertaste. Palate is a tad metallic and watery. Worth it for a cheap bucket or 12 pack.

From the bottle.
This is another one of those beers that is too familiar for me to rate adequately. I’m not very troubled by that - you’re reading this here, so you already know it’s not a good beer. 

But my host handed me one, and I figured I might as well try to rate it...I poured it into a class, light light yellow with very limited head...thought about how I could comment on the slightly sour aroma, the weak mouthfeel and the very weak taste...and then all of sudden that familiar taste takes me back and I’m 21 years old, sitting in sand on a Massachussetts beach with my best friend, going through a coolor of those clear bottles (purchased because we could stand it and "Chicks love this stuff, dude."), watching the girls walk by, thinking about taking another swim, "hey, hand me another one of those, man", listening to Springsteen on the tape player, "damn, I’m hungry, did we bring any chips?", seagulls raiding a neighboring picnic, "hey, that girl over there keeps smiling at you, man...", the sun still hanging high in the late afternoon sky, "toss me another bottle, dude..."


Gotta throw it a few points just for the memories.

corona looks, smells and tastes like piss.  maybe if you imagine your on the beach or at a Jimmy Buffett concert you could convince yourself its actually a decent beer. But I cant. If your looking for Mexican have a Dos Equis or any other Mex option. The only reason I didn’t score this a Zero is because if its the only beer available I will still drink it. so I guess I cant say its not drinkable.

Thin yellow carbonated body with barely any head.  Truth be told, I’ve always had it straight from the bottle with or without the lime.  Better with flavor (lime), but doesn’t offer much either way.  Light taste, and refreshing when ice cold on a hot day.
fizzy yellow beer. i have never liked this one. warm cold lime or no lime. i have yet to find a good mexican beer.
I used to like this beer before I had tasted many.  Had one yesterday with dinner, and barely finished it.  The most appealing feature was the sweaty bottle with the lime in it.

It’s Corona.  It’s not the greatest tasting beer, and you need a lime wedge to really be able to drink it.  But it’s a great summer beer on a hot day or at the beach.  And yes, I think sentimental value has its place in the ratings.
strong taste, without the lemon just concentrated mexican piss! with lemon... drinkable.. not desirable after taste, popular due to cool commercials on tv!

lots of skunk.  then to my suprrise as it warmed there was more i didnt realize it was possible to have this much skunk in one beer. fine mexican beer yeah if this is fine i would hate to drink mediocre beer.

Bottle. No lime unfortunately. Pours a golden blonde. Watery beer with a hint of something. No discernable bitterness, obviously lacking malt presence and just...blech. But at least it’s better than Bud, Miller, and Coors...
why review this shit???  to remind myself to not drink it again.  usually free beer tastes pretty damn good but this was skunked

Watered down taste. Have to add lime. Everyone knows this is just a good beer to drink and drink when on the beach at Cancun, Acapulco, Cabo or anywhere else. Nothing special at all, other than a party beer.
This stuff is crap.   If you gotta put a piece of fruit in a beer to make it taste better, then it’s not good enough to wash your socks in.  Nasty stuff.
Very watery as you can probably tell just from looking at the color.  Definitely needs a lime wedge.
Bottle. Pale gold. Thin white head. Too cold, tasteless bit of lemon. Harmless
Watered down, very carbonated, no taste, aroma is a bit skunky - Only flavour came from the Lime Wedge...

Poured a pale golden color with just a little white head.  Aroma was very weak and I could only pick up faint corn and a little sweetness (until i put a lime in there.. but that wasn’t factored into the rating).  Flavor had a little maltiness and no noticable hops.. very weak on all fronts.  It went down smoothly, but largely due to its semblance to water.  Was not offensive in any regard... but there just wasn’t anything in this beer to pique my interest.

Hey what can you say.  This is a good drinking beer.  Add a Lime sink it and drink away.  If in need some something refreshing I say get this.  It can be much worse and this goes down smooth and very little hops I think none.

I had this with and without the lime.  The lime did add a little to the taste but I would not bother cutting one up if I was having this at home.  Poured golden in color with little head. Very smooth tasting and quite refreshing (now I sound like a commercial).

i’m not the kind of person who is going to use all the rating’s  i know what i like (i’m easy)
i put my beer in the frig. pour it into a frosted mug and enjoy. simple like football win or lose i still enjoy. i do enjoy corona. and hope others do

Light yellow with a thin white head that quickly dissapears. Aroma of DMS, corn, and a compost pile. Taste of stale cardboard, with a hint of corn.  Effervescent with dense carbonation.  Stinky macro lager, what else need I say.  This is not a horrible beer, just really really bad.  Definately not worth $1 a bottle.
Nothing else than a summer beer, when there’s nothing else in the beer fridge. Light and bland: you almost wish there was three or four pieces of lime in it instead of just one.

I think as far as mass produced commercial pale lagers goes, Corona isn’t really that bad.  Yeah it’s very light in body and flavor, and yeah it’s got a slight sweet corn after taste, but (imho) it’s better than Bud, Miller, Coors etc.  I actually enjoy a corona on a hot day if it’s icy cold.  We can’t glug double IPAs all the time!

this beer is too light for me.
I can drink this if it was hot summer and under the daylight.
skunked all to hell.  my first corona ever.  no lime.  just skunked and had that cerveza-vomit flavor to it.  i could do without ever having one of these again.
