Pale, thin, tasteless brew. Most of the time I wouldn’t touch this sort of thing, though I have to confess it didn’t go down badly on a hot day by English standards.
this is must have with lime, it’s good a fat aftertaste, and if it’s the least bit warm it reminds you of cesspool water.

Very very watery.  Any beer that you have to put a lime or a lemon in to make it taste better can’t be good, but it is somewhat appealing.  kind of bland on it’s own. Better with a lime.  After working outside in 90 degree weather this tastes pretty good.  ALthough, anything after working in 90 degree weather would taste good.  I would explain this beer as the Miller High Life of Mexico.  Not that good.
Not much to say except that it is possibly a little better than Bud, Miller, or Coors, but it’s still weak and boring.  It tastes like a macro for sure.  Not much more to say.

Despite its reputation, this is not nearly as offensive as most macro lagers. Poured with a better head than I expected (probably because I’ve never seen it in a glass before - it’s always drunk from the bottle). Two pillowy centimetres of head which showed reasonable length. Faint aroma of biscuity malt and lemony hops. Flavour is faint adjuncts with some skunk, cardboardy malt and a late shot of bitterness. Palate is exactly what you’d expect from a pale lager.

Bottle. Clear yellow and bubbly, but you’ve all seen it before. Tastes mostly like bad water, but I suppose vegetables could be ascribed as well. Taken with lime, it improves to the rank of crappy lime soda, but not even close to beer. Essentially a beer substitute.
hmm what can u say about this bland beer except looks like urine and im betting my urine tastes better then this beer
they say it tastes better with a lime.  they say that for a reason.  without the flavor masking of the sour green friut, this beer continues to taste like pee.  apparently america loves pee

Pint Bottle:  This nastified brew comes a light gold color with lots of carbonation.  It also boasts a skunk like smell as well as a skunk and bad grape aftertaste.  So, if you like road kill, go for a Corona to wash it down.  No thanks!
Yellow, bland, better than Bud, Coors etc, but not very good at all. Nothing more to say.

Not sure I expected much from a country where you can’t drink the water -- so beer substitutes.  This beer is clear, clear, clear.  Nose is faintly floral and grassy.  While the beer is void of many things, it does also lack the horrifying metallic flavor of run-of-the-mill macros.  And while I’ve never seen anyone light up at the prospect of fishing a bottle of bud light out of a tub of ice at a party, drinking corona does seem to keep guests happy. I suppose that is worth something, too.

(This rating done without the addition of a lemon or lime to the beer.)

Its intresting, everytime i sell this i have to put lime in it so i tryed it in a glass. Gee man this really is the blandest beer iv ever had. The lime actually makes the flavour, i can understand why its soo popular, but surely a beer that has to have fruit in it is saying something.

Water really.  If you are eating seafood in a restaurant that has nothing else available then this would a choice next to water.

Available anywhere USA.
Seriously not worth drinking.  If you want another Mexican beer, give something else a try.

well it is from mexico so my hopes weren’t too high.  smelled like something you’d get outta a 40oz.  thin white head that dissipates.  taste isn’t too great.  less then average lager taste, a bit dry.  Why do people buy this especially at the import price?

The lime gimmick has ensured that this alcoholic lemonade has had some success, even in Belgium. But the beer itself, though drinkable, is not worthy of the name beer: the taste is so bland you could mistake it for water with some added taste. Only recommended in case the other options are Budweiser or Heineken...

I have to admit, this was around for many a family function and I’ve drank many in my past.  I will still pick this over Bud, Coors or Miller.  Having said that, it’s not very good.  Yet another beer I have RateBeer to thank for saving me from.
Actually, this beer is made when urine is made to ferment. It’s pretty gross

This is a somewhat unique beer product.  It has a distinctive pissy skunky flavor that can be appealing, especially when ice cold on a hot day.  The combination of taste, color, packaging and lemon/lime tradition make this product do-able once in a while.
Light, sweet, smooth, classic. I won’t bash corona.  Hot day beer when I am not in arms reach of a hefe.

Very light beer, nothing special. Citric and floral aromas and taste. Goes down very quickly.
The lime slice was first used to prevent flies  from touching the bottle’s rim (it’s even a trivial pursuit question !). It eventually became a trend.
not very good without a lime, with a slice of lime it goes down pretty smooth, a little frothy if not at the right temperature. easy to find

I want to thank ratebeer.com for ruining what used to be a simple pleasure. I can’t drink this corn anymore. I used to love sucking these down and concentrating on not cutting my figure off when it came time for the next lime. Them days is gone.
looks like piss in a bottle.  Tastes like piss in a bottle and makes you want to piss in a bottle.  Why not recycle?  Limes make this beer ok but not really.  Pedro Piss is what we used to call it.
With a lime no doubt, you gotta clean out those mexican bottles, but seriously it’s not that bad.

Very refreshing if not particurly memorable... Unless you’re thinking back to a fun summer day at the beach when you met a beautiful girl and shared a Corona.  What, that didn’t happen to you?  (330 ml bottle)

Golden yellow color.  Very carbonated.  Taste is a hint of citrus, but mostly a simple light macro.  The citrus tastes odd though, like cleaning supplies. Nothing special, but at least has some taste.

Bottle, 33cl. Not much to say about this one. Pale yellow colour. Almost no head and, of course, no lacing. The only thing good that i can say about Corona is that if you are thirsty, this one will be a good option. Very fresh and carbonated, it will seem like a Sprite or something similar, because it’s very easy to drink. Nevertheless, it goes well with mexican or indian food. I’m amazed how Corona is the number one selling beer in Mexico!!!

I really don’t think this one is as bad as people say. Having said that, as a Texan I grew up on it so I may be a bit biased. It’s easy to drink, goes down fast and tastes refeshing w/ a lime and a plate of enchiladas.

Bottle.  Wow, it’s hard to believe that I haven’t rated this before now.  Pours clear and light yellow-gold with a small white head that leaves sparse lacing.  Aroma is sweet and grainy, like corn syrup over cornflakes, faint soap smell and some floral hops in the background.  Flavor is pretty assertive, with the sweet malts and grains in the forefront and surprisingly bold and tart floral and lemon hops with a bit of turpentine as well.  Light body and aggressive carbonation that both tingles and irritates.  Yup, it’s a macro-mex lager all right.
This was the only beer in my moms fridge, I should have passed.Straw color with corn aroma.It was most definately easy drinking but its just over produced macro crap.

Yeah, Yeah, Yeah, suckered in by another pale. Some friends had this at their apartment so I was a bit obliged. Anyway, the smell was awful and the look was pretty dismal. The taste, however, was quite bearable. Not great, but I’d say there was more taste than Bud heavy. Still not worth drinking...

Bottled in frosted mug at El Lorito mexican restaraunt.. I have had this beer many times with mexican food.. And it does a great job with mexican food.. The lime gives it a bit more flavor.. Refreshing and hit the spot with my stuffed peppers.. Not much more to say about it though..

Esther: Je ne peux pas juger cette biere subjectivement juste voir la bouteille entre les mains me rappele un unnivers de souvenirs cette biere ma accompagner a travers des monter d acide, des sejour a la plagedes descentes de tout genre et ausii de bonne vieiles apres midi a se xsoigner la gueule de bois devbant la tele
...................................................................Juju Ben idem ca me rappelle pas mal de debut de soirre dans des bar du vbieux nice, dans les caves p[arisiennes ou encore les terrace au halles ou autres......pas mal de descentes avec  et un bon medicament pour la bonne gueule de bois. C est clair g du mal a etre objectif et j ai toujours la desperados en tet aussi sa fameuse rivale francaise. les fois ou je mettais 4 heures a foutre ce putain de citron pour pitetre avoir du ghout dedans ..... c trop drole que ca e voketellement de souvenirs

enfin.......
Pours a yellow color with thin head.  Tastes of malt, grass, and adjunct.  Slightly skunky due to the clear bottle.  Slight sweet malty taste.  Not impressed.  Lacks any real flavors.
Corona is ok if it’s the only beer around.  Otherwise I would never buy this crap.  The only good thing about it is the lime.

so I just reolized that my last 10 reviews have been for lousy beers. Wonder why. Oh well, not like another one will make a diffrence. Pours a pale golden yellow, phizy head, over carbonated, no lacing {suprise} Aroma is awful: sweet moldy grassyness, stale water, and a deffonate hint of ashtray. Seriously. palate is sandy, dry, overcarbonated. Taste is of grassy malt, corn syrop, tobaco leaf, some weird unplesant hoppyness, and well, some vegitation. Aftertaste is awful. Skunky american hop, cloying roughness in the throat. Most people add a slice of lime. The reason is in mexico if you dont plug the bottle flys ge in. Here, it’s got to be to cover up the taste of beer made with dirty water.  I’ve always thought it was a bad idea to drink mexican beer, there is no crisp clean glacier or well water in mexico after all.  Cheers.

12 oz bottle.  A good lawnmower beer. Remember it’s not SUPPOSED to be a deep, rich brew.  For a mass produced beer, I think they’ve done an OK job with it.  A good alternative to mega-swill BudCoorMil.
better than bud, and better with a lime, but if you never drank this beer, your not missing anything

Bottle. Light yellow with a small, extremely soapy white head that disappered almost as soon as I’d finished pouring the beer. No lacing, but then again I wasn’t expecting any. Nose: cabbage water, moldy hay and seaweed. Flavor: faint taste of overcooked creamed corn, with an aftertaste of raw spinach. No wonder people add lime to this sorry excuse of a beer. I bought this because it was super cheap (75 cents). I plan never to buy it again. Nasty! Nasty! Nasty!

I don’t know why I buy this.  It has some kind of lure when you want to drink during the daytime when its hot.  Smells like lime, tastes weak with a hint of lime---oh wait I added a lime!!!  This is crappy beer.  Maybe one day I’ll learn

Bottle from a friend’s fridge while house sitting.  Pours a urine sample yellow with a foamy, qickly disappearing whit head.  Aroma is of light skunk and even lighter malt.  Taste is thn, watery, cheap commercial malt with no hops to be found antwhere.  Watery, somewhat fizzy mouthfeel.  Overall, hey it’s Corona.  If you want flavor either add a lime or order something else

It was Cinco De Mayo. It was cheap! What was I thinking????? No body. Nice white head that disappered very quickly. Tasted like a skunky Pilsner Urquel and I’m being VERY nice in my rating. Would I buy again? Maybe on May 5th. Other than that no way Jose!!
Not a huge fan of corona. It usually smells and tastes like it is skunked. Bitter aftertaste that isn’t real appealing. However for $12.99 for 12 bottles it isn’t bad after you’ve had a few ;)

Very light golden color.  Small worthless head with alright lacing.  Flavor is a little pungant and very acidic.  I wouldnt reccomend you spend your money on this stuff, although it is a tad better than the real cheap americans.

I am ashamed to say that I have had this beer more than once. Sampled from a 12 oz clear bottle this beer pours a medium golden color with a very small white head. The aroma is pungently skunky. The flavor is also skunky with noticeable corn undertones. No finish. Awful.
Very watery. Pale yellow color. The taste is very bland. Good to wash down spicy food.

12 oz bottle:  pale yellow w/a short lived sparse white head.  Soft grainy malt aroma, and that is it.  At least it doesn’t smell like a skunk’s ass!  Bland malt flavor, and it’s very light.  HIghly carbonated, watery body.  Not a very flavorful beer, but it would be refreshing after a day of hot summer yardwork.

I really wanted to like this,because it looks so good, clean gold in colour and a great lookin’ big white head, complete with a fine steady bead of bubbles...what an awful aroma tho’ initially malty but followed by hints of warm rubber...yugh! Grainy palate, with no finish...did they forget to put the hops in? I suppose this might be ok chilled with a chilli/fajitas/hot spicy concoction, but on its own its bland beyond belief...shame, cos it looked so good!

The very average-looking light-gold colour makes you think they should hide this beer in a dark-coloured bottle. The aroma is a little more enjoyable than expected, with a fair dose of hops and fresh-cut grass. Actually starts pretty nicely as well, with a palate-cleansing touch of hops and hay. However, the enjoyment disappears pretty quickly, as the middle gets very thin and distasteful, and finishes with an unnatural, chemical-like bitterness. Once again, irrefutable evidence that the herd will drink any old swill.

I’ll never pass if someone hands to me on a hot summer day, but really, I just assume have an ice water with lime.  Tasted like watery corn soup with splashes of butterscotch (w/o the lime).  Anyway...
i cant deny that i consider a corona with lime beer candy.  doesnt really taste like beer so much but goes down real easy.  certainly not a good beer by any standards though.

Although this tastes like shit without lime...once that lime drops in....it seems to transform the beer..kinda weird..dont’ drink it without lime or you will go blind..j/k..no i’m serious! lol  Why is this shit so expensive?.because of spring break!
ick.  only adding lime makes this tolerable.  at least there aren’t dead babies floating in it.

Bright yellow beer with a big, fast white head. No real flavor. Skunky. Metallic aftertaste. After 2 of these, I actually went out and bought a lime to drink the other 4.


Kenwood Liquors, Oak Lawn, IL
I suppose if I was dying I might drink it to save my life.  Very popular around here, and marginally better with a lime in it to take away from the pissy flavor.
Good thing I was drinking a Mexican beer.   Putting lime in it was about the only way it was drinkable
Not good but not horrible. You definitley need the lime to make it taste tolerable though.

Very thin and Metallic.  This is one of the most popular beers ordered at the bar and I still don’t know why.  You absolutely need the lime to get rid of some of the natural flavor that comes out of this beer.  Basically, you should only order this Mexican beer if you have no other choice.
Pale yellow, very thin (vanishing) head. Watery. Citric nose. Slight hoppy flavour. Light bodied. Metallic segments. No palate at all.
Poured yellow with the basic swill aroma and flavor. was free so what the heck.

Pours a two-finger white head that goes quickly and leaves no lace.   Yellow color similar to urine.  Light carbonation and very light bodied.  Slight skunky nose.  Starts and finishes very bland, no flavor, qualifies as a poor lawn mower beer.  Why did I buy this stuff?  I needed the bottle for my collection - now over 1650.  $1.60 for a 12oz bottle from Colonial Spirits Acton, MA
I am the 1111 person to rate this.... not bad girls love it but it is very high priced you can buy some really good beers for the same pric great to take to a party
Oh boy! Mexican wee-wee in a bottle! Pours a pale straw yellow color with a fizzy head. Tastes like dirty water and grains. Throwing in a lime is a must... gotta hide that skunky nasty flavor!

Mexican food tonight so I thought I would break out some appropriate beer.  I wanted to give this a real chance, without the lime.  Ok, so I didn’t have one anyway.  On to the beer.  Pours a yellowish color with a thin white head.  Doesn’t look too bad.  Initial aromas of light malt, after the head fades the aroma quickly changes to vegetable with a growing hint of skunk.  I’m starting to get worried now.  So I take a drink, a nice big drink.  That is how your supposed to drink it right?  I notice some flavor of cooked corn at first but the aftertaste is nasty skunk.  I would rate this higher if it had less flavor.  I handed it to my wife to try and I quote, "Ewww, that smells like pee.  I can’t drink that!"  No wonder people put lime in this stuff.  Now for the best part of this beer, the palate is watery but that is exactly what I would want in a beer like this.  This was my first drain pour.
yellow in color, pop the cap no aroma.  light favor. Even with the limee or lemon.  Couple this as the mexican equel of bmc.

A beer that is advertised to college kids as the perfect summer beverage. No actual aroma or taste. More like a massed produced national brand from south of the border. If you don’t use the lime it tastes even worse.
Over commerialized beer. No distict aroma except the lime. You drop the lime in and you get the carbination going. Yellow color no head to speak of went away so quickly.

Yellow color, good carbonation, little dissapearing head, and light flavor.  Has a tendancey to be skunky.  I wouldn’t  have drank it if it wasn’t offered to me.  I would stick to american lagers and keep the money in the States with smaller brewers (ie: Yuengling).
Mexican ranchhand beer...cheap and efficient alcohol delivery system...ice-cold with a lime...gaucamole and salsa...wash it all down with one or six of these mindless brews.
I don’t like this beer without a lime.  With a lime, it is good on a hot day.  Good beer for the summer.
Not worth drinking without the lime or lemon.  With them in turns into a decent thirst quencher very suitable for the warm Mex. climate.
this ain’t a bad beer. a little watery but without the bitterness. i like this beer best with a lime wedge or some lime juice.
weak, watery, utterly useless. tastes the same as all the other macro "brews" but is slightly more expensive, you would have to be  complete idiot to drink this more than once,  unless its free.....
I sucked back a couple of these today out of the bottle, no lime. Not bad for macro lager, light and refreshing, with a minimal bitterness...must be fresh bottles.

Commercials are true- it’s good for hot sunny days on the beach.   I don’t think its worth the price.  Its look resembles a bud or other cheap american beer.   If you are eating at a mexican restaurant, I’d recommend Negra Modelo (an american dark lager).

I was basicly disappointed in this beer.  After all the advertisement I expected it to be at least better than Bud.  If you want a really light flavored import I guess this is the way to go, but definatly over priced.  I’d rather have a Bud if it didn’t give me headaches.  If you want a beer like this get a Del Mar.  Tastes just like a Corona only cheaper.
every summer I’m reminded why I drink this beer. it’s a great summertime drink with lime when your moving around.  the ligthtness was made for the beach.

this beer is difficult to say if it’ s good or bad sometimes you can get some that are really good with some lime in it or lemon. or you can get terrible ones. overall i think it is an aquired taste to really like corona. personally i don’t think it’s that bad
Very weak, watery taste.  Only enjoyable in the middle of summer, while barbequing, with lime.  Otherwise, horrible.
Bottle. Pale golden color with a white head. Skunked aroma, adjunct flavor.  Thin body.
Perfect for refreshing after a strong chili meal, simply because it’s like having a soda. Again, watery and plain. In argentina is served with sliced lemons in it to add some flavor.

Not very good. Mexican budwesier, maybe not even that. Pretty watery and the lime doesnt save it

Side note 1/1/09...while in mexico this past week, I bought a Corona Familiar from a liquor store. Upon arriving at my friends house, I was told that this was actually "family sized Corona"! haha! fun for all ages!

Mexican beer weekend for me, not by choice however.  Between this beer and Pacifico Clara I don’t plan on any more Mexican Pales in the future.  Boring.  No wonder people find it necessary to insert a lime to make this beer go down.
I opened one of these tonight to see if it was still worthy of the 0.5. Holy crap this is so rancid. It smells like a mix between an asshole and a skunk. It does not get worse.

Easy to dismiss as another crappy pale larger.  Yellow hues in the glass, looks very much like you-know-what. Soft nose, doesn’t give much away.  Similar story in the mouth, not much going on flavour wise but like the Asahi has some appealing texture; zesty, fizzy, refreshing.  It would be quite easy to put a few of these away.

It’s your typical piss-in-a-bottle Mexican beer, but put a lime in it and it’s not terrible.  It is what it is; don’t take it as something earth-moving.  Light hops and malt.  Stinging bite.  Good for the beach or a day in the sun near the coast.
a very beautiful lager.  i used to like it actually.  but taste changes.  i still think the corona bottle is pretty cool though.
yes i know this beer sucks lol but we mexicans dont drink corona , the ones that drink corona r the americans what a good way to drink our piss jejeje

So OK, I decided to rate this one star gem.  Pale golden lager with a collapsable white head.  Got lucky I guess since the skunkyness is fairly restrained. Bland and boring in mouth with a sickly corn sweet finish.  OK...its rated...next!

Without a lime slice this is just plain unbearable. Thin, ugly, and skunky tasting (probably from the clear bottle). Clearly just made from water and adjuncts. Needs like sour citrus of the lime to add flavor and counterbalance it’s light sweetness.
Thin watery beer that is just boring. Pale yellow colour, some bitterness in the aroma, nothing in the flavor and a very thin palate.
bottle at a Mexican restaurant.  nothing special here.  I’m not sure why this holds such reverence with some people.  pilsners are not my fav.

What a sad excuse for a beer. But if you’ve never had anything but water for your meal but thought of learning to like beer,this one could be a good start. The color is more to the yellow than water, there are some bubbles and the price is higher.

Beer should not need fruit to be good. I like Corona once every three summers on a very hot day, without additional fruit, and that is plenty often enough for me. A waste of meny, alcohol, time, and lemons or limes.
As much as my New Jersey Beer Hunter friends make fun of me, I love this beer. It is great for a hot day.

Aroma:Skunk.  
Appearance:yellow gold no head.   
Flavor:Sweet taste of nothing.

I don’t understand why this is served in so many establishments in Ontario. I picked up a case, the bottles were so dirty I had to wipe them off before served. I was ashamed of myself for even serving it, although my guests didn’t seem to mind. The Extra is for Extra watery.
A bit of tart/sour to add to the sweet taste. Yellow gold in color, Good to have on the beach in mexico, that’s about it.
Light gold color, virtually no head.  Light bodied smooth beer and quite watery. Not much flavor or aroma, with some tinge of sweetness and corn.

Bottled. Clear yellow, malty rice taste with hints of hops. Sweet rice and malt in taste, with a bit bitter aftertaste. I prefer this one with a slice of lime. 3 2 5 2 8


Bottled (to celebrate the 10th anniversary of 2Pac on RateBeer). Bottled. No lime slice, just the bombastic fluids in the bottle, from the bottle. Sweet rice and malts with some slight citrusy notes in the aroma. Flavour is rice, maize, mild malts and not that much more. Thin palate. Rather empty in flavour. Merv likes this stuff. 3 2 2 1 4.

I can’t tell what the head is like when it pours.  A number of years ago I made the mistake of pouring this beer in a glass and discovered why this beer is meant to be in a bottle with a lime.  The aroma is almost sickening.  If you can get past the smell, this is a light, refreshing not too hoppy, not too malty beer that goes good with chips, salsa, sand, and sun.
Goes well with food, the same way water goes well with food.  I like this beer, but I’ve been told it’s because I’m a girl.
While I was writing this review I actually gagged. So we’ll just leave it at that. Besides, I wouldn’t want to drink something that I can smell by walking outside. Welcome to the Barrio.
It’s not too bad on the toungue because there is not much flavor, but anytime you have to put something in a beer to make it drinkable...that’s a bad sign.
I think the lime that everyone put in the bottle kills the beer, makes it flat.  But the lime also adds flavor, and a citrus smell that covers up the urinal aroma.

Skunky nose.  Reminds me of HEK.  ALL BOW TO HEK.   Very light malt in the flavor (or maybe I’m imagining that) sour grains.  Lime improves it quite a bit.. but that isn’t really an ingredient now is it?
The most vile tasting beer ever.  I’d rather drink giraffe piss.  Any beer that NEEDS a lime to make it drinkable shouldnt be called beer.

The best thing about this beer is the way it looks -- it’s pale, crisp looking, and just has a fun, tropical feel about it with a lime sticking out the top.  Unfortunately that fun looking bottle is clear so it’s easy to get skunked Corona, and even when you don’t, it’s just a thin lager with no good flavors to write about.  It never smells fresh or delicious.  The lime covers up the bitterness/staleness fairly well, however, and makes it passable.  It’s a great beer for people who don’t like beer.
This is too expensive for what you get. It needs a lime to cover the horrible taste. Swill Amigos!

a light golden color w/ no real head.. smelled a bit of barley and a hint of something citrus maybe lemon the palate is pretty much water and the flavor is a bit stale... the lime cleans it up a bit but overall not a good beer.

Piss. They put piss in a bottle, and use those shitty clear ones at the same time, so you end up with this bottle of beer that comes in a box reeking of rotten milk for some strange reason.  You open your beer, and are suddenly drinking skunk piss. Skunk, piss, and rotten milk do not mix. Beer is not supposed to be skunky. Green and clear bottles suck. Corona sucks. 0.0

This beer is something I use to love.  But I guess my taste has refined.  If I drink this... I have to drink it with lime and kosher salt.  I will go out and buy this for a party.... but if I want to sit at home and enjoy a good brew... I would not buy this.

Poured a translucent yellow with a very thin head that dissapated quickly.The aroma was of corn sugar and grass. The taste is sweet malt and has a grassy bitterness. Finished clean. Not alot of carbonation. I tried it again with a lime wedge and liked it much better. This was an average mexican lager. I’m not a huge fan of mexican beers but somtimes they do hit the spot.
Thin, pale, watery.  This beer is the Mexican equivalent of Bud, a beer designed to be consumed by the 12 pack. Don’t bother.

It’s like they buy skunked beer from Budweiser, and add Mexican water.  This is one of  the palest, thinnest swills I’ve ever seen, and I can’t believe this crap sells in a first-world country.  Apparently people will drink ANYTHING if you put a lime in it.
I’m suprised this beer is so popular in Australia, just goes to show how marketing can work...it’s ordinary, and usually served with a slice of lemon or lime....what are they trying to hide??

Very pale gold; white fluffy head, dwindling. Chalky, grainy nose - and a  bit lemony already? And, I think, lightstruck. FAWGH! Medicinal taste and "skunked" as you say. Absolutely horrible, ruined grain. Falling flat after 1’ of opening time. Medicinal salve flavour getting worse all the time. Flat, dull sweet, no body. It beggars belief that this concoction is so loved around the globe. It’s good advertisement for limes, however. Covers up anything. (I drank this without, of course.

Good old yellow beer. The only cerveza to be brewed and shipped out of Canada. Pop a lime in her and forget that she’s a nasty old pale ale. After a 12 pack, you won’t really care. Don’t hesitate to blow on the neck. You know you want to.
Yellow.....not gross in aroma taste just really unimpressive...this really needs the lime.  Cramming that lime down in the bottle and watching it fizz would be the best part of having this beer.

This is an ok pils.  It’s better cold.  Recently, on a trip, I ate in a small Mexican café in the rural southeast US.  I fell in with a group of Mexican men who were buying Old Milwaukee long necks by the bucket.  The beers were delivered with a plate of sliced limes.  We got to talking and they told me that they used limes to cover up the flavor of the crappy beer.
If I was stranded on an island with this, I’d wait for rain. Filtered through the horse.

Hard for me to consider this "beer", but since I drank one today, and it’s on the site, I may as well rate it. Little noticeable aroma. Taste is... well... barely noticeable as well. Tastes slightly malty, but I couldn’t really discern much in the way of hops. I guess one thing that it has going for it is that it doesn’t really taste awful, and it’s fairly crisp, with no aftertaste.

The best thing going for it is 1) no flavor when chilled, and 2) still better than the bottled horses urine retailed as "Sol." But there’s no reason to buy either when Dos Equis is available to wash down your Chimichangas. At least XX is not full of crap that doesn’t belong in beer.
of all the common brews, i like this one the best.  Still way better than beast or miller.

Definitely not a great beer but it does have a certain corn taste that is appealing to me. Also the mild hops and malty aroma invite you to drink this one with a lime on a hot summer day. Having one of these goes well with a taco or burrito.

Considering its price you would think I would be able to say something good about this beer but I really can’t with exception to say that I was fortunate that someone else bought it :-) Overall an overpriced fairly common drab tasting beer.

A slightly improved piss beer, tastes better then it’s peers but still very flat, very watery, goes down way too fast, it’s been a long time since a last drank it and i don’t think i’ll drink it anytime soon, it’s also overpriced.

This beer has two things going for it. 1) The taste is not particularly objectionable, because it does not taste like much. 
2) Your friends like it (if they are not beer geezers) Having said that, I do not need to drink beers that need a lime added to make them passable. If I wanted a lime flavour I would buy a bloody sierra mist.

Looks clear, tastes citrus like and metallic.  I don’t know if I’d be able to discern this in a blind taste test with Pine-sol.   You know, this isn’t your only option for Mexican beer.  Better Mexican beers: Pacifico, Negra Modelo, Dos XX Amber.
Over priced at what you get.  Hadn’t had one since college.   Hey, I’m just rating it to get my numbers up!

I hadn’t realized I had never rated this.  Glad to be the 1042nd person to have the opportunity to post an opinion about this brew.  Pale yellow, fizzy.  Faint nose of corn, almost nothing there really.  Almost no flavor either.  At least it wasn’t aggressively offensive.  Treat it like a barley pop and slap a lime in it, pretend you aren’t a beer drinker, and you may actually enjoy it.
Mexicans are just not good at this whole beer thing....tried one at one of my buddy’s B-day......hum lets see 3.99 for a crapy glass of water.....i’ve been cheated..
Well, i guess if it’s really hot out,I’m thirsty as hell, and they are cold, very cold.

I could hardly see the color of the beer as it was pretty dark at the moment where I took it. Or was it? I think I should revise this and say that the beer had no color! Wow! This is very very very pale yellow!

And as for the aroma, I understand why they put a lime in it... because there is next to no aroma.

I find this beer is pretty expensive for water.
Pretty awful straight; somehow with a lime it’s passable as a drinkable liquid, even though it’s not drunk that way in Mexico and makes it completely un-beer-like.  It’s got a bad aftertaste.

So I went on a trip to Mexico recently. I find it funny that Mexican citizens talk about this beer like it’s roughly the equivalent of America’s "Beast". Only thing worse than this, as Mexican beers go, is Sol.

Frankly, this beer is horrible.  Smells bad, tastes bad with awful aftertaste.  Adding lime helps somewhat but not enough to even consider this brew if you can call it that.  Avoid like the black death.

Pours a pale gold with a white head that lasted surprisingly long.  It has an unpleasant aroma that I can’t describe.  Not much flavor and I don’t like the "chemical" after taste.   I’m not sure what all the hype is about.
Barely a beer.  Pissy in colour and  pissy tasting.  I agree it is way over marketed for what it’s worth.  A very trendy beer for the trendwhores out there

Why do I like this beer? It is drunk by obnoxious fat guys wearing the matching corona brand visor at the lake, Over-marketed, and looks like urine. It tastes bad, unless you add a lime. Yet I feel as if I am on a Mexican vacation, have I succumbed to corporate marketting? Apparently I have. This beer tastes poor and yet I will drink it from time to time....I’m rating it low beacuse it is crap beer. ..Ole’

Sort of a tart uriney flavour - albeit a not unpleasant appearance.  The chemical after tastes are quite noticable, formaldehyde, ethanol, benzene and other aromatics.  After sessioning on this tincture one evening, I had one of my most memorable hangovers of the last two decades.  Still throwing up 24 hours later.  
This is a nasty beverage not for the faint hearted or weak stomached, drink as a fashion statement only with a wedge of lime to mask the appaling flavour.

Bright yellow with fleeting fizzy white head.  Served with a lime wedge, which is really annoying when jammed into the neck requiring a poke prior to drinking.  Hmm I never realized they consider this a pilsner.  Thirst quenching but so is clean water... oh wait a minute, i get it now.

I give it all ones, but a 10/20 because if you’ve had a harsh night out, and you are recovering, and you need to wean yourself back onto beer.  Drink this in the hot african sun with a wedge of lime in the neck of the bottle. 

Very little flavour, body, head, or aroma, but none the less, if you don’t see it as a beer, see it more as a soft drink with a kick!  Reminds me a lot of miller, no flavour or head.
Kinda looks like beer..... Sorta smells like beer..... tastes like? Not beer. Mexico’s version of Busch or Bud light.  Hard to believe this comes from the same maker of the good Negro Modelo.
Shining yellow color. Much light one, without body and bitter. No famous one to find.
The best thing about this "beer" is the advertising. The first time I tried it was an honest mistake.  Thinking a lime would make the second one better was foolish.  Stay far away!

Pale yellow with an airy white head that fades almost instantly.  Bitter taste that really makes me wonder why Cinco de Mayo is such a big deal.  I think they bottle it straight out of the brewery drug screening specimen bottles.

This beer is alright as long as there is lime. Otherwise it has like no taste.  Piss is a good word that someone else mentioned.  If you want to have ten beers this is the way to go.  It is too expensive.  This and Franziskaner Hefeweizen are like the same price.  Give it a rest.
this was a beer i tried once since there was so much hype. can we describe beer as piss in a bottle, it seems the best description ever.

Bottle at JDW High Wycombe. Absolutely nothing I hadn’t tried on draught anywhere in the town centre, so I had this. Pale gold, big fluffy white head. Aroma is sweet and grainy (corn). Malty & sweet lager with notes of corn flakes and candy floss. Sugary.
flavorless, especially if drank with lime. don’t bother with this one. nothing but marketing hype.
There’s not much to say about this one.  It sucks.  Avoid at all costs, and resist any and all shameless marketing techniques.

Any beer served with a lime in it should have a question mark on the label. Still serves a purpose, I think? Should be drunk from the bottle, as in the clear glass it resembles the urine of a dehydrated human, who may need one of these if their pee is this colour. Sour lemon grass and rice starch nose. Watery taste, cardboardy mid-palate, low to no hop tones and flavour reminds me of rice cakes. Finish is as blunt as a bowling ball! Not really beer at all!!!
One of the biggest lie in imported beers.Very acidy,very watery.No carecter,nothing but nothing.Is this beer!
Bottled. Lucid yellow beer with fizzed head. Weak thin grainy flavour, stodgy and saccharin. This really is an awful beer, I can see why they try to flavour it up with fruit.
Looks like piss, taste like...well, lime if you stuff one in the neck. Rates right down there with BMC. Drinkable if really cold.
Bottle. Pale yellow in color. Aroma is a little grainy and watery. Flavor is pretty bland. Grain and a little metal. Not really offensive, just boring.
Ai yi yi yi yi, best south o the border beer there is.  Decent flavor and aroma, not too much carbonation, real good barbecue beer.  VIVA CORONA.

(De Barril - brown bottle) Faint malty aroma with some tinny-ness.  Pale yellow color with thin white head.  The flavor is that of a very weak, thin lager.  As I said before, this is a very thin beer, which is pretty typical for Mexico.  Overall, this is a worse than average beer.  However, it must be said, that the brown bottle makes it much more palatable, much of the tinny-ness from the tradition clear bottle is lacking.
Looks like piss, tastes like piss. Honestly, not worth buying, and not worth drinking unless it’s ice cold and you’re not paying.
710ml clear bottle. Pale yellow, no head, faint sweet aroma, surprisingly not skunky. Light bodied, thin, fizzy, faint sweetness hiding beneath a lot of water.

Don’t really see how so many find this one appealing.  Light and watered down.  The only discernable flavor is that of being skunked.  The lime is a neccesity to mask this.  That being said, on a hot summer day this is pretty good at quenching thirst.

Bottle.  Yeah, they put in a lime... Yeah, the lime makes it better... but I’d be a liar if I said that I hate this beer.  It actually has some decent body and has a nice sweetness to it.  I can drink this without much problem.  I have never tried it without the lime... and after reading everyone else’s ratings, I don’t think that I will.  It does not resemble a pilsener to me.  Not bad though.

Not sure about the style of this beer. Says its a pilsener.  I didn’t think so. But I really understand why the lime is needed, to crispen up the flavour.  
Without the lime, a distinct sought of dull/flat flavour of its own. 
Sounds strange to say that I found it was full bodied. Some aroma (with a hint of wheat?). Lacked gassing and head. I might have to re-rate this one down the track...
I like this beer....but i like most cheap beers since that is what I can usually afford. Good for a friday night with the boys.

MUY FEO!!   Looks real watered down and has no head and no pleasant aroma.  Flavor is lackign any pale lager qualities and its no wonder why a lime is served with this no matter where you go.  I do order this when im at a mexican seafood restaurant cuz it does seem natural with the food.  Not to brag but this is the  beer i can down the fastest in a 12oz showdown on who can finish a beer the quickest(clocked in at 9 seconds once)

Extra what?  Extra taste needed: Served with lemon slice. This is not a great beer - it’s not even a good beer and it certainly ain’t a pilsener (as the company will say).  
Sure it’s yellow like the sun in a kids picture but there’s a watery texture, fresh but empty smell with similar taste and no head. There is a hint of malt under the tart fizz with a palate-wiping short finish. A friend noted soda in the aftertaste - true, I agreed - but then I thought he’d written "sock". Mexicos answer to DB Export but far far worse.  May go with tacos at the beach, while fending off the hot midday sun.  It seems to me this is a beer for those who are "daring to try something exotic" ("Look, my beer is served with lemon!"). Gets points,  though, for being slightly camp. The best thing about it was inserted into the bottle after it was opened. Up there with Efes Pilsener.
Awfull beer, the worst in Mexico only after XX Lager, I don’t know why so many peaople like it, it’s flavor is like someone had froze it and then boiled it.

Bottled.  God I must hate myself.  Drank this straight after a bottle of Sol:  some comparison that is.  Not as sweet as Sol but just as crap.  More malty but in a farty way.  I’m glad I don’t live in Mexico, but why do we import this crap?
(0n bottle) I was the 1001th sucker to rate this beer. I´ll never drink it again.

The beer pours a pale yellow color. Thin white head, lots of fizzy bubbles. STRONG light-struck, skunky odor. Tastes of light-struck hops, DMS, and not much else. You NEED the lime to make this excuse of a beer drinkable.

My son being a surfer drinks this, so I occasionally have to choke one down when I am at his house.  They dont put limes in this for nothing. Its better than a Miller Lite, but that ain’t saying much.  I wouldn’t pay actual money for this swill

I’ve always had a hard time drinking this beer. Gold/orange colour(at least its not green) and the clear bottle used does nothing to hide that. Poor watery taste, bitter. This is a last resort beer when at a club that only serves Corona, Miller, or Bud. Next time choose a better club.

Can’t believe I haven’t rated this macro nasty.  Biting body with hints of hops and a tangy malt backbone.  Actually the hops aren’t so indetectable.  Please don’t drop a lime into the bottle and smile.  Please?

I think I heard the lime scream when I tried to put it in, right before it bit me and ran away. Beer smells like fermented skunk, tastes like fermented skunk, and looks like fermented skunk urine. The only reason I drink this is nobody here in CA carries anything else. Detectable amounts of fermented Mexican in the water and aroma. Watery in the beginning, watery in the middle, watery in the end. Leaves the human body looking much the same way as it entered.  If you swill it fast enough, the taste ain’t so bad, and the buzz is ok...after you down 5 or 6 of them through the course of an hour. Just don’t remind yourself that it contains Mexican water. After that, the only reason I don’t throw it up is because I don’t want to taste it again.
i have a small place in my heart for corona.add a little "lucas" (you latinos will know what im talking about)and some carne asada tacos and its a pretty good combo.

This is THE BEACH BEER. It only ,and I mean only goes well with hot mexican food and hot mexican nights. The only reason anyone would drink this is for the nestalgia and that’s what they’ve made it soooooo big on.

Sampled out of a St. Bernardus Goblet.

Straw.

Skunk, pure water, salt, noble hops, butterscotch, herbs, cooked asparagus, adjuncts and pale malts in the nose.

Herbal, noble hops along with adjuncts, skunk hair, pale dust covered malts and more skunk combine to make this one of the worst beers I have ever tasted.

The colour is pale, bright, and clear yellow. The white foam is quite small, and it sinks into a minimal layer within just a minute.

The smell is quite simple and a bit sourish with hints of lime and dry malt.

The carbonation is strong and fresh, it feels just like soda water.

The taste is straightforward and simple: A sweet note is soon replaced by a refreshing, plain bitterness. The aftertaste has some flavours of citrus fruits and some hops, but after a while the remaining taste is that distinctive sweetness from corn.

By itself, it is not much of a beer, but if you let it accompany a hot dish with lots of chilli peppers, it turns into a cooling thirst-quencher with a nice touch of malt.

Corona gets really bad marks on here, and yes, I am new to all this...

But... I do enjoy it with lime. Sans lime it’s intolerable to me, but with a third of a lime in a bottle, I find it goes quite well with Mexican food.

I had one of these that my friend gave me after I had already been drinking good micros. I don’t know what piss tastes like, but I imagine this stuff comes close to replicating that taste. I think it needs a full lime per beer to even make it drinkable. One of the worst beers I have ever had.
This beer doesn’t taste good.  Adding a lime helps a little, but it still is disgusting.  Maybe if they put it in a brown bottle or a can it wouldn’t be so gross.
I don’t mind it with lime in it. Without the lime it lacks flavour. Lack of fizz. Great summer drink. Decent for deck parties.

Definitely a summer beer if you throw a lime in it ... but that’s about it.  Without limes this beer would not have a market and probably would not exist.  Also, it’s sold at rip-off prices for what it is.  Whatever, it’s drinkable, but does not resemble a lager at all.  I give the lime 15 points, the beer 5.

Yuck, you open this up in a room of micro and home brews, and it smells like a skunk go loose!
However, i was up in Wawona, Yosemite just this weekend, and i found a thicket of Hops, (probably not native or natural) that were definatly bitering, and not aromatic.  My brother-in-law had brought the corona’s and had some limes.  So  I added a lime slice, added several fully ripened hops, let it set for awhle,  it was drinkable.
Pilsener type beer?!... No head, very little carbonation. Light-bodied,faint hop taste and aroma .Clear bottle is begging for skunkhood. I'd rather have an A-B or Miller product.

Probably my least favorite Mexican beer.
Boring appearance, very little aroma, 
hardly any flavor with a thin palate. No wonder everyone puts a lime in it. Fine if
you are thirsty and just need a quencher, but there are many beers to fill that role which have tons more taste.
It has been said - a good beach beer, barbaque beer, hot as hell and need a beer beer.  Nothing more.

Had this in Florida while on vacation, as it had been left in the fridge by relatives.  Considering how many people love this beer and claim it to be different from other pale lagers, I found little distinguishable about it.  No really bad aftertaste, just no real taste at all.  I suppose one could call it refreshing, but seltzer water would provide a similar effect at a cheaper price.  I assume adding a lime to a Corona would be like having seltzer with lime, which would probably be an improvement.

This was foul, not in an extremely bad taste way, but in an almost-no-taste-but-the-taste-that-exists-is-bad way. Even the colour is offputting. And it’s quite expensive here, I think around 2 euros. Good thing I got the bottle I drank (well, drank half, and poured the rest in the sink), for free (a cousin bought 4, drank one, got disgusted with it, and gave me one to try).

Coronas work best in an outdoor party setting, and incredible when ice cold.  This beer has become extremely popular recently, but the notoriety lives up to its taste.  A little expensive for college kids, we like to drink this most at parties hosted by our friends or parents.

Outdoor Summer Beer.  That pretty much covers the bases for this one.  I’m certainly not about to be the guy supporting much of the pop-culture idea of this being a phenomenal, be-all, end-all of the beer world, but at the same time I can’t give in quite yet to completely disregarding it’s place in life.  This is not a beer that’s going to win any versatility awards, unless you’re living in some tropical destination or live permanently at a Jimmy Buffett concert (if this is the case please contact me so we can try to arrange a meeting) but for a good hot day by the grill, or just on a deck with some good tunes, it gets my OK.  Keep it in the bottle, bang the top of with something other than a conventional opener to add to the overall experience, throw a lime in there, flip it over for a sec, then enjoy.  When it’s oppresively hot out, a complex beer isn’t really what’s needed (technically beer isn’t either, but that’s certainly not the point here) but the simplicity and timeless look of this one puts it on my list.  Let someone else bring this one to the barbeque, as it’s a little pricey, or despite the fear of being conventional and played out, pick some up yourself and just have it around in case any summer festivities pop up at random.

Pours a urine yellow with a thin soap head.  A weak aroma that suggests a general "beer" flavor is present, but only mildly noticeable.  Flavor is bland, thin and dry, primarily tasting like a watery, skunky, sun-struck lager.  This flavor is however, substantially complimented and improved by the addition of a lime wedge or two.  Not something I’d really care to drink, but I have to admit that, while cooking over a hot grill before the football game on a late-summer day in Georgia, an ice cold Corona with a lime wedge really hits the spot.

Not much aroma, taste or anything else.....but boy can you neck it in one. Not exactly one to savour, BUT Blackie mentions it inside the cover of WASPs the Crimson Idol CD so thats good enough for me !!!

My origial score of this beer....was probobly a little unjust and unfair to this brew. While not of any particular note, corona is fairly reasonable when paired with mexican food and has a sweet corn flavor that I find palatable.
This is the tinniest flavored of the Mexican lagers.  I don’t know why anyone drinks this stuff.

Skunks smell bad for a reason. It shouldn’t be part of any consumable beverage. Maybe you can put lime in any shitty beer and make it drinkable. I suggest they throw lime into this crap at bottle time if thats what it takes. if you soak a dog turd in salt and ciitus long enough, it might taste like beef jerky. I won’t drink this even if it’s free and I am a pretty cheap guy.
bad...bad...bad....  A horrible beer that is much to popular and overpriced.  Taste is probably worse than even budweiser.  A shame...
the commercials don’t lie, this beer was made for the beach... or with a casual home cooked mexican meal
piss yellow, sharp skunky aroma, this is what they drink in Mexico?  It would not be the same without a lemon or a lime.

Skunky aroma doesn’t resemble a world-class beer.  Taste is better- but perfectly neutral.  Probably not as good as BMC. Would be easy to consume mass quantities, if that’s the goal.  Top-selling import shows that many buy based on image.
This one should carry a subtitle, "El Bud Lite de Mexico."  So bad, I never got past trying a sip of my sister-in-laws’.  Does not stand up to either Negro Modelo or Dos Equis.

A light tasting beer, for some reason some people are fanatics about this thing.  I could see how it would taste good at the beach, but otherwise it leaves something to be desired.  A lime or lemon is the only thing that will give it taste, and after a few rounds of such it gets sickly and repetitive.  Had this in a can (!!!) without citrus once, and just tasted bland.

This sample must have been straight from the case and thusly was not light struck as there was no skunk flavour at all, however that still left a piss yellow watery beer with some fizz. Maybe o.k. on a hot day or at the end of one like I had it.
Very similar to the Light but tastes and smells slightly better.  Has a slightly sweet smell to it and tastes skunked, watery, and has a pretty bad long finish.

The beer itself without lime has almost no flavor and is barely enjoyable to drink.  And on top of all that is more expensive than most beer because of the huge marketing and advertising that the company does.  And that doesn’t include the cost of the lime that is necessary to make the beer taste decent.

The WORST beer i have ever, ever tried. If there’s a beer worse than this one, please tell me so i will not try it never.
The first and last time i tried this one was in a night club, where they told us they did’nt served another kind of beer (sadly, its a night club frecuented by us-citizens). They should serve Indio instead of this kind of urine-in-a-bottle.
Skip this one, never try it.

If it wasn’t for Bud Light, this would be the worst beer I ever tasted (not including Red Tail, but that was just weird) I had to see what the hype was about, it tasted like bodily waste, there are not enough limes in the southern hemisphere to make this beer taste good.
This is by far one of the worst beers on the market...without a lime it tastes like cat piss...with a lime it tastes like a festive version of cat piss...

Bottle: Poured clear gold with a small short white head. Initially strong cowshit-like hop aroma that faded to a typical weak Pale Lager set. Watery flavour, again the usual PL taste. Palate was again the usual, although gets a point for not being over carbonated. The only time I have ever like this beer is with Mexican food, and there are plenty that go better.

It is a great beer, for what it is ... a beach beer.  With a lime and some sand, it must be summertime or springbreak.  No one claims it to be the best beer availible, but it is a nothing beer and a good one for being watery.
I’m sometimes amazed at how popular this beer is at the beach.  I guess it is the weak, light flavor and the Mexican mystique.  Personally I’d rather have a Negra Modelo.
Hate to admit to it, but pretty damn good with a lime in it on a very hot summer day when you’re extremely parched.  That said sans lime there’s really nothing to comment about.

A beer that is better than Coors, Miller or Bud. That doesn’t say much. With a squeeze of half a lemon or lime (that would normally ruin the taste of a good beer made with rich hops), it makes it tolerable. I would recommend Negra Modelo as an alternative Mexican Beer instead.

I only like this on a scorching hot day.  Other wise it seems to smell and taste of urine.  To me, it seems to vary from time to time in many qualities, particularly taste.   Drink it on May 5 or when its 99 degrees (w/ a lime)..otherwise not really recommended.
I don’t know how people drink this, I used to drink this before I knew what good beer was, glad I don’t touch this stuff anymore.
THIS STINKS!  I DRANK THIS LONG LONG AGO, SO GLAD I MOVED ON TO BIGGER & BETTER BEERS!  IT HAS A HORRID TASTE....YUCK!

To be honest, I hate Corona. Absolutely despise it...but I felt I had to rate it after drinking almost a full 12 pack that was sitting at my parents house.  I drank the Corona like it was my arch-enemy, just to get rid of it.
This is a perfectly neutral flavored and bland lager. Should be used as a yardstick to measure all other bland lagers. Good for a hot summer day, but I prefer lemonade.

It was a hot day, we were having Mexican for lunch, and my buddy suggested Coronas. Well, you won’t see any sub-1 ratings from me, it really wasn’t so bad. It wasn’t great, but with the lime and all, it seemed to round out the spicy food fairly well. On a side note, I could have sworn it had less than the 4.6% ABV listed on this site--like 2% or something.
This beer is bad, but when it’s all you got to get from a bar, its great....epecially with lots of lime and after being a little tipsy.

On a very hot day, with lime, it is passable. Colour is urine, no noise to speak of. A white pasty head on pour, not much lacing at all. If you let it warm it gets very skunky. Drink only on hot days, ice cold with lime.
Had this after a Corona Light yesterday.   Not as skunky, a little bit of flavor, but I  remember it tasted much better in Cancun.  Without the beach and high temp forget it.

There’s no way I would buy a Corona, but I was at a party, there wasn’t anything else and I didn’t bring any beer and I felt naked without a beer in my had. Of course the person in charge of the party says to me, ’I bought the good stuff’ as he handed me a Corona with a Lime in it. Needless to say, I didn’t stay too long. I can’t say anything about this that hasn’t been said before - it is light in appearance, smell and taste. Bad.
Golden color with a white head. The taste is water, metal and corn. And no it doesn’t help to put a lime slice in it.
Satisfactory if cold on a hot day. Some foam otherwise yellow nothing special, malt,corn sweetener, carbonation whallop on the aggressive side. Just mediocre.

Oh my god, this is bad. It tastes bad when it’s ice cold, and terrible if you let it warm up at all. I don’t know if it’s the clear bottle or the Mexican water or what, but this is even worse than the Macros! And that’s saying something!

Botlle and tap (in Mexico) Since I started rating brews on Ratebeer I decided to actually pay attention to how some of the ones I occasionally drink actually match up.   I was shocked at how awful this stuff is.  The color of urine, bad aroma, unpleasant flavor, and nothing that makes it worth drinking.  The next time someone hands me one ot these  I will just suck on the lime and pour out the beer.  This shows the power of marketing.  If you poured a liittle vodka in tap water you would have a better tasting drink.

i love this stuff on a hot summer day,  really i do.   one of the few brews you’ll see me drop a lemon in.   its refreshing, and always full of memories.   again,  its not a special beer in how it tastes or looks, but is a beer that  does the trick when in need.  an old favorite, that i wont deny enjoying on certain occastions.
It is what it is - just fine to quench the thirst on a hot afternoon.  I would rather have a Corona than a Bud Light any day.
Standard bad pale lager, with a metallic, acidic taste that is cut slightly by the addition of a lime.
if your gonna drink anything mexican might aswell just get some Jose Cuervo,it has better taste and get drunk quicker haha
ok, sure this is overpriced and trendy and skunky as hell, but the lime makes that all ok. drank one without a lime once.  this defiinately not reccommended.
Horrible appearance and slightly funky flavor.  Adjuncts galore.  Not bad with a lime though...it does the job on a hot sunny day in San Diego or Tijuana.

I hear the Mexicans piss in this beer.  Just kidding.  It possess a urine gold  color.  Definately watery with some bitterness to it.  Now I understand why it needs lime or lemon.  To help add complexity to nothing and to help ease your suffering!   Don’t know how people drink this stuff sometimes.  Must because of the bright color which are used to help brainwash the dummy beer drinkers.  Definately has to be the power of marketing with the beach as a backdrop.

A lot of nothing. A whole bunch of nothing. Actually, on a first swig of a recent bottle, I did notice some hoppy crispness. But it went away quckly. There was a lot of this floating around the island of HIlton Head on my recent vacation. It’s stacked to the ceiling (in cases) in some convenience stores there. It’s got the whole isalnd vacation mythos workin for it. Saw some guy in a flower shirt (the Hawaii kind) carrying out two cases to his car. Poor guy. I have very good friends who love this stuff. They’re good friends and they remain so, in spite of their lack of discerning judgment when it comes to matters beer-like and et cetera...

I can say this, though, with certainty: Drink it with limes and you will fart. And it will not be good.

Extra what? Pale urine color, I have a hard time finding anuthing good to say here. I guess it really is the power of marketing. watery with some bitterness (I guess that’s what the lime is for). This stuff reeks.

Clear pale yellow with a medium diminishing rocky white head.  Aroma of soap, DMS, cereal, and light bread.  Light watery body with fizzy carbonation.  Flavor of corn, soap, cardboard, stale pepper, and moldy bread. Almost offensive, this number-one seller is some of the worst swill I have had.  I'm still holding out for that one beer that makes me cringe for the 0.5 rating. This one is pretty close.
Extra. Ha. Extra soap maybe. Even my Mexican friends don’t drink this. It boggles my mind why this tastes like soap. Don’t waste a lime on it, it won’t help.

Not too good.  Had it at home from bottles in Buffalo, NY as well as off the tap and in bottles in Mexico.  I was never impressed.  A week in Mexico with nothing but Corona and Modelo made me miss real beer.  Poor watery but bitter flavor.  It’s bottled Mexican urine plus alcohol.  Try it for the novelty if nothing else.

It staggers me how they can charge $50 a case for this swill in Australia. When you can buy European beers like Stella or Urquell around the $40 or $45 a case mark. Whoever does Coronas marketing..............your doing something right, its definitely not the product.
graduation party beer.1st one no lime little aroma and flavor. 2nd one with lime there is the flavor to bad it was lime. another one to drink ice cold and fast
Pale Honey Coloring.  Had at O.C.  It’s like taking one for the team...Put a lime in it to ease your suffering.

Light,pale yellow and fizzy.  No real flavor unless you put a lime in it. This is one of those beers that is trendy to have but for the life of me i can’t figure out why. To skunky for my palate and way overpriced.

Considering that this was one of the most expensive beers I’ve purchased, I’m more than a little disappointed with the result, and it’s not an exercise I’m ever going to repeat. It’s the worst beer I’ve ever tasted. I realise after a bit of reading up on it, that the clear bottle is most likely the cause of the rather off-putting skunky smell and the corresponding skunky taste. I’ve heard it described both as "skunk beer" and "chihuahua piss" and I’d have to agree with those comments. When I bought it, the salesperson told me to put some lemon juice in it. After trying about a third of the bottle, I was willing to try anything to take away the disgusting taste of the beer. My conclusion: The lemon juice was only a slight help.

By no means the best Mexican lager. That’s like saying a fluke is by no means the best parasite. However, I like the painted bottle concept. Unfortunately, I can’t reuse these stupid clear bottles for homebrewing. Taste of citrus...no wait! That’s the ubiquitous lime. Actually does not taste at all. Maybe that’s a saving grace?
not bad with a lime to flavor it but without the lime it is very bland... It goes great with mexican food, although; so would any kind of beer.

Now that I am a beer snob :)-this beer just isn’t what it was when I was in college.  There is little, if any, flavor.  The beer tasted skunked.  Color was decent-golden yellow and I had it with a lime, but it did not help much.
I don’t think I’ve ever tasted Corona in the States that wasn’t skunked.  If you are in Mexico, it is slightly better beer - cleaner tasting but choose just about any other Mexican beer before Corona
Mexican piss in a bottle.  even worse in a can.  the lime doesnt fit in the can.  Not alot of flavor and favors urine in a clear bottle

Bottle - Pale yellow color with a whitish head.  Usually drunk from the bottle with a lime - this is important as the clear bottle makes the beer skunky and the lime reduces this unpleasant smell and taste.  really not worth it, unless there is nothing else, of course.
Light yellow in color. Clear bottle.  Light and watery. Barely any taste at all here. Not worth the time.

12 oz bottle at Tom’s 30th bday party in New Haven.  Painted clear bottle is something different. Drinkable, forgettable brew.  Might be a better real cold on a hot summer day - but then have a wheat beer, Heineken, or Pilsener.

Bottled from local bodega,Well the beer of choice of lame college girls everywhere..is pale piss yellow, has a bubbly white shortlived head. And tastes of corn,smells bad too. All image no substance and god damn it no friggin limes save that for the jose cuevero. Overpriced trash. next...
Corona is the epitome of what high school kids dream of drinking. It shows the high level of living. In reality Corona isnt all that great in my opinion.

i have heard from a lot of people that corona isnt too great. i was expecting it to taste bad, but i was even more disappointed. it didnt taste like anything at all. i was hoping for it to taste either good or bad, but its just so bland! i think my tap water has more flavour.

No idea on the head, as I drank it out of the bottle - that’s a law, isn’t it? The first was without the customary lime, the second with. Crystal clear appearance, grassy nose. Must be served ice cold - anything less and it’s hard to take. Ultimate "lawn mower lager".

Beer number 3 in my marathon lager evening. This one was bottled and not fully chilled. Unfortunately that let the dull grainy adjunct aroma come to the fore. The flavour was murky and none too clean. Metallic finish. Most of the lagers I tasted in the session were simply innocuous; this one was positively unpleasant. Horrible. The best part was the look on the barmaid’s face when I said I wanted it with a glass and without a slice of lemon although, with the benefit of hindsight, that could only have improved it. Next up was Staropramen.

My wifw hates beer... she likes Corona... why, because it does not taste like beer.  Add a lime and you have a soft drink.  I liked this beer when I was too young to drink beer legally.  Still... it it’s really hot out and this beer is so cold ad to almost be solid.. I will drink it.  It’s not a bad tasting beer... it’s just ath it has hardly any flavor ,aroma, pallate, body, or anything else that makes a good beer good.  Refreshing in the same way as a cold glass of H2O
The loser of my tasting vs the Corona Light.  Although this did have more body, I could taste a corn sweetness and a slightly metalic sticky finish. Not very good at all.
Once again, the number one selling beer in (insert country here) tastes like urine. Had this last night served warm with a lime, it was awful. Unless its ice cold and its blazing hot out dont bother.

Pours yellow with little head.  Aromas of skunk, urine, standard cheap beer.  Flavor is skunked beer, watered down beer, very slight malt.  Not really sure why I even bothered to seriously rate this beer.  I can drink it with lime in the summer, but definitely would prefer the few other better mexican beers.

I swore that I wouldn’t review any crap that I knew to be crap unless a sample was provided gratis, and guess what? Providence provides. I will begin my scrutiny by violating several rules of the sacred canon of Corona consumption: 1: I pour the "beer" from the bottle into a glass, 2: WITHOUT ANY LIME! And so...
appearance: totally transparent, color matching that of a very pale urine sample, head exists, is frothy and white (has anyone, ever, conceived of Corona’s head?). Aroma: stinky, skunky, suggesting nothing beyond the liquid leavings of sick, sad, rabid animals. Foul, rancid, polluted, poisonous.
Now to drink: harsh, sour, cornish, wince-inducing, not-the-least-bit-good. Possesses none, absolutely not a one of the qualities we would want to find in ANY beer...body, character, finish (oh, no!), hops, malt, texture, flavor, ad infinitum...but wait, I didn’t give it the benefit of the doubt, employing the preferred method, inclusion of lime...why, I have some wedges right here!
Mmmmm!!!! Limey! Yep, you can really taste the lime, oboy! Boy, I can drink a million of ’em now! Ahhhh! Give me a bucket of Coronas, some limes, the beach, and volleyball, ..and then kill me...
This is the best selling imported beer in America. Have mercy on us all.
(I wish there were negative points available. One star seems too charitable.)

Ah, the four-door sedan of Mexican beers. Pours a medium yellow, smells a bit on the skunky side. Similar to most U.S. domestics in its watered down, faintly malty taste. Better with lime, but best if skipped altogether. One would be better off with Negra Modelo ... or even Dos Equis Amber.
Famous pale stinky concoction with cult status among "tough" mama’s boys. Almost undrinkable (whether with lime or not).

I’ve got lotsa friends who drink this religiously.  I don’t get it.  I first tried it back in 1987 in Denver.  I couldn’t get it in NJ at the time.  I was so excited due to it being a new taste experience.  To this day that moment stands as one of my lifes  biggest disappointments .  I would’ve been better served to put my nose up someone’s buttocks rather than the opening of that bottle.  I smelled another last week.  If nothing else, Cerveceria Modelo’s quality control is the image of consistency.  The aroma still stinks.  The flavor is nothing special, at least it doesn’t taste completely like a fart.  Filtering this stuff through a lime helps a bit, but what’s the point?  If nothing else it’s a below average lager.
i like the taste of corona. with or without lime its pretty good.it got a different flavor than other beers.
Bottled at Benningans for Cinco de Mayo. Didn’t have the lime. Don’t know if that was a mistake or not. Most likely would have gotten rid of the slight skunky taste and smell.
Well, it’s a lager, not much more than that.  O.K. for a change of pace, meaning other choices not available, put a lime in it and drink a few with your buddies on a hot day.

This is pretty shitty stuff. Pours a piss golden with a white head. Taste is a very boring macro lager taste, probably brewed with rice and corn. Drink only if free at an office party. Not recommended.

Hello marketed garbage.  Add a lime or lemon so you wont have to taste this horrid beer!  
One of the worst tasting beers I have ever had.  At least light beers have no flavor.  
This definitely qualifies as one of the worst overpriced beers in history.

This 8.99 beer costs 14.99 - 16.99 a 12 pack on Long Island.  Why?  Why?  I first drank this in 1986 in southern Texas (where it cost $3.50 in a club) and in Mexico (where it cost $6 a case).  I thought the bottle was cool, at age 20.  At age 21 I developed some taste. This is a non-offensive beer; maybe the ladies like it because it goes down OK.  No character - Total rip off.

Bottle:  Aroma is almost not existent.  What aroma exists, is a little hoppy.  Appearance is a clear, dull yellow.  Small head that dies almost instantly.  Not a whole lot of flavor, but a little bitter.  Short lasting slightly bitter aftertaste.  This really isn’t much of a beer, but for some reason I do enjoy drinking them on occasion.  Much more than my rating indicates.  I guess you can call it my guilty pleasure of beer drinking.  Maybe I’ve just built a tolerance for it since it’s what I prefer over Bud and Bud Light when I’m at bar that has a very ordinary selection of beer.

It tastes like Corona because it is. If you’re looking for a description here I would have to say that you just have to brave it and try it yourself. If you like it you might be able to find counseling. If you want to find what "skunkiness" is just leave one in the light for a month. If you can drink it go buy a book on masochism.
It is what it is...thin, mostly uninteresting beer. But for summertime drinking, it will do.
One of my favorites. Great Mexican beer. Very smooth, refreshing taste. Great on the beach.

Ahh, Cinqo de Mayo. Even if it is a kinda of a pretend holiday (at least here in the States), any excuse for a beer, right? This one looks, smells, and tastes exactly like the lime the bartendress stuck in it.
Really only drinkable on a hot day with a slice of lemon or lime, when a beer of more substance may not be the more refreshing choice.

Highly carbonated yellow beer with thin white head. Weak hoppy aroma with hints of rice. Taste is not unpleasant because it tastes almost nothing. Palate is unexistent. Adding a lime is the only way to make it taste something. It’s hard to believe that a large number of people considers that drinking a Corona is a mark of sophistication. To me, it just shows how these people are ignorant beer drinkers...

Never liked this beer. Why the youger crowd think it is "hip" to drink I will never know.Watered down, pour it in a glass and it is flat city. The profit must be huge in terms of its price and cost to brew.

Any beer I need to put a lime in it to make the taste good, I will pass on! This beer is watered down and has no flavor. I give points to Corona for being great marketers for such a crappy beer however. This beer goes down smooth however.

First off, the $7.99 price tag would lead you to believe its a decent beer....wrong. It is watery as hell, always smells skunked no matter how "fresh" it is, and the only thing a lime does is disguise the aweful flavor.
I love how people consider this a premium beer and pay out the rear-end for it.  Its thin wattery and tasteless.  Its the Mexican Budweiser.

I hear so much about this beer from college students after they come back from spring break. All the press i decided i could at least try it. It is an attractive beer, that is about it, light and almost may i say, dirty aroma. Little taste too, tasted like rice and pennies. Fresh on a dry mouth, but so is water. I guess any beer you have to add fruit too make it drinkable is not really worth it.
Smooth, tasty and not too filling, a good beer.  Better with a lime, excellent with mexican food or seafood.
Does it get any worse that this beer?  I'm not sure but this stuff sure was awful, and it even had a lime in it.
EEEK...How can this be called beer.? Maybe I'm just a spoiled over opinionated  Canadian but this isn't my cup of tea....(nor beer).

On a hot summer day, it's like lemonade. Probably the most thirst quenching beer  made. I think if you drank this in place of water it would keep you hydrated. Drink it with a lemon instead of a lime -- seriously!
cerveza suave, rubio claro a la q se puede añadir limon o tequila para mejorar el sabor

Generally it looks like urine, smells like urine, and if you're an asshole it tastes like urine too.  I, however am not an asshole and I enjoy the taste of the cooling yellow liquid immensely.  By immensely I mean a lot more than I should.  If you don't agree with me well too bad, that's life isn't it.  Bitch.
This is just straight up nasty shit.  If you have to add a lime or lemon or whatever to your beer, set it down, go to the store, and get something else.  This is worse than the beast.
Did someone step on a skunk or did a Heineken fart.  Damn this beer stinks.  And you shouldn't have to add shit to a beer to make it taste better.

I am not impressed with this beer.  It pours really nicely and looks quite nice in the glass and is quite impressive in the bottle.  The batch I had had a bit of a skunky quality to it and was overall very bland.  Not bad in the clubhouse at the turn on a hot day though.
How the 29th best beer in Mexico became so popular is an enduring mystery.  Great when you're on the beach, but which beer isn't.  Little taste, decent carbonation, completely forgettable.
Great on a hot day in Phoenix while sitting in the shade trying to stay cool. Also great when playing craps in Las Vegas. Fine with or with out the lime, just keep and drink them ice cold.
Decent yellow color, with some hop/citrus aroma.  The only beer I add lime to when I drink it (which really isn't a good thing).  This one is OK on a 95 degree summer day.
A fairly crappy and tasteless beer. But, I still find myself enjoying one of these from time to time with a lime. There is no way I would ever get one of these if there wasnt a lime.

These Mexican lagers have their own flavor that I can't really place. They seem bland by themselves, but are quite good with mexican food. Corona is one of the best that I've had. Pushing a lime into the bottle helps.

Pretty inoffensive stuff, just watery and thin; no real head; passing hint of flavor (yeast?  corn?).  Everything changes when you stick a lime in it, but why bother?  A six-pack of beer that's not only drinkable but also outright *good*, such as Sam Adams Boston Lager, costs the same or less.  And you don't have to spend an additional $0.25 on a citrus fruit that shouldn't be necessary in the first place.

Golden color, little head. Very crisp, almost "airy" feel. Extremely watery. Flavor is very slightly "skunky" and is dominated by light, yeasty notes. Fantastic with a lime; refreshing if not phenomenal.

This beer has successfully marketed itself as the quintessential summer-time beer and what it lacks in taste, it tries to make up for in refreshment.  It almost seems like a cross between a regular and light beer.  fine now and again, but hardly a beer anyone could sit down and enjoy time after time.

Why the heck is this beer so popular?  A good beer does not require a full lime!  Ok, so I have to rate it.  It barely has an aroma, yet looks like it should.  It gives me the bitter beer face.  Preserve your dignity and don't drink this when visiting Mexico.
Doesn't taste like much of anything fizzy and boring.  I guess thats why its served with lime?

Pours pale yellow with no head, just an everlasting bubbly fizz.  The aroma is mild, but pleasant ...oh wait that was the lime!  Everything about this beer is "underdone", but that can be refreshing at the right times.  There is nothing bad about the aroma, flavor, or mouthfeel, just nothing exciting either.

This beer is an enigma. It stinks, it looks like piss, it is soft on the palate, but I like it! Don't ask me why. When served very cold, it goes well with spicy foods. If I am in the mood for a non-intimidating simple beer, this is what I go for.

Pours a piss-like color with a very flat smell. Flavor? There isn't any. It tastes like there are hints of canola oil. Lime wedge brings it from a "D" to a "C-". Only decent on a hot day. One of the great mysteries in life: Why does this Beer cost so much? It's from MEXICO, not GERMANY!

bottled:  searching through the rates. trying to find some swill i havent rated....oh, corona!! i use this term daily but it aint when im ordering beer, when someone want/needs a crown of course.  this is the worst of the mexican beers but the most popular. the worst part its sold as a premium import increasing the price. if you drink too many of these you build a tart nasty taste on your palate that wont go away.  the lime just tries to hide the bad flavor. stay away unless your in mexico and drink dos equis or tecate instead of 'these crapola!'

(Bottled, 4.5% ABV, BBE 09/2004) Pale lager color, no head to speak of. Pretty strong, corny, hoppy and grassy aroma with some skunkiness. Very lightly malty, corny flavor with bitter finish. Light, quite bitter palate. Good with spiced food or in hot weather. Quite harshly bitter and watery lager.

I do not like this beer. This beer is not representative of other fine Mexican brews.  Much too light in all respects.  Oily taste, and no I don't think a lime wedge enhances the taste of this beer, I don't know the reason behind this accoutrement.

This was my first time drinking this.

Pours fizzy yellow w/ soapy white foam (that I won't call head it disappeared so fast) that dissipates quickly.
