The smell is flat, empty and unappealing.
Started out with slight sweet flavors but is quickly o'ertaken by adjuncty notes that dominate. The mouthfeel is thin and unworthy. 

I didn't enjoy this one at all. It is one of those beers that makes you say "Hey Barkeep, somebody pissed in my water!" 
On a positive note: the bottle was not skunked, as I've been warned about.
I used to love this beer, but for some reason I am no longer in a relationship with my Corona.....because I realized it tasted like sh*t.
Anyone who describes  this as even remotely delicious, is proof that we evolved from monkeys. Surprisingly enough, monkeys also love limes.
A rather plain, watered down beer that does little to catch ones attention.

Too pale golden color, nice white head that diminished rather quickly.  Lacing in very small, well scattered "spots".  Light hops, sweet, american standard skunk odor, all odors rather minimal.  Sweet, some kind of semi-fruit hops(!!!?), almost no skunk flavor and an aftertaste reminiscent of...something I can't quite place a finger on, yet is familiar.  Apple.  Like apple skin from a Granny Smith and has the bitter of a crab apple, but so light it's almost not there.  Foamy mouthfeel, very light body, less watery than most light beers and dry mouthfeel.  Sadly, a very good American Standard with the light, minimal flavor, foamy, watery body.  I don't hate drinking it.

This is a watered-down Mexican beer.  That's really all there is to it.  Maybe it would be better with a lime, but beer should be appreciated like a fine tea.  If you have to add sugar or lemon, then why are you drinking it in the first place?  If you want a good beer or even just a good Mexican beer, there are plenty of good choices.  Mexican?  Pacifico Clara.  Just don't force yourself into thinking this is the best it gets...
And so the great debate continues, to add a lime or not. One thing is for sure, you don’t want to pour this stuff into a glass.
When my friends are drinkin the fine stuff it's always Corona.  [Sob]  I just drown my sorrows in my $9 six pack.  Which happens to be AS MUCH AS A CORONA SIX PACK!!  Ahhhh!

Bottle (Uxmal, Mexico 19.2.04)
Yellow. Small vanishing white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Watery and tasteless.

Bottle sample- A skunky smelling beer that tastes like canadian, export, etc. It's a piss yellow. That is kinda scary to me. Tastes ok with lime, but nothing to go crazy over. A little better than your average "big boy" beer.
A somewhat decent beer, but only with the addition of lime. The beer alone was somewhat watery and unpleasant.
piss yellow color...weak aroma with a skunky smell, carbonated and slightly malty with that familiar skunky taste and quite waterd down...good for a cheap summer lawn mowing beer
This is budweiser in a mexican bottle, watered down.  I'm going to Mexico for Spring Break and I'm not looking forward to getting freshly skunked Coronas.
This beer was smooth, but had almost no flavor. I know why they say to serve it with a lime!
Squeeze a lime and this beer screams excitement.  With the lime the beer exudes a crisp texture and sharp finsh that must be appreciate on a special level.
This beer has little to offer in terms of taste and quality. Must have lime just for taste.

My #1 Beach Beer. Totally undrinkable without a lime squeeze and a couple shakes of salt (the 6 for flavor includes these two adjuncts - otherwise it would be a 1). Toss in the fruit and the sodium, though, and you've got a refreshing bev for a summer day on the beach. Otherwise it's a novelty at best. Unless you're slathered in tanning oil, have your toes buried in the sand, and smelling the salt air as you watch the waves roll in, don't bother with this.
Water water and more water.  That's all of the taste this has.  Anything where you must add a lime to get any taste is not my style.
Once you get past the skunk aroma, you get a slightly skunky and watery flavor. Slap a salted lime wedge in there, and it's a decently refreshing summer beer.

Thin, but refreshing. Mostly malt with a hint of weak hops. If this beer cost as much as a domestic, it would be a good lawnmower brew. Really a light beer. Overpriced. Easy to drink several. use lime
No better than light BMC products. Tastes like carbonated water. Nothing ineresting here, just swill.

I honestly don't understand why someone would pay extra for a beer that's no different than the average domestic swill.Really pale, watery yellow with minimal head,minimal flavor,minimal aroma and everything else.If you want an American Standard, save yourself the extra cash and buy a domestic. And why do they insist on packaging in clear bottles?

Apparently some people put lemon in it. Either way, a refreshing beer that's a little too easy to drink.
Spanner.
It is an okay beer if you want to chug a few back, however, it is not my favortie sip and enjoy brew.

A couple of my friends used to live to drink Corona... WHY? Though it’s not bad with a lime (yes it is, who am I kidding?), you shouldn’t need to add anything to a beer for it to taste good. The smell is awful, very skunky... and sometimes the taste matches the smell. Nothing impressive about this beer.

The best thing going for Corona is it's a pretty beer to look at and you don't have to open it or drink it to get the benefit of looking at it with the nice clear bottle.  A real good beer if you like this style I guess, but I'll have a skunked Heineken over this Mexican pipi de caballo any day.
I tend to disagree with most on this one. I like it, lime or no lime. Better flavor than B/M/C products.
Is it a beer???? It taste like, like... like wellow carbonated water! It's just a good blonde to take if your soo drunk and want a little "break"...
Not much to this one at all. Weak head, pale yellow colour, not much flavor. Requires lime to hide the skunk.

Not following the consensus here. I like this beer. it has a skunky aroma, likely because of the clear bottle. But for such a yellow beer, it has surprisingly bold flavor. Lach of head is surely disappointing, but is more than made up for in smoothness. To me, a summer classic. Sue me.
Well if you need to add fruit to a beer, it sucks. much like the water in mexico, it wil give you.....
A very skunky beer that doesn't sit well in the palate. however, if spiced up with a lemon it becomes tolerable. But if you need a lemon in your beer........you need a new beer.
Corona is obviously the best marketed beer in the world, it's the quality of bud at twice the price. With lime and only with lime on a beach in mexico it's better than drinking the water.

This is fizzy, watery, and not good.  It has very little head, straw yellow color, and no complexity.  I get it with the lime on a warm day, and it’s the lime that makes this different and it distinguishable from other beers (I won’t say "good", however).  But this isn’t ratelime.com is it?
hard to believe i know so many people that serve this stuff.  you know it's bad if it takes a lime to choke it down.  stay away from this beer!

I wish I could give this beer an even lower rating..this stuff is the favorite beer of almost every beer drinker I know, and I just don't get it. Horrible stuff. No taste, no head, boring color, no smell...no distinguishing features whatsoever. If it didn't come in a beer bottle, I wouldn't even know it was beer. I guess that's why people like it...it's almost indistinguishable from water. I think it's safe to say that this beer sucks.

A pale straw shade, with no detectable smell except for a slight malty sweetness.  Possibly corn?  Little to no head, and almost no carbonation.  Slightly bitter acidic taste, that's not very clean.  Actually, it has a very attractive color, but past that point, it's reminds me of bad tap water.
Drinkable on a hot day or when there's nothing else and you need a drink. Otherwise why bother....
Ony drink with lime.  Weaker of the Mexican imports.  Pale yellow with little aroma.  Similar to Miller or Miller Lite.

[bottle] Not much of an aroma to this one. Really pale yellow and has good carbonation. It has a rather bland yet somehow bitter flavor to it and is very watery. I can really only drink this one at the beach. For some reason it makes it taste better. Then you have to factor in the lime. Why does a beer need a lime to taste better?

In a clear bottle, so that is a sure sign it will be of average quality.
Just a bland beer, and as with most of these types of beers, too sweet. Any beer that needs lime in the neck is a major worry.

Better than anything the gringos have to offer. Much better flavor than Old Milwuakee, Miller or Budweiser for sure. The only weak point of this beer is it low Alc %. You will need many of this tiny bottles to get really drunk!
Adequate quality- not a long-term beverage.  A refreshing taste on a hot day when no other beer is available.  Bitter and flat.
Although not a high-achiever, it has high drinkability. Appearance quite beautiful, yet very reminiscent of water. Right out of the tap.
I cannot give this beer high ratings for aroma/appearance/flavor/palate.  Still, add sliced limes and a party, and my overall impression is favorable.
Water.  Just water.  Ever so slight tart, I guess the only taste you could say it has is "carbonation".
If you have to drink this beer, make sure you have a lime available, it's the only way it's tolerable.
Any beer you NEED to put a lime into before you drink it isn't going to be good. No exception here. The beer of choice for many a high-school student. Bleah.
A Miller lite in a bottle with Mexican writing all over it.  Some hints of skunk.
Even nasty when not skunky. A lime makes it drinkable. Offensive in every way. Nasty adjunct and urine aroma, worse flavor. Harsh palate. Rancid.

This one needs to be drink on the beach during hot summer days. I see no other purpose or reason to drink this. Also, ensure it is fresh because the skunky taste will overpower everything else about this beer.

Awful, I can't see how people can drink this stuff. The place I went to yesterday had absolutely nothing good available so I decided to give this a try, it's considered by them to be "Premium" though I imagine in that context it just means imported.

It looks like urine in it's clear glass bottle. Has no distinguishing flavour. Serving it with a lime doesn't make it taste any better. Extremely light. Hopefully I don't have to drink this beer again.
overated, drink ice cold preferably with a slice of lime, corona make great beers but this most common of them is absolute rubbish.
This is a good Mexican beer, with a great taste and overall its a good beer with a decent flavor especially with a little lime.
Overpriced mexican swill! How can people pay $60 a carton for this? Pale golden colour,musty aroma and a metallic taste.

I said when I rated Sol that I can't tell the difference between it and this.  However I have a feeling that Corona is not quite as sweet - maybe it's 1% more salty, although at the end of the day, it makes no odds.  This is OK too.
My favorite beer.  Goes down smooth with a great taste / even better with a lime. Good Aroma, not too overpowering.

Coronita Extra bought in Mexico!!
Pours a fast disappearing head on a pale yellow beer. Sweet corny and brewing mashy aroma. Thin malty flavor with a weak tone of citrus. Man, this uninteresting!
The only good thing about this beer is the appearance. The beer has no flavour and is not worth drinking unless you're trying to impress someone, and in that case, don't forget the lime. Cheers!

Wow this was a disappointment.  Had an all too familiar litterbox aroma (is that why they use a lime)?  Undrinkable the only beer i ever dumped down the drain.  Maybe a bad bottle but I won't pass this way again.   I'll stick with Carta Blanca for a Mexican brew.
This beer has a wonderful taste, even better with a lime.  However for the price you pay, i consider it a ripoff.  Better off buying two cases of miller high life or coors
Bottle: good for chugging with lime of course on a hot summer day. (If your from AZ you can truly appreciate what I'm saying). "hey lets get drunk at the lake beer"

Is this beer?  I guess it is.  For some reason, I drink this whenever I have a head cold.  Perhaps its because I equate the Vitamin C in the Lime with getting better.  Other than that, I try to avoid at all costs.  I think its the color of pee the day after a lot of tequila is consumed!

This beer possesses very little of anything, besides a high price and average alcohol level.  The little aroma that is there is almost sour, average appearance, and the flavor is truly light. I can't imagine their light beer. Not one that I would add to the grocery list.

This one competes closely with Pacifico for the best beer in Mexico. And, that ain't saying much. If there's better beers I've yet to find them.   I now understand why it's important to add a lime to most of these brews. There isn't much flavor to speek of, maybe some malt and a lot of carbonation.  I also find it hard to believe these guys make a Corona Light.  How much lighter can they get?  The aroma is skunkish if any at all.  A Corona can be enjoyable on a hot summer afternoon, but would certainly choose another brand if given a choice.
I had this out of the bottle with a lime, expecting a spectacular brew. I realized after tasting this bitter stuff that it is popular because it is trendy, not tasty.
Gimme a 12 pack and a couple of limes and i'd be happy. This stuff tatse like shit without a lime, but with it it's very drinkable. My favorite bitch beer. Not as strong as im used to though.
Grassy and mild skunk aroma with a clear yellow color and medium white head.  Mild carbonation and little flavor.  Somewhat dry finish and thin across the palate.

Surprisingly, I don't think this beer is great with food. However, it is really great with lime, good with lemon, and swill if drunk without salt or citrus fruits. It has been compared to piss water due to lower carbonation. Still, I gave it a favorable rating simply because I only drink it with lime. It is a bit expensive: around $7-8USD (c'mon, this stuff is made in Mexico not Germany for fck's sake). I first started drinking this when I was in Panama while stationed there. I still buy it about 2-3 times a year. Overall, not a great beer but does go down nice on a very hot Florida day at the beach.
Not much to this beer.  Smells of alcohol and malt.  Pale yellow color with a dry taste.  Somewhat bitter on the end.
Sooo Drinkable when it is super hot.  Although lacking in flavour this beer is definitely a session beer.  Other than Negra Modela what cha drinkin' at mexican restaraunts.

This beer is lacking in substance.  It lacks flavor and unless a lime is a necessary plus for it to be great.  Expensive too for its weak flavor.  Though as I bash its lack of flavor, I can't deny it is highly drinkable (again with a lime). Though it is a standard mexican beer, it is weak compared to the rest.
other than the feeling that a skunk just pissed in my mouth its not too shabby, however i like its light brother better
This is the ultimate wine cooler. This beer is for women that can't stand the taste of beer and very femanine men.
I guess I don't get it. Smells horrid. Looks good. Tastes evil. Advertising does wonders, I guess.
Pale gold with small white head. Fairly crisp with mild floral hops finish. Hints of citrus, but that probably came from the lime wedged at the top of the bottle.

Ok the time has come to take on this "awsome" brew, I had put it off for a long time, much longer than I had earlier avoided Budweiser.
I did not take this with lime..a beer should stand on its own merits.
The appearance sad to say is no better poured into a glass than it is in the bottle..looks like urine after a good nights partying...small pure white head dissapeared in nano-seconds..leaving a rather unattractive wisp effect ( al la urine) on top.
An absolutlly appauling aroma sensation..rotting grass etc
Taste is ..nada nothing..just a horrid astringency at the back of the tongue that lasts 2 secs then nothing again
Not impressed by the mouth feel..like water and not good bottled water.
I suppose in some weird parallel universe I might find this hogwash drinkable. I really had every intention of bucking the trend and giving this a good review..but its just terrible. 
Odd how so many fall for marketing over substance.
This beer is alright, but I felt messed up after I drank it.  (That may be because of the 4 bottles of killian's I had before that.)  The only way to drink it is with lime.
Another typical tasteless mexican-type beer. It is supposed to go well with mexican food...but any good beer (lager, pale ale) can do the job as well. Forget about this one.
Obviously the lime covers up the flavor. Too much carbonation and has a bitter taste. There are a lot of better Mexican made lagers out there.

Corona has a vegetal, skunky flavor and smells of it too.  The beer is crisp and sharp, so when served cold with a slice of lemon or lime, it's passable.  A mi no me gusta nada.  Esta cerveza no tiene cuerpo y no es muy sabroso.
I had one last week when we went out to eat Mexican food.  Tastes halfway decent if you put like 3 lemons in it... what wouldn't though?  Yuck.
No wonder you have to add lemon and salt, it has no personality. Only good for Micheladas.
One of my first beers i actually liked. Now this has nothing but slight flavor. Best with lime slices inside, but just too much time, i just wanna start pounding it.
Any beer that must be served with a lime can't be good.  Piss yellow with no head and little flavor.  Only good to cool off after eating too much hot sauce at a Mexican restaurant.

Im gonna have to agree with the majority here, maybe its all mental but on a sunny day a corona tastes good at the beach (with the lime, and proper technique to mix lime and beer)  but if you step back and take that lime out you'll realize.  The beer is water.  taste is hardly even there.  there is no head, and its wayyyyy overpriced.

I like it with the lime but not without.  The lime gives it some flavor that it would otherwise be lacking.  Pretty plain tasting, its looks are decieving.  Extremely overpriced too.  Nice and refreshing for when you are at the beach but any other time I would stay clear and save your money.

When I was in my teenage years (1980s) this stuff was way cool to drink. It meant you had a bit of cash and the lemon sticking out of the longneck bottle was a novelty. thankfully in my early 30s I know better. This stuff is as plain as you can get and the price tag is outrageous.

i was actually scared of this beer for a long time.  for some reason, i thought it would be hard core.  i was mistaken.   tastes a little better than your average macrobrew but it's not worth the outrageous amount of money they want for it.  straight out of the bottle, pissy yellow.  had it with the lime, still not impressed

Its amazing how many people think they are high class beer drinkers because they order this. I suppose at one time I was the same.Tastes better then a US macro at a Mexican resturant,that's the best I can say for it
I could read a paper through this beer.  Any beer that you need to add lime to is not a beer for me.  I only have it if the two options are Corona or Bud at a summer barbeque
A really good beer when fresh lime is added.  Without lime its just a standard lager without a great deal of flavour but with it it kicks some serious flavour.
very bitter taste nothing much else to say but the bottle has a cool design

Bottled. Well, served at a bar so it may have been kept in a carton and not light-struck, since it's not as sucky as I'd expect. It is just a little bit maltier than most American megabrews. So I'll at least rate it a little above the average swill. As you might guess, the was the most exotic “import” the bar had.
Bright golden color, glad I had a lime floating on top.  The subtle lime flavor really makes this drinkable.  Much better on a hot day, but this will start me off at a good friend's wedding as well.
This Mexican beer tastes like the water, gross and if you drink to much of it expect to be sick. But on the other side the bottle sure looks cool
Skunky yellow water, you truly need the lime to cover the nasty aroma.  Not good at all!!
might as well sacrifice the piss taste it has and stick a slice of lime in it

Without a doubt an overated beer.  It lacks taste.  There is no body at all, a very pale yellow colour.  If you serve it to me give it to me icy cold with a slice of lime at stumps from a long session of beach cricket. cheers

Aroma: Not present. Appearance: Clean, light colour. Insufficient head. Flavour: Where?
Palate: Very thin and weak.
May be good to wash down a spicy mexican dish but at $6.50 over the bar not worth it.
I agree with most comments made about this beer. Very over-rated. Overpriced.
It's a skunky tasting beer with almost no aroma. Big money spent on advertisement and not refinement.
Without a lime this beer stinks.  With a lime this beer stinks.  Fill your glass with water and you'll never know the diffrence.  Why do people dig this stuff?

A Monty Python beer (ever seen the skit "American beer is like sex in a canoe, fucking near water?"? Unimpressive color and almost non-existant flavor.  Head was as weak as a ten year old cancer patient.  Did I mention it had no flavor?  It smelled faintly of corn and rice, like many other chem-fermented mass produced brews, and earns points for consistincy, but its a consistantly bland beer.  Did I mention that it lacks any real flavor?

This beer, and I hesitate to call it that, is down right terrible.  Its like carbonbated water with yellow food coloring added.  Smells like a sewer.  There is a valid reason for putting a lime in it.  You probably couldn't swallow the stuff without it!

Well, it is thin, watery, decapitated (headless) and reminiscent of frat-boy urine after partying all night at Senor Frog's, but it is refreshing and downright hoppy compared to crap like a Marca Bavaria. With a twist of lime, it goes well with fajitas, etc. You can't get drunk off it, but chicks seem to dig it, so you really can't win.

Bubbly, light, lacking in flavor, except when you add the lime. Although it isn't a great beer I find myself drinking through a case or two during the summer. Great to sit outside on the beach with a corona in your hand.

decent yellow fizzy water.. with lime and a pinch of salt, very drinkable. rated below MGD, and above Coors original. without the lime/salt though.. the adjuncts come through and the poor mexican water quality leaves you wishing for montezuma's revenge.

i have to admit i like this on a hot day witha slice of lime there is a lot of good about this beer, very refreshing, highly drinkable and a certain smething about the taste that makes it a big step up form bud in my humble opinion!

Bottle. Little to no aroma, slight smell and flavour of corn/skunk.  Hints at bitterness enough to make me want a better beer. 1 Bonus overall point for being a free cold beverage after my white water rafting trip.

Corona and with a squeze of lime is a Tex-Mex staple. Not much flavor: less after taste than a normal mass produced brew but less head and flavor as well. A must if you live in Texas. Then again, I'm biased towards the southern tastes.

Give my a lime and some tasty Jimmy Buffett tunes and I'll be all right beer. Goes well with Mex-Tex spicy foods, cuts through and cleans palate. A frat boy beer, cheap easy "Get Drunk and Screw" brew. But too bland to be "Chesseburgers in Paradise", very watery and fizzy. "Come Monday" you will NOT still feel alright because drinking many of this beer will lead to massive hangover, trust me! "Wasted Away Again". I'll stop being so CORNy now.
Pale yellow with a small head. Not much aroma, maybe rice and corn. Watery mouthfeel with no finish to mention.
Fun to drink when you are in Mexico.  This cerveza es muy malo.  However, I will drink it with a lime and with some of my mexican friends

The lime does make it better, but over all it's just alcoholic water.  Central American beers are made to replace the often undrinkable water, so it's understandable that most taste like watered down light beers. The 4 for flavor is with a lime.

Well back in Highschool I loved to get this because the chicks loved the lime.It made for a great party. Then I realised, this is tasteless!!!! If it was not for the lime there would be no flavor at all...forget this and get a Tecate.

From bottle, skunky aroma. Bland in taste, not much to go on here. Much better with a lime or squirt of lemon. Easy to guzzle once you get past the smell, but not as flavorful as other common Mexican beers like Pacifico or Bohemia.
I will only drink it with a lime, or there would be no taste. It does quench my thirst, but then again, so does water.
When abroad I usually drink Mineralnaja Vada during daytime and beer in the evenings. This was one exception. But I was thirsty. Corona is a watery beer, like Mineral Water with gas.
Did I order a Perrier? The bottle says it's a beer, but I can't tell from aroma or flavour.

I had this beer wonce when I was desprate for a beer (because I was at a baby-naming).  Seriously, it's so butt avrage that I was like, "yo dude - this is so butt avrage."  If you wanna a real beer you're gonna go down to the store right now and snag a 6pack of mikelob dry.  Seriosly, drink the first 2 befor you even leave the store!  My friend Area does that all the time and he hides the bottles if the ownar isn't looking.  That's not realy cool but I love the guy.  One time Area took a bullet for me.  He wasn't shot or anything .. he just took it from a gun shop when the ownar wasn't looking. And then he gave it to me later that day.  
I'm so pissed, my girlfriend shaved her mullet.  "Mik dry" rulez!!
Why oh why do people insisit on bringing this over to my house for parties and leaving it in my fridge? An atrocity.
This one begs for a lime to make it palatable. Nowhere near my top 10. Dos Equis much much better Mexican beer.
Urine colored, but surprisingly tastes only slightly better.  Needs the lime, but that makes it a non-beer in my book.  Not the best beer from mexico and definitely not the best in the world.
Refreshing, but not much of a beer. Too simple and it passes your throat without leaving very many memories.
Keep it in the bottle, and you GOT to have the lime. Otherwise, this is lousy stuff. Really though, it can be quite refreshing, but so is ice water!

Pale yellow and fizzy when poured. No malt or hop presence to be found anywhere. Faint skunky bitterness. Very watery. The lime helps because lime juice tastes much better than Corona. My only fond memory of this beer is when my friend inverted his bottle to sink the lime at a bar and upon releasing his thumb, a tight trajectory of beer launched out and shot some woman in the face.
Mass marketed urine is all i hafta say, worst tasting beer on the market, would only pay for it if the girls from the commercials came with it
This is slightly better than a regular american domestic.  I don't understand why people will pay a premium price for it.
Marketing, marketing, marketing!!!  Smells like piss.  Probably tastes worse.  I don't get the appeal.

Sunny limpid yellow color. Not much aroma beside corn. Extremely light taste in a watery texture, I was surprised to hear there exists a light version. Lack of body, but i'd accept one for its refreshing characteristics after an intense basketball game.

I tried it with and without lime. With and without salt. And I am sorry to report that even WITH lime and WITH salt it still did not have any 'good' taste. It just seems like aromated water. Not a good drink.
A fine drink if you are lying around in a tropical paradise filled with magestic sunsets and gorgeous women. Outside of this setting, however, this drink can get ugly. Use a lime at least.

Very poor example of a rather vapid style.  To say this beer has no aroma would be a compliment.  This beer has negative aroma characteristics.  I smell wet hay and maybe a saddle too.  The appearance is yellow and very fizzy.  The flavor is not much better than the aroma, tiny bit of hops.  At least with a lime in the bottle you get the fresh taste of a lime.  Yuck!
little bit waterly, but nice on a hot day served very cold, very refreshing.

Corona, its light, easy and smooth, strong corn flaivor, lingering on and on after a few, not bad if you buy it cheap for home use, I would never bust a bank for it at trendy clubs or at a restaurant where you will get a better beer (do it in the summer outside your house)

I had Corona years ago and was struck by the skunky taste.  Had another recently at a friend’s place (only beer there) and was pleasantly surprised.  Some lager character, light hops, corn taste (from adjunct, not DMS) - a decent beer.
Water-like beer. Drink it only if someone threatens you with a shotgun and you really want to live. Be SURE that you want to live before trying this shit.
A good alternative to water if you are stuck in Mexico. Otherwise, forget it. I usually eat my burritos with Negra Modelo on the side.

This beer is only popular because of its marketing campaign.  I'm surprised its slightly more expensive counterpart (Sol) has not caught on.  You have to wonder about a beer that needs a lime to compliment it.  Yuppies, enjoy.  Beer lovers, stick with Tecate or DE if you want Mexican.
I know true beer aficianados put this beer down, but with spicy foods and the hot summer days I find it hard to beat. Not a world class beer by any means, but very refreshing.

An incredibly boring and skunky beer. If you could imagine water with yellow food coloring that smelled like corn and a drop of hops, you'd have corona pegged. Theres nothing here to taste or to write about. Garbage.

Everyone's had a Corona.  Does in fact taste better with a lime in it.  This is definitely one of those beers that you can put back rather quickly if your not careful.  Not much flavor except for the lime you throw in it.
Bottle.  Served in a bottle with a slice of lime in it. Cold but tasteless . I enjoyed the slice of lime more, didn`t finish the beer. Trendy and shallow
Simple pale yellow, carbonated but not much head.  Simple and light.  Not nearly as bad in my opinion as so many reviews.
Bottle looks cool, but that is nearly all. If you want to drink mexican beer, buy desperados!
Looks like piss, taste like...well, lime if you stuff one in the neck. Rates right down there with BMC. Drinkable if really cold.

Corona Extra what? Clear bottle? Stick a lime in it? Is it even a beer? Its ok, worth trying I guess, but definitely not worth the hype or the price. Not a teriible brew, but its not a good beer either. (In fact I argue against the practice of referring to Corona as beer)

This is no amazing beer, however it is not without its charm. The water taste is complimented quite nicely by a twist of lime and it goes down easily with most fatty fried meals. skunky nose and over all a typical american creation
Yep, skunky, watery has nothing on American mass produced beers. Needs a lime and salt added to make it worth it.
I think it's kind of refreshing on a really hot day.  A bit skunky, but easy to drink.  It's no masterpiece, but I've had worse.

Not good, not bad; I'll still take one of these over a Budweiser any day. Watery and a little bit sweet. Crisp and clean. Neat color but looks almost artifically gold. Don't listen to anything anybody tells you about the water in here.

I always get the urge to drink a vew of these every now and again.  I drink em straiht out of the bottle because I like the way it comes out.  A fashion, showy beer for when everyone is drinking macros.  I buy the 24oz ones at the gas station once in a while.
Slightly skunked, thin, watery. Somewhat sweet with a slight dry hop finish. For chugging on a hot day (like water).

The aroma is a bit skunky, and slightly sweet.  The appearance is a clear gold, maybe a bit watery.  The flavor is sweet, and I swear even though I sampled it without the lime it still tasted like there was a lime in it (must be a conditioned response).  The beer is crisp and easy to drink.  Overall not really that bad, I think I like it better than the American mega brews.
I personally hate this beer and i would rather drink piss (almost).  It tastes horrible and needs a lime to make it drinkible, thats all you really need to know.

well - it's like this: if you add a lemon to this beer it's a little better. it's a summer beer i suppose. kind of like spiked lemonade if you put enough lemons in it, hank. it's nothing spectacular though - that's for certain.

I've had more of this swill then i can remember.Yes i fell into the craze years back,but I'm feeling much better now.I remember the brew being the worst kind of beer imaginable the color was ok the head,well hard to say since you usually leave it in the bottle.aroma was mild and IMO some what skunky,the same goes for the flavor,but by some form of magic,add some lime and it changes into some kind of almost drinkable beer.yes i used to choke this stuff down at one time,and i laugh when i see late comers drink this stuff and say how great it is.How little they know.I believe this brew was solely concocted to boost the pockets of lime producers,and it had it's day.Time for it to say good-bye.
Mexican piss water.  Golden in color and mildly refreshing on a hot day, like today.  Otherwise, nothing to separate it from the ordinary.
A great summer beer. Nothing extraordinary - just refreshing on a hot summer day. I'm a lime guy though - even though it's such a controversy these days among beer purists.
Bottle.  Golden color with a laced white head.  A thin aroma with a touch of malt and flowers.  The flavor is hard to find and it leaves a slight skunk at the finish.

Little skunky aroma. Pale yellow color, white head, few lace. No flavors (didn't add the lime), watery, short finish. Must be refreshing when you're in Mexico with 40' Celsius, but over here in Holland even in the sun it doesn't do it.
If a beer requires a lime to make it palatabl then its not a good sign. When the sun's blazing overhead I'll grab one only if the lime is there as well.

I shall be the 700th rater of Corona.  Let me first qualify my rating by saying that the body in question was plucked from an icy tub, and was complimentary from my hotel, in Dallas.  This was an essay in the evils of the clear bottle.  Here in Dallas, I'm reckoning that the beer was fresher -- and it had none of the skunky quality that Corona has 900 miles to the east in Tallahassee -- just the Mexican-American Standard smell that say, Bohemia has.  It did have a corn quality, but it was like sweetish hominy, rather than Fritos.  The slice of lime definitely makes the difference.  The appearance is rated highly for the painted bottle.  When the label was first marketed in N. Florida ca. 1986, it was proudly emblazoned on tanktops all along Panama City Beach.   Charitable appearance marks for savvy marketing, and for the ladies of my youth who wore those tank tops without brassieres.
Mexican night tonight. I now know why I also don't like this 'cuisine'. Sloppy, messy and unfilling. At least it wasn't skunky.
I really like this beer. It's a little skunky, but it goes down really well. I suggest a lime, definately... better than Budweiser for sure!
NEEDS a lime to make it tolerable. Nothing too exciting about this beer-- a good alternative to Bud Light in a pinch!

After a couple weeks of sampling such gems as Kalamazoo stout and Old Peculier, drinking Corona is really "slumming". Skunky, limey aroma. Crystal clear piss appearance. Lacking in flavour, but drinkable in Cancun on the beach. Include lime to kill taste.
Golden Yellow, gotta have the lime, at least for the first one, but after that let it slide to much citric acid.  Funny, but i liked this beer a lot more when i was in high school.
Clear glass in the burning sun. No real flavour of its own, a little sour and very thin. No hops to speak of. Better get that lime in there quick!

Once upon a time, this was my favorite beer.  Boy, how times have changed and tastes have gotten more sophisticated!  This simply does not have the taste, color or smell of a Class-A beer.  Yes, it tastes better with a lime, but, c'mon, this is beer, folks, not cocktails.  Mexican beer sucks and this is the worst one.  Cave Creek Chili Beer minus the chili pepper.

I'm usually long-winded in my ratings, but everyone has tried this Mexican/beach beer at some point. Served ice cold in a frosted glass with a lemon wedge, this brew is tolerable. With Mexican food, it's serviceable. On its own? Please! I've run over skunks that smell and probably taste better than this brew. Adjuncts and skunks? Not for me, thanks.

Can't understand the cult like following for this brew. I'm sure the obligatory lime wedge is what gives this beer it's character. Not entirely offensive though. Ice cold, it's ok on a hot summer day, with the lime wedge of course...Hysteria

This beer sucks on so many levels.  It has a very unique taste of old, dirty...  well something old & dirty.  The color & packaging trick u into thinking it ia beer, it is not.  Hmm...  which is worse corona or mexican tap water?

If you  put lime in dog food, it means you must like the taste of the lime cause you sure as hell don't care for the dog food. Aroma and appearance are ok while the taste leaves much to be desired. Too many unusual, indescribable flavors. A last resort beer.
Not the worst beer I've tasted but far from the best.  Definitely needs a lime or lemon to disguise that thin pissy taste though.
used to drink this alot.  then i turned 21 and havent bought it since... not a good beer
(bottle) It was free, it was beer-like and I drank it. Not much more to say about it.

Good beer - but only in warmer months.  Taste best in Key West - preferably at Ricks checking out all the hoochies walking by or down at Malorie Square.  If Irish Kevin's is still opened then that is a great place to enjoy a couple dozen of these also.
Bad mexican beer that needs a lime to hide the pissy taste. Has a aftertaste that can't be masked with a lime.

This brew poured a medium head of small to large sized white bubbles that left very little lacing. It has a wheat yellow body with a mild or no aroma. It has an initial bite that lingers slightly into the aftertaste. It has a mild hoppy flavor.
"Only if it´s a Corona" That quote was from The fast and the furious. I dont like this beer(urine) and I will never buy it again.
Bottled. Even on location in Mexico, surfing your nuts off, this beer is not something you look forward to coming home to.
I love this beer.  Ok so it needs a lime, so what, you put salt on popcorn, same difference.
Very carbonated. Horrible appearance. Females who I was with ;-) thought it looked like an alcopop.

I was surprised that my sample wasn't all that skunky because of the clear bottle and all. Two words: adjunct beer. This beer reeks and tastes of corn and adjuncts. Kind of dirty smelling and tasting as well. Lime does mask these qualities and any others that this cerveza might have.

WTF is this add a lime crap?.....
I could add some chocalate cake to some old english 800 and make it taste good. But my OE 800 rating was done without the cake. No, Corona has been stripped of the lemon and/or lime and must face the music alone. This beer sucks, right from the time you twist off the cap and get a whiff of the skanky dishwater aroma. This crap comes packaged with a very unpleasant aftertaste,(this must be where the lime comes in.)
I last had this at a mexican restaraunt, where the waitress asked if I would like another, I said no, I will have a Bud light instead. Think about that.

This beer poured a medium sized head and it had good lacing. It had a smooth taste. It tasted a little bit bitter, but not overwhelming. It did not have an aftertaste to me. This beer had some carbonation. There was nothing outstanding about this beer as it did not have much character to it. I am glad I have this rating out of the way!

Has to be a drain pour for me. Weak head, very skunky aroma and one sip was enough. Didn't have a lime available, but I don't think it would have made any difference. No problem though, because my daughters fiance claims that Corona is pretty good, so I gave him the other five. What the heck, that's what friends are for!
It's okay if you drink it with a lime.  It's very weak, but it's much better than the Corona light.
Even though this beer sucks pallete and taste wise. I think it tastes great with lime in it, without it sucks. An overall good beer on a hot summer day.
just typical piss water.. I could drink this if I was stranded on a desert island and I had nothing else.. but I wouldnt enjoy it. CRAP!!

Some people i know like Corona a lot, so i thought, hey, why not.  I didn't realize that it had no taste.  i would have given it all 1's but the timy lime wedge brought the score up.  Maybe i should have used a bigger lime.  A much bigger lime.
This rating was given with a lime, because without one, it's be all 1s.  If you have to add something to a beer, it's probably not that good.

No head to speak of on this beer.  Lots of pretty little bubbles rising from the bottom of the glass.  Subtle aroma of alchohol and hops.  Slightly phenolic.
Effervescent on the tongue.  Light bodied with mild flavors.  Hoppy start with a malt body and a dry finish.  Residual lager-esque aftertaste that I found unpleasant.
Corona is a decent beer if you can get a lime to add to it.  It's not extremely enjoyable, but it's something good to drink at a Jimmy Buffett concert.

I can't say there was anything really wrong with this beer, except that there was no taste whatsoever. But hey, at least it wasn't a bad taste. Dull yellow colour, very little fizzy head. Aroma is lime and a bit skunky. Dry and flat mouthfeel. Nothing in the taste at all. Distilled water has more flavour. But again, at least it doesn't taste bad. 
Re-Rate, with lime: It actually made the lime taste bad.
beer is worth drinking, add a lime and it's pretty damn good, nice change from the average beer

2/4 bottle: Pours yellow with high carbonation. Virtually no head though?. Slight hop aroma, not much else there. Very thin though tingly (from carb) mouthfeel. Slightly fruity taste with a tiny hint of bitterness. Very inoffensive. To spite the taste/palate etc it is a rather refreshing drink, just not a good beer IMO.
unoffensive.  drank this on a trip to mexico.  very much prefer this to Carta Blanca, and in some ways to Modelo especial.

I probably should have tried it without the lime first so my evaluation wouldn't be skewed, but that can wait for next time.  This is what I call a bi-polar beer, a person will either like it or hate it.  I liked it.  It was light, not bitter, and had more flavor than most mainstream American beers I've had.
People who dislike this beer are being far to subjective. In warm climates, enjoy this one with a slice of lime, and you will not be dissatisfied.
bah, a clear bottle with a piss like liquid.  no hops, or anything else expected in a beer; barely any flavor at all other than skunk and lime.  It's sad that I'm a sucker for the specials...

This beer is utter garbage...possibly the last beer I would ever choose to drink, considering the relatively high price. While the taste is not quite offensive, it is also not pleasant. With a lime and while in the sun, it is tolerable, although I would usually rather drink water.
Ah, what can I say? Everyone's tried this once before. I think that there are worse beers out there, but I won't order one for myself unless I'm desperate (and this is rarely the case).
almost as good as  piss...with a lime. Far too watery, wouldn't even drink if I was paid to.
Sweet, simple, floral taste.  Little hop, little malt.  Just not much of a beer.  Better with a lime.  Adequate with Tex Mex.
A beer overrated by the general public. Kind of a beer than needs a lime and salt at the local tex-mex rest. Otherwise its nothing impressive. Blah

I'm not sure what the fuss is with this stuff.  Sure it's drinkable, sure it's better than alot of beers, but there are so many better choices on the market.  And what's the go with drinking it with a slice of lemon?  Beer's beer - it's not a bloody cocktail!

Promised myself I wouldn't mention anything about Mexican workers standing around in the sun, drinking water and pissing into a vat labelled corona, so I won't. But it is a disturbing colour. Has no smell or bitterness, flavour of corn and is disgusting. Only had it because it was the only one of a pub's mediocre selection that I hadn't drunk previously.
I never buy this beer, but people always get when it's hot and sunny out because of Corona's ad campaign. So I end up drinking it. I have nothing to say that others haven't already said.

Every summer I dig one out of a bucket of ice and carefully slice a lime and wedge it in the bottle.  Every year I never finish that beer.  Peer pressure, will I ever learn? I think the lime is added to block the smell coming out of the bottle and assaulting your nose.  Basic aroma of back end of skunk dunked in piss.  This beer is disgusting and simultaneously amazing.  Why is it so incredibly popular?  Gives good mexican beers a bad wrap.  You can drink it without dying.
just like many other mexican beers. this one represents how good piss would look like in a bottle, and why would u need to add a wedge of lemon to beer.
I'm glad they stuffed the lime in the bottle. It's what gave it a drinkable flavor. Slightly skunky aroma but not enough to turn you away on a hot day.

Pours a golden amber right out of the bottle with an almost white head. The aroma is slightly skunky and bitter. The taste is very similar to standard American beers but with a little more quench to it. Slight malt and citrus taste along with the hops/skunkiness. Goes well with a wedge of lime. Most Mexican beers like this do. Only drink very cold. Warm tastes like piss. Deadly.
Pretty standard lager, bottled, golden hue, quite hoppy but not that much taste, by no means offensive and by no means great
Has a very light appearance. Little to no head even when poured in an improper fashion. Aroma of all you classic filtered macrobeers.

I never thought I'd say this, but I'd rather drink Bud. This fails dramatically to quench even the feeble "fire" of Taco Bell Mild Sauce, and by itself fails to taste like anything except the fleeting idea of adjuncts (yes, the idea!) unless you put the lime in, which is a silly thing to have to do. None of the Mexicans I know like this; they prefer Tecate, or Negra Modelo.
A more or less watery and slightly bitter taste - nothing special realle, but on a hot, summer day it is very refreshing

It's got that pathetic pale crystal-clear yellow color that you come to expect from inexpensive beers.  Pure white head that lasts about three milliseconds.  Flavor?  What flavor?  No aftertaste, because there's no taste to begin with!  Let the record show that I drank this only because it was free.  Would I pay for this?  Um, no.
People actually like this Mexican horse piss, I mean come on.  This is not what it is cut out to be at all.
Not a bad lighter beer.. but please don't forget the lime! It may be the difference between tolerable and piss!

While compared with nice Euro imports and high quality North American micros, Corona leaves most wanting.  However, for an after work brew to be enjoyed on the beach of Lake Michigan, Corona is great.  Not much character, but refreshing in the summer.

Skunky and nasty, even when cold.  I put lemon in my iced tea, not my beer.  Looks nice in the bottle but like piss in a glass.  No aroma to speak of; ¿donde esta mi malt, senores?  Decent mouthfeel, but that doesn't make up for the pain of swallowing the stuff.  Blech.  Avoid it.

A bitter taste that requires the right conditions to drink, being australian the summer sun is harsh a very cold corona with lime is the best thing in the world. Nothing comes close, but its only that specific time that i will drink and enjoy them. Wonderful colour and appearence smooth flowing down a harshly choked weathered throat.
Golden with hardly any head.  Flavorless unless you add a lime.  I can enjoy a few of these on a hot day.

I don't understand what is suppose to be so great about this beer. It's so so at best as the flavor is like drinking hard water with lots of minerals. I'll admit a lime will add to the flavor however. I wouldn't buy it but if someone gave it to me i wouldn't pass it up either.
This beer is over-carbonated with very little flavor aside from the obligatory lime added to the bottle.  Even with a lime, it is borderline undrinkable, and way overpriced.
After the skunk goes away there are notes of green apple, metallic hops, and a touch of resin. Dry with a dry finish. Did I just drink something?
I think the only real reason people in America drink this is because there is this stereotype among the ignorant that "import" means "good."

Ah, the joy of free beer. Why couldn't it be a free World Wide Stout? I'm a real man, I'm drinking this one hardcore style, lime-free baby. It pours a very clear, light yellow color with a small, fizzy white head that does not linger. The aroma is slightly skunky, and that is about it. Flavor is non-existant except for a somewhat foul, cheap lager aftertaste. High carbonation, but actually goes down easy until it warms up. It is actually better than Budwieser, but that is not saying much.
Not so bad for the style. Ok not much head and urine-colored. But fine soft taste (rice?). Nice to drink, but to expencive.
flavor gets a 3 if you actually add the lime. i actually find it helps the taste but maybe it's psychosematic. hmmm. get it if its free or if buds the only other option.
Low blow. Waste of time and money. Completely overrated. No taste, no aroma. A mistake.
Good sunny day brew, however, beer that needs a lime as a compliment doesnt have a lot to be said for. I wouldnt turn down a corona, especially if a bikini clad senorita was handing me one.
Thin body, not much flavor.  The alcohol content has a dry, winelike taste.  Nothing special.
Basically it's a Mexican Budweiser. A fairly decent flavor to it but pretty much average in appearance with very little aroma unless you count the lime it's served with.
Blonde colour, no head. The taste is a little bitter and acid. This beer of often drunk with lemon, probably to give a kind of flavour that covers its. Bad, really bad...
Quite light blond flavour.  Bad flavour.  Little bitter.  God, have mercy for the Mexicans, because this is their best-selling beer.
I'd rather drink Schaefer. Really bad stuff. I can't believe it's 20 bucks a case. Don't waste your money. This stuff is bad. I can't describe the flavor. Tastes like Mexican sweat.
Oh boy, not so good.  Have had worse, but that was before I found this site.  For now, this is the worst beer I have had.
If anyone wonders why there is a lime in it try it without.  Still a wonder why it is so popular throughout the world
Mexican Piss beer--This beer is a step below PBR............................
Yes it looks like soemthing other than beer, lacks flavor and the aroma is lacking.  However forget the lemon or lime and sometimes it isn't that bad. Still better than "beast"
Slightly better than the macro American beer................................

I know where there is a stained ceiling in a house in Weatherford, TX which represents the time 20 yrs ago that my cousin's friend sprayed this mexican curse all over the room...the stain outlasted the paint, imagine what it does to your guts, man.Beware anything that contains mexican water...and has a name like corona...dickhead.
This beer is truly rot gut, everytime I drink it feels like my stomach is on fire
every summer i crave corona when it first starts to get really hot, and then i have one and and i never crave it again because it's awful. until the next summer. when will i learn?

For all of those who hate Rolling Rock, nuts to ya.  I hate Corona.  I still don't get why this stuff is so popular.  It's borderline flat on taste.  Comes close to being a Coors in watery content.  The lime you may get with one of these will provide all the flavor.  Drinking the Corona will provide something akin to a Shasta double cola. Pretty much dismissable.

Don"t fear the lemon, it helps. If it’s hot as Hades’ outside and your running around in the sun you will enjoy it. Watery, smooth, off aroma and taste, that to the American who drinks Bud Lite can come across as pleasant complexity. Its just cheep watery beer I like it better than Bud but that is due to my past surfing and fishing in Mexico not to its being a better beer

A fairly famous beer, known as the Mexican budweiser. It's not, people in Mexico generally drink other things, it's just well marketed. It's got a strong off taste that can come from the clear bottle. I've had it on Tap in Mexico and it's much better on tap, but still not great.

Absolutely no head. No aroma but skunk. It''s not as bad as Heineken, America''s favorite overpriced import. I like it better with some lemon because that way it tastes more like lemon and less like Corona.
It might be the best selling Mexican beer but I really can''t think of it as that.  More like, Budweiser...but foreign.
Put the lime in, tilt your head back, pour.  Cheap.  Mexican.  Hardly beer.
Not so good.  The appearance is deceiving.  Tastes rancid...................
Good if you want absolutely no taste and the smell of mexican pee!..........
Whats up with the smell? Good stuff if you are going for a non domestic though there are better beers in the "Beers of the World" collection if you are going for non-domestic
Skunky and nasty odor with no flavor........................................
Average, overrated what more can be said - Highly priced here to boot.......

Overrated. Period.  Even at 4.6th percentile.  It''s really not all that much different than the usual macro lagers.  Certainly use a lime wedge to liven up this typical, crowd-pleasing, poor excuse for a beer.
Not the greatest but it has a little more kick to it than corona light......
Did not live up to taste of piss water that I expected, but not really beer either.

Drank out of bottle, bought at Dominick's in Chicago, 12/5/03.  Not much aroma, or at least nothing special to speak of.  Light beer in every sense except perhaps the calories, it's a very easy drinker and not a horrible one for parties, penny-pinchers, and quick snacks.  Pretty refreshing, but you MUST have it with a lime wedge.  Otherwise, it's just crap.
Mexican Pilsner + Piss Water.  tHe only way it tastes good is to have it with lime juice, it help to mask the bad taste.
Good beer for the price, smells horrible. Though it is good for a change every once in a while.
Skunky and nasty.  This is a sorry excuse for Mexican beer.  Mexicans don't even drink this crap.  This shit is like the Mexican Budweiser.

Nothing like the color of Mexican urine. The taste is slightly better, I would think, but the smell isn''t. Another favorite of stupid college kids or college kids with little money. For a better Mexican beer, try Dos Equis or Negro Modelo.
little aroma and light on the hops not so bad but its over priced...........
Tastless beer for crazy price. Not worth it.................................
Little aroma, even less head. Light on hops not so good on flavor...........
This beer has a yellow-orange body - hue with no initial flavor and a light body. It taste to nothing.
If you smell hard enough you will find that there is something in it. Look was completely out of style. Plain boring, no head, no nothing. Taste was of very diluted lager.
Decent beer.....again, you need the limes to hook it up, without them, it's not worth drinking.   A little overpriced too, you can get a lot more for your money.
Not too bad for a macro lager.  Gets an extra point for the thirst-quenchingness when served with a slice of lemon shoved in it.

corona...i know there are people out there that love this beer. don''t know why.. first off appearance..umm kind of looks like..piss. the taste. hmm. water with a slight lime flavor..cause of the lime. this is the worst beer out of mexico.
It is what it is.  Put a lime in it and have fun............................
this is a real good beer if you buy it in the 12 pack box... i like it and buy it sometimes.
Great beer in the summer with lime. Not especially great, but decent. Way too pricy for what it brings to the palate.
Throw in a lime for a good time.  Way too damned expensive.  Not too bad.  You can definately get get better beer for less.

Looks just as American standard in the bottle as it does in a glass. Nothing to be said about head, and lacing falls down the glass like a bowling ball from an airplane. Intense bitter hops with skunk smell. Flavor is bitter american standard. I choose not to rate this with a lime because that is covering up the rottenness of the beer. Very nice carbonated watery feeling drinking. A nice attempt at American standard, much better than what most macroproduction American comanies can do. Drinking this reminds me of my trip to Cancun, so it’s kinda nastalgic in a way.
UPDATE: Good god how could I stand this crap?! This is one of the worse mass drank beers available bar-none. Why is it so expensive?!?!?!

It's not as bad as everybody says it is, and in the 1980's I thought that a Corona with lime and salt was the height of beer drinking.  So I try to forgive people who do it now, I see them in bars putting the lime in, some of them have this trick where they put the lime in and turn the bottle upside down with the their thumb over the top.  I guess this is to evenly distribute the lime flavor throughout the beer.  They always look like they feel incredibly slick when they do this too.  Yeah, I drank a bunch of Corona the other night, but I didn't do the thumb in the bottle trick.
Easy-drinkin, smooth if not plain taste. Everyone raves about putting limes in this shit, but in my opinion, you don''t put fruit in your beer, so needless to say, i haven''t tried it yet.

Let some other fool stock his fridge with this and find a new beer. This beer needs more then a couple limes to be drinkable. Personally I like to convert into a Superbeer by pouring out the neck then adding 2 shots of Bacardi Limon and a lime. You now have something that is still watered down but has a stout like ABV.
Not the greatest beer. Kind of sharp tasting. Does a number on my gfs stomach everytime she she drinks it she pukes. Dosent taste horrible though.
Had this without the damn lime for the first time. Really allows the corny aftertaste to come through and show up how bland it is.
It was ice cold and lonely in my refrigerator.  Why did I drink it without the lime? Ouch!
similiar to the Japenesse beers in that the flavour is so much better when eating the local food.  Slip in some lemon or lime and not a bad brew.
Straw colow with a wispy white quickly diminishing head.  Aroma of straw, and light grain.  Minimal flavors of malt sweetness with only a touch of bitterness.  Unfortunately an american standard.
tasts like mexican piss water and cig butts.................................

Not as positively disgusting as I remember.  Some malt flavor.  Can''t imagine paying much to drink this.  Again, not disgusting, just not much of a beer.  Loses Overall Impression points for being highly regarded and expensive.

For some reason, lots of people think this is a good beer.  Probably cuz its imported.  This was popular among my friends in high school.  In my opinion, corona is the most overpriced and overrated beer you can buy.
this beer''s flavor is too inconsistant to give a good rating.  Basically this beer is jail for limes
beer that only a custy could appreciate.....................................
Very blond with a small creamy head. Interesting grainy aroma with hints of rubber. Rather sweet taste with a hint of hop and grain. Rather flat finish with a slightly bitter aftertaste.
really grows on you with time. pretty good with lime. horribly overpriced...
When in Mexico don''t drink the water, when not in Mexico pass on the watery Mexican beers. Not much in the way of flavour but a good light summer beer. I always preferred del Sol...

Wow! So many ratings; such a low average rating! It's not that bad. Fresh, clean grain aroma, with light hints of yeast. Small, frothy, white head with good lacing. Head is mostly diminishing, however. Body is clear and light; yellow. Reminiscent of a good Bavarian Pilsner, though not as complex. Nevertheless, imminently drinkable and refreshing; especially when accompanied by a wedge of lime.
I disklike this beer other than in hot temperatures with a lime or a lemon. It''s overpriced in my opinion and it''s very trendy.
I used to like this stuff...until I tried it without the ubiquitous lime. Yuck! It tastes like dough with alum and MSG sprinkled on it. Overall a nonevent.
Mexican piss. Made but mexicans that drank mexican water....................

It smells bad, I don’t know why it is so over rated. Why people pay so much for it is beyond me!

Re-rate May 15 2009
I had one of these again last night. No Lemon. Light golden colour with white head that is quick to go. Aroma is skunked. Watery flavour, light graininess, grass flavours. Palate is watery.

Since my first rating of corona, I have discovered that it was the lime that caused my serious aversion to the beer, not the beer itself.  Without the lime, it goes down easily when cold and it really isn't that bad.
Definitely an overpriced and overrated beer.  I put the lime in and turned it upside down and it starts spraying everywhere.  what kind of a beer needs an instructional manual
Congratulations, you win the fraternie award for the most overrated and overpriced beer in the entire world.

Decent light beer without a lot of flavor.  A good "thirst quencher" beer.  No head to speak of.  Great if you want something on the very light side, but fans of darker beers will hate this.  A good beer to go with seafood or Mexican food.
This is an okay beer if you are looking for something a little on the light side of things
drinkin this in cancun is a good time when ur scuba diving off a sailboat into clear waters

After I put a lime in it, well..it smelled like a lime, I personally love limes, so I have to admit, living in soCal, and eating all the mexican food that I do, Corona, although not my personal favorite of the typical watered down mexican beers (sol is) It is damn refreshing..(mexican water makes mexican yellow lagers better than their american counterparts..at least thats my theory.)
SKUNKY.  The odor is bad, but luckily not too strong.  pretty good with a lime.  Not a lot of flavor.  Used to drink this alot when I was younger.
Skunky, urine colored, and sweet. Canned Corn + Cheap Vodka = Corona........

The beer for people who usually go for "malternatives". Loses points with me for having little head. Gotta have the creamy stuff, ya know. I only drink it in the summer or when it is the only option besides domestics at a party. Gotta have a lime with it.
When they warn you not to drink the water while visiting Mexico, this beer tastes like it conatins the same H2O.  WAY over-rated and I''ll save the limes for gin & tonics!

A yellow beer with almost no head. It has a slight aroma of hops. The taste is watery but not disgusting - just plain boring. No real sweetness and but a slight bitterness. Good for thirst quenzing but too expensive for that.
What can you say about a beer that only tastes good with lime added??.......
Great beer with a little salice of lime.  Otherwise bland and normal.  Something about it makes the lime essential and greatly improves the beer.
Very pale, watery unpleasant beer.  ........................................

something to drink with mexican food.
standard tasteless fizzy yellow crap.
I only like it with the lime. Its a fun summer beer but not much of anything else.
How do "brewers" make beer that stinks like this?  As for the flavour...I would rather drink soapy water.  Foul.

Blech! The only way to drink a Corona, is to make it a Corona-Kazi. Take a swig of the beer and pour in some Vodka, Triple Sec & lime juice. A bartender at the clubhouse of a local golf course made it for me about a year ago. Nice way to finish a BAD round of golf.
The more I drink this beer the more I dislike it.  The lime doesn''t help, nothing does.  Drink cold and fast.
Good party beer on a hot day. You can drink them like water. Need the lime to make the experience twice as good!
Wow, again all the hype gets me confused.  I got a skunked bottle so my rating may be really skewed.  It had a nice golden hue though.  Taste was awful corny and the aftertaste was terrible.
this beer sucks and I know it.  but for some reason, with a lime on a hot day, I can't turn it down(so long as I don't have to pay for it.

What can I say, it was originally brewed for the laborers in Mexico. Hence the quality is low, it requires a lime if you want to enjoy it, but it is a necessity if you visit Mexico (a substitution for the contaminated water). It is the bottom of the Mexican beer chain (ouch).
Not much to say here - I wouldn''t want one even if you were buying.........
Overrated (not at RateBeer but the general public opinion - much like Heineken).
I have a suspicion that this is really just bottled urine.  I don''t even drink this stuff if it''s free.
NEED MORE LIME BC IT TASTES LIKE SHIT!!!!!!!!...............................

Very water down, but can hit the spot on
warm summer day...................
It seems somewhat vulgar to put lime in beer, but this is pretty decent that way.
w/o lime this beer is absolutely horrible but with it, it is pretty damn tasty
This is not a spectacular beer but when served with a lime, its something different and one of my fav''s.  Not high up on the quality scale, but good nontheless
A very good beer. A light taste, with a good texture, and the after taste is also nice. All this is enhanced when you add lime to the eqation.
good beer to have in the summer. bottle transparency not a good idea. Skunky after short time

Used to drink this in Manning Bar, Sydney Uni, `cause I thought I looked cool with a lemon hanging off my bottle of Mexican peasant beer. I was wrong, and there are enough lemons at Manning Bar anyway. Ended up going back to this shit in New York because it is the cheap shit over there, and you gets it in supermarkets etc alongside Bud etc. This is some very average shit, which is refreshing ice cold, but what beer isn`t?

Prone to skunking, but perhaps that's not the worst thing in the world, as at least it gets some flavor then.  My colleagues seemed to think this was "a pretty good beer"--compared to Bud, etc.--but this was pretty mediocre.

A fair beer, nothing special.  Kind of mild actually.

Like it at a pool or club, w/ or w/o lime.

Okay beer.
The Border Police aren't doing enough to keep this stuff out of the country.

I just can't get into this.  People, including other beer drinkers, tell me that this tastes great on the beach when it's hot.  No.  It looks like urine, and the chemical aftertaste is just overwhelming.  I wouldn't be surprised to learn that they brew this with corn and absolutely no barley.  Any other mexican lager you can find is better.  The most popular is also the worst.  I have pity in my heart when I see people buying or drinking this.  The power of advertising.
Some people probably love this, but not me. its acceptable with a lime. But still taste like really bad.
I like this one, but not as a beer. To me its more a refreshing soda. I do not associate it with anything beer stands for in my mind. Its a good drink especially when its (or your) hot.
once again....beer my girlfriend likes. ABV too low for me to consider drinking it, but, like most everyone else, i know what it tastes like.... corny
Don't get me wrong, this isn't a bad beer. But any beer you need to add a lime to in order to make it taste good can't be that great.

Oct 2012.  I found this to be a little more tasty than water - some ripe dung malt on the nose, and a fairly clean body like a freshly washed corpse on the slab, with just that exotic hint of decay. A palatable if undistinguished lager.
Just nothing special about it.  It's carbonated yellow water with some hops added in.

this beer is rediculously over priced it is more just about a dollar a beer. i think it tastes awful especially for such a terrible price. overall this beer sucks. and the even when the whole lime deal it is terrible and just gettin the lime in the you spill the beer all over most the time and i think if u have to add something like salt or a lime to your beer you shouldnt be drinking it.

I always have a fit when I see this beer for $7 or $8 buck a six pack in some places. I remember when I could by this stuff for 25 cents a sixer in Baja.

Light Gold color, small head. Light tasting lager style beer. Light bodied and moderately hoppy. Very carbonated. Mouthfeel is a little light, a little yeasty. Finish is crisp. Aftertaste is slightly bitter. Trendy Swill
Bubby gave me one tonight, Yuck had plenty in the past, any beer that has to have a citrus wedge to drink(lime) ,beer that needs fruit need to to to be a drain pour.
Very watery and little taste.  I guess that is why the lime is needed.  I would rather have a Shlitz or PBR.  They have more flavor for less $.

I had higer expectations for this beer since people will choose this beer if they want to look sophisticated or whatever, but I forgot that these same people drink stuff like Bud Light and Smirnoff Ice on a regular basis.  Ugh.  This is a watery beer; although it is fairly unoffensive, if that counts for anything.  The appearance is typical of this style, as is the aroma.  Not much flavor to speak of, I'll save lower ratings for foul tasting beers.  Not much to see here.
its ok not to great, the flavor is just not that great to me somethin about it i guess, not my choice and at 2.50 for a deucer i wont be buyin it any time soon.
I like the bottle and the beer is pretty good but not the best beer in world.
Well if a beer requires an outside flavoring source it doesnt speak well for its taste. What does it lack .... hmm... taste more import crap and waste of money.
After 72 hours in 36C degree heat in Cancun this beer gained a few points.  For those who drink beer to be seen.  Not good for the style and not good for the country.
Horrible mexican beer! Won't touch it!......................................

Very pale gold with a hint of green under a small short lasting off white head. Very faint stale sweet corn, hops and chicken feathers aroma. Thin watery body with faint citrus sour (no I did not have it with lime or lemon), some corn sweetness and weak bitter hops flavours. I'm only rating this to pick up another country on my list.

OVERRATED. Even with the lime. Chicks love the shit though.
...............

There is a reason why a lime in the bottle is required whe serving this beer:  it maskes the skunkiness of any of those clear bottles that are exposed to sunlight!  Lots of fermented corn with a little bit of fermented 2 rowe barley and a little bit of hops makes this beer very unremarkable but remarkably marketted.

First time I've had it since I started rating.  As a youngin it was my fave, but that's when I thought a Heinie was a fancy beer.  Didn't have it on the beach, but rather at 6 am in the freezing cold after an all nighter tripping face.  It was cold and corony.  Hardly qualifies as beer though.
I've had worse, but Mexico should stick to burritos instead of beer.........
This one sucks.  And the lime does nothing for it...........................

Pee yellow body with lots of bubbles rising to a thin bubbly head. Smells sweet and cardboardy (yeah, i know, no such word). Bit of corn sweetness in the mouth upfront. Some oxidation, though light, in there as well. Not as bad as I thought it would be. Smooth and easy drinking, but completly unchallenging.

In my earlier days I had some corona while eating mass quantities of Mexican food in San Antonio.  At this time it was ok.  Good to quench the fire of the hot salsa.  After drinking some decent beer though, this beer simply must be rated as poor.  Watery, fizzy, no flavor, no taste, no color, not even much alcohol.  What is the use.

With lime, this is a very refreshing beer.  For the beach, pool or hot tailgate, I'll take this over any of the American macros.  It doesn't have much flavor but its not supposed to.  Never had it without lime or lemon and don't ever plan to.
Corona is a poser/gringo beer.  I prefer any Mexican beer that doesn't require a lime.
Any beer thqat requires fruit in it to taste close to platable sucks ass. A last resort beer
A summer beer out by the pool.  Must have a lime or it is undrinkable.......
I am frequently given to wonder if the customary slice of lime is mainly used to masque the taste of this beer, or perhaps clean it out of your mouth quickly so that you can forget.
It is too bad that by the time this beer is imported from Mexico it tasts skunky
In the immortal words of homer simpson, "hello? taste?".....................

I don't think I've ever had one without a lime in it, and I don't ever plan to.  This beer has one purpose and one purpose alone - to quench your thirst while lying on the beach/by the pool, thus getting drunk and dehydrated.  It is a small niche, but it does its job well.

There is no good reason to drink this beer unless it is the only thing on the menu, or in someones fridge.  It is bland, tart, and has a yeast like aftertaste. Please, they don't need the money, go with any other mexican beer.
Refreshing beer. Nice for a hot summer  in the sun.  Appearance and palate are quite bad. It's a little like ice-T with alcohol..
Very good beer, high in calories but a good all around beer for parties, etc.
True, true ... thin, with little distinctive character.  And it's real high in calories too.  But it's a better alternative than lemonade.
not the greatest true.  but it has it's moments.  tastes bland but at least its not sweet like other crappy macros

i dont  know about this stuff... i dont really trust mexico or there peopl. My frieds dad said hes been tot he brewery and it smelt like piss around it and that some of the workers said they piss it th batches, wouldnt be suprised
The crappiest beer I have ever had! Me and my friends will never touch it. It is a horrible mexican beer. stay away my friends! AWAY!
"I once convinced my friend that the Corona employees were paid to piss in the bottles"... Crazy thought huh, Who wants to drink piss?
Not bad, a tad bit thin, but overall it's not too bad.  At the import price I generally stay away though.
You know something is bad when you have to introduce a lime to make it tolerable.
This what i call a flat beer. No aroma, no flavor, no taste. ...............
Any beer that you need to put fruit into to make it taste better...pass.....
Pale golden color with little head and no lace.  the aroma is barely detectable with some malty notes.  the flavor is almost non existent, however some malty sweetness is evident.

Not the worst.  Weak, watery, just plain bad.  Did they use 
any hops at all?
Bitter. Drink it with a lime and some Tex-mex and it's bearable.............
I highly recomend never pouring this beer in a glass.  The lime contributes the only discernable flavour of note in this beer.

Very nice job of marketing this swill to convince the uneducated it is the perfect beer. No worries, just you and your beer and a beautiful beach. Yeah right, if that was the only time people drank this stuff I would never see it again. There are two reasons why it got the 2 rating it did:
I assumed you are putting a lime into it and for some reason I like painted bottles.

In the summer heat, nothing beats a Corona with a slice of lime.  It's really just a substitute for drinking water.  Sure, its color resembles something you've seen in a urinal.  And so what if it has no taste!  Overall, this is the perfect beer to enjoy at the beach.
Crisp, Clean, no hops or taste. High CO2. Better with a lime. At least then it has some taste

This beer is a package deal you have to have lime and mexican food while your dinking it.  If you don't have the combination of the three don't bother drinking it.By the way I'm rating it as a package because I won't drink it alone.
Slightly non-descript beer with little flavour or aroma.  Nice I suppose for drinking on a warm day.  The one plus point is it doesn't have the bad aftertaste of a Bud.

This isn't tasty at all.  I didn't enjoy this.  Extremely weak. I don't understand why people love this.  Sure it goes down easy, it's because you can't taste anything.  One of those beers you'd down to get hammered.
goes down very easily, very good beer.......................................
In my experience, I prefer this after a a long day of snowboarding and dinner than by itself, but even then, it's nothing much to write home about.  By itself, it's a little dry going down.

Rerate Duped into buying this because it was labeled Corona Familiar in a 24 oz bottle at Habersham in Savannah.  Medium gold pour, white head. Typical corny lager flavor, some graininess. Aroma has some we paper bag essence - but not putrid. Original 2.2 I rated without the lime - however, without the lime this beer is barely drinkable. But at happy hour at a trendy bar - image is everything!
good commercials - but why would anyone actually drink it?..................
Any beer that needs fruit added to it isn't beer its zima...................

I am gonna take it easy on Corona since I actually do drink it from time to time.  I agree with the reviewer from Denmark that proclaimed this beer is perhaps more enjoyable while consumed in the same climatic region where it is produced.  For example, I guzzled down a few Coronas with lime last night while sitting on the lake in the 90 degree humid South Carolina heat and it was much more drinkable.  This is not a beer that I honestly enjoy without the lime or some pleasant female scenery.  I don't buy this unless there's a beach, water or a party nearby.
Drink with a lemon so you actually taste something. Overpriced Mexican beer water. Nice bottle (amazingly the clear glass doesn't create skunkiness...maybe because there are no hops)
I've always thought this beer has an odd yellow color. A little too yellow for me. Very mild hops flavor...bland.
okay with burritos,uh yeah, goody and hopped up, pretty hue,and stuff.......

It's refreshing and smooth, but it's not a good beer in my opinion. 007lund hit the nail on the head: it doesn't taste like beer and that's because girls like it. Much better with lemon. (In Spain is called Coronita)

Well, Colpitts and I were just out and I tried this and Sol for the first time. The aroma points are mainly because the beer was served with a lime and the "aroma" of the beer was somewhat masked. When I couldnt taste the lime, a bit of raunchy beer taste would tickle the tastebuds. Does go good with the dry taste of beef nachos, as Colpitts also said.
A nice refreshing beer. Needs Lemon/Lime wedge .............................
I don't think this beer and warm weather go together.  As this beer warms up it tastes like $hi&.
