yes this needs to be consumed in the hot sun down on the beach.  dont try to have it as a nice drink with dinner because it will fail miserably.
Too bad. I think the beer could be acceptable if it was comsumed a land with the same climatic region. the beer will be less repulsive is you drink it with a lemon squeezed down in the bottle.

This isnt a great beer but its not a bad drink at a baseball game. I dont get the hype of the expense of this beer..its not that spectacular. But it has a good, smooth flavor, but it lacks in aroma and taste if not chilled.

Popular amongst girls who don't like beer, and for good reason: Doesn't taste like beer.  With a lime, somewhat tolerable.  But, there's no point in buying this "beer" because even with the lime, it still doesn't taste like beer.  More like water with barley flavoring.  The best thing this has going for it is girls love it, so if you're looking to entertain females, keep some handy.
This is the beer for people who does not like beer. Served ice-cold with lemon it is god for thirst, but beer? No way, jose...

My favorite of the "cheap" beers, it definitely deserves a low spot on my list.  Bland, boring, but easy to drink.  A lime is a necessary evil with this beer (also needs to be ice cold).  If any beer needs something added to it, it's just not right.  No limes with cheap Mexican beer, no lemons with Hefeweizen.  Better than Sol and Dos Equis, this light, yellow beer has a spot on my list solely because of it's easy (and cheap) drinkability.
Bad, must be ice cold but still it is bad. Lime is needed also..............
This beer has its niche, but its very small.  Think beach surrounded by beautiful women...that is all.

One of the greatest public-relations promotions in history! This used to be the cheapest of the cheap Mexican imports. Then the brewers got wise and got a high-powered American ad agency to turn this lightweight into a commercial juggernaut. Great business foresight---horrible beer for the money...Drinkable? Sure...Light...fizzy. Tastes fine ice-cold. A fine imported "premium" beer?  Can you say "Fraud"?

Ice cold and fresh lime required. Corona is what it is: a pleasant alternative to american lagers because it's sooo light in taste. As I've said before, no taste is better than bad taste. The lime provides most of the flavor and with it corona can be a refreshing hot-weather beer. Attractive bottling and effective marketing can make this a fun beer.
Bottled: Not much to it. Better than Sol, but not much. Fresh and tasty when served with a lime.
on a hot day with a lime this is the best "lawnmower" beer out there........
Corona is a good beer substitute.  Women will usually drink it.  Drop in a lemon or lime wedge to give it taste.  Watery, but good on a hot day.
Defintely a summer-only beer. I like it with lemon or lime and they are nice and watery for the hot weather. Not necessarily a great beer, but I seem to drink plenty of them on hot evenings.
Girls like it. That's the only good thing about this Mexican piss water.....
Corona is some good stuff..If you got the money, pick up a case of Corona...
I've had mexican beers that are worse, but this is by no means a huge improvement.  If you put enough lime in it, maybe you can convert it to a sort of bitter margarita, until you find some beer.

Very mexican. Very bad.
I think mexico looked (longingly) over the border, and saw all us gringo folk drinking horrid beers like bud, MGD and Milwakees Beast, and exclaimed, in that intellectual tone of theirs, "eh vato, lets make some crap brew too, essay". And thus began the toe to toe race to see who could produce the most horrid trendy beer. 
America is winning, but its still a very close race.

I vist the islands alot and I all ways enjoy corona on the sandy Beach just like the Ads. I think this Beer is one of the best ones out there has a Great Flavor even if you dont have a lime to add to it .

weak, watery, and smells bad. Anything that you have to add fruit to in order for it to taste good has problems. I use it to cook in my chili, but as a drinking beer it is well towards the bottom of the list.

Unless the commercials have sucked you in, there's no reason to ever try this beer.  Too many guys and girls took Spring Break in Mexico and made this beer an unpassing fad.  It has nothing notable about it at all.  When the juice of a lime makes your beer taste better, you've got bigger issues on your hands.

This isn't a terrible beer, but by no means a good one.  It tastes somewhat like a slightly more sophisticated Budweiser.  I would prefer Bud over it though because it is cheaper. Whatever though this beer sucks.
Make sure to drink this cold. Difficult to drink by itself; it must be with a meal. It's not all bad with Mexican food.

We called it the ’gateway beer’ because even if one didn’t like beer, one would like Corona, and quickly move on to other beers.  I have moved on, but it was my first, of course, and so I need to give it its due.  Refreshing, light and dangerously drinkable.  (6/3/7/5/13)

Rerate (7/27/07): What the hell was I thinking?  Pale yellow color, a thick, rapidly dissipating white bubbly head, stale nose of corn and sickly sweet hoppiness, drinkable but like all other pale lagers, this one is best reserved for when there’s not much else around.
not bad with a lime, but not that good a beer overall.......................

man this beer sucks. Stale beer. ameliorated by the fact that it is mostly water. nothing good about this beer.  It looks very pale, only a small tinge of yellow with little to no, fizzy head.  Aroma of skunked beer to the max.  No hops, no malt.  Flavor is unclean, thin, bland, watery and adjunt ridden.  Body is extra light, fizzy. Difficult to drink when warm.
Gave off a skunky smell when I opened this, but turned out to be not so bad as I thought. Light malt taste, nice gold color, and a quick profile. Overall thin and nothing special.
very artificial sweet hops smell. pee yellow. Boring as the people who like to drink it at the parties!
The only way I like Corona is if it has a lime in it - that way it tastes like lime juice - and I really don't even like lime juice - so basically this is just a bad beer all around.

It is a party goer's beer. Not very sophisticated. And it looks poorly for a beer, if it is recommended to add anything. Like all mexican beers, there is a salty taste which usually requires lime juice to make palatable.
The Lime is absolutely necessary to kill all the bacteria.  I heard they found piss in this beer once.
A fun fizzy beer with a lime. Without the lime? Not so good. Hmm..I guess I rated the lime as well. That cannot be a strong commentary on the flavor of the beer itself.
Weak beer. If you want a good Mexican beer go with Pacifico or XX. .........
a good drop for the right occasion, despite the fact it's a yuppie beer.....
A decent beer.  Definitely needs the lime to be good though.................
This beer by itself is fucking terrible. add a slither of lemon (or lime but that is gross) and you have a much better drink. goes well with burgers and sangers on a hot day
Aromas of corn and cow dung and an adjunct flavour. If this is the number one selling beer in Mexico I don`t want to try any of the also-rans.
ick... i would rather drink a retards swimming pool water, not good. pure crap.

Anyone who thinks this is the standard of Mexican beers has been duped. Why this has emerged as a representation of Mexican cerveza I don't really know. Stray from the masses and avoid this sad, over-promoted South-of-the-Border version of American beer.

Holy cripes, why do so many people buy this stuff?  I really don't think it's any better than Budweiser or any other macrobrewed beer.  In fact, I'd rather drink Blatz than this stuff.

I think the beer in the bottle I tried must have been exposed to way too much light at some point (dastardly clear bottles!).  It really tasted...deterioriated.  No better way of describing it than that.
If i'd like to sit on the toilet the next morning these are great. not the worst tasting but my stomach doesn't agree

The only people who really truly enjoy this beer in America are stupid hardasses that try and act "hip" to pick up their "honeys" at the local mexican tavern or restaraunt...followed by some crazy drunk driving in their Grand Ams...its a damn shame

nothing like cold one on sitting on a lawn chair listening to smashmouth and watching women's golf...
Ah yes, Corona. If you drink this, chances are you're in high school or like the taste of urine. Any beer that needs a lime for it to be tolerable shouldn't be bought, particularly not for the price.

Terrible. The fact that someone conceived the idea of adding a crappy piece of lime for added tasted is a testament to the weak nature of this brew. Born and raised in Mexico – it should have stayed there. If you’re looking for a good tasting Mexican beer, you’re better off with Negra Modelo. Sadly, I'd take a Bud over this anyday.
Never drink without lime. Weak and watery. .................................

Bottle. Head is initially small, fizzy, white, fully diminishing. Body is clear light yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (cereal, grain, husks), with notes of DMS and soap. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter, unclean. Light body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation. Virtually the same as Corona Light; difficult to find anything enjoyable about it.

I cant believe i was this generous to this beer.  This beer is shit.  There's nothing more to say.  I think the only people I've ever seen that drink this are yuppies and girls, or yuppy girls.  They think it makes them look cool to drink one with a lime in it, when really it looks ridiculous.  Next time I drink a 40 of OE I think I'll get a few strawberries and drop them in the bottle, maybe then I will be cool too.

Corona has a place in this world. Its a light and crisp beer which is widely available. I think of it more as a thrist quencher on a hot summers day or perhaps after a long day of skiing. Pairs well with Mexican fare. It'll work for me every now and then - sure the heck beats Bud, Coors, etc.
Sweet smell. Pale yellow, light head. Grassy taste, almost no bitterness. Watery. Below average.
Water, water it's all it is and nor any beer to drink!......................
Don't forget the lime! At its best makes for a grea summer drink but I wouldn't go as far as comparing it with real beers.

Good, really good, but don't foregt the lime, n it must be ice cold.
......

What is up with the popularity of this swill? It tastes terrible, there's no aroma, the aftertaste is bitter at best. I love pilsener type beers, but this one, well........... there's no other way to say it,... it sucks. I give it a 2 only because I love and respect my brother in law and he likes the stuff.

Why don't more beers come with lemon?  Without lemon this beer would be nothing.
might be bland otherwise, but add a slice of lime and you have a drinkable tasty beer.
similar to many mass produced american standards, but a little stronger lemon taste.
I had it with a lime and when I was drunk, but it seemed prety smooth and although I usualy dont like fruit in my beer, I rather enjoyed the citrusy twist it gave the beer.

If you have ever tasted the current beer sold as "Miller HIgh Life", you have tasted Corona.  I cannot tell the two apart.
I've had tastier, better bodied well water.  I rated it even lower than I rated Miller High Life, because for the price and hype, you are expecting better.
I've decided that there are two basic groups of Mexican beer affecionados:  The Cornoa/Carta Blanca group, and the DosEquis/Negra Modela group.  When Mexican beer is the order of the day, you'll always find me in the latter.
Add a touch of lime juice, and it's a great beer.  I like it................
Corona Extra is definatelly an acquired taste.  It is strong, but in a good way.  It does NOT go well w/cigarettes, however.
Not that bad, and just the thing on a hot day.  But a beer that needs a lime in it to truly be drinkable is a little silly I think.
I stick my thumb over opening and turn the bottle upside down to make sure I get the lime juice throughout this light beer.
The lime makes this beer much easier to drink.  I think it is a below average light beer.
if you like imported light beers that cant be drunk without a lime.  Then drink this.  If you dont, then you gonna hate it like i did.  Might as well drink water with a lime.  a lot cheaper.
You know this one. I certainly don"t need to describe it. .............
A really great beer even though it's not very complex.  But only really good with lime.
This is absolute junk.  I can think of a hundred better things to do with a lime.
corona is the worst beer, BUT I LOVE IT!!!!.................................
like this one when im thirsty.. it's freash and nice  on a hot summer gay =)
Cold and with lime its a fair thirst quencher. Not much of a beer though....
hey, it's drinkable.  It does the job.  It might not be great or anything, but it's tasty to have with those enchilads

I'm not going to fall into the normal trappings "if you can't drink the water, why drink the beer", "tastes like pee" etc.  (I guess I just fell in, didn't I?)  I digress.  Look, this beer at least has IT'S PLACE!!  Put in a lime, sit on the beach, and drink Corona.  Put it in perspective, on a nice cozy beach with thong bikini's running around everywhere and YOU with a stout or porter in your hand.  All the hotties are saying "what a dork!"  All I'm saying is, this is one of those "favorite memory" beers if you only let it be!!  Don't buy it for sitting at home and watching TV though (your wife will be saying "what a dork").
I'll drink it at a Mexican restaurant, but only on a hot day when there's absolutely nothing else and I've ordered something spicy.  I insist on the lime.
NO aroma, zero flavour. Looks like pee, tastes like pee.....................
Good beer especially with a lime in it.  I really prefer to drink it when its hot out though
Vegetable-like aroma. Neutral taste with some sweetness. I didn't find any hopbitterness. Very bland and sticky. If you are very thirsty, don't drink Corona. Drink a decent beer or mineral water!

Ummm...I don't even think I would have liked this last year, when I just began drinking good stuff. Muddy, corn syrup sweet yet strangely bland. Part of my student's 4 beers of the world presentation.

This is a medium-bodied beer with a pleasing, yellow color. This beer is zesty and crisp, is 4.6% alcohol by volume, and is reputedly brewed with all natural ingredients: water, barley, hops and yeast. You can buy this beer in Germany because it meets beer purity laws. (Hmmm... incidentally, the beer industry in Mexico was started by German expatriates. I guess the same thing can be said about America as well.) This beer is very popular in California, especially here in Los Angeles where most people drink it with a wedge of lime squeezed into the neck of the bottle. This beer is brewed by Cerveceria Grupo Modelo in Mexico; this brewery is also known for its Modelo and Pacifico brand beers, which do not have the cult, mass-market appeal that Corona has. Corona is the #1 import beer in America.
Not my personal favorite, without a lime or something, I really can't stand it, but when I drank it; it was free so who can really complain.
my personal favorite, love it with lime, can get skunky quick though........
With or without a lime a superior beer......................................
I like it, its not the best beer, but hey, put a lime in it, kick back by poor with one and relax

Wattered-down yuppie brew.  It's overpriced and doesn't taste that great.  The lime is used so that it doesn't taste bad.  I can handle it, but it reminds me of Miller High Life.  This isn't one of my favorites.  I don't really understand the appeal of this one, but like any beer, it's an aquired taste.  A friend gave me a 12 pack once for some work that I did for him, and it was good for a nice buzz.  Drank them all in an evening.
This is not a good beer. It does not offer much taste. It is good that you drink it out of the bottle, because in a glass it would look more like apple juice.
Belongs to the preppy crowd. Heavy carbonation and a good head with nice lace.  The lime is really necessary to add to the flavor.

Buy a sixer and some lime, serve ice cold on a hot day with some friends. One or two are nice but the fad fizzles out after that.
This was o.k. for a hot day out on the beach in cancun...great with the lime.

This is a fabulous Beer. How could anyone not like it. Sweet and tangy. No aftertaste. Great!

a crap yuppie beer. strictly for poofs. if a beer made to beer served with a slice of lemon, then it is obviously crap.

Never liked this one, though a few friends like it just because they think its exotic.  An old Bud in a different bottle.  Lime doesn't improve it much either.
My favorite pissy beer, next to Miller High Life. Leaves nothing on the palate, litte aroma to speak of, but its clean, smooth taste make it a favorite while sitting poolside.

corona didnt meet the hype but its still one of the better beers ive had and i like the lack of aftertaste

Very poor. Very poor. Very poor, and did I mention almost tasteless?........
people say this is so damn good, it isn't.  it's bitter and tastes bad.  people also say that lime juice makes it taste better, fat chance.......expensive highly overrated

This is a must have if you ever go to Cancun, Mexico--and its 6.0% alcohol to boot down there! (4/4/4/4/7)-----RE-RATE------32 ounce brown bottle labelled as Corona La Familiar.  Purchased at Food 4 Less in Woodland, CA.  I’ll be interested to see how this tastes from a brown bottle, as opposed to a clear one.  The aroma is a familiar one when it comes to pale lagers....corny, sweet, and lightly grassy.  Not much else, just a touch of acetaldehyde.  Transparent yellow body with a small, quickly dissipating white head present.  Starts pretty watery and flavorless, before some corn and cereal sweetness takes over in the middle.  Has a little bit of lemon tartness towards the end, which is an obvious flaw.  Finishes virtually hop-less.  With a little apple cider twang.  Not good.

Well it’s been just a month shy of 4 years since I’ve had a Corona, and now I remember why. The beer sleazes from the 12-ounce clear bottle a limpid light gold color with the head small  and white, frothy in texture and the lace thin. Nose is dominated by the malt, sweet as is the start, top is ultra thin. Finish is mildly acidic, the hops sparse and the aftertaste dry. The reason even after 4 years was the fact I was helping someone move, and the only beer he had was a six pack of Corona, must admit, it did fend off the heat strike I was getting from moving several million tones of stuff up a flight and half of stairs in 112 degree heat.
